name: BUAD 280 Introduction to Financial Accounting
description: Emphasis on understanding financial statements and the impact of business transactions on information presented to management and interested stakeholders .

name: BUAD 281 Introduction to Managerial Accounting
description: An emphasis on how accounting information , combined with a variety of techniques and best practices , supports enhanced management decision making .

name: BUAD 302T Communication Strategy in Accounting
description: Theory , practices , and techniques essential to communication in accounting . Interpersonal and group communication ; oral presentations ; writing ; use of communication technologies ; communication strategies for varied audiences .

name: BUAD 304 Organizational Behavior and Leadership
description: The role of leadership in business organizations ; concepts and skills for managing oneself and others .

name: BUAD 306 Business Finance
description: Financial problems of business enterprise ; function of financial manager ; sources of funds ; instruments , institutions , and practices of finance ; problems of financial management using case studies .

name: BUAD 307 Marketing Fundamentals
description: Develops a managerial viewpoint in planning and evaluating marketing decisions of the firm : products , pricing , channels , promotion , information processing , legal implications , and marketing in contemporary society .

name: BUAD 310g Applied Business Statistics
description: Statistical methods for business analysis ; data exploration and description ; sampling distributions ; estimation ; hypothesis testing , simple and multiple regression ; model building . Extensive computer applications .

name: BUAD 311T Operations Management for Accounting Majors
description: Learn the fundamentals of operations management and acquire skills to analyze , measure , control and improve production processes .

name: BUAD 497 Strategic Management
description: Examination of managerial decision-making , planning , and policy under changing environments ; readings , cases , exercises , simulations .

name: ECON 351x Microeconomics for Business
description: Development and business applications of : theory of the firm ; theory of the consumer ; intertemporal decisions ; decisions under risk ; market failures ; industrial and enterprise structure . Not for major credit for : economics , economics/mathematics , social sciences (economics) majors .

name: ECON 352x Macroeconomics for Business
description: Theoretical development and significance to business and markets of economic growth ; inflation ; unemployment ; monetary and fiscal policy ; business cycles ; savings and investment ; exchange rates .

name: MATH 118gx Fundamental Principles of Calculus
description: Derivatives ; extrema . Definite integral ; fundamental theorem of calculus . Extrema and definite integrals for functions of several variables .

name: MATH 125g Calculus I
description: Limits ; continuity , derivatives and applications ; antiderivatives ; the fundamental theorem of calculus ; exponential and logarithmic functions .

name: ACCT 370 External Financial Reporting Issues
description: Understanding of decision-making , problem solving , and research skills as a supplement to financial accounting knowledge for accounting professionals .

name: ACCT 371 Introduction to Accounting Systems
description: Understanding of technology and controls needed to capture data used by professionals in financial and managerial accounting , auditing and taxation .

name: ACCT 372 Internal Reporting Issues
description: Understanding of decision-making , problem solving , and research skills as a supplement to managerial accounting knowledge for accounting professionals .

name: ACCT 373 Introduction to Auditing and Assurance Services
description: Exploration of the requisite skills and knowledge needed to offer services in assurance , attestation or auditing engagements .

name: ACCT 374 Introduction to Tax Issues
description: Basic tax principles , introduction to U .S . federal , state and local tax systems , income and expense definitions , property transactions , and fundamentals of individual taxation .

name: ACCT 377 Valuation for Financial Statement Purposes
description: Explores Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 820 “Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures” and reviews the historical background of US GAAP fair value guidance .

name: ACCT 430 Accounting Ethics
description: Theoretical knowledge and practical application accountants need to identify ethical issues and reconcile conflicts among competing stakeholders’ interests in all major areas of accounting practice .

name: ACCT 470 Advanced External Financial Reporting Issues
description: Develop capabilities to identify and resolve advanced external financial reporting challenges , focusing primarily on operating , financing , and investing activities of business enterprises .

name: ACCT 473 Financial Statement Auditing
description: Course builds on the background developed in ACCT 373  , specifically the process used by external auditors to conduct financial statement audits .

name: ACCT 474 Tax Issues for Business
description: Capabilities to identify and articulate tax issues related to a business entity’s life : formation , investing , financing and operations , and change of form .

name: ACCT 416 Financial Reporting and Analysis
description: Examination of the role of financial statement analysis in the prediction of a firm’s future financial performance .

name: ACCT 462 Detecting Fraudulent Financial Reporting
description: Understanding/identifying methods of fraudulent financial reporting , and signals that financial statements were fictitiously prepared ; major frameworks for analyzing ethical dilemmas ; reforms in corporate reporting environment .

name: ACCT 463 Internal Audit
description: Examination of internal audit/auditors and their relationship to management , the investors , the regulators , and the external auditors .

name: ACCT 471 Accounting Information Systems
description: Issues related to the design , control , and implementation of accounting information systems .

name: ACCT 472 Managerial Accounting
description: Understanding of systems providing cost information useful in management decision-making and problem solving .

name: ACCT 475 Systems Security and Audit
description: Issues related to the security , control , and auditing of accounting information systems .

name: ACCT 476 Performance Measurement Issues
description: Introduction to understanding how management control systems can enhance achievement of the organization’s objectives and strategies .

name: ACCT 477 Intermediate Fair Value Issues in Accounting
description: Develops the ability to identify and understand new areas of emerging guidance involving fair value issues and to recognize and demonstrate appropriate application of methodologies .

name: ACCT 478 Accounting Systems Design
description: Explores the design of accounting systems . Introduction to tools and techniques for analyzing and designing accounting systems with an emphasis on system controls and reporting .

name: ACCT 479 Accounting Systems Development
description: Examines the fundamentals of accounting systems development . Introduction to the concepts of implementation and support , with emphasis on system quality assurance , evaluation and attestation .

name: ACCT 493 Leventhal Honors Research Seminar
description: Provides the methodological tools to identify research problems , develop researchable hypotheses , apply appropriate methodologies , conduct research , derive meaningful conclusions from data , write a research proposal .

name: THTR 105 Introduction to Screen Acting
description: Introduction to the theoretical and foundational practices , techniques and strategies specific to screen acting in relation to the basic dynamics of acting for the stage .

name: THTR 115a Movement I
description: Basic training for the actor’s body for expression and communication . Awareness and control through mind-body techniques .

name: THTR 120aL Acting I
description: Basic principles and techniques of acting through theatre games and improvisation . Introduction to contemporary texts , basic characterization and cold reading techniques .

name: Introduction to Theatrical Production
description: Introduction to the nonperformance areas of theatrical production (administrative , design , and technical fields) through hands-on participation in USC productions .

name: THTR 140a Voice I
description: Physiological mechanism of voice : breath control , phonation , resonance , articulation of language for the stage ; expressive use of stress , intonation and rhythm .

name: Movement II
description: Training of the actor’s body with focus on development of precision and strength .

name: Intermediate Acting I
description: Continuing development of imagination leading to an increased range of dramatic expression through the formalized text of William Shakespeare .

name: Voice II
description: Development of the voice using material which explores the techniques of Shakespeare and his contemporaries .

name: THTR 250 Camera and Improvisation
description: Understanding on-camera acting and improvisation by creating original material both in front and behind the camera .

name: Directing
description: Examination of basic directorial principles . Pre-production analysis and rehearsal procedures ; relationship of the director to actor ; integration of technical aspects of production .

name: Physical Theatre I
description: Actor training anchored by rigorous physical movements . Activities include comedy , clowning , juggling , and mask work .

name: Intermediate Acting II
description: Further development of range and breadth of performance skills with emphasis on texts of heightened language and style .

name: Intermediate Voice
description: Extended development of vocal freedom and range , acquisition of articulate speech . Enhancement of vocal power and resonance , techniques for performing with a dialect .

name: THTR 397 Theatre Practicum
description: Substantive participation in productions sponsored by the school and supervised by the faculty .

name: THTR 410 The Digital Actor
description: Empowers the student to forge a career in acting by managing and utilizing the many facets of social and digital media .

name: THTR 411 The Business of Acting
description: Develops the student’s ability to connect and combine managerial , economic and business-related skills with the craft and career of acting .

name: THTR 415 Physical Theatre II
description: Advanced Physical Acting focusing on principles of verbal/non-verbal improvisation and communication . Elements of textual analysis , including development of character mask and of the ensemble .

name: THTR 420a Senior Project
description: Contemporary material from plays and screenplays with an emphasis on individual challenges and problems .

name: THTR 427 Audition Technique for Film , Television and New Media
description: Develop on-camera auditioning skills for actors at a professional level in a variety of film , television , and new media venues .

name: THTR 440 Advanced Voice
description: Continuation of exercises related to the individual student for the stage .

name: THTR 464 An Actor's Reel
description: Using original and existing scripted material for film , television and new media students will act , film and edit scenes to form a professional performance reel .

name: THTR 467 Going Viral : Performance for New Media
description: A writing and performance course (partially online) for new media . Students will learn to create original short form and web series content for new media including YouTube , Funny or Die , Periscope and other Internet platforms .

name: Senior Showcase
description: Designed to provide the graduating students with an opportunity to select , prepare and perform for agents , directors and producers in film , television and theatre . Audition required .

name: THTR 475 Acting on Camera : The Collaborative Process
description: Acting students will learn to develop on-camera acting skills and to collaborate with student directors and cinematographers from the School of Cinematic Arts .

name: THTR 480a Performance for Camera
description: Structured to address the dynamics of acting in relation to film/television . Refining the students’ understanding of the similarities/differences between acting on stage/film .

name: THTR 497 Advanced Theatre Practicum
description: Intensive participation in a production sponsored by the school and supervised by the faculty , to increase and develop artistic growth .

name: THTR 125 Text Studies for Production
description: Focuses on the questions , artistic choices , methodologies , and approaches of an actor/director/designer in the preparation of a production score prior to rehearsal .

name: THTR 225g Theatre Across History and Cultures
description: The analysis of a range of plays from different times and cultures with a consideration of the roles of actor , director , dramaturg and designer .

name: THTR 310 Comedy and Diversity
description: Issues of diversity are central to the societal function of comedy . Students will explore the techniques , structures and performance of sitcoms , sketch comedy and stand-up .

name: THTR 312 LGBTQ Theatre
description: Explores the range and genealogy of LGBTQ theatre and performance across political , historical , and theatrical contexts .

name: THTR 395m Drama as Human Relations
description: A focus on American ethnic and multicultural diversity from the perspectives of gender , race , and myth as revealed in plays , film , and other performance media .

name: THTR 405m Performing Identities
description: This course explores the live performance medium as a creative means of social redress and personal expression .

name: Theatre on the Edge
description: An exploration of the art of theatre at the edge of possibilities .

name: THTR 456 Latinx Theatre
description: Explores the range and genealogy of Latinx theatre and performance from its origins in the last fifty years to the present .

name: THTR 460 Asian and Asian American Theatre : Identity and Aesthetics
description: Explores Asian and Asian Amerian theatre , from the historical to the contemporary , with an aim toward understanding issues of aesthetics , acculturation , and identity .

name: THTR 476mw African American Theatre , Dance , and Performance
description: A survey of African American theatre and cultural performance traditions as a reflection of both African American culture and American history .

name: THTR 301 Greek and Roman Theatre
description: Examines the function of theatre , production and acting conventions , and the drama of classical Greece and Rome .

name: THTR 302 Shakespeare in His World
description: The plays and theatre of Shakespeare , the influences on his work and his contemporary world .

name: Comedy of Manners
description: Study of the development of Comedy of Manners , with primary focus on Restoration Comedy of Manners .

name: Advanced Topics in Modern Drama
description: 20th century realism and the avant-garde .

name: THTR 400 Eco-Theatre : Art and Science in Contemporary Plays
description: Explores theatre artists’ responses to the growing environmental crisis and provides a model for the intersection of theatre and other disciplines .

name: THTR 401 Contemporary Theatre in a Changing World
description: Explores the bold approaches that characterize the best of contemporary theatre , as well as the artists who are groundbreakers in a changing world .

name: THTR 403 The Performing Arts
description: An interdisciplinary inquiry into the aesthetics of the performing arts . Examines a dramatic classic and its adaptation into musical theatre , opera , ballet , and film .

name: Acting Theory
description: Examination of the theoretical foundations of acting as an art form through the reading of primary historical texts .

name: WRIT 150 Writing and Critical Reasoning–Thematic Approaches
description: Academic writing , emphasizing analysis and argumentation , rhetorical judgment , critical reasoning , creative insight , the careful use of evidence , ethical perspectives , logical organization , stylistic and grammatical fluency .

name: Advanced Writing
description: Instruction in writing for various audiences on topics related to a student’s professional or disciplinary interests , with some emphasis on issues of broad public concern .

name: Calculus II
description: A continuation of MATH 125  : trigonometric functions ; applications of integration ; techniques of integration ; indeterminate forms ; infinite series ; Taylor series ; polar coordinates .

name: MATH 127 Enhanced Calculus II
description: Applications of integration , review of techniques of integration , infinite sequences and series , some beginning linear algebra , ordinary differential equations . Designed for students who earn a score of 4 or 5 on the Advanced Placement Calculus AB Examination , or a score of 3 or 4 on the BC Examination . Admission to course by departmental approval .

name: MATH 129 Calculus II for Engineers and Scientists
description: Trigonometric functions ; applications of integration ; techniques of integration ; indeterminate forms ; infinite series ; Taylor series ; polar coordinates . Engineering and physics applications .

name: Calculus III
description: A continuation of MATH 126  ; vectors , vector valued functions ; differential and integral calculus of functions of several variables ; Green’s theorem .

name: MATH 227 Enhanced Calculus III
description: A continuation of MATH 127  ; vectors and vector spaces functions of several variables , partial differential equations , optimization theory , multiple integration ; Green’s Stokes’ , divergence theorems .

name: MATH 229 Calculus III for Engineers and Scientists
description: A continuation of MATH 129  ; vectors , vector valued functions ; differential and integral calculus of functions of several variables ; Green’s theorem . Engineering and physics applications .

name: Mathematics of Physics and Engineering I
description: First-order differential equations ; second-order linear differential equations ; determinants and matrices ; systems of linear differential equations ; Laplace transforms .

name: PHYS 151Lg Fundamentals of Physics I : Mechanics and Thermodynamics
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in Physics and Astronomy . Statics and dynamics of particles and rigid bodies , conservation principles , gravitation , simple harmonic oscillators , thermodynamics , heat engines , entropy .

name: PHYS 161Lg Advanced Principles of Physics I
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in Physics and Astronomy . Introductory treatment intended for well-qualified students . Dynamics of particles and rigid bodies , conservation laws , wave motion , thermodynamics , heat engines , entropy .

name: PHYS 152L Fundamentals of Physics II : Electricity and Magnetism
description: Electrostatics , magnetostatics , electrical circuits , wave motion , sound waves , electromagnetic waves .

name: PHYS 162L Advanced Principles of Physics II
description: Electrostatics , magnetostatics , electrical circuits , electric and magnetic properties of matter , Maxwell’s equations , electromagnetic waves , propagation of light .

name: PHYS 153 L Fundamentals of Physics III : Optics and Modern Physics
description: Geometrical optics , interference , diffraction , special relativity , quantum mechanics , atomic physics , solid state physics .

name: PHYS 163L Advanced Principles of Physics III
description: Interference and diffraction of waves , special relativity , quantum mechanics , atomic physics , nuclear physics , condensed matter physics , elementary particles .

name: CHEM 105aLg General Chemistry
description: Fundamental principles and laws of chemistry ; laboratory work emphasizes quantitative procedures .

name: CHEM 115aLg Advanced General Chemistry
description: Equivalent to CHEM 105a   -CHEM 105b   , but taught at a higher level for exceptionally well-prepared students .

name: MASC 110 L Materials Science
description: Chemical bonding and structure in crystalline , amorphous , and molecular solids ; tendency and mechanisms for chemical change ; homogeneous and heterogeneous equilibria .

name: Introduction to Aerospace Engineering
description: Gateway to the Aerospace Engineering major . Introduction to flight vehicle performance and propulsion . Elements of the physics of gases . Laboratory : computers and graphics ; model rocket and glider test flights .

name: AME 201 Statics
description: Analysis of forces acting on particles and rigid bodies in static equilibrium ; equivalent systems of forces ; friction ; centroids and moments of inertia ; introduction to energy methods .

name: AME 204 Strength of Materials
description: Stress , strain and deflection of mechanical elements due to tension , shear , bending , or torsion ; combined loads ; energy methods , statically indeterminate structures ; strength-based design .

name: AME 231L Mechanical Behavior of Materials
description: Material properties of metals , ceramics , and composites ; stress-strain relationships ; microstructural characteristics ; fracture , fatigue , and creep ; effects of processing .

name: AME 261 Basic Flight Mechanics
description: Performance of flight vehicles ; maximum speed , rate-of-climb , range , and endurance ; basic stability and control , weight , and balance ; computer exercises .

name: AME 301 Dynamics
description: 2-D and 3-D kinematics and dynamics of particles and rigid bodies ; systems of particles and rigid bodies ; coupled rigid bodies ; introduction to vibrations .

name: AME 302 Dynamic Systems
description: Modeling of lumped parameter elements and systems ; free and forced response of first and second order systems ; design oriented approach to dynamic systems .

name: Computer-Aided Analyses for Aero-Mechanical Design
description: Introduction to the finite element method ; practical application of computer analysis tools for structural analysis and design .

name: AME 309 Dynamics of Fluids
description: Fluid statics ; conservation of mass , momentum , and energy in integral and differential form ; applications . Laminar and turbulent pipe flow ; compressible flow ; potential flow over bodies .

name: AME 310 Engineering Thermodynamics I
description: Fundamental laws of thermodynamics applied to actual and perfect gases and vapors ; energy concepts , processes , and applications .

name: AME 341aL Mechoptronics Laboratory I and II
description: A coordinated laboratory and lecture sequence on aeromechanical instrumentation and device control stressing the symbiotic integration of mechanical , optical and electronic components .

name: Energy and Propulsion
description: Performance and analysis of reciprocating , jet , rocket engines , and hybrid systems . Characteristics of inlets , compressors , combustors , turbines , nozzles and engine systems . Energy and environmental problems .

name: AME 441a L Senior Projects Laboratory
description: Individual engineering projects designed and constructed to model and test a physical principle or system .

name: AME 451 Linear Control Systems I
description: Transform methods , block diagrams ; transfer functions ; stability ; root-locus and frequency domain analysis and design ; state space and multiloop systems .

name: AME 481 Aircraft Design
description: Aircraft design and analysis , design requirements and specifications ; integration of structure , propulsion , control system , and aerodynamic configuration ; performance analysis and prediction .

name: Foundations of Astronautical Engineering
description: Coordinate systems and transformations . Spherical trigonometry . Orientation angles . Spacecraft orbits and orbital maneuvers . Introduction to rocket propulsion , spacecraft attitude dynamics and control , and space environment .

name: ITP 168 Introduction to MATLAB
description: Fundamentals of MATLAB : a high-performance numeric computation and visualization environment . Overview of linear algebra and matrix manipulation ; using 2-D and 3-D plotting routines ; programming in MATLAB ; basic numerical analysis .

name: Computational Solutions to Engineering Problems
description: Mathematical aspects of the solutions to typical advanced mechanical engineering problems . Modeling , simulation , computational aspects , computer solutions , and computational tools .

name: Flight Mechanics
description: Applications of basic aerodynamics to aircraft and missile performance , power and thrust , stability and control , compressibility effects .

name: Aerodynamic Theory
description: Basic relations describing the inviscid flow field about bodies and wings moving at subsonic and supersonic speeds .

name: AME 443 Control Systems Laboratory
description: Vibration measurement and analysis ; simulation , design , and experimental verification of mechanical control systems ; identification of system parameters , implementation of controllers , verification of closed-loop performance via experimentation and stimulation .

name: Engineering Fluid Dynamics
description: Laminar and turbulent boundary layer flow with and without heat transfer ; boundary layer separation , stability , transition and control ; introduction to compressible fluid flow .

name: AME 485 Aerospace Structures I
description: Design , qualification , and workmanship verification of aerospace structures . Analysis for assessing buckling and crippling , welds , and analysis of connections and thin-walled structures .

name: Theory of Structures I
description: Deformations and deflections of elastic systems ; statically indeterminate beams , arches , and frames ; secondary stresses .

name: Stress Analysis
description: Theories of failure , shear center , unsymmetrical bending , curved beams , torsion of non-circular sections ; cylinders , rotating discs , thermal stresses , inelastic strains , energy methods .

name: Engineering Vibrations I
description: Theory of free and forced vibrations with and without damping ; systems of single and multiple degrees of freedom ; iteration ; methods ; vibration isolation ; instrumentation .

name: Computer-Aided Design of Mechanical Systems
description: Design of mechanical systems using advanced graphics techniques ; computer-aided drafting , design optimization , elements of computer graphics , solids modeling ; introduction to computer-aided manufacturing .

name: CE 458 Theory of Structures II
description: Matrix algebra ; stiffness method ; force method ; computer analysis of planar structures .

name: Engineering Dynamics
description: Principles of dynamics applied to mechanical and aerospace problems . Introduction to gyroscopic motion and rigid body dynamics .

name: Spacecraft Dynamics
description: Two-body motion , rigid-body motion , attitude dynamics and maneuvers , spacecraft stabilization : gravity gradient , reaction wheels , magnetic torques , thruster attitude control .

name: Thermal Systems Design
description: Design methodology for thermal systems ; boilers , condensers , air conditioning , power generation , air pollution control , combustion and alternative fuels .

name: ASTE 421x Space Mission Design
description: Space systems engineering process : requirements definition ; trade studies ; system integration ; technical reviews ; cost and schedule development ; case studies ; ethics . Capstone design experience .

name: Engineering Thermodynamics II
description: Application of thermodynamic principles to fluid flow , power cycles , and refrigeration .

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: First , second , and third thermodynamic laws ; thermodynamic potentials , applications ; distribution laws , kinetic theory , transport phenomena , specific heats .

name: Heat Transfer
description: General principles underlying heat transfer by conduction , convection , and radiation ; steady and transient conditions ; heat exchangers .

name: AMST 205g Introduction to American Popular Culture
description: Examines the relation between U .S . national culture , race , and popular culture .

name: AMST 206mg The Politics and Culture of the 1960s
description: Examines political and cultural change in the United States during the decade of the 1960s .

name: AMST 285gm African American Popular Culture
description: Examines history of popular cultural forms such as literature , music , dance , theatre , and visual arts produced by and about African Americans .

name: AMST 301gp America , the Frontier , and the New West
description: Introduction to the interdisciplinary study of American political , cultural , and social life with a particular emphasis on the Western United States as a region .

name: Literature and Popular Culture
description: Study of mass-reproduced verbal and visual art forms , such as graphic novels , comics , animation , popular music , video , graffiti , advertising .

name: Interpreting Popular Culture
description: Popular culture as an indicator of cultural values , a producer and reflection of cultural meaning , and a means of communication ; theory and case studies .

name: Visual and Popular Culture
description: Course in the theory and practices of “popular culture ,” highlighting modern and contemporary culture , film , video and popular music , as well as narrative forms .

name: HIST 380 American Popular Culture
description: Rise of popular culture (sports , amusement parks , movies , and television) and its significance in American society from mid 19th century to the present .

name: AMST 357m Latino Social Movements
description: Focuses on the political experience of Latinos in the U .S . Comparative analysis of their political experiences and perspectives , their histories of identity formation , and their political organizations .

name: Leadership in the Community — Internship
description: Eight to 10 hours per week in a community-based internship plus two hour lecture . Theoretical and practical issues associated with community leadership .

name: African American Culture and Society
description: Examines social and cultural issues affecting the past and present lives of African Americans in the United States .

name: AMST 395m African American Humor and Culture
description: Examination of one of several traditions of African American humor for insights into shifting notions of race , culture , language and identity in and beyond Black America .

name: AMST 448m Chicano and Latino Literature
description: Development of poetry , essay , short story and novel of the Chicano and Latino peoples of the United States , with particular emphasis on the differentiating characteristics between the multiple cultures that constitute the Latino populations .

name: AMST 449m Asian American Literature
description: Survey of Asian American literature from the earliest time to the present ; development of prose , poetry and novel .

name: ENGL 343m Images of Women in Contemporary Culture
description: Representations of women and gender relations in contemporary literature and mass culture , using the tools of feminist , literary , and political theory .

name: AHIS 363m Contemporary Art and the Culture Wars
description: Focuses on issues of race , gender , and sexuality in American art of the last three decades .

name: AHIS 370g Modern Art III : 1940 to the Present
description: Questions of social engagement and political structure address this examination of major international movements in art since 1940 .

name: History of the American Film , 1925–1950
description: Screenings of American film classics and their relationship to society . Lectures and discussions .

name: CTCS 393 Postwar Hollywood , 1946-1962
description: Cinematic and extra-cinematic determinants of Post-Classical and Modernist Hollywood studio and independent genres , styles , and the star-phenomenon and their relationship to American history and culture .

name: History of the American Film , 1977–present
description: Cinematic and extra-cinematic determinants of Postmodernist Hollywood studio and independent genres , styles , and the star-phenomenon and their relationship to American history and culture .

name: ENGL 371g Literary Genres and Film
description: Literary studies in the relationship between fiction and drama and their adaptation as films .

name: Science Fiction
description: Investigation of the scope and possibilities of British and American science fiction as a genre , with some attention to its historical development .

name: ENGL 381 Narrative Forms in Literature and Film
description: Critical approaches to narrative form in literature and film ; readings and films from several genres and periods , emphasis on gender , ethnic , and cultural studies .

name: Producing Film Histories
description: History of film form and its institutions . Students will produce an original written or multimedia research project .

name: MUJZ 419m The Jazz Experience : Myths and Culture
description: An examination of the music , culture , and mythology of jazz revealed through the study of jazz fiction , film , poetry , and recorded examples .

name: The Beatles : Their Music and Their Times
description: Music , lyrics , recordings , production techniques , career strategy , social ramifications , and especially the technological impact of the musical group known as The Beatles .

name: AHIS 100g Introduction to Visual Culture
description: The description and analysis of various forms of visual culture , including both mass media and “high” art representations , both Western and non-Western images .

name: Critical Approaches to Modern Art
description: Consideration of various categories of “The Modern” as they have been constructed in Western art of the late 19th and 20th centuries .

name: AHIS 255g Culture Wars : Art and Social Conflict in the Modern World
description: Examination of social conflicts and political controversies in American culture through the lens of visual art and photography .

name: L .A . Now : Contemporary Art in Los Angeles
description: Explores the production , display and critical reception of contemporary art , taking Los Angeles as its laboratory .

name: Myths , Arts , Realities : Visual Culture in California , 1849 to the Present
description: Diverse interpretations of “the California experience and lifestyle” in paintings , sculpture , photography , cinema , public art and popular culture of the last 150 years .

name: AHIS 365m African American Art
description: A survey of the fine arts produced by people of African descent in the United States from the nation’s inception in the late 18th century until the contemporary movement .

name: ANTH 240gm Representing 9/11 and Hurricane Katrina
description: Critical examination of visual , textual , and performative representations of culture and identity anchored by discussion of the terrorist attacks of 9/11 and Hurricane Katrina

name: ANTH 263g Exploring Culture through Film
description: Concepts of social anthropology using filmic representations of societies throughout the world in contrast to written ethnography .

name: ANTH 380 Sex and Gender in Anthropological Perspective
description: Cultural construction of gender in a number of non-Western societies is compared to ideas of sex and sexual differences in American society .

name: Multidisciplinary Seminar in Visual Anthropology
description: IrregularApplication of broad cast journalism , cinema , and anthropology to ethnographic film making .

name: COMM 206 Communication and Culture
description: Examines cultural institutions , ideologies , artifacts , and productions ; role of culture in everyday life ; cultural studies as methodology ; culture and power .

name: Sound Clash : Popular Music and American Culture
description: Music as inter-cultural communication and method for exploring race and ethnicity in the constitution of American culture and American self ; role of music industry .

name: Media and Society
description: Interplay between media and society , including family and children’s socialization , inter-group relations and community , pornography and violence , gender and race , media ethics , conduct of politics .

name: The Business and Culture of Celebrity
description: Employs the concept of “celebrity” as an optic through which to view and assess some of the key aspects of the communication revolution .

name: The Rhetoric of Los Angeles
description: Representations of Los Angeles communicated in diverse media ; the city as a rhetorical text ; analysis of cultural identities , art , architecture , and representations in popular culture .

name: COMM 366 Designing Media and Communication Projects for Social Change
description: Students explore the theoretical and practical issues involved in designing effective media and communication projects for social change in international contexts .

name: COMM 371 Censorship and the Law : From the Press to Cyberspace
description: The study of current and historical battles over the limits of free expression from press and public parks to television , movies , music and cyberspace .

name: Fashion , Media and Culture
description: shion as a form of communication and culture ; fashion’s role in identity , body politics , art , nationhood , celebrity and Hollywood culture , youth cultures and subversive practices .

name: COMM 413 Propaganda , Ideology and Public Controversy
description: Seminar examining the relationship between propaganda , ideology , critical thinking and rhetoric ; application to contemporary controversies , both domestic and global ; role of public argument .

name: COMM 415m African American Rhetoric and Image
description: Interactive course addresses how people of color use symbols to construct identities and communities and disrupt networks through media , politics , entertainment and technology .

name: COMM 426 Religion , Media and Hollywood : Faith in TV
description: How religion , ethics and spirituality are embedded , embodied and emplotted in television drama ; how secular texts represent “lived religion” to increasingly diverse audiences .

name: American Media and Entertainment Industries
description: Examines the history , technology , regulations and business practices of American broadcast and entertainment industries .

name: Entertainment , Marketing and Culture
description: Explores blurring of entertainment , marketing and culture in advanced information economies ; intersections of culture and media and their social ramifications .

name: COMM 458m Race and Ethnicity in Entertainment and the Arts
description: Examines how race and ethnicity as social categories are shaped by communication media ; focuses on how race and ethnicity sustain entertainment and media industries .

name: COMM 465m Gender in Media Industries and Products
description: Examination of the effect of gender stratification in media industries upon the cultural products they create , especially gender and gender/race role portrayals .

name: CRIT 371 Art in the Public Realm : Contemporary Issues
description: Critical frameworks and theoretical perspectives of contemporary public art issues explored through case studies and discussions with artists , architects , and designers engaging the public realm .

name: CTCS 192gm Race , Class , and Gender in American Film
description: Analyzes issues of race , class and gender in contemporary American culture as represented in the cinema .

name: Studies in National and Regional Media
description: Detailed investigation of traditions , achievements , and trends of film and/or electronic media in a particular country or region .

name: Television Criticism and Theory
description: The evaluation of television programs and their reception from various theoretical perspectives which may include cultural studies , race and ethnic studies , psychoanalysis , gender and queer studies , and semiotics .

name: History of American Television
description: History of television as an entertainment , information , and art medium . Emphasis on programming and institutional history , including issues of regulation , censorship , aesthetics and activism .

name: African American Cinema
description: IrregularIntensive survey of African American cinema ; topics include history , criticism , politics , and cinema’s relationship to other artifacts of African American culture .

name: CTCS 408 Contemporary Political Film and Digital Media
description: IrregularExamination of a variety of politically engaged films and digital media recently produced in the U .S . and abroad , with particular emphasis on aesthetic strategies .

name: Censorship in Cinema
description: An inquiry into the practice and patterns of censorship in cinema .

name: CTCS 411 Film , Television and Cultural Studies
description: Detailed examination of film/television from the perspectives and insights of Cultural Studies ; focus on the production and reception of cultural texts , practices , and communities .

name: CTCS 412 Gender , Sexuality and Media
description: Examines how gender and sexuality are figured in cinema and television with an emphasis on the development of feminist media theory .

name: CTCS 414 Latina/o Screen Cultures
description: Examination of Latino/a moving image production including film , video , and digital media in the context of the politics of race , class , gender , sexuality , and international relations .

name: Critical Theory and Analysis of Games
description: (Enroll in CTIN 462 )

name: CTCS 478 Culture , Technology and Communications
description: Cultural study of communications technology and its relationship to society . Evaluation of the social and cultural impact of technologies from the telegraph to the Internet .

name: DANC 212g Dance in Popular Culture
description: Examination of the role of dance in popular culture in a studio setting . Practical studies in styles and their evolution in recreational and professional settings .

name: DANC 302g Hip Hop Don't Stop : Exploring Black Vernacular Dance
description: Introduction to the history and practice of Urban Folk Dance including hip hop , freestyle , street dance and the relevant social dances of the 20th century .

name: ENGL 341 Women in English Literature before 1800
description: English poetry , plays , novels , and discursive prose by and about women from 1375 to 1800 .

name: ENGL 342g Women in English and American Literature after 1800
description: Women as writers and as subjects , with special emphasis on feminist and liberationist traditions and on changing female images after 1800 .

name: JOUR 467 Gender and the News Media
description: Gender and news media evolving images of women and men in print and electronic media . Impact of gender in content and style of news , television and cinema . Open to non-majors .

name: Sociolinguistics
description: Linguistic and cultural pluralism in the U .S . ; distributional and structural characteristics of selected urban and minority dialects ; the relationship between dialects and “media standard .”

name: SOCI 342m Race Relations
description: Past and present relations between the White majority and the “conquered minorities” (Blacks , Chicanos , American Indians) , as well as Asian immigrants ; conflict vs . assimilation perspectives .

name: Visual Sociology of the City and Its Residents
description: Students examine images of urban America and use the camera to produce visual representation in their analysis of social relations .

name: The Sociology of Popular Culture
description: From the entertainment capital of the world , course surveys sociological research on artistic producers and critical theories of the connections between popular culture and society .

name: THTR 488mw Theatre in the Community
description: Research and actively develop the theory of theatre as a moving political , social , economic and spiritual force of change within the local community .

name: THTR 295 Theatre in Los Angeles
description: Current state of American theatre , through a study of acting , playwriting , criticism , stage design , lighting , and dramatic styles .

name: AMST 200gm Introduction to American Studies and Ethnicity
description: Introduction to American studies and ethnic studies . Provides an overview of major theories , concepts , and issues .

name: AMST 230g Introduction to African American Studies
description: Examines the socio-historical and political imperatives of multi-disciplinary scholarship foundational to the study of African Americans .

name: Junior Seminar in American Studies and Ethnicity : Theories and Methods
description: Advanced study in interdisciplinary theories and methods for analyzing race and ethnicity in the United States , including a comparative study of topics such as inequality , gender , and class .

name: Senior Seminar in American Studies and Ethnicity
description: Capstone course for majors , highlighting interdisciplinary study of race and ethnicity in a comparative context .

name: AMST 250gmw The African Diaspora
description: History , political-economy and aesthetics of the African Diaspora with emphasis on Latin America , the Caribbean , Europe and Africa .

name: AMST 252gmw Black Social Movements in the U .S .
description: This course examines black social movements for freedom , justice , equality , and self-determination . Beginning with Reconstruction , movements include labor , civil rights , radical feminism , socialism , reparations , Black Nationalism , prisoners’ rights , and Hip Hop .

name: AMST 332m Post-Civil Rights Black America
description: Analyzes the political , economic , and cultural experiences of the post-1965 period through an interrogation of contemporary conditions , movements , and responses to power in Black America .

name: HIST 355 The African-American Experience
description: An historical and social analysis of the African- American experience from Colonial times to the present .

name: The Age of Emancipation
description: Examines the evolution of racial status law in the long 19th century , with special emphasis on the relationship between slavery , segregation , and citizenship .

name: HIST 455 Advanced Topics in African-American History
description: Exploration of African-American history through primary and secondary sources employing a colloquium format with an emphasis on shared responsibility for comprehensive discussion and analysis .

name: HIST 456 Race , Slavery , and the Making of the Atlantic World
description: OtherIntroduction to the literature of the Atlantic World with a focus on slavery and its role in the emergence of the modern era . Seminar enrollment limited to 15 students .

name: AHIS 475m Blackness in American Visual Culture
description: A historical overview of how people of African - descent have been represented visually in American culture .

name: African-American Poetry and Drama
description: Survey of black poetry and plays in America from the Emancipation to the present , with special emphasis on the new poets and dramatists of the current “Black revolution .”

name: ENGL 447m African-American Narrative
description: Development of the novel in African-American literature beginning with the anti-slavery fiction of William W . Brown and his pre-Emancipation contemporaries and concluding with the emerging novelists of the late sixties .

name: GESM 120g Seminar in Humanistic Inquiry
description: Interpretation and analysis of works of the imagination , exploring language , thought , and cultural traditions in relation to one another .

name: MUSC 320gmw Hip-hop Music and Culture
description: A history of hip-hop music from its inception to the present : its musical processes and styles , as well as attendant social , political and cultural issues .

name: AMST 101gmw Race and Class in Los Angeles
description: Analysis of race and the economic , political , gender , and social dimensions of contemporary Los Angeles including topics such as residential segregation , economic inequality , and city politics .

name: AMST 274gmw Exploring Ethnicity through Film
description: Examination of the constructions of American ethnicity/race in film .

name: AMST 330m Black Music and the Political Imagination
description: Explores the changing political meanings of “Black music” throughout the 20th century , from freedom to a threat to civil order , from racial integration to Black liberation .

name: AMST 337m Islam in Black America : From Slavery to Hip Hop
description: Exploration of the rise of Islam in Black America , and the relationship of Black American Muslims to more recent Muslim immigrants using historical and sociopolitical frameworks .

name: AMST 342m Law and Identities
description: Examines the complex and contested interaction between the law and racial , gender , religious , ethnic , and sexual identities using historical and contemporary cases .

name: AMST 344m Islamic Law and American Society
description: Examination of the nature and substance of Islamic law (Shari’a) and how it relates to American democracy , society and secularism .

name: AMST 348m Race and Environmentalism
description: Relationships between environmentalism , environmental problems and racial-ethnic minorities . Rise of environmental justice movement . Assessment of social science methods used to investigate these relationships .

name: AMST 389m Carceral Geographies
description: Focusing on California , interdisciplinary research teams will study why there are so many new U .S . prisons . What is their relationship to shopping malls , gated communities , globalization?

name: AMST 466m The Psychology of African Americans
description: Provides an introduction to the study of health , mental health , and social behavior among African Americans .

name: ANTH 445 African American Anthropology
description: An examination of anthropological research on race and African American culture , from the 18th century to the present .

name: GESM 130g Seminar in Social Analysis
description: Individual and collective human action as it shapes and is shaped by economic organizations , political institutions , and broad social and cultural settings .

name: HIST 265gw Racism , Sexism , and the Law
description: Study of laws concerning marriage , inheritance , slavery , immigration and the allocation of public space and how they have organized historical constructions of race and sex .

name: Ethnic Politics
description: Analysis of the political behavior and roles of ethnic and racial groups in the American political system ; public policy issues and patterns of political action are examined .

name: Black Politics in the American Political System
description: The effects of the organization of the American political system and its operations on blacks and other minorities .

name: PSYC 462m Culture and Mental Health
description: IrregularThe influence of culture , ethnicity , race and gender on human behavior . Mental health issues relevant to ethnic minorities in the U .S .

name: REL 469 Black Religion in America
description: Historical , sociological , and theological analysis of the nature and role of black religion in the American setting .

name: AMST 320 Social Construction of Race and Citizenship
description: Comparative perspective on the social construction of race and citizenship . Social , economic and political experiences of selected groups in the U .S . are examined .

name: AMST 353m Race and Racism in the Americas
description: Examination of selected topics in the historical development of racism with the goal of understanding the complex ways in which race has functioned in the modern world .

name: AMST 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: AMST 493 Senior Honors Thesis in American Studies and Ethnicity
description: Writing the honors thesis ; for students in one of the four American Studies and Ethnicity majors and Honors Program .

name: AMST 499 Special Topics
description: ecial topics in the earth sciences . Field trip required when appropriate to the topic . Departmental approval required .

name: POSC 424m Political Participation and American Diversity
description: Examines how diverse groups in the U .S . interact with the American political system .

name: SOCI 432m Racial and Ethnic Relations in a Global Society
description: Examines race/ethnic relations with U .S . and selected countries from a global perspective , causes/social effects of globalization on people’s lives , U .S . attitudes , and political policies .

name: AMST 378m Introduction to Asian American History
description: Comparative examination of the social , economic , and political experiences of Asian immigrants and their descendants in the U .S . , 1840s–present .

name: AMST 150gw The American War in Viet Nam
description: Examination of the ways that different nations and cultures have remembered the Vietnam War or the American War as it is called in Vietnam .

name: REL 336 Re-viewing Religion in Asian America
description: Interdisciplinary analysis of the religions traditions , institutions , and experiences of Asians and Pacific Islanders in the U .S .

name: AMST 220gmw The Making of Asian America
description: Historical , social , and cultural analysis of (East , South , and Southeast) Asians in the United States . Themes examined : immigration , race and gender relations , ethnic culture , community and identity .

name: POSC 328 Asian American Politics
description: Examines political attitudes , behavior and participation of Asian Americans in diverse U .S . society .

name: SOCI 376m Contemporary Issues in Asian American Communities
description: Survey of current social and political issues facing Asian American communities with emphasis on Los Angeles region ; design and implementation of community-based research projects .

name: AMST 373m History of the Mexican American
description: Racial and cultural background of Mexico ; immigration and conquest ; the Mexican in California and the southwest ; the rise of contemporary Mexican- American consciousness .

name: AMST 379 Arabs in America
description: Arab immigration and acculturation in the U .S . from late 19th century to present ; emphasis on community formation , race , religion and gender .

name: HIST 100gm The American Experience
description: Patterns of American development from Colonial times to the present .

name: Mexican Migration to the United States
description: Mexican migration from the 1850s to the present , emphasizing labor migrants to the United States .

name: The American West
description: IrregularThe nation’s westward movement from Colonial times to the present , with emphasis on the frontier’s effect on American life and institutions .

name: History of California
description: Exploration , colonization , and development of Hispanic California ; coming of the Americans ; political , economic , and cultural development of California since its acquisition by the United States .

name: AHIS 465 Studies in American Art
description: In-depth exploration of a specified topic in the history of American art .

name: AMST 305 Art and Performance in the Americas
description:
IrregularCritically examine the histories , formations , and possibilities of art and
performance from the 1970s forward .

name: ENGL 263g American Literature
description: Intensive reading of representative writers .

name: ENGL 442 American Literature , 1920 to the Present
description: American poetry , fiction , and drama since World War I with special attention to Eliot , Frost , Hemingway , Fitzgerald , O’Neill , Stevens , Faulkner , and Nabokov .

name: ENGL 445m The Literatures of America : Cross-Cultural Perspectives
description: Introduction to African- American , Chicano , Asian American , and Native-American literatures — and to the literary diversity of American cultures .

name: REL 483 Religion and Popular Culture in the United States
description: Critical analysis of the relationship between religion , mass media , and popular cultural forms in the U .S .

name: AMST 111g Sex in America
description: Explores how the proliferation of sexual cultures , identities , politics shape everyday lives in the U .S . and beyond .

name: AMST 140gw Borderlands in a Global Context
description: Interdisciplinary survey of theory and borderland site cases , national sentiment , linguistic and cultural conflicts , exploration of local , regional , and national identities in cultural contact zones .

name: AMST 201g LGBTQ America
description: Examines how U .S . sexual identity and experience are represented in the 20th and 21st century and introduces the interdisciplinary field of LGBTQ Studies .

name: AMST 202m Interethnic Diversity in the West
description: Introduction to community , culture , and ethnicity within the Western United States with emphasis on African American , Asian American , and Chicano/Latino cultures and social patterns .

name: AMST 204g Introduction to Native Studies
description: Overview of Native American studies , including Indigenous intellectualism and resistance through language revitalization , film-making , and the recognition of one another .

name: AMST 340m Latina/o LA
description: Examination of spatial and social patterns of the Latino population in Los - Angeles . Emphasis on economic , demographic and cultural processes .

name: AMST 345 Law and American Indian Studies
description:
Examines indigenous sovereignties and the historical and
contemporary legal histories and cases which inform them .

name: Cultural Circuits in the Americas
description: How does culture move within and across the Americas? What are the relationships between new global media conglomerates , “national cultural industries ,” and local cultural practices?

name: AMST 452m Race , Gender and Sexuality
description: Examination of sexual discourses in the United States in the context of slavery , empire , sex work , labor markets , schools and prisons .

name: JOUR 466m People of Color and the News Media
description: Reporting and portrayal of people of color in the United States ; impact of racial diversity on media , employment and access , and development of media for individuals and communities of color . Open to non-majors .

name: Urban Politics
description: Evolution of contemporary institutions ; differing views of community power ; major policies ; state and federal relations to local governments ; metropolitan community problems .

name: POSC 428 Latino Politics
description: Analysis of the historic and contemporary roles of Latinos in the American political system ; patterns of political participation and representation are examined .

name: REL 333 Religion in the Borderlands
description: Survey of religious history of U .S ./Mexico borderlands . Emphasis is given to definitions of place and transformations in culture and forms of belief .

name: SOCI 100gm Los Angeles and the American Dream
description: Los Angeles as a metaphor for the American Dream , exploring the city’s history and potential futures , including economic opportunity , social justice , spatial organization , and environmental sustainability .

name: SOCI 355m Immigrants in the United States
description: Social construction of historical and contemporary immigration to the United States , including causes of migration , immigration policies , and the socioeconomic integration of immigrants .

name: SOCI 356m Mexican Immigrants in Sociological Perspective
description: Effects of class , global inequality , legal status , gender , racial/ethnic , and language differences in distinguishing Mexican immigrant populations from the U .S .-born population ; differentiation among Mexican immigrants .

name: AMST 392 Undergraduate Research Methods
description: Examines processes of scholarly research ; quantitative and qualitative research methods ; faculty mentorship ; experiential learning ; research proposal writing ; careers in research . Sophomore or junior standing in the major . Departmental approval .

name: SPAN 413m Social and Geographic Varieties of Spanish
description: Historical , social , and cultural elements represented in the dialectal diversity of the Spanish language ; fieldwork in bilingual communities in the United States . Majors prepare assignments in Spanish , non-majors in English . Conducted in Spanish and English .

name: ART 110 Drawing for Art and Design
description: An introduction to drawing , both skill and perception oriented , as the basic tool for all the visual arts and design .

name: Reality Starts Here
description: Introduction to emerging forms of immersive entertainment , to Cinematic Arts faculty , and to guest speakers who will comment on the changing nature of the industry .

name: CTAN 101 L Introduction to the Art of Animation
description: Theory and practice of animation across organic and digital media with an emphasis on self-exploration .

name: CTAN 102 L Introduction to the Art of Movement
description: Theory and practice of animation with a focus on movement , gesture , timing and performance .

name: CTAN 201 L Intermediate Animation Production
description: Tools , skills and procedures used in animation production with a focus on professional execution of independent and collaborative productions .

name: CTAN 202L Introduction to 3-D Character Animation
description: 3-D animation performance utilizing preset rigs and virtual characters . Emphasis on timing , gesture , and performance .

name: CTAN 301L 3-D Character Performance Animation
description: Advanced 3-D character animation with an emphasis on performance , lip-syncing , timing and execution .

name: CTAN 302L Expanded Concepts in 2-D/3-D Animation
description: Integration of advanced concepts to create and produce a short 2-D/3-D animated work with original sound and content .

name: Professionalism of Animation
description: Understanding the business of the animation industry . Developing presentation skills for interviewing and pitching , preparing personal marketing tools , researching employment opportunities , and practicing networking techniques .

name: CTAN 336 Ideation and Pre-Production
description: Emphasis on lateral thinking working across boundaries to find underlying principles in terms of ideation : the act of becoming an agent of ideas .

name: CTAN 401a Senior Project
description: Understanding the requirements and relationships between theory and practice regarding the complexity of an animated film in idea and execution .

name: The World of Visual Effects
description: Introduction to the expanding field of visual effects ; topics include integration for cinematic storytelling and the study of digital productions employing the latest visual effects .

name: Writing for Animation
description: Workshop exploring concept and structure of long and short form animated films through practical writing exercises .

name: History of Animation
description: In-depth survey of historical developments , styles , techniques , theory and criticism of animation as an art form .

name: CTCS 190g Introduction to Cinema
description: Gateway to majors and minors in cinematic arts . Technique , aesthetics , criticism , and social implications of cinema . Lectures accompanied by screenings of appropriate films .

name: History of the International Cinema II
description: The development of international cinema from World War II to the present . Lectures , screenings , and discussions .

name: CTAN 496 Directed Studies
description: Individual research under faculty guidance .

name: CNTV 495 Internship in Cinematic Arts
description: On-the-job film , television , and interactive industry experience in the areas of interest of the individual student . Requires departmental approval .

name: CTIN 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Self-Defense
description: Basic instruction of self-defense for beginners ; strategies for standing and ground fighting situations with and without weapons .

name: PHED 120a Yoga
description: Introduction to meditation , breathing techniques and postures as a means towards relaxation ; increase muscle flexibility ; understanding of basic anatomy and nutritional guidelines .

name: DANC 181a Contemporary Dance
description: An introduction to methods developed from modern and post-modern dance techniques , including the study of the rebellious , individualistic , and democratic nature of dance in the 20th and 21st centuries .

name: DANC 184a Jazz Dance
description: An introduction to Jazz Dance technique , focusing on African and Latin based diaspora dances with European influences , improvisation , and strength/stretching series .

name: DANC 188a International Style Ballroom Dance
description: Introduction to International Standard , International Latin , and American Style ballroom dances . Designed to introduce students to the fundamentals of ballroom dance , emphasizing partner connection , communication , and creativity , with the practical application of dance within a social setting .

name: DANC 189a Tap Dance
description: An introduction to basic Tap Dance technique , rhythms , syncopation , and musicality , developing into complex steps and elementary dances with progressive understanding of weight change , improvisation , and combinations of sound .

name: THTR 122 Improvisation and Theatre Games
description: Individual and group exercise to free the actor physically and emotionally and to stimulate creativity , imagination , and self-expression .

name: Movement for Actors
description: Training and practice in the coordination of the physical apparatus of the actor utilizing various movement techniques through improvisation .

name: Non-Fiction Film and Television
description: An international survey of documentary , informational , and independent experimental film , video and television .

name: CTCS 464 Film and/or Television Genres
description: Rigorous examination of film and/or television genres : history , aesthetics , cultural context , social significance , and critical methodologies .

name: CTCS 469 Film and/or Television Style Analysis
description: Intensive study of the style of an auteur , studio , film or television making mode in terms of thematic and formal properties and their influences upon the art of film .

name: Transmedia Entertainment
description: An examination of transmedia , or cross-platform , entertainment : commercial and grassroots texts , theoretical framework , historical context , and commercial projects . Developing transmedia strategies for existing media properties .

name: ANTH 201g Principles of Human Organization
description: Major culture types , nomadic hunters and herders , peasant and tribal societies , sophisticated kingdoms ; social , political , economic , and religious institutions .

name: ANTH 202g Archaeology : Our Human Past
description: Archaeology as the means of investigating our shared human past , from the origins of humanity to the foundations of current civilization .

name: HBIO 200Lg The Human Animal
description: Foundations of the human species . Examination of scientific evidence from Darwinian theory , primate behavior , fossils , and the behavior of modern people .

name: Ethnographic Field Methods and Practicum
description: Survey of anthropological methods for acquiring and analyzing data . Ethnographic research methods and modes of analysis ; development of a field research project .

name: History of Anthropological Theory
description: Ideas about man , culture , and society which have formed the field of anthropology as a research discipline ; present trends and problems .

name: Humans and Ancient Environments
description: Examine ways that humans have caused and adapted to environmental change in the past .

name: ANTH 305 Childhood , Birth and Reproduction
description: Cross-cultural analysis and comparison of the experience and cultural conception of birth , maternity , parenthood , and childhood in western and non-western societies .

name: Primate Social Behavior and Ecology
description: (Enroll in HBIO 306 )

name: ANTH 309L Virtual and Digital Culture , Heritage and Archaeology
description: (Enroll in ARCG 305L )

name: Imaging Indians : From Warriors to Windtalkers
description: An historical and anthropological overview of 500 years of the presentation of differing and , often , contradictory perceptions of Native American life and character in popular and academic media .

name: ANTH 333gm Forms of Folklore
description: Introduction to folklore as a discipline , including folklore research methods and theory . Core course for the minor in Folklore and Popular Culture .

name: Comparative Muslim Societies
description: IrregularExamines issues of nationality , religion , and culture among Muslim peoples in the Middle East , Africa , East Asia , and the Soviet Union from an anthropological perspective .

name: Politics , Social Organization , and Law
description: Political and legal systems of primitive societies , social control , and structure .

name: Urban Anthropology
description: IrregularExploration of empirical and analytical approaches employed by anthropologists in studying urban phenomena cross-culturally ; urban origins , structure , and social processes .

name: Symbolic Anthropology
description: The role of symbols in the evolution of culture ; symbolic aspects of myth , ritual , and social life .

name: Life History in Anthropological Perspective
description: IrregularExamination of one’s life within its sociocultural context ; study of family history , autobiography , diary , journal , and film ; research and writing of a life history .

name: ANTH 370 Sex , Love , and Marriage : An Introduction to Kinship
description: Comparative examination of family and kinship in tribal , peasant , and complex societies , emphasizing non-Western cultures , societal and normative consequences of forms and functions in family .

name: ANTH 371gm Cross-Cultural Research on Urban Gangs
description: Youth gang dynamics and their effects on institutions . Comparative analysis of Asian , African , and Mexican American gangs .

name: Interpretation of Myth and Narrative
description: Oral narratives from non-Western cultures ; communications about deeply-held beliefs , psychological tensions , social problems , and the structure of the mind .

name: Magic , Witchcraft and Healing
description: Analysis of the practices of witches and witch doctors , priests , diviners and traditional healers in Western and non-Western societies , relating their practices to religion and medicine .

name: Applied Anthropology
description: Evaluation of cultural impact of policy and program designed to stimulate change in traditional communities . Fieldwork assignments in education , health , and development .

name: Peasant Society
description: Comparative study of the social , economic , political , and religious characteristics of peasant societies as they have existed and continue to exist in Asia , Africa , and Latin America .

name: Economic Anthropology
description: Comparative study of human systems of production , distribution , and consumption ; anthropological approaches to study of economic behavior ; economic systems of primitive , peasant , and developing societies .

name: Visual Techniques in Anthropology : Stills
description: Visual techniques for data collection and analysis in anthropological research . Visual anthropology research using 35 mm . photography skills , fieldwork procedures , data analysis , and presentation formats .

name: Ethnographic Film Theory from an Historical Perspective
description: Technologies and uses of , theoretical frameworks for , and the presentation styles of ethnographic materials are examined from an historical perspective .

name: ANTH 481L GIS for Investigating the Past
description: Training of archaeology students in the use of GIS through the understanding of basic principles and theoretical restrictions of geospatial sciences .

name: HBIO 300 Evolution , Ecology , and Culture
description: The roles of biology , culture , and the environment in shaping human society , integrating evolutionary biology and cultural theory .

name: HBIO 405 Evolutionary Medicine
description: Evolutionary , cultural , and environmental factors in the emergence and existence of diseases ; a Darwinian examination of illness in the human species .

name: SWMS 336 Health , Gender and Ethnicity
description: Cross-cultural notions of the body , health , and healing ; historic and cultural variability of ideas of reproduction , birth , sexuality , mental illness , and disability .

name: SWMS 385m Men and Masculinity
description: Interdisciplinary examination of social , personal meanings of masculinity ; variety of male experience by social class , race , sexuality , and age ; emerging masculinities of the future .

name: ANTH 310 Archaeology of the Americas
description: IrregularPre-Columbian culture from early hunters to the Spanish conquest in major geographical areas of Mexico , Central America , Peru , or the United States .

name: Old World Archaeology
description: IrregularNeolithic revolution and origins of civilization in major culture centers such as Mesopotamia , Egypt , India , or China .

name: ANTH 314g The Nature of Maya Civilization
description: A seminar forum on Maya culture from the earliest form to present ; problems of origins , classic florescence , systems collapse , conquests , persistence , and transformation today .

name: ANTH 315g North American Indians
description: North American Indian societies , their major cultural themes , ethnological significance , and comparability with Western European cultural forms ; lectures , visuals , and indigene demonstrations .

name: ANTH 316gmp North American Indians in American Public Life
description: Role of American Indians in American public life from colonial times to the present ; native American forms of government ; relations between tribes and the U .S .

name: ANTH 320 Male and Female in Pacific Society
description: Cultural variations in gender systems and historical changes due to colonialism and development in Polynesia , Melanesia , Indonesia , and other Pacific Rim cultures .

name: Anthropology of Bali
description: An introduction to the methodology of social anthropology , focusing on the culture of the Indonesian island of Bali .

name: Globalization and Multiple Modernities
description: The cultural and social diversity of Southeast Asia today , focusing on globalization , modernity , and change .

name: Regional Ethnology : China
description: Anthropological perspective of the ordinary citizens of the Peoples’ Republic of China : peasants , workers , bureaucrats , students , and women .

name: Ethnography of European Culture
description: IrregularEurope as a geographic area in terms of its linguistic , ethnic , racial , and cultural diversity ; particular focus on peasant society and the Little Tradition .

name: Anthropology of the Middle East and Islam
description: Explores written and visual ethnography for study of Middle East community , sociopolitical forms and religious life . Examines scriptural and living Islam and dynamics of contemporary Islamic revival .

name: ANTH 328m Culture Change and the Mexican People
description: IrregularCulture change theories and methods (archaeology , community studies , participant- observation) used to examine the varied experiences of peoples in Mexico and the U .S . Southwest .

name: ANTH 330m Culture , Gender and Politics in South Asia
description: Examination of violence , identity , law , religion , nationalism , development , caste , kinship , gender , and the South Asian diaspora .

name: Peoples and Cultures of Latin America
description: IrregularCultures of the indigenous peoples of South America ; results of Spanish conquest and colonization ; present folk societies and their cultures .

name: ANTH 435 x Ethnic Diversity in China/Inner Asia
description: Tibetans , Mongols , Muslims and other minorities on the China and Inner Asian frontier will be surveyed through ethno histories , lectures , films and guest lectures .

name: ANTH 101g Body , Mind and Healing : Introduction to Medical Anthropology
description: The body , illness and healing from a cultural perspective , including comparative studies of folk healing systems , curing rituals and Western biomedical practices .

name: ANTH 105g Culture , Medicine and Politics
description: Survey of the impact of public institutions , the private sector , and cultural practices on health and the delivery of health care in the United States .

name: ANTH 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Directed Research for Honors
description: IrregularIndividually guided research and readings culminating in the production of an honors thesis .

name: HBIO 406 Theory and Method in Human Evolutionary Biology
description: Historical and theoretical approaches to major issues in the field of human evolutionary biology . Capstone course in which students will undertake an original independent research project .

name: HBIO 306 Primate Social Behavior and Ecology
description: Behavior and ecology of living nonhuman primates , with an emphasis on field studies of apes and monkeys . Topics include aggression , communication , reproduction , and cognition .

name: HBIO 308 Origins and Evolution of Human Behavior
description: Examination of the evidence for and against evolutionary bases of a range of human behaviors . Topics include sex differences , human reproductive strategies , race , IQ , human ecology .

name: ANTH 200Lg The Human Animal
description: (Enroll in HBIO 200Lg )

name: Ethnographic Film Analysis
description: IrregularAnalysis of film as a tool for investigating primitive and modern cultures and societies .

name: Linear Algebra and Linear Differential Equations
description: Matrices , systems of linear equations , vector spaces , linear transformations , eigenvalues , systems of linear differential equations .

name: Probability Theory
description: Probability spaces , discrete and continuous distributions , moments , characteristic functions , sequences of random variables , laws of large numbers , central limit theorem , special probability laws .

name: MATH 458 Numerical Methods
description: Rounding errors in digital computation ; solution of linear algebraic systems ; Newton’s method for nonlinear systems ; matrix eigenvalues ; polynomial approximation ; numerical integration ; numerical solution of ordinary differential equations .

name: Applied Algebra
description: Induction , Euclidean algorithm , factorization , congruence classes , Rings , RSA algorithm , Chinese remainder theorem , codes , polynomials , fundamental theorem of algebra , polynomial multiplication , Fourier transform , and other topics .

name: MATH 408 Mathematical Statistics
description: Principles for testing hypotheses and estimation , confidence intervals , methods of moments , maximum likelihood , information inequality , likelihood ratio tests , goodness of fit and nonparametric methods .

name: Fundamental Concepts of Modern Algebra
