description: Sets ; relations ; groups ; homomorphisms ; symmetric groups ; Abelian groups ; Sylow’s theorems ; introduction to rings and fields .

name: Fundamental Concepts of Analysis
description: The real number system , metric spaces , limits , continuity , derivatives and integrals , infinite series .

name: Theory of Numbers
description: Introduction to the theory of numbers , including prime factorization , congruences , primitive roots , N-th power residues , number theoretic functions , and certain diophantine equations .

name: Applied Combinatorics
description: Mathematical induction , counting principles , arrangements , selections , binomial coefficients , generating functions , recurrence relations , inclusion-exclusion , symmetric groups , graphs , Euler and Hamiltonian circuits , trees , graph algorithms ; applications .

name: Vector Analysis and Introduction to Differential Geometry
description: Vectors , elements of vector analysis , applications to curves and surfaces , standard material of differential geometry .

name: MATH 445 Mathematics of Physics and Engineering II
description: Vector field theory ; theorems of Gauss , Green , and Stokes ; Fourier series and integrals ; complex variables ; linear partial differential equations ; series solutions of ordinary differential equations .

name: Dynamic Modeling
description: Formulation and study of models arising in population dynamics , growth of plankton , pollution in rivers , highway traffic , morphogenesis and tidal dynamics : stability , oscillations , bifurcations , chaos . The lab will consist of computer simulation of models using commercially available software .

name: Theory and Computational Methods for Optimization
description: Methods for static , dynamic , unconstrained , constrained optimization . Gradient , conjugate gradient , penalty methods . Lagrange multipliers , least squares , linear , nonlinear dynamic programming . Application to control and estimation .

name: Topics in Linear Algebra
description: Polynomial rings , vector spaces , linear transformations , canonical forms , inner product spaces .

name: Nonlinear Dynamics in Science and Engineering
description: Nonlinear models , bifurcations , discrete and continuous dynamics , stability , dissipative and reversible systems , Poincare maps , Lyapunov exponents , fractal dimension . Applications stressed : Economics , Engineering , Biology , Physics .

name: CSCI 101 L Fundamentals of Computer Programming
description: Introduction to the design of solutions to computer solvable problems . Algorithm design , solution implementation using a high-level programming language , program correctness and verification .

name: CSCI 103L Introduction to Programming
description: Basic datatypes , assignments , control statements (if , switch , for , while) , input/output (printf , scanf , cin , cout) , functions , arrays , structures , recursion , dynamic memory , file handling . Programming in C/C++ .

name: ITP 109 Introduction to Java Programming
description: Introduction to object-oriented software design for business problems . Creation of console applications , windowed applications , and interactive Web applets .

name: Programming in Python
description: Python’s high level data structures and clear syntax make it an ideal first language with powerful applications to science , business , finance , math , and the web .

name: ITP 165 Introduction to C++ Programming
description: Fundamentals of C++ syntax and semantics , including function prototypes , overloading , memory management , abstract data types , object creation , pointers to class members , and I/O streams .

name: Statics
description: Statics of particles and rigid bodies ; equivalent force systems ; distributed forces ; applications to trusses , frames , machines , beams , and cables ; friction ; moments of inertia .

name: Mechanics of Deformable Bodies
description: Analysis of stress and strain ; axial , flexural , and torsional behavior of slender bars ; elastic deflections ; combined stresses ; introduction to elastic stability and energy methods .

name: CE 235 Dynamics
description: Elements of vector algebra ; dynamics of particles , systems of particles and rigid bodies ; kinematics ; momentum relations , energy methods ; vibrations ; Euler’s equations of motion .

name: CE 309 Fluid Mechanics
description: Fluid statics ; relative velocity field ; total acceleration ; divergence theorem ; conservation of mass , energy , and momentum applied to engineering problems in laminar and turbulent flow .

name: EE 326 Lx Essentials of Electrical Engineering
description: Network analysis and theorems ; transient analysis ; transformers ; semiconductor physics and circuits ; power amplifiers , modulation and demodulation , and pulse , digital , and switching circuits . Introduction to instrumentation .

name: AHIS 120gp Foundations of Western Art
description: Mediterranean and European art and architecture presented in historical , cultural and social context that introduces art history as a discipline .

name: AHIS 125gp Arts of Asia I : Antiquity to 1300
description: An introduction to the major art forms and monuments of religious art in India , Southeast Asia , China , and Japan from pre-history to 1300 .

name: AHIS 126g Arts of Asia II : 1300 to the Present
description: A survey of the art and architecture of India , China , Korea , and Japan from 1300 to the present .

name: AHIS 127g Arts of the Ancient Americas
description: A survey of the art , architecture , and archaeology of the diverse array of peoples and cultures in ancient Mesoamerica and the South American Andean Mountains .

name: AHIS 128g Arts of Latin America
description: Survey of the art , architecture , and visual culture of Latin America from the colonial period to the present , focusing on connections to culture and society .

name: AHIS 201g Digging into the Past
description: A broad survey , covering some 8 ,000 years and focusing on the material culture of the ancient world in a historical and social context .

name: ANTH 140g Mesoamerican Cosmovision and Culture
description: An exploration of the nature and contributions of pre-Columbian high civilizations (Maya , Aztecs , etc .) and their descendants as they resist and assimilate to the modern world .

name: ARCG 298aL Introduction to Scientific Diving
description: (Enroll in ENST 298a )

name: CLAS 150g The Greeks and their Legacies
description: Introduction to the culture of ancient Greece and its influence on contemporary ideas , institutions , values , and literary and artistic works of the imagination .

name: CLAS 151gp The Legacy of Rome
description: Ancient Roman values , ideas , and institutions of relevance to later periods of civilization .

name: CLAS 212 Archaeology : Interpreting the Past
description: Methods and techniques employed in modern archaeological research , including the tools and principles of allied scientific fields and the impact of analytical and technological advances .

name: CLAS 280gp Classical Mythology in Art and Literature
description: Classical Greek and Roman mythology as inspiration for literature , art , music , and film in various historical contexts .

name: ENST 100g Introduction to Environmental Studies
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in Environmental Studies . Provides students with an overview of how government agencies and societal institutions address (or fail to address) the interrelated social and scientific aspects of environmental problems and policies .

name: ENST 150gx Environmental Issues in Society
description: Exploration of the major social , political , economic , religious , and philosophical disagreements that exist between scholars , leaders , and citizens concerning today’s most serious environmental issues and problems .

name: HIST 101gp State and Society in the Ancient World
description: Achievements of the near East , Greece , and Rome with emphasis on the development of ideas , arts , and institutions which have influenced modern man .

name: LING 295g The Ancient Near East : Culture , Archaeology , Texts
description: An investigation of the peoples of the ancient Near East , focusing upon the writings which they produced , their languages and scripts , and their archaeological remains .

name: REL 111g The World of the Hebrew Bible
description: The Hebrew Bible in the cultural setting of the Ancient Near East ; the formation of theological and ethical concepts which have shaped Western culture .

name: REL 112g Religions of Ancient Egypt and the Near East
description: Religions , cultures , and values of ancient Egypt and Near East (Iran , Iraq , Israel , Syria , Lebanon , Arabia , Turkey) and their legacies in contemporary society .

name: REL 114g The Mediterranean : A Religious History
description: Explores multiple religious traditions of the Mediterranean as networks that emerge within and among the landscapes , cultures , and politics of this highly interconnected geographic space .

name: REL 115g Jerusalem , City of Three Faiths
description: History of Jerusalem as a window onto the nature of the three Abrahamic faiths .

name: REL 121g The World of the New Testament
description: Historical investigation of New Testament characters , events , ethics and theology in relation to its social , intellectual , and religious contexts in the Jewish and GrecoRoman world .

name: REL 125gp Introduction to Christianity
description: Survey of the changing beliefs and practices of the Christian religion from obscure origins to globalized present , with special attention to the varieties of Christian literature .

name: REL 132g Origins of Western Religions
description: Examination of Judaism , Christianity , and Islam in their origins and their development in relation to Western civilization .

name: REL 135g Chinese Religions and Culture
description: Historical and thematic survey of Chinese religious history from earliest times to the present .

name: REL 136g Sense and Sensuality in Indian Religions and Culture
description: Exploration of the senses and the technologies of pleasure in India , relating this material to some fascinating examples of Hindu , Jain , and Buddhist literature .

name: REL 137g Introduction to Islam
description: Introduction to Islam , emphasizing its historical and cultural development since the seventh century C .E . , and the basic teachings of Islam .

name: SSCI 165Lgw Sustainability Science in the City
description: The influence of sustainability science on public policy and vice versa in the context of social/ethical theories , analytical methods and solutions .

name: SSCI 265Lg The Water Planet
description: An exploration of earth’s water , ranging from water properties , chemistry , and pollution , to groundwater dynamics , watershed processes , and oceanic-atmospheric circulation . Implications for past and future societies .

name: REL 304 Ethics and Global Heritage
description: Archaeology and global heritage debates , laws , ethical conundrums , and stakeholder perspectives reveal goals and guiding values of society’s exploration of the past .

name: AHIS 325 Roman Archaeological Excavation : Methods and Practice
description: Students learn about archaeological methodology and practice by visiting archaeological sites in Rome and excavating a nearby ancient site .

name: AHIS 415 Object-Worlds : Histories and Theories of Things
description: Developing strategies for analyzing what material culture of the past can tell us about the individuals and cultures that interacted with it .

name: AHIS 425 Interdisciplinary Studies in Classical Art and Archaeology : Research and Methodology
description: IrregularEach year a different topic in Greek and Roman art and archaeology will be examined in depth . Emphasis on interdisciplinary methodological approaches and research techniques .

name: Archaeological Theories , Methods , and Practice
description: Examined are various theoretical approaches , methods , and practice of archaeology in a seminar style format , with lectures , oral presentations , and museum visits .

name: ANTH 307 Trojan Archaeology : Excavating USC
description: Archaeological excavation on USC’s campus features training in research design , digging , survey , mapping , archive use , artifact analysis , public communication , and confronting political and ethical challenges .

name: ANTH 400 Maya Resilience : Constructing Past and Present Identities
description: Examination of how the Maya , past and present , have forged their cultural identity . Issues are explored through visits to sites and communities in Guatemala .

name: ANTH 450 Field Research in Maya Archaeology
description: Hands on research experience at a Maya ruin in Guatemala , including archaeological survey and excavation in the jungle .

name: REL 303g Exploring Ancient Ways of Living : Experimental Archaeology
description: Active learning course enables students to acquire and experience survival skills devised in pre-modern times and to apply this knowledge in an experimental context .

name: REL 494 Lab Methods and Theories in Archaeology
description: Archaeological research design , data recovery , artifact analysis , interpretation and analogy , publication and ethics .

name: REL 495 Field Methods and Theories in Archaeology
description: Archaeological field study emphasizing current paradigms of data collection and evaluation ; social scientific study of material culture and its relationship to religious expression .

name: AHIS 321 Greek Art and Archaeology
description: Survey of artistic works and monuments of ancient Greece from the Geometric through the Hellenistic period (c . 1000 - 30 BCE .) .

name: AHIS 322 Roman Art and Archaeology
description: Survey of the art and architecture of ancient Rome and its empire , from the beginnings of the city through Constantine (8th century BCE to 4th century CE) .

name: Medieval Art
description: Introductory survey of art and architecture of Christianity from 300–1300 ; biblical themes and classical traditions ; cultural and historical analysis of medieval art .

name: AHIS 381g Visual Cultures of Asia
description: Exploration of one or more major traditions of visual culture in Asia through cross-cultural , interdisciplinary perspectives .

name: AHIS 384 Early Chinese Art
description: A survey of Chinese architecture , ceremonial bronzes , sculpture , ceramics and painting from antiquity through the T’ang Dynasty .

name: AHIS 420 Studies in Ancient Art
description: IrregularIn-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Ancient art and architecture .

name: Prehistoric Archaeology
description: Examination of the rise of human social complexity from the first Homo Sapiens through the development of agriculture , chiefdoms , states and empires .

name: Archaeology and Global Cultural Heritage
description: Exploration of the role archaeology plays in the creation of modern national , ethnic , racial and other types of identities worldwide .

name: Anthropology of Warfare
description: Examination of the origins of warfare , its evolution and the changes it brought to human civilization .

name: ANTH 377 Archaeological Interpretation of Complex Societies
description: Archaeologists translate raw data sets into broader understanding through interpretation . Students engage specific examples and develop their own perspectives on past societies . (Block semester)

name: CLAS 323 Aegean Archaeology
description: Survey of the Bronze Age Aegean societies of Minoan Crete and Mycenaean Greece ; emphasis on archaeological theory and method in a prehistoric context .

name: CLAS 324 Late Antique Art and Archaeology
description: Investigation of the transformation between classical antiquity and the middle ages through examination of cities , buildings , images and artifacts of the 3rd–8thcentury Mediterranean .

name: CLAS 328 Archaeology of Religion in the Greco- Roman World
description: Examination of ancient objects , images and archaeological sites as evidence for religious practice and ideas about the sacred in the GrecoRoman world .

name: Warfare , State , and Society in the Ancient World
description: War , warriors , and their relationship to politics and culture in the ancient world . Mobilization , socioeconomic status of soldiers , discipline , organization , and hierarchy . Memory of war .

name: Ancient Science
description: Cross-cultural investigation of aims , origins , and transmission of various scientific traditions in antiquity . Relationship between science and philosophy , scientific thought and practice .

name: CLAS 349g Ancient Empires
description: History and cultures of the ancient empires of southwest Asia , from Cyrus the Great to the establishment of Islam .

name: CLAS 371 From Alexander to Cleopatra : The Mediterranean in an Age of Expansion
description: The history and culture of the Greek kingdoms in Egypt and Asia .

name: JS 370 Digs and Dispute : Religion and Archaeology in Israel
description: Investigates contemporary conflicts in the discovery of the ancient world . Students will ask essential questions about the power of discovering and showcasing specific narratives .

name: JS 378 Jewish Magic in the Ancient World
description: A cross-cultural examination of different kinds of magical literature that describe miraculous practices in Jewish mainstream and marginal life in the ancient and classical periods .

name: MDES 316p The Great Muslim Empires of the Near East and India
description: Explores the social , political , and religious forces that helped shape the Ottoman , Safavid , and the Mughal empires , their intellectual trends , and cultural dynamism .

name: REL 302 Religions of Ancient Egypt and the Near East
description: Religious experience and values of ancient Egypt and Near East through material culture , literature , art , and cultic practices ; and their legacies in contemporary society .

name: REL 317g The Bible in Its Ancient Context
description: A close consideration of ancient Near Eastern myths — especially those from Mesopotamia and Canaan — with special attention to their influence on the Bible .

name: Religious Experience in the Greco-Roman World
description: Varieties of religious experience as reflected in the literature , art , and cultic practices of the Hellenistic world .

name: REL 326gp Historical Jesus
description: Examination of the question of how ancient and modern Christians and scholars have reconstructed the life of Jesus of Nazareth , founding figure of Christianity .

name: REL 394 Archaeology of Egypt and the Near East
description: Study of archaeology and excavated artifacts from Egypt and the Near East .

name: REL 402 Cultural Heritage , Religion , and Politics in the Middle East
description: In-depth exploration of archaeology and heritage issues in the Middle East and their implications for politics and practice in modern Islam , Judaism and Christianity .

name: Religion , Material Culture and the Senses
description: A comparative study of the role of material culture and the senses in religions based on a number of case studies and problem sets .

name: Art and Archaeology of Religion
description: The history of religion through its material expression : art , architecture and artifact . Exploration of different themes and time periods .

name: ANTH 376 Scientific Analysis in Archaeology
description: Examination of the range of scientific techniques and technologies used for the analysis and interpretation of material culture recovered during archaeological excavations .

name: ARCG 305L Virtual and Digital Culture , Heritage and Archaeology
description: In-depth exploration of design , techniques and evaluation of immersive , virtual and augmented reality and digital visualizations of cultural heritage , archaeology , historical sites and artifacts .

name: ARCG 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings . Not available for graduate credit .

name: CHEM 300 L Analytical Chemistry
description: Theory and practice in chemical analysis , emphasizing instrumental techniques ; error analysis , fractional distillation , extraction ; chromatography ; visible , ultraviolet , and infrared spectroscopy ; introductions to electrochemistry and nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy .

name: ENST 320a Water and Soil Sustainability ; Energy and Air Sustainability
description: Overview of issues related to water and soil sustainability including science , policy and business aspects .

name: GEOL 305L Introduction to Engineering Geology
description: Principles of geology with emphasis on structural geology , hydrogeology and geological hazards ; basic geologic considerations in civil engineering practice ; introduction to mineralogy and petrology . Field trip required .

name: GEOL 320L Surficial Processes and Stratigraphic Systems
description: Processes of erosion , sediment transport , and deposition that shape the land surface ; landscape response to tectonism ; recognition and interpretation of depositional environments in the stratigraphic record .

name: Oceans , Climate , and the Environment
description: Survey of physical , chemical , and geological oceanography emphasizing the role of the oceans in modulation of climate , atmospheric composition and biogeochemical cycles ; paleoceanography and paleo climate .

name: SSCI 301 L Maps and Spatial Reasoning
description: Role of maps and spatial reasoning in the production and use of geographic information for representing and analyzing human and environmental activities and events .

name: SSCI 382L Principles of Geographic Information Science
description: The various ways in which geography can be used to acquire , represent , organize , analyze , model and visualize information . Laboratories are organized around ArcGIS software suite .

name: SSCI 483 L Spatial Science Practicum
description: Application of GIS concepts and skills to a local opportunity or problem in a studio setting . May involve site visits , community contact , and presentations .

name: CLAS 465 Archaeology and Society
description: The interaction of archaeology and contemporary societies through political and moral claims ; archaeologists’ role as stewards and interpreters of ancient cultures and their remains . Capstone course for the Archaeology major .

name: Architectural Design I
description: Introduction to principles and processes ; sequence of exercises emphasizing development of basic skills , ideas , and techniques used in the design of simplified architectural projects .

name: ARCH 105 L Fundamentals of Design Communication
description: Visual communication techniques applicable to the design of the built environment ; drawing , photography , modeling .

name: Architecture : Culture and Community
description: Introduction to the ways architecture represents aspirations of culture , satisfies practical and spiritual needs , shapes the social and urban environment , and helps preserve the planet .

name: MATH 108g Contemporary Precalculus
description: Equations and inequalities ; functions ; graphs ; polynomial and rational functions ; exponential , logarithmic , and trigonometric function ; analytic geometry .

name: ARCH 214ag World History of Architecture
description: A world-wide perspective of architectural history as a product of social , cultural , religious , and political dimensions , 4500 BCE to 1500 CE .

name: PHYS 125Lg Physics for Architects
description: Fundamental laws and principles of physics with emphasis on the application of physical principles to the problems of architecture .

name: ARCH 202a L Architectural Design II
description: Continuing development of principles and processes ; sequence of projects selected to broaden awareness of design issues at various scales in the urban context .

name: ARCH 213a Building Structures and Seismic Design
description: Investigation and design of elements and systems for building structures ; applied mechanics , strength of materials , structural investigation as a design tool .

name: Materials and Methods of Building Construction
description: Basic considerations and design implications of the problem of determination of the materials and construction details and processes for buildings .

name: Design for the Thermal and Atmospheric Environment
description: Ideas , problems , and computations related to the design of buildings in response to the thermal and atmospheric environment ; passive solar systems , mechanical control systems .

name: Design of Building Structures
description: Problems and processes of design of building structures ; structural investigation for design ; codes and standards ; design of elements and systems of wood , steel , masonry , and concrete for gravity and lateral loads .

name: History of Architecture : Contemporary Issues
description: Examination of the buildings , issues and images , the polemics and personalities that are animating current architectural discourse and practice .

name: Architectural Studies — Expanding the Field
description: Survey of opportunities , specializations , and professions related to architecture provides a resource for professional growth for architecture majors , and introduction to the field for non-majors .

name: Design for the Luminous and Sonic Environment
description: Ideas , problems , and computations related to the design of buildings in response to the luminous and sonic environment .

name: Architectural Technology
description: Architectural design considered as a technological problem ; influence of technology on design ; buildings as integrated sets of subsystems .

name: ARCH 525 Professional Practice : Pre-Design , Project and Office Administration
description: Design methodology , typology programming , site analysis , budget formulation and pro-forma procedures . Office management , emphasizing professional service and professional ethics as well as project management focusing on the architect’s responsibilities during construction .

name: ARCH 470a Architectural Studies Capstone
description: Introduction to methods of inquiry , research framework , and scholarly writing necessary to develop a comprehensive foundation for the Architectural Studies Capstone (ARCH 470b) .

name: ARCH 302a L Architectural Design III
description: Special integrative year including design issues relating to housing .

name: ARCH 402a L Architectural Design IV
description: Selected areas of specialization ; three projects chosen with advisement from a variety of studio offerings that concentrate on different areas of vital concern .

name: ARCH 500aL Comprehensive Architectural Design
description: Selected areas of specialization ; projects chosen from a variety of studio offerings , all with an emphasis on the comprehensive design of buildings .

name: Critical Topics in Architecture
description: Seminar supporting the research , development , and writing of Degree Project Paper provides a comprehensive base of information for the final Bachelor of Architecture studio .

name: ARCH 502aL Architectural Design V
description: The final comprehensive architectural project under the guidance of a faculty adviser to demonstrate architectural knowledge , skills , and professional interests and goals .

name: Professional Practice : Legal and Economic Context , Project Documentation
description: Design methodology , typology programming , site analysis , budget formulation and pro-forma procedures . Office management , emphasizing professional service and professional ethics as well as project management focusing on the architect’s responsibilities during construction .

name: ART 105 Art and Design Studio I
description: Introduction to the fundamental elements in art making , design creation and thinking , including key principles of

name: ART 106 Art and Design Studio II
description: Introduction to the fundamental elements in art making , design creation and thinking , including the key principles of process and critical analysis .

name: ART 280 Studio Critique I
description: Interdisciplinary forum where students develop research skills , learn how to best articulate their artistic production , discuss materials related to their research interests , and critique the work of their peers .

name: ART 380 Studio Critique II
description: A continuation of ART 280  for third-year students , providing an interdisciplinary forum for artistic practice and a deepening critique of one’s work and the work of peers .

name: ART 485 Studio Capstone
description: A faculty-mentored course supporting advanced conceptual exploration and the development of an ambitious , self-defined series or body of work , culminating in an exhibition .

name: CRIT 150gp Histories of Art , Design and Visual Culture
description: A loosely chronological , thematic survey of art , visual culture , design , and critical theory from the early modern period through modernism (1500 – 1950) .

name: CRIT 160g Critical Theory in Art , Design and Visual Culture
description: An issues-based introduction to critical theory in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries , especially as it relates to philosophy , art , design , and visual culture .

name: CRIT 350gw Global Art , Design and Visual Culture since 1960
description: A critical history of art , design , visual culture , and visual theory since 1960 , addressing through a postcolonial/decolonial lens the concepts and practices of “global” art .

name: AHIS 121gp Art and Society : Renaissance to Modern
description: European art and its legacy in the Americas . Painting , sculpture , architecture and other visual media considered in relation to social and cultural history .

name: Undergraduate Proseminar in Art History
description: Historiography and methodology : introduction to techniques of research and writing . Required of all art history majors , preferably in the junior year .

name: AHIS 220g Medieval Visual Culture
description: Medieval visual culture as an introduction to the Christian heritage of western civilization and to the interaction of Church and state from the 3rd to the 13th century .

name: Art and Culture in Early Modern Europe
description: Survey of European art from the 15th to the 17th century . Case studies in Renaissance and Baroque art with emphasis on artists in major urban centers .

name: AHIS 304m Gender and Difference in the Early Modern Period
description: An introduction to Italian Renaissance art with emphasis on the role of gender and sexuality in the creation of “masterpieces .”

name: AHIS 343 Renaissance Art
description: Painting , sculpture and architecture in Renaissance Europe , north and south , from 1300–1600 .

name: AHIS 344 Baroque Art
description: Painting , sculpture and architecture in 17th century Europe , north and south .

name: AHIS 361 British Modernism , 1780-1918
description: A survey of art and architecture in Britain from the age of Hogarth to Art Nouveau . Among the artists studied are Constable , Turner , and the Pre-Raphaelites .

name: AHIS 366 Picturing Democracy : American Art and Visual Culture , 1750-1900
description: Studies the art and visual culture of the United States from nation formation to the World’s Columbian Exposition of 1893 .

name: AHIS 367 Early American Modernism : American Art and Visual Culture
description: Studies the art and visual culture of the United States between 1876 , the date of the Centennial Fair in Philadelphia , to the eve of World War II .

name: AHIS 368 Modern Art I : 1700–1850
description: A cultural and historical examination of European art and architecture from 1700 (Rococo) to 1850 (Realism) , focusing on the beginnings of modernism in the age of revolution .

name: Modern Art II : 1851–1940
description: An examination of European modern art and design , focusing on industrialization , urbanism , primitivism , colonialism , and their relations to the arts .

name: AHIS 373g History and Theory of Photography
description: IrregularExplores key moments in the history of photography from its invention to the present . Issues include modernity and mass culture ; photography as a fine art ; technologies of vision .

name: Korean Art
description: Introduction to the richness and complexity of artistic expression in Korean art through the study of painting , sculpture , ceramics , and architecture through the 19th century .

name: AHIS 319 Mesoamerican Art and Culture
description: Introductory survey of painting , sculpture , and architecture of Mesoamerica before the Spanish conquest presented in their social , cultural , and political contexts .

name: Introduction to African Art
description: An introduction to sub-Saharan art (sculpture , textiles , architecture , masquerades , performances and body arts) in the context of issues of function , gender , politics and ethnic diversity .

name: AHIS 385 Later Chinese Art
description: A survey of Chinese painting from 900 to the present , emphasizing the role of painting within the context of Chinese intellectual history .

name: AHIS 386 Early Japanese Art
description: A survey of Japanese Buddhist and secular architecture , sculpture and painting from antiquity to 1333 , stressing the relation of art to cultural context .

name: AHIS 387 Later Japanese Art
description: A survey of Japanese architecture , garden design , ceramics , and painting from 1333 to the present , stressing the role of art within cultural context .

name: AHIS 400x Undergraduate Apprenticeship
description: Independent work in art museums , galleries or art history related institutes supervised by on-site professionals and USC faculty . Not available for credit to art history majors . Available to upper-division art history majors only .

name: ACAD 174 Innovators Forum
description: Leaders in diverse disciplines , industries , and the arts present and discuss problems facing society , and critique real-world projects that challenge the concept of innovation .

name: ACAD 176 Rapid Visualization
description: Basic techniques , methods , concepts , tools , and materials that are used to quickly communicate ideas and concepts in a visual manner .

name: ACAD 177 Digital Toolbox for Design
description: Eight-week session covering the basics of industry-standard creative , analytical and presentation software . Applications include : design , presentation , publishing and business management .

name: ACAD 178 Digital Toolbox : Motion Graphics
description: Eight-week course covering the basics of industry-standard digital video and motion graphics software used for visual effects , non-linear video production and editing .

name: ACAD 180 Digital Toolbox : Sound and Audio
description: An eight-week course covering the basics of industry-standard hardware and software used for designing , creating , processing , and distributing sound and audio .

name: ACAD 181g Disruptive Innovation
description: Critical approaches to social and cultural changes stemming from disruptive innovations in the arts , science , technology , communications , new media , politics and business .

name: ACAD 182 Case Studies in Innovation
description: Employing a case-study methodology , students analyze the artistic , technological , and entrepreneurial factors and address the conceptual , ethical , and logistical issues that lead to disruptive innovation .

name: ACAD 187 Digital Toolbox : 3D Design
description: An eight-week course covering the basics of industry-standard 3D modeling , rendering , and capturing software used for product , packaging , industrial and environmental design . Open only to Arts , Technology and the Business of Innovation majors .

name: ACAD 207 Multimedia for Designers and Entrepreneurs I
description: Basics of industry-standard hardware and software specific to creating effective and compelling multimedia experiences .

name: ACAD 240 Materials : Denim to Nanotubes
description: Covers the fundamentals of materials science and introduce students to the principles of designing with specific materials in mind .

name: ACAD 275 Dev I
description: Web page design and creation , web objects , scripting and interactivity . Includes developing skills to design and build interactive websites .

name: ACAD 276 Dev II
description: Fundamentals of server-side scripting and web templates . Design and creation of data structures and databases . Visualize analytics and data .

name: ACAD 277 Dev III
description: An accelerated approach to object-oriented programming , including foundations of mobile application development . Focus on user interface design .

name: ACAD 245 Product Design I
description: A wide investigation of techniques specific to dimensional design as they apply to package , product and spatial design , in analog and digital environments .

name: ACAD 280 Designing for Experiences
description: Designing effective and elegant interfaces and experiences for the ways people interact with data , devices , systems , and environments .

name: ACAD 302 The Hacker Imagination : from Ancient Greece to Cupertino
description: Exploring issues in innovation , design and invention from the perspective of the hacker imagination .

name: ACAD 323g Design Theory
description: (Enroll in DES 323g )

name: ACAD 360 Design Consulting : Problem Solving for Organizations
description: A professional , collaborative and multidisciplinary consulting approach to diagnosing problems and applying design-based solutions on behalf of organizations .

name: ACAD 376 Discerning and Making I : Concept and Feasibility
description: A broad look at innovation from the perspectives of designers , engineers , and entrepreneurs as applied to concept/feasibility of art , design , products , services and experiences .

name: ACAD 377 Discerning and Making II : Creation and Implementation
description: Students create and implement – from conception through prototype – new ventures , products , services , and processes ; building upon the innovations of designers , engineers , and entrepreneurs .

name: ACAD 475a The Garage Experience
description: Academy capstone experience , innovative projects leading to operational prototypes and viable enterprises , mentored by faculty and industry experts .

name: ACAD 230 3D Design : Materials and Tools
description: (Enroll in DES 230 )

name: ACAD 303 Web Design
description: (Enroll in DES 303 )

name: ACAD 330 3D Design : Objects and Space
description: (Enroll in DES 330 )

name: ACAD 332a Typography
description: (Enroll in DES 332a )

name: ACAD 342 Mobile Application Development
description: (Enroll in ITP 342 )

name: ACAD 344 Advanced Topics in Mobile App Development
description: (Enroll in ITP 344 )

name: ACAD 365 Managing Data in C++
description: (Enroll in ITP 365 )

name: ACAD 382 Mobile Game Programming
description: (Enroll in ITP 382 )

name: ACAD 404 Modern Technologies of Web Development
description: (Enroll in ITP 404 )

name: ACAD 405 Professional Applications and Frameworks in Web Development
description: (Enroll in ITP 405 )

name: ACAD 425 Web Application Security
description: (Enroll in ITP 425 )

name: ACAD 435 Professional C++
description: (Enroll in ITP 435 )

name: ACAD 442 Mobile App Project
description: (Enroll in ITP 442 )

name: ACAD 460 Web Application Project
description: (Enroll in ITP 460 )

name: ITP 250x Database Systems for Analytics
description: Concepts in modeling data for analytic applications . Designing and implementing robust databases . Querying databases to extract business intelligence .

name: ITP 251 Applied Statistics for Analytics
description: Core statistical methodologies that are critical for quantitative reasoning . Focus on concepts through practical applications and analyses of real data .

name: ITP 350x Technologies and Practices for Analytics
description: Overview of the process of data analysis . Reporting , visualization and prediction . Practical applications of analytics through case studies .

name: Technologies for Interactive Marketing
description: Designed to introduce students to technologies , concepts and strategies in the emerging online advertising ecosystem . Through lectures , discussions , and projects , students learn strategies and tactics to drive traffic to a website . They learn how to analyze and measure the efficacy of their plans . Lastly , they will work with a real client and with a real budget to craft and execute an online marketing plan .

name: ACAD 315x Basics of Project and Operations Management for Non-Majors
description: (Enroll in BUAD 315x )

name: ACAD 385x Marketing of Creative Disruption and Innovation
description: (Enroll in MKT 385x )

name: ACAD 467 Strategic Management of Innovation
description: (Enroll in MOR 467 )

name: BAEP 455 Founder's Dilemmas
description: Prepares potential founders , hires , and investors for the decisions they will face both before and during their involvement with new ventures .

name: BAEP 460 Seminar in Entrepreneurship
description: Perspectives into the art and science of entrepreneurship under the guidance of a master instructor . Specific topics vary .

name: The Entrepreneurial Mindset — Taking the Leap
description: A deeper insight into the entrepreneurial mind , how it approaches opportunities and challenges and gives leadership to an organization .

name: BAEP 475 Entertainment Entrepreneurship
description: Explore the current entrepreneurial trends and opportunities in the entertainment industry and uncover the key success factors for entrepreneurs in this industry .

name: MOR 431 Interpersonal Competence and Development
description: An exploration of the nature of relationships at work ; focus on analytical skills and self-assertion necessary to have effective , rewarding relationships .

name: MOR 461 Design of Effective Organizations
description: Designing management systems and practices that lead to organizational excellence ; techniques for organizational change .

name: ACAD 200 Advanced Sound and Audio
description: An in-depth study of sound , acoustics , psychoacoustics , and the standard components of the audio signal chain , including microphones , mixers , interfaces , signal processors , amplifiers , loudspeakers , and audio-distribution systems .

name: ACAD 352 Digital Audio Recording and Processing
description: The principles , techniques , and aesthetics of digital audio recording and processing with an emphasis on mastering for multimedia integration .

name: ACAD 354 Synthesis and Sound Design
description: A comprehensive study of the elements of electronic synthesis and sampling , as well as the use of “live” and “found” audio recordings for creative sound design purposes .

name: ACAD 356 Audio and Media Integration
description: Methods and techniques for integrating audio into various media and applications including : film and video , Internet streaming , mobile devices , and other digital and computer applications .

name: ACAD 206 Communication and Culture
description: (Enroll in COMM 206 )

name: ACAD 306 Innovation , Entertainment , and the Arts
description: (Enroll in COMM 306 )

name: ACAD 366 Designing Media and Communication Projects for Social Change
description: (Enroll in COMM 366 )

name: ACAD 375 Business and Professional Communication
description: (Enroll in COMM 375 )

name: ACAD 312 Materials Behavior and Processing
description: (Enroll in MASC 310 )

name: ITP 308 Computer-Aided Design for Bio-Mechanical Systems
description: Concepts of computer-aided design in 2-dimensions and 3-dimensions . Creating advanced parts using extrusions , surfaces , and equation driven sketches . Forming assemblies , and sub-assemblies , for motion analysis

name: Analytical Writing
description: Focuses on analytical and argumentative writing skills requisite to academic and professional writing . Emphasizes logical analysis of texts and other data , effective use of evidence , ethical argumentation , and stylistic and grammatical fluency . Enrollment limited to specified groups of students . Students must achieve a satisfactory score on the verbal portion of the SAT , the USC Writing Examination , or credit for WRIT 120  or WRIT 121  before enrolling in WRIT 130 .

name: ASTE 101 L Introduction to Astronautics
description: Gateway to the Astronautical Engineering major . Introduction to space , space exploration and the space business . Elements of orbits , spacecraft systems , rocket propulsion , and communications . Laboratory : introduction to graphics , computation and simulation .

name: Engineering Freshman Academy
description: Introduction to the profession of engineering . Ethical , political and societal consequences of engineering innovations and the impact of engineering on everyday life . Team projects and guest lectures . Open to freshmen only .

name: ASTE 301a Thermal and Statistical Systems
description: Thermodynamics and statistical mechanics ; kinetics of atoms , molecules , and photons ; compressible fluid dynamics .

name: Introduction to Spacecraft Systems and the Space Environment
description: acecraft systems : attitude determination and control , power , thermal , command and data handling , telecommunication , structures and mechanisms , propulsion . Space environment : atmosphere , gravity gradients , radiation .

name: Spacecraft Propulsion
description: Introduction to rocket engineering . Space missions and thrust requirements . Compressible gas dynamics . Propellant chemistry and thermodynamics . Liquid- and solid-fueled rockets . Nuclear and electric propulsion .

name: Physics Discovery Series
description: Introduction to current research activities of the faculty of the department ; topics of current and popular interest among the wider community of physicists .

name: The Solar System
description: Earth’s motions ; planets and their satellites ; comets ; meteorites ; interplanetary matter ; elementary celestial mechanics .

name: Galaxies and Large-Scale Structures in the Universe
description: Galaxies and clusters of galaxies : their content , structure , dynamics , distribution , and motions ; the cosmic microwave background : theory and observation ; elements of observational cosmology .

name: Cosmology
description: Concepts of space-time , general relativity applied to an homogeneous and expanding universe . Universe’s content and thermal history . Introduction to current observational tests of cosmology .

name: Stellar Astrophysics
description: Observation and theory of stellar atmospheres and stellar interiors . Theory of stellar evolution . Physical and astronomical significance of the end states of stellar evolution .

name: Mechanics
description: Dynamics of particles , kinematics of rotations , rigid body motion , Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formalism , theory of small vibrations .

name: PHYS 492 L Senior Lab
description: Projects will include experiments in mechanics , thermodynamics , electricity and magnetism . Emphasis on laboratory work with discussion of theoretical background .

name: Electricity and Magnetism
description: Electrostatics ; thermal , chemical , magnetic effects of steady currents ; DC circuits .

name: Introduction to Quantum Mechanics and its Applications
description: Concepts and techniques of quantum mechanics ; free and bound states , the hydrogen atom .

name: BISC 120Lg General Biology : Organismal Biology and Evolution
description: In-depth survey of key topics related to advances in our knowledge of the diversity of life and evolution ; origin of life ; eukaryotes/prokaryotes ; ecology .

name: BISC 121Lg Advanced General Biology : Organismal Biology and Evolution
description: Equivalent to BISC 120   , but taught at a higher level for exceptionally well-prepared students . Admission to the course by departmental approval only .

name: BISC 220Lg General Biology : Cell Biology and Physiology
description: In-depth survey of key topics related to advances in our knowledge of cellular biology and physiology ; cell composition/metabolism ; gene action ; organism structure and function .

name: BISC 221Lg Advanced General Biology : Cell Biology and Physiology
description: Equivalent to 220L , but taught at a higher level for exceptionally well-prepared students . Admission to the course by departmental approval only .

name: BISC 320L Molecular Biology
description: Structure and synthesis of nucleic acids and proteins ; molecular biology of prokaryotes and eukaryotes ; principles of genetics and cell biology .

name: BISC 330L Biochemistry
description: Basic biochemical principles ; classes of molecules - structure and function ; cellular energetics .

name: BISC 403 Advanced Molecular Biology
description: Molecular mechanisms and control of DNA replication , DNA repair , recombination , gene expression , cell growth , and development in prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms , from bacteria to humans .

name: Advanced Biochemistry
description: Macro molecular structure and function ; enzymology ; metabolic regulation .

name: CHEM 107Lg General Chemistry for Chemistry Majors
description: Fundamental principles and laws of chemistry emphasizing contemporary chemistry ; laboratory work focuses on quantitative procedures .

name: CHEM 108L General Chemistry for Chemistry Majors : Kinetics and Equilibrium
description: Fundamental principles and laws of chemistry emphasizing contemporary chemistry ; laboratory work focuses on quantitative procedures . Second-semester general chemistry course for majors .

name: CHEM 322aL Organic Chemistry
description:
Chemistry of the carbon compounds of the aliphatic and aromatic series ; laboratory preparation of typical compounds of both series . 
Enroll in CHEM 325a   ,CHEM 325b

name: CHEM 325aL Organic Chemistry
description:
Required of majors in chemistry .
Enroll in CHEM 322a   ,CHEM 322b

name: Thermodynamics and Kinetics
description: Kinetic theory ; equations of state ; thermodynamics ; phase equilibria ; chemical equilibrium ; nuclear chemistry , wave mechanics ; spectroscopy ; statistical thermodynamics ; kinetics ; electrochemistry ; surface and colloid chemistry .

name: CHEM 432 Physical Chemistry for the Life Sciences
description: Principles of physical chemistry relevant for the life sciences : thermodynamics , chemical equilibria , molecular dynamics , kinetics , molecular structures and interactions , spectroscopy , statistical thermodynamics and macromolecular structures .

name: Introduction to Statistics for Biologists
description: Statistical methods in biological science and medicine , including populations and samples , random sampling , confidence intervals , paired samples and regression .

name: MATH 208 x Elementary Probability and Statistics
description: Descriptive statistics , probability , discrete and continuous random variables , expectation and variance , sampling , Central Limit Theorem , estimation , hypothesis testing , correlation and regression . Emphasis on health science .

name: PHYS 135ag Physics for the Life Sciences
description: Fundamental laws and principles of physics emphasizing areas related to life sciences ; prerequisite for biological sciences , medicine , dentistry , and pharmacy .

name: Genetics
description: Transmission genetics and genotype/phenotype ; mapping methods ; complex traits ; genetics of human disease and population genetics .

name: BME 101 Introduction to Biomedical Engineering
description: Historical development and survey of major areas comprising biomedical engineering : theoretical neurobiology and systems physiology , biomedical instrumentation , artificial organ and prosthetic devices , biomedical computer applications .

name: BME 210 Biomedical Computer Simulation Methods
description: Computational methods for simulation of circulatory , respiratory , pharmacokinetic , and neural models . Quadrature , differential equations , systems of linear equations , simulation languages , experimental statistics .

name: BME 302 L Medical Electronics
description: Electronic design and measurements for medical applications . Use of integrated circuits , biopotential measurements , static and dynamic calibration of physiological transducers .

name: BME 402 Control and Communication in the Nervous System
description: An introduction to the structural and functional elements common to nervous systems , with emphasis on cellular dynamics , interneuronal communication , sensory and effector systems .

name: BME 403L Physiological Systems
description: A thorough bioengineering treatment of the physiological properties of various mammalian organ systems : e .g . , cardiovascular , respiratory , renal , and musculoskeletal .

name: BME 405 L Senior Projects : Measurements and Instrumentation
description: Application of instrumentation and measurement techniques to biomedical engineering projects involving measurement , replacement or augmentation of biomedical systems .

name: BME 410 Introduction to Biomaterials and Tissue Engineering
description: Application of principles of physical chemistry , biochemistry , and materials engineering to biomedical problems , e .g . , materials selection and design for implants and tissue replacement .

name: BME 413 Bioengineering Signals and Systems
description: Introduction to concepts relating to linear signals and systems theory , time and frequency domain analysis , and application of these concepts to problems in Biomedical Engineering .

name: BME 423 Statistical Methods in Biomedical Engineering
description: Applications of parametric and nonparametric tests , analysis of variance , linear regression , time-series analysis , and autoregressive modeling , with biomedical applications to statistical analysis of biomedical data .

name: Basics of Biomedical Imaging
description: Engineering , clinical applications and modern physics concepts underlying X-ray imaging , Computed Tomography (CT) , nuclear medicine , positron emission tomography , Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) , ultrasound imaging .

name: Biomechanics
description: Mechanical properties of biological tissues and fluid transport in physiological systems : blood rheology ; bioviscoelastic solids and fluids ; gas flow and mixing ; prosthesis design .

name: BME 430 Principles and Applications of Systems Biology
description: Computational methods for simulation and analysis of metabolic networks , cellular signaling pathways , and gene regulatory networks . Biochemical kinetics , differential equations , stability analysis , sensitivity analysis .

name: Fundamentals of Biomedical Microdevices
description: Introduction to biomedical microdevices with emphasis on microtechnologies and biomedical microelectromechanical systems (bioMEMS) . Principles for measurement of small-scale biological phenomena and clinical applications .

name: Introduction to Biomimetic Neural Engineering
description: Engineering principles , biology , technological challenges and state-of-the-art developments in the design of implantable biomimetic microelectronic devices that interface with the nervous system .

name: EE 202L Linear Circuits
description: Lumped circuit elements ; network equations ; zero-input and zerostate responses ; sinusoidal steady-state analysis ; impedance ; resonance ; network functions ; power concepts ; transformers ; Laplace transforms .

name: Development and Regulation of Medical Products
description: An introduction to the process of medical product development with emphasis on the regulations that govern the design , fabrication , and maintenance of medical products .

name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics
description: Elements of chemical engineering thermodynamics , including generalized correlations of properties of materials , phase behavior , physical and chemical equilibria .

name: Introduction to Separation Processes
description: Use of equilibrium phase relations and principles of material and energy balance for design , operation , and optimization of separation procedures such as distillation , absorption , etc .

name: CHE 489 Biochemical Engineering
description: Application of chemical engineering principles to biological and biochemical processes and materials . Design of biochemical reactors and of processes for separation and purification of biological products .

name: MASC 310 Materials Behavior and Processing
description: Principles of mechanical behavior and processing of materials . Relationships between mechanical properties , microstructure , and processing methods . Composites and nonmetallics included .

name: EE 109L Introduction to Embedded Systems
description: Information representations , embedded programming , digital and serial I/O , analog-to-digital conversion , and interrupt mechanisms . Elementary analog , logic , and state-machine design .

name: EE 209 Foundations of Digital System Design
description: Logic-function synthesis , state machines , combinational and sequential data-path components . Physical principles used to analyze and design digital integrated circuits .

name: EE 338 Physical Electronics
description: Semiconductor device characteristics and applications . Physical models of electronic conduction in solids , p-n junctions , bipolar and field effect transistors and other solid-state devices .

name: EE 348 L Electronic Circuits
description: Basic analog and digital circuit design using Bipolar Junction Transistors , Field Effect Transistors and integrated circuits .

name: EE 354L Introduction to Digital Circuits
description: Digital system design and implementation ; synchronous design of datapath and control ; schematic/Verilog-based design , simulation , and implementation in Field Programmable Gate Arrays ; timing analysis ; semester-end project .

name: EE 454L Introduction to System-on-Chip
description: Design flow , tools , and issues related to System/Network-on-Chip (S/Noc) design for real-time embedded systems with applications in mobile , cloud , aerospace , and medical electronics .

name: Physical Biology : From Molecules to Cells
description: Length , time , and energy scales of life ; statistical mechanics of biomolecules and cellular processes ; physics of cell shape ; biological fluid dynamics ; electron transfer and metabolism .

name: BUAD 425 Data Analysis for Decision Making
description: Leveraging large corporate datasets ; slice and dice data ; dash boards ; data mining and statistical tools ; neural network ; multiple and logistic regression ; decision tree ; gain inference and decision making ; clustering .

name: CNTV 441 Business and Cinematic Arts Entertainment Practicum
description: Application of business and cinematic arts concepts to entertainment industry networking and career-building experiences . Peer collaboration/competition , and identifying organizational compatibility .

name: CNTV 463 Television : Integrating Creative and Business Objectives
description: An investigation of the creative and business sides of television and how they connect , including changes caused by fractionalization and digital technology .

name: The Future of Digital Media and the Entertainment Industry
description: Examines how digital media will affect the future of the television , motion picture , game , music , and interactive industries .

name: Introduction to Television and Video
description: Exploration of the economic , technological , aesthetic , and ideological characteristics of the television medium ; study of historical development of television and video including analysis of key works ; introduction to TV/video theory and criticism .

name: Business and Management of Games
description: Overview of current business models in games and interactive media , methods for pitching and getting products funded ; copyright and intellectual property .

name: Colloquium : Motion Picture Production Techniques
description: Basic procedures and techniques applicable to production of all types of films ; demonstration by production of a short film from conception to completion .

name: The Movie Business : From Story Concept to Exhibition
description: Examination of the industry from story ideas through script development , production and exhibition ; evaluation of roles played by writers , agents , studio executives , marketing and publicity .

name: CNTV 458 Producing and Marketing Feature Length Films
description: The principles and business practices of producing and marketing feature length films in the motion picture industry .

name: IR 210gw International Relations : Introductory Analysis
description: Comprehensive introduction to contending theoretical and analytical approaches ; development of critical , evaluative , cognitive , and analytical competencies regarding historical and contemporary issues .

name: Multinational Enterprises and World Politics
description: Political implications of interactions between different types of multinational enterprises and all levels of U .S . government , other industrial nations , and less-developed countries .

name: North-South Relations in the Global Economy
description: Analysis of inequality in relations between developed and developing states ; contending views on the causes and legacies of imperialism ; development strategies and aid .

name: U .S . Foreign Economic Policy
description: The U .S . economy and political-economic institutions in comparative perspective ; economic diplomacy and policy ; role of trade barriers , exchange rates , foreign aid , energy , foreign investment .

name: Politics of the World Economy
description: Exploration of questions and concepts in international economics and politics , especially as they relate to flows of trade , capital , people , and problems across borders .

name: China in International Affairs
description: Economic reform , the open door , and China’s changing role in the international system . Relations with the United States , Japan , and other key powers in Asia . Tensions between the interests of American business and the human rights community over China policy .

name: Russian and Post-Soviet Foreign Policy
description: Overview of Tsarist and Soviet experience as background to detailed examination of the political , economic and ideological forces behind contemporary Russian foreign policy .

name: International Relations of the Pacific Rim
description: Political , economic and security relations among the countries in East Asia and the Pacific with the emphasis on the role of the United States , China and Japan .

name: South and Southeast Asia in International Affairs
description: The historical , cultural , and political reasons for Asia’s dramatic transformation into a powerful engine of world economic growth . The secondary consequences of economic growth for environmental protection , gender relations , ethnicity , and military tension .

name: IR 362 The International Relations of the Contemporary Middle East
description: Introduction to problems and issues in the Middle East today : religio-ethnic rivalries , conflicting nationalisms and ideologies , the Arab- Israeli conflict , Middle East oil .

name: IR 363 Middle East Political Economy
description: Examination of general economic development issues : population , agriculture , industrialization , trade , oil , etc . Several Mideast case study countries are then explored in depth .

name: The Political Economy of Latin American Development
description: The main economic development themes and strategies in Latin America over the past century . The interplay between domestic and international variables , and the resulting dynamic changes .

name: Politics and Democracy in Latin America
description: Examines Latin America’s experience with democracy emphasizing events since the 1980s . Analyzes the roles of interest groups , ideology , domestic politics , bureaucratic processes , perceptions and analogical reasoning .

name: Africa in International Affairs
description: General overview of main historical , political , and economic issues as they affect Africa , focusing on nationalism , development , and superpower competition in Africa .

name: Post-War European Relations
description: European interstate conflict and cooperation since 1945 ; history of Western European integration during the Cold War ; the European Union in post-Cold War Europe .

name: Third World Negotiations
description: Origins , intensity , management and/or resolution of regional conflicts in developing countries and the role and intervention of great powers .

name: European Foreign Policy and Security Issues
description: In-depth analysis of foreign policy events and cases in Europe in the 20th century ; focus on security issues .

name: Political Economy of Russia and Eurasia
description: Interaction of politics and economics in the former Soviet Union and its component republics ; the historical planned economy , the politics of reform and the political economy of former Soviet foreign relations .

name: Japanese Foreign Policy
description: Economic , political , territorial , and security issues ; foreign policy decision-making ; relations with major powers and neighboring states .

name: Contemporary Issues in United States-Latin America Relations
description: Examines major issues in the relationship between the United States and the countries of Latin America and the Caribbean , including trade and financial questions , security , immigration , the environment , narcotics , etc . Major bilateral relations (especially with Mexico , Brazil , and the Caribbean Basin countries) are emphasized , as are regional and multilateral relationships .

name: IR 468 European Integration
description: Research on the European Union’s role in European international relations ; internal EU developments since 1985 as an actor in the world economy .

name: IR 305w Managing New Global Problems
description: Examines strategies for managing global issues in the post Cold War period . Explores ways that international institutions , national governments and non-state actors work separately and together to provide order and control over complex international issues areas . Issues that will receive attention could include financial and monetary relations , trade and foreign investment , preservation of the environment , the spread of weapons of mass destruction , population and migration , terrorism and ethnic strife .

name: International Organizations
description: The emergence of international organizations as a permanent feature in world politics ; role of the United Nations organization as well as regional international organizations .

name: Peace and Conflict Studies
description: Interdisciplinary study of the pursuit of peace , including causes of wars , arms races , conflict resolution , peace movements , nonviolent resistance , and peace with justice .

name: Ethnicity and Nationalism in World Politics
description: Ethnic identity and nation formation in the global society of states ; nation-states ; conflict or political accommodation within multinational states ; impact of dispersed nations on interstate relations .

name: IR 316 Gender and Global Issues
description: An examination of the role women have played in world politics focusing on issues of war and peace , the environment and the global economy .

name: IR 323 Politics of Global Environment
description: Examines the politics of managing the global environment . The nature of ecosystems , common problems , population and resource utilization problems along with biodiversity and global governance are emphasized .

name: International Negotiation
description: Practicum in negotiation skills . Diagnosis of situations and identification of strategies through case studies and personal exercises .

name: Foreign Policy Analysis
description: Basic concepts and analytical approaches in the study of decision-making at the international level . This is a case-based class , requiring participation of students in interactive discussions of decision forcing and retrospective foreign policy cases .

name: Developing Countries in World Politics
description: Origin , concepts , realities , and ideals of the nonaligned movement , focusing on the United States’ role in the developing world .

name: Introduction to International Security
description: Key concepts in international security studies ; historical evolution of international warfare and diplomacy ; contemporary international security issues .

name: IR 382w Order and Disorder in Global Affairs
description: Modern and post-modern perspectives on changes in the inter-state system , relations among cultures and civilizations , the conditions of ecologically sustainable human development .

name: Theories of War
description: Causes of war ; means of prevention and consequences of war .

name: Seminar on Economics and Security
description: Introduction to important economic issue areas that are understood as security-related in the contemporary world : food , trade , debt , etc .

name: IR 444w Theories of Global Society
description: Why the world is organized into sovereign nation-states . The challenges to nation-states in the 21st century from globalization , democratization , revolution , technology , and new forms of cultural identity .

name: War and Diplomacy : The U .S . in World Affairs
description: Perspective on recent American foreign policy ; a case study of conflicting literature on the origins , development and legacy of the Cold War .

name: FBE 391 Real Estate Finance and Investment
description: Introduction to income-producing real estate from the perspective of finance , market analysis , capital markets , development and investment . Includes focus on analytical techniques and computer applications .

name: Real Estate Law
description: Principles of law regarding real property transactions ; buyer-seller , debtor-creditor , landlord-tenant relationships ; environmental law and land use control ; investments and syndication .

name: FBE 465 Real Estate Analysis and Computer Modeling
description: Real estate valuation . Three approaches to valuation : Market comparison , income , and cost . Highest and best use analysis . State of the art real estate software .

name: Management of Real Estate Development : Feasibility Studies
description: By means of a significant real-world case study chosen each term , the development process is examined from the interrelated perspectives of finance , market analysis , and design and construction technology . Team-generated development proposals are proposed and presented in a consulting environment that includes industry participants .

name: FBE 470 Advanced Real Estate Analysis
description: Mixed lecture/case approach covering market analysis , asset valuation , ownership structure , negotiation , asset management , corporate real estate , portfolio management , and affordable housing , appraisal and advanced financial modeling .

name: FBE 489 Real Estate Capital Markets
description: Topics in real estate capital markets including markets for debt and equity ; residential and commercial mortgages and mortgage-backed securities ; REITs ; institutional sources of capital .

name: FBE 491 Real Estate Finance Colloquium
description: The roles of economics and finance in real estate . Lessons from history , the origin of real estate bubbles , how real estate markets work .

name: BAEP 423 Management of Small Businesses
description: Strategic , organizational , financial , and human issues facing the small business .

name: DSO 455 Project Management
description: Topics related to project management in a variety of industries such as real estate projects , new product launch , plant location , etc .

name: Financial Analysis and Valuation
description: This course develops and uses tools of financial analysis to evaluate the performance and assess the value of individual companies in an industry context .

name: Introduction to Venture Capital and Private Equity
description: Introduction to venture capital and private equity . Topics include fundraising , valuation of new firms and venture capital securities , and exiting investments through public offerings .

name: Applied Finance in Fixed Income Securities
description: Emphasis on hedging tools necessary for portfolio managers . Introduction of all securities available in fixed income and provision of tools to analyze investments .

name: Entrepreneurial Finance : Financial Management for Developing Firms
description: Internal financial management of developing firms . Cash flow analysis ; capital budgeting ; sources of financing ; risk analysis ; measurement of profits ; and mergers and acquisitions .

name: Investments
description: Theories and applications of investment decision-making ; the behavior of security prices , portfolio theory , asset pricing models , market efficiency , bond valuation and term structure , derivative securities .

name: Financial Derivatives
description: A rigorous introduction to the pricing and corporate use of financial derivatives — futures , options , forwards , and swaps — on stocks , exchange rates , bonds , and commodities .

name: Negotiation and Persuasion
description: Theories , strategies , and ethics underlying negotiation and persuasion in contemporary organizations and societies . Emphasizes the knowledge and skills needed for effective negotiation and persuasion .

name: BUAD 104 Learning About International Commerce
description: Provides insight into the opportunities and challenges faced by business professionals operating in a global environment by focusing on international cultural norms .

name: Social and Ethical Issues in Business
description: The free-enterprise system examined from the perspective of modern corporations and their critics ; business ethics in relation to personal/external values .

name: BUAD 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings under the supervision of a faculty adviser . Application and proposal required .

name: FBE 403 Introduction to the Legal Environment of Business
description: Legal principles of business : litigation process , constitutional law , torts , product liability , crimes , contracts , sales and leases , intellectual property , international law , agency , employment law , and ethics .

name: Beginning Russian I
description: Introduction to the Russian language with emphasis on basic conversational skills , major points of grammar , and reading .

name: Beginning Russian II
description: Continuation of SLL 120  .

name: Intermediate Russian I
description: Development of thematic conversational skills with emphasis on extended dialogue . Review of basic morphology with special attention to verbs of motion . Reading of authentic material is emphasized .

name: Intermediate Russian II
description: Continuation of SLL 220  . Development of proficiency in conversation skills , reading , and writing .

name: Advanced Russian in Popular Culture
description: Advanced conversation topics , readings and analysis of Russian press , films and other popular materials . Advanced grammar . Conducted in Russian .

name: Intercultural Communication in Russian
description: Advanced language training focusing on specific issues of communication with Russians . Analysis and translation of literary texts . Advanced syntax . Conducted in Russian .

name: German I
description: Introduction to modern German . Oral practice , listening and reading comprehension . Basic structures necessary for simple spoken and written expression .

name: German II
description: Continuation of German I . Introduction to German culture .

name: Elementary Polish I
description: Structure of the language , pronunciation , basic communication , and reading in modern Polish .

name: Elementary Polish II
description: Continuation of SLL 122  .

name: Communism and Post-Communism : Eastern Europe and the Balkans
description: Analysis of communism and post-communism in East-Central Europe , including economic transitions , nationalism , inter-and intra-state conflict , NATO and EU enlargement .

name: The Holocaust in 20th Century Europe
description: The origins and development of anti-Jewish persecution in Germany , resulting in the systematic mass murder of Europe’s Jews during World War II .

name: HIST 324g Islam in Russia , the USSR , and Independent States
description: Cultural cohesiveness and ethnic diversity of Islam in the USSR ; nature and effect of government policies aimed at the integration of Islam into the state .

name: The Second World War
description: Comparative analysis of the Second World War as a major transforming event of the 20th century . Its causes , conduct , and consequences for humanity .

name: Contemporary Europe
description: IrregularWorld War I and its aftermath ; challenge of new culture values ; World War II ; problems of postwar adjustment .

name: History of Imperial Russia : 1689–1917
description: The evolution of imperial society , politics and culture from Peter the Great to the Bolshevik Revolution . The dilemmas of identity in a multinational empire .

name: History of Soviet Russia : 1917–1991
description: The birth of the totalitarian regime , the emergence of the superpower and the socioeconomic , political and cultural developments that culminate in its demise .

name: European Intellectual and Cultural History : The 20th Century , 1920 to the Present
description: IrregularIntellectual and cultural trends of contemporary Europe , including Dadaism , Surrealism , Western Marxism , Fascism , Existentialism and Structuralism .

name: The German Question : Nation and Identity in Modern Central Europe
description: A seminar on the making , unmaking and remaking of the German nation-state , with particular attention to issues of race , class and gender in German identity .

name: Terrorism and Genocide
description: Comparative analysis of the determinants of political violence , terrorism , and genocide and their social and moral consequences ; application of theories to contemporary case studies .

name: European Political Thought II
description: Western political thought since the French Revolution . Rise of Marxist socialism , communism , anarchism , fascism , National Socialism , other doctrines ; the democratic tradition ; new theories of the state .

name: European Politics
description: Institutions , cultures and politics of western Europe , eastern Europe and Russia ; internationalization ; historical and contemporary political , economic , and social change .

name: Politics of Russia and Eastern Europe
description: Culture , society , and politics in Russia and in Eastern Europe . Contemporary political institutions and processes .

name: SLL 302g Modern Russian Literature
description: Survey of the major developments in Russian literature during the 20th century , from modernism to the post-Soviet era . Readings in English .

name: Contemporary Russian Literature
description: Developments in Russian Literature from the 1960s to the present . Literature of moral resistance directed against official cultural models . In English .

name: SLL 330gp Russian Thought and Civilization
description: Russian cultural identity from its beginnings until today . The Eastern Orthodox tradition , its traumatic confrontation with Western culture , and their continuous interaction .

name: Literature and Film in Eastern European Historical Experience
description: Exploration of key moments in the recent historical experience of Eastern Europe through close readings of literature and film . Taught in English .
