name: SLL 465 Seminar in Russian Studies
description: Readings and discussion in Russian of current topics in Russian culture , politics and society . Content varies each time offered .

name: Introduction to Chemical Engineering
description: Problem-solving techniques in chemical engineering using graphics and computers . Mass and heat balances .

name: Numerical Methods in Chemical Engineering
description: Computational tools for solving numerical problems in Chemical Engineering .

name: Chemical Reactor Analysis
description: Basic concepts of chemical kinetics and chemical reactor design .

name: Viscous Flow
description: Constitutive equations and rate laws , momentum equations and kinetic theory of Newtonian , Non-Newtonian and complex flows . Applications to chemical engineering systems .

name: CHE 444a L Chemical Engineering Laboratory
description: Resolution of chemical engineering problems that require original planning , observations , and data interpretation . Written and oral reports .

name: CHE 445 Heat Transfer in Chemical Engineering Processes
description: Phenomenological rate laws , differential and macroscopic equations , and elementary kinetic theory of heat transfer processes with emphases on conduction and convection .

name: Mass Transfer in Chemical Engineering Processes
description: Molecular and continuum approaches to diffusion and convection in fluids and multicomponent mixtures ; simultaneous mass , heat and momentum transfer ; steady-state and time-dependent diffusion ; Maxwell-Stefan equations .

name: CHE 460 L Chemical Process Dynamics and Control
description: Simulation , stability , and automatic control of chemical processes . Open and closed loop control schemes and introduction to optimal control theory . Computer implementation and laboratory application .

name: Chemical Process and Plant Design
description: Applications of unit operations , thermodynamics , kinetics , and economic balance ; energy conservation in heat exchanger networks and in sequencing of separational devices . Safety aspects .

name: Computer-Aided Chemical Process Design
description: Use and optimization of modern computer software for chemical process design .

name: CHEM 431 Physical Chemistry : Quantum Mechanics
description: Kinetic theory ; equations of state ; thermodynamics ; phase equilibria ; chemical equilibrium ; nuclear chemistry , wave mechanics ; spectroscopy ; statistical thermodynamics ; kinetics ; electrochemistry ; surface and colloid chemistry .

name: Applications of Probability and Statistics for Chemical Engineers
description: Principles of probability and statistics , random variables and random functions . Application to chemical engineering problems , including process design , process safety , heterogeneous materials and processes .

name: CHE 476 Chemical Engineering Materials
description: Chemical and physical properties of solid materials used by chemical engineers , including polymers , metals , and ceramics . Materials design for industrial applications .

name: EE 438L Processing for Microelectronics
description: Applications and electrical evaluation of selected processes used in electronic microfabrication .

name: Engineering Economy
description: Utilizing principles of economic analysis for choice of engineering alternatives and engineering systems . Pre-tax and after-tax economy studies . Upper division standing .

name: BUAD 301 Technology Entrepreneurship
description: Starting and managing a technological business : developing a viable concept , market and financial planning , product development , organizing the venture , protecting intellectual property rights .

name: BISC 300 L Introduction to Microbiology
description: Comparative approach to bacteria , Archaea and viruses ; their structure , life cycles , geochemical activity , ecology and nutrition . Fundamentals of metabolism and microbial genetics .

name: Design of Environmentally Benign Process Plants
description: Chemical Process Plants interact with the environment as an integrated system . This course discusses design procedures to minimize unwanted effluents to air , water and solid wastes .

name: CE 453 Water Quality Science and Engineering
description: Water quality criteria and fundamental considerations of acceptability . Natural purification of surface waters . Processes employed in the treatment of waste waters for disposal or re-use .

name: CE 463L Water Chemistry and Analysis
description: Chemistry of water purification technology and water pollution control . Chemical processes in natural and engineering aquatic environments ; physical/chemical and biological characterization of water and wastewater .

name: PTE 463L Introduction to Transport Processes in Porous Media
description: Properties of porous rocks ; capillarity effect , single-phase and multiphase flow through porous media ; diffusion and dispersion , miscible displacement , heat transfer .

name: ENE 428 Air Pollution Fundamentals
description: Air pollution effects on man , vegetation , materials ; pollutant sampling and analysis ; air quality standards and criteria ; meteorological factors and dispersion modeling .

name: Air Pollution Control
description: Emission surveys ; engineering controls of aerosols and gaseous contaminants at emission sources , disposition of contaminants . Field trips .

name: Advanced Inorganic Chemistry
description: Atomic structure , theory of bonding , molecular structure , metallic state , coordination compounds , transition and nontransition metals , magnetic and optical properties , crystal field theory , mechanism of reactions .

name: Nanotechnology and Nanoscale Engineering through Chemical Processes
description: Properties and processing of nanomaterials including polymeric , metallic , and ceramic nanoparticles , composites , colloids , and surfactant self-assembly for templated nanomaterial production .

name: CHE 391 L Introduction to Nanotechnology Research
description: Planning and execution of an experiment , and presentation of findings through oral presentations and a written report . Application of the scientific method learned through immersion in a lab environment .

name: CHE 491 Nanotechnology Research for Undergraduates
description: Independent research in nanotechnology . Research project selected by the student in close consultation with a research adviser .

name: MASC 350 L Nanostructured Materials : Design , Synthesis , and Processing
description: Structure , properties , synthesis , processing and design of metallic , ceramic , polymeric , electronic , photonic , composite , nanophase and biomaterials ; nanostructures , microfabrication and smart materials .

name: PTE 461 Formation Evaluation
description: Concepts of petroleum geology , interpretation of downhole surveys and measurements including well logs , MWD , mud logs and samples .

name: PTE 464L Petroleum Reservoir Engineering
description: Properties of reservoir fluids , volumetric and material balances for gas and oil reservoirs ; reservoir modeling concepts .

name: PTE 465L Drilling Technology and Subsurface Methods
description: Theory and practice in drilling technology ; mechanical properties of reservoir rocks ; well completion ; acidizing and fracturing , oil production technology .

name: CHE 472 Polymer Science and Engineering
description: The preparation , characterization , and properties of synthetic polymers . An interdisciplinary approach to polymers as materials .

name: CHE 474 L Polymer Science and Engineering Laboratory
description: Experimental methods for the preparation , characterization , and properties of synthetic polymers .

name: CHE 475 Physical Properties of Polymers
description: Theoretical methods and semi-empirical correlations for estimating mechanical , thermodynamic , transport , optical , and electrical properties of polymer solutions , melts , networks , glasses , polymer blends and semi-crystalline polymers .

name: Computer Assisted Polymer Engineering and Manufacturing I
description: Estimation of physical , mechanical , chemical and processing properties of thermal plastics . Major molding processes . Mold flow simulation and residual stresses analysis . Case studies .

name: Materials and the Environment
description: Interactions of metals , alloys and composite materials with liquid and gaseous corrosive environments ; corrosion protection by alloying and application of inhibitors and metallic or organic coatings .

name: CHE 450 Sustainable Energy
description: A comparison of various forms of sustainable energy from a perspective ranging from molecules and materials to industrial-scale processes , including biomass , geothermal , and solar energy as well as carbon dioxide capture and utilization .

name: CHE 301g Introduction to Engineering Biology
description: Engineering methods to understand and design molecules , cells , and living organisms . Techniques to analyze biological systems at the molecular and microscopic level . Computational analysis .

name: CHE 488 Molecular and Cellular Bioengineering
description: Design , synthesis , and analysis of biological molecules ; routes to understand and engineer living systems at the molecular and cellular level ; systems and synthetic biology .

name: Solid State Energy Devices
description: Design and operation of solar photovoltaic energy converters , thermovoltoic energy converters , thermoelectric energy converters , and solid state light emitters ; their roles in renewal and conservation of energy .

name: PTE 519 Integrated Physical and Cyber Security for Oil and Gas Operations
description: Infrastructure Security , Resilience and Management of Digital Oil Fields , Process Control Networks in exploration and production , refining and chemical plants , Asset Integrity principles , case histories .

name: CHEM 332L Physical Chemical Measurements
description: Experimental study of topics discussed in CHEM 430 and CHEM 431 ; adsorption , magnetic susceptibility ; electron spin resonance , kinetics , equilibria , molecular spectra and structure , viscosity , dielectric properties .

name: CHEM 423 L Advanced Laboratory Techniques in Organic and Inorganic Chemistry
description: Advanced synthetic , analytical , and physical measurement techniques in organic and inorganic chemistry . Emphasis on laboratory work with discussion of theoretical background .

name: CHEM 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: CHEM 463L Chemical Nanotechnology Laboratory
description: Experimental techniques in the synthesis and characterization of nanoscale materials . Emphasis on examining size-dependent properties of various nano - scale materials using spectroscopic techniques .

name: CHEM 465L Chemical Instrumentation
description: Principles of operation of instruments used in physical sciences . Basic electronics , interconnection of building blocks , data acquisition and data reduction , noise , instrument systems .

name: CHEM 467L Advanced Chemical Biology Laboratory
description: Principles , methods and protocols of chemical biology through experimentation focusing on the interactions of small molecules with biomacromolecules such as proteins and DNA .

name: Advanced Organic Chemistry
description: Advanced treatment of organic chemistry from a mechanistic point of view according to the following topics : polar and isopolar reactions , intermediates .

name: Biochemistry and Molecular Biology : An Introduction for Chemists
description: Amino acids and peptides ; protein structure and function ; enzyme kinetics ; structure , analysis and synthesis of nucleic acids ; chemical biology of DNA and RNA ; biotechnology .

name: CHEM 455 Chemical Nanotechnology
description: Studies in the fundamental principles governing nanoscale materials . Structure and chemical bonding , preparative methods , and electrical , optical and magnetic properties of nanoscale materials and applications .

name: CHEM 499 Special Topics
description: Lectures and discussions on specialized topics in chemistry .

name: Introduction to Theory and Practice of X-ray Crystallography
description: Introduction to single crystal X-ray diffraction theory and its extension to two-dimensional diffraction . Application of modern instrumentation and software techniques to problems of current chemical interest .

name: X-ray Crystallography
description: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction theory and experimental methods .

name: Polymer Synthesis
description: Concepts of polymer structure and stereochemistry . Organic chemistry of polymerization reactions with emphasis on condensation , radical , cationic , anionic , and coordination- - metathesis polymerization .

name: CHEM 292 Supervised Research
description: Supervised undergraduate research experience .

name: CHEM 294 Undergraduate Research Seminar
description: Seminars in current research in the chemical and molecular sciences .

name: CHEM 494x Advanced Research Experience
description: Directed undergraduate research supervised by faculty , with advanced capstone research experience .

name: MPVA 301 Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction : secondary emphasis for music majors , principal emphasis for music minors and all BA music majors .

name: Introduction to the International Phonetic Alphabet
description: Principles of pronunciation and enunciation ; basic application of the International Phonetic Alphabet symbols and sounds to English , German , Italian , French and Latin .

name: Choral Conducting I
description: Basic conducting techniques ; score analysis ; conducting patterns ; problems of tempo , dynamics , articulation and text .

name: Choral Conducting II
description: Refinement of techniques developed in MUCD 340  ; study of styles and interpretations of choral music from the Renaissance to the present .

name: Introduction to Choral Music
description: An introduction to the many facets of choral music . Grounding in the intellectual and practical issues of choirs , singing , and choral literature .

name: Choral Development
description: Problems of achieving proper balance , blend , intonation , diction , precision , etc . , in choral groups ; criteria for selection of repertoire for particular groups .

name: MUCO 441 Choral Arranging
description: Arranging and composing for chorus .

name: Keyboard Instruction I
description: Beginning and elementary instruction ; emphasis on reading skills , harmonization , transposition , score reading , improvisation ; group instruction in a keyboard laboratory facility .

name: Aural Skills I
description: Sight-singing , dictation , related keyboard application .

name: Theory I
description: Notation , scales , intervals ; introduction to counterpoint ; harmonic principles of the common practice period ; analysis , written work .

name: Aural Skills II
description: Continuation of MUCO 132a  , MUCO 132b  .

name: Theory II
description: Analysis of representative pieces from the classic and romantic periods ; exercises in composition .

name: MUCO 338 x Elementary Orchestration
description: Range , techniques , timbre , transposition of orchestral instruments ; exercises in orchestration .

name: MUHL 250g Music and Ideas
description: A topical study of critical issues and cultural relationships found in music from antiquity to the present and across musical genres and styles .

name: MUHL 350g Western Art Music History I
description: A study of the musical styles and genres from antiquity through early modern periods within their historical context . Detailed analysis of selected works .

name: MUHL 351 Western Art Music History II
description: A study of the musical styles and genres in the late modern and contemporary eras within their historical context . Detailed analysis of selected works .

name: CTCS 200g History of the International Cinema I
description: The development of international cinema from its beginnings to World War II . Lectures , screenings , and discussions .

name: CTCS 473 Film and Media Theory
description: Influential ideas and theoretical approaches that have shaped the making and study of film . Students are encouraged to take this course in their junior year .

name: Cinematic Communication
description: Introduction to the interrelationship of visuals , sound , and editing in cinematic communication . Workshops in directing and producing . Individual and group projects .

name: CTCS 367 Global Media
description: Studies in the global configurations of television industries and cultures , including new technologies and the textual and sociological analysis of global media events and programming .

name: CTCS 402 Practicum in Film/Television Criticism
description: Exercise in writing film and television criticism using new and classic films and television programs .

name: CTCS 494 Advanced Cinema and Media Studies Seminar
description: Rotating topics involving detailed study of the historical , cultural and aesthetic analysis of film , television , and new media technologies .

name: CTCS 495 Honors Seminar
description: Advanced work in the historical , cultural and aesthetic analysis of film , television , and new media technologies .

name: CTPR 294 Directing in Documentary , Fiction and New Media
description: Basic concepts of directing in new media , documentary and fictional narrative . Includes work with actors , documentary concepts , and creation of short new media projects .

name: CTPR 295 L Cinematic Arts Laboratory
description: The aesthetics and tools of the major disciplines of cinematic arts : producing , cinematography , sound , and editing .

name: Intermediate Production
description: Principles of visual and aural communication ; idea development and realization using image , movement , pace , the spoken word and other sounds ; small crew projects .

name: CTPR 450 The Production and Post-Production Assistant
description: Detailed view of the process of making media . Introducing fundamental thinking typical of each craft . Weekend crew experience and responsibilities .

name: CTWR 413 Writing the Short Script I
description: Preparation of scripts for short films : form , structure , planning .

name: Television Script Analysis
description: In-depth analysis of the craft of writing prime-time episodic television . Examination of situation comedies and dramas through weekly screenings and lectures .

name: CTWR 414 The Screenplay
description: Students study story structure and develop several story outlines , write a short script for possible production , a feature film outline and first act .

name: Motion Picture Script Analysis
description: Critical analysis of story structure from classic films to contemporary works . Identification of key story concepts and elements of three-act structure .

name: Practicum in Editing
description: Workshop in how editing can shape storytelling , using content from a variety of media and in various styles . Modern non-linear equipment and techniques .

name: Practicum in Cinematography
description: Camera and lighting workshop in color cinematography , beginning with 35mm still photography and moving into 16mm and digital motion picture formats . In-class exercises .

name: Practicum in Producing
description: A comprehensive overview of the role of the producer . How projects are conceived , developed , packaged , financed and marketed .

name: CTPR 440 Practicum in Sound
description: Aesthetic and technical skills of production and postproduction sound necessary to create a motion picture soundtrack .

name: Practicum in Production Design
description: Introduction to visual storytelling : designing the look of a film , building visual continuity into a film , study of the production designer’s art and craft .

name: Practicum in Directing
description: Concepts of directing for motion pictures , emphasizing the working relationship of actors and directors . Scenes will be staged in class and filmed for class presentation .

name: Introduction to Film Graphics — Animation
description: An introduction to methods for creating analog animation through experimentation with imagery , concepts and materials . Emphasis on basic timing principles and hands-on techniques .

name: CTPR 480 Advanced Production Workshop
description: Directors , producers , cinematographers , editors and sound designers collaborate to produce , shoot , edit and deliver fictional , documentary or experimental projects .

name: CTPR 484 Advanced Multi-Camera Television Workshop
description: Exercises and practical application for writing and producing a multi-camera television project . Special attention to the development of the sitcom .

name: Single Camera Television Dramatic Series
description: Collaborative production and postproduction of an original episodic drama , shot on original sets on stage and on location .

name: Lateral Thinking for Filmmaking Practice
description: Introduces contemporary concepts of production , emphasizing the variety of contemporary media and significant related concepts . Projects created using laptops , phones and networks .

name: CTPR 458 Organizing Creativity : Entertainment Industry Decision Making
description: Analysis of the unique structures in the entertainment industry for organizing and managing creativity . Students research and chart pathways to leadership .

name: The Art of the Pitch
description: Presenting ideas for feature and television projects to buyers : shaping ideas for pitching , assessing and targeting the marketplace , in-class pitching of projects .

name: The Film Industry : Career Challenges and Choices for Women
description: This class discusses women’s roles in the entertainment industry and career opportunities available for women in the business , corporate and creative sectors .

name: CTAN 452 Introduction to 3-D Computer Animation
description: Lecture and laboratory in computer animation : geometric modeling , motion specification , lighting , texture mapping , rendering , compositing , production techniques , systems for computer-synthesized animation .

name: Visual Effects
description: Survey of contemporary concepts and approaches to production in the current state of film and video effects work . Digital and traditional methodologies will be covered , with a concentration on digital exercises illustrating modern techniques .

name: Visual Music
description: Experimental animation providing the opportunity to produce individual or group projects . Focus is non-conventional techniques for image creation and collaboration between composer and visual artist .

name: CTIN 401 L Interface Design for Games
description: Introduction to the aesthetics , terminology and common trends of interface design for games . Topics include 2-D and 3-D spaces and user/camera perspectives .

name: Anatomy of a Game
description: Examine two game products from concept to delivery ; introduce students to each of the professional disciplines involved in making digital games .

name: CTIN 464 Game Studies Seminar
description: Rigorous examination of interactive entertainment : genres , history , aesthetics , cultural context , and social significance . Topics vary by semester .

name: CTIN 482 Designing Social Games
description: Leading industry techniques and networking fundamentals ; designing an original social game .

name: CTIN 483 Introduction to Game Development
description: Introduction to technical and creative aspects of game development , including the art of creating the digital game prototype and development of games ; coding experience required .

name: IML 340 Remixing the Archive
description: An intermediate level course which approaches archived material from multiple perspectives , in order to develop new avenues of expression , education , and research .

name: Creative Coding for the Web
description: Analysis and development of scholarly media projects using diverse web authoring strategies , technologies and documentation .

name: IML 420m New Media for Social Change
description: Creating real social change through multimedia , working in collaboration with a local nonprofit organization .

name: IML 466 Digital Studies Symposium
description: Lectures , presentations , and readings introducing cutting-edge digital media innovations and applications . Analysis of the critical and creative challenges of contemporary digital media practices .

name: CE 106L Design and Planning of Civil Engineering Systems
description: History of civil engineering ; introduction to the synthesis and design of systems dependent upon civil engineering technology ; structuring , modeling , and simulation of systems using graphics .

name: Introduction to Computer Methods in Civil Engineering
description: Computer programming , organization of problems for computational solution , flow charts , programming ; numerical methods ; analysis and solution of civil engineering problems .

name: CE 207L Introduction to Design of Structural Systems
description: Structural materials , components and systems ; gravity and lateral forces ; structural performance and failures ; introduction to structural plans and analysis ; computer applications , case studies , design project .

name: CE 334L Mechanical Behavior of Materials
description: Measurement of stress and strain ; tensile , impact , creep , and fatigue behavior ; statistical methods , brittle fracture ; properties of structural materials .

name: Computer Methods in Engineering
description: Fundamentals of analog and digital computers ; simulation of nonlinear physical systems ; numerical analysis and solution of engineering problems .

name: CE 408 Risk Analysis in Civil Engineering
description: Realization of nondeterministic problems in civil engineering ; quantitative analysis of structural and system reliability ; optimal design and design with specified risk .

name: Water Resources Engineering
description: Discussion of broad perspectives on control and utilization of water , quantitative hydrology , ground water , probability concept , economic study , hydraulic structures , multipurpose water resources projects .

name: Design of Steel Structures
description: Fundamentals of analysis and design of steel structures ; structural elements ; simple and eccentric connections ; design project .

name: CE 467L Geotechnical Engineering
description: Fundamentals of geotechnical engineering ; soil classification , seepage , stress-strain behavior , shear strength , consolidation , design of retaining structures and foundations , and slope stability . Soil testing .

name: CE 471 Principles of Transportation Engineering
description: Planning , design , construction , maintenance , and operation of facilities for air , water , rail , and highway transit systems .

name: Structural Systems Design
description: Evaluate , design and analyze buildings . Organize and perform calculations for vertical loads , wind loads , and seismic loads on building projects .

name: CE 465 Water Supply and Sewerage System Design
description: Design of water supply systems , storm drains , sanitary sewers , and lift stations .

name: Reinforced Concrete Design
description: Strength and deformation of reinforced concrete ; beams in flexure and shear ; bond and development of bars ; deflections ; columns ; slabs ; footings ; introduction to prestressed concrete .

name: ARCH 205a L Building Science I
description: The process and communication of building design : physical building shell , systems for structure , enclosure , and space ordering .

name: ARCH 305a L Building Science II
description: The design of a building as a complex of interacting systems ; relations of subsystems ; influences of production and marketing on design .

name: ARCH 405a L Building Science III
description: Design of building systems as an experimental process .

name: CE 210L Introduction to Environmental Engineering Microbiology
description: Principles of environmental microbiology ; waterborne pathogens ; microorganisms and air pollution ; microorganisms in soil ; water pollution microbiology ; biodegradation of hazardous chemicals ; eutrophication .

name: Wastewater Treatment Design
description: Process kinetics , mass balance , reactor design , pretreatment , clarification , chemical treatment , biological treatment (aerobic and anaerobic) , disinfection , sludge treatment , nitrogen and phosophorus removal , carbon adsorption .

name: ENE 200 Environmental Engineering Principles
description: Analysis of water , air , and land pollution , including hazardous waste , and engineering of mitigation measures . Water and wastewater treatment systems .

name: ENE 426 Particulate Air Pollutants : Properties/Behavior/Measurement
description: Particulate air pollutants , their measurement and instrumentation methods , and their effects on the environment and human health ; optical properties and visibility degradation .

name: Introduction to Structural Dynamics
description: Response of single and multiple degree of freedom systems to dynamic excitation ; structural modeling and approximate solutions ; introduction to earthquake resistant design .

name: Construction Engineering
description: Introduction to the construction processes ; estimating and bidding , construction administration , planning and scheduling , equipment and methods , labor relations , cost control systems , and safety .

name: CE 478 Timber and Masonry Design
description: Characteristics and properties of wood ; beams , columns , trusses , connectors , and diaphragms . Properties of masonry , working stress and strength design , seismic design requirements .

name: CE 482 Foundation Design
description: Analysis and design principles of building foundations , including spread footings , piles , drilled shafts , sheetpile walls and retaining structures .

name: COLT 101gp Masterpieces and Masterminds : Literature and Thought
description: A broad introduction to the great works of Western culture from antiquity to 1800 .

name: CORE 102gp Culture and Values : Thematic Option Honors Program
description: Systematic reasoning about values and ways of living ; close reading of major texts within the Western tradition ; Biblical and classical through contemporary sources .

name: Greek I
description: Essentials of classical Greek grammar and vocabulary .

name: Greek II
description: Essentials of classical Greek grammar and vocabulary , continued . Basic reading skills .

name: Greek III
description: Reading Greek literature . Introduction to reading and translation of classical Greek prose and poetry . Extensive grammar review .

name: Latin I
description: Essentials of Latin grammar and vocabulary .

name: Latin II
description: Essentials of Latin grammar and vocabulary , continued . Basic reading skills .

name: Latin III
description: Reading Latin literature . Introduction to reading and translation of classical Latin prose and poetry . Extensive grammar review .

name: CLAS 101g The Ancient World
description: (Enroll in HIST 101gp )

name: CLAS 410a Research in Classical Studies
description: Current approaches to study of the ancient world . Research methods and resources .

name: PSYC 100Lg Introduction to Psychology
description: Factors that influence human behavior , including learning , thinking , perception , motivation , and emotion ; analysis of determinants of development , adjustment , and maladjustment .

name: PSYC 274Lg Statistics
description: Introduction to the use of statistics in psychology : basic ideas in measurement ; frequency distributions ; descriptive statistics ; concepts and procedures in statistical inference .

name: PSYC 301 L Cognitive Processes
description: IrregularExperimental and theoretical aspects of human memory , perception , thinking , and language .

name: PSYC 339Lg Origins of the Mind
description: Exploration of ancient philosophical questions concerning the origins of human knowledge through empirical studies of infants , animals , and adults from diverse cultures .

name: CSCI 455x Introduction to Programming Systems Design
description: Intensive introduction to programming principles , discrete mathematics for computing , software design and software engineering concepts .

name: LING 210g Introduction to Linguistics
description: Empirical study of the sounds and structures of human language ; syntax and semantics ; language change ; linguistic universals .

name: LING 301 Introduction to Phonetics and Phonology
description: A survey of topics in phonetics and phonology .

name: LING 302 Introduction to Syntax and Semantics
description: A survey of topics in syntax and semantics .

name: PHIL 122ag Reasoning and Argument
description: Techniques for constructing good arguments and for assessing and criticizing the arguments of others .

name: PHIL 262g Mind and Self : Modern Conceptions
description: Philosophical problems about the nature of mind associated with the rise of modern science ; topics include the mind/body relation , personal identity , rationality and freedom .

name: PSYC 304 L Sensation and Perception
description: IrregularReceptor processes and stimulus organization ; traditional topics in the perception of objects , space , time .

name: PSYC 336 L Developmental Psychology
description: Child and adolescent behavior and associated theories ; exploration of the continuity between child and adult behavior .

name: CSCI 360 Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: Concepts and algorithms underlying the understanding and construction of intelligent systems . Agents , problem solving , search , representation , reasoning , planning , machine learning .

name: LING 385Lg Human Language as Computation
description: Study of language as a complex natural system that requires elaborate mental computation .

name: LING 405 Child Language Acquisition
description: Universal characteristics of child language ; stages of acquisition of phonology , syntax , semantics ; processes and dimensions of development ; psychological mechanisms ; communicative styles .

name: LING 406 Psycholinguistics
description: Experimental and theoretical aspects of how spoken and written language is produced and understood , learned during childhood , and affected by brain damage .

name: LING 407 Atypical Language
description: Analysis of atypical language and language pathologies throughout the lifespan and their relevance to current linguistic and cognitive science theory .

name: Symbolic Logic
description: Introduction to basic techniques of propositional and quantificational logic , and elements of probability . Especially useful to philosophy , mathematics , science , and engineering majors .

name: British Empiricism
description: Development of philosophy in Great Britain from the 17th to the 19th centuries ; emphasis on Locke , Berkeley , and Hume .

name: Philosophy of Mind
description: Examination of contemporary theories of mind and its place in the natural world .

name: PHIL 465 Philosophy of Language
description: The nature of communication , meaning , reference , truth , necessity , speech acts , convention , and language .

name: Learning and Memory
description: IrregularPrinciples involved in classical and operant conditioning . Concentration on basic causes of behavior ; consideration of the relevance of simple behavioral laws to complicated human behavior .

name: PSYC 320 Principles of Psychobiology
description: IrregularThe integrative study of bio-behavioral systems . Evolutionary , developmental , ecological , social , ethological , and physiological factors mediating representative behavioral and psychological phenomenon are examined in detail .

name: Abnormal Psychology
description: The commonly diagnosed behavior pathologies ; biological , social , cultural , and developmental antecedents of abnormal behavior ; principles of learning , perception , and motivation , as they relate to psychopathology .

name: Animal Behavior
description: Exploration of human nature through studies of nonhuman animals , including topics of navigation , culture , object representation , social cognition , music , and morality .

name: Human Judgment and Decision Making
description: Descriptive and normative models of decision making ; topics include probability judgments , inference , correlation , emotion , mental accounting , decision analysis , lens model , equity , social dilemmas , time , risk .

name: PSYC 433 Children's Learning and Cognitive Development
description: Principles of cognitive development , learning , and motivation applied to the development of literacy ; includes tutoring a child two hours per week .

name: PSYC 450 Neural Network Models of Social and Cognitive Processes
description: IrregularIntroduction to using neural network or connectionist models to simulate cognitive , social , emotional and motivational processes ; basic concepts and tools in computational neuroscience .

name: Social Cognition
description: IrregularTheory and research on cognitive processes in social behavior , to include social inference , cognition and emotion , the Self , social categorization , person memory , and attribution processes .

name: BISC 421 Neurobiology
description: Structure , function , and development of nervous systems ; neural integration and mechanisms of behavior ; organization and operation of brains .

name: CSCI 109 Introduction to Computer Science
description: An introduction to , and overview of , Computer Science ; both as a discipline and a body of knowledge .

name: LING 275Lg Language and Mind
description: Language within cognitive science : speech physiology and acoustics , language acquisition , reading , language disorders , perception and mental representation of words , linguistic diversity and computer analysis of speech .

name: Language and Law
description: Principles of semantics ; analysis of speech acts including informing , promising , threatening , warning ; linguistic analysis of consumer contracts and advertisements ; readability studies .

name: The Critical Philosophy of Kant
description: Intensive study of the philosophical works of Kant .

name: Theories of Action
description: Systematic investigation of action , the mental states involved in action , the reasoning processes that lead to action , and related concepts including intentionality and free will .

name: Methodologies of the Sciences
description: Comparison of the methodologies of the natural , social , and/or behavioral sciences ; consideration of such topics as the concept of scientific law , prediction , explanation , confirmation .

name: PSYC 314 L Research Methods
description: Experimental research methods in psychology ; nature and concepts of scientific method .

name: Behavioral Neuroscience
description: Neural bases of behavior . Concentration on sensory and motor processes and the interaction of neural , chemical , and hormonal systems .

name: PSYC 424 Neuropsychology
description: IrregularEffects of brain damage on human behavior and abilities , particularly language , memory , and emotion .

name: PSYC 425 Functional Imaging of the Human Brain
description: IrregularIntroduction to the physical and physiological bases of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) , and principles of functional MRI , safety , design and analysis of experiments , and operation .

name: PSYC 440 Introduction to Cognitive Neuroscience
description: Introduction to the major components of cognition (perception , memory , intelligence) in terms of the neural coding characteristic of the relevant brain areas .

name: Communication and Social Science
description: Social scientific inquiry into human communication ; core theories of message production and reception in interpersonal , group and organizational contexts .

name: COMM 313 Communication and Mass Media
description: Survey of mass communication research ; history , content , effects , theories , and policy implications of various media .

name: COMM 311 Rhetoric and the Public Sphere
description: Humanistic approaches to inquiry in communication ; qualitative research techniques ; core theories of message production and reception in social , political , and mediated contexts .

name: COMM 209 Communication and Media Economics
description: Economic and political economic principles for the analysis of communication and media industries including broadcasting , newspapers , motion pictures , music , video games , advertising and public relations .

name: COMM 309 Communication and Technology
description: Cultural , social , political , and economic dynamics of communication technologies , including internet architecture , social media , participatory cultures , privacy , surveillance , networked journalism , big data , algorithms , online activism .

name: Public Speaking
description: Principles and practices of effective oral communication ; analysis of the speaking-listening process ; selection and organization of speech materials ; use of new presentation technologies .

name: Argumentation and Advocacy
description: Basic argumentation theory including analysis , research and evidence , case construction , refutation ; discursive and visual argument ; diverse fields of advocacy including law , politics , organizations , interpersonal relations .

name: COMM 301Lg Empirical Research in Communication
description: Experimental and survey methods for communication study ; basic statistical concepts , procedures , and tests .

name: Understanding Social Science Research
description: Students learn to be consumers rather than creators of social science research . Examines the challenges and opportunities of communicating research through mass media .

name: ASCJ 200 Navigating Media and News in the Digital Age
description: Students will be engaged as discriminating media/news consumers and contributors . Emphasis on critical skills needed to understand , employ , enjoy and help shape our media landscape .

name: ASCJ 210 Contours of Change in Media and Communication
description: Provides an introduction to cultivating a curious , critical , and proactive approach to the challenges of social change . Students will be encouraged to develop an expansive and critical definition and understanding of change as it relates to the role of media and communication in producing and responding to political and cultural transformations that shape our status as citizens and our ideas of citizenship .

name: Introduction to Literary Theory
description: Introduction to general forms of reflection on literary discourse .

name: Globalization : Culture , Change , Resistance
description: Cultural dimensions of issues in globalization : migration , diaspora , terrorism , communications , climate change , collectives , production and technology , money and exchange .

name: COLT 102g On Location : The Place of Literature in Global Cultures
description: Comparative study of works from a broad range of cultural traditions that originate from , and provide insight into , vital global locations outside the Western sphere .

name: COLT 250g Cultures of Latin America
description: Comparative study of Latin American cultures , especially vis-a-vis those of Europe and the U .S . Materials drawn from literature , but also film , opera , history , cultural theory .

name: COLT 251g Modern Literature and Thought of the West Since 1800
description: Survey of literary and other cultural texts from the 19th to the 21st centuries , with emphasis on the individual and social change .

name: COLT 264gp Asian Aesthetic and Literary Traditions
description: A comparative study of the Asian aesthetic heritage of poetry , painting , music , and drama ; of literary themes , trends , and myths .

name: Epic
description: Formation and development of epic poetry from Near Eastern and Greco-Roman antiquity through the Renaissance to the present . Emphasis on relation to political and cultural change .

name: Heroes , Myths and Legends in Literature and the Arts
description: Study of transformations of characters and themes from myth , legend or fairytale (Oedipus , Antigone , Faust , Don Juan , Cinderella , Comic and Tragic Twins , Hero and Monster) .

name: COLT 324 Women in Medieval and Renaissance Europe
description: Study of literary , social and cultural lives of women during the European Middle Ages and Renaissance . Reading and analysis of texts written by and about women .

name: Decadence and Modernity
description: Study of the notion of “decadence” and its impact on modern and contemporary literary/cultural production , with a comparatist focus on different linguistic traditions .

name: Realist Fiction
description: Study of the ways literature presents the “real” (social and/or individual) through readings of selected novels and short stories in the realist and naturalist traditions .

name: Fictions of the First Person
description: Study of prose fiction in the first person as a model of fiction in general and as a reflection of the fictional structure of selfhood .

name: Modernist Fiction
description: Study of the Modernist aesthetic in narrative texts by Gide , Joyce , Kafka , Woolf and others ; possible focus on related trends in other literary traditions .

name: COLT 351 Modern and Contemporary Drama
description: Comparative study of major modern dramatic trends , subgenres , and techniques , through representative works from Strindberg to the Theatre of the Grotesque and the Absurd .

name: COLT 374gm Women Writers in Europe and America
description: Introduction to works of major women writers from the Middle Ages to the 20th century in their literary , social , and cultural contexts .

name: COLT 382gw Zen and Taoism in Asian Literature
description: Studies of the presence and influence of Zen Buddhism and Taoism in Asian literature , with a focus on China and Japan .

name: The Fantastic
description: Representative works from the “fantastic” and related currents within the European , U .S . , and Spanish American traditions ; reading of texts by authors such as Borges , Cortazar , Kafka , and Poe . Discussion of relevant theoretical concepts and critical works .

name: Utopias
description: Examination of selected utopias in their historical context as “no places” whose projections of alternate cultures always comment on their own .

name: Poetry and Poetics of the Everyday
description: Relations between poetry of the dominant tradition in various languages and vernacular forms of poetry , such as riddles , nursery rhymes , ballads , and poems in dialect or slang .

name: Europe and the Writing of Others
description: Analysis of European texts — literary , musical , philosophical , visual — that focus on other cultures , as well as of non-European texts dealing with Europe or - European cultural forms .

name: COLT 448 Multilingual Encounters
description: Exploration of multilingual encounters in literary works , films , and theoretical texts . Topics may include immigrant languages , dialects , jargons , imaginary or hybrid languages , theories of translation .

name: Los Angeles Crime Fiction
description: The noir tradition in books and films set in Los Angeles . Emphasis on generic conventions , representations of the city , and discourses of class , gender , race .

name: COLT 475 Politics and the Novel
description: Examination of the modern realist novel with special focus on the representation of social change (revolution , class conflict , sexual politics) .

name: Narrative and the Law
description: Study of the relationship between law and narrative through Western literature , including the realist novel , medieval morality plays and Greek drama .

name: The Shoah (Holocaust) in Literature and the Arts
description: A critical analysis , in their historical contexts , of representative literary , dramatic , musical and artistic works created by or about the victims of the Shoah (Holocaust) .

name: EALC 454 Bildungsroman in Modern East Asia
description: Comparative study of core narratives of youth and its destiny in modern literature from China , Japan , Korea , and Taiwan . Readings include scholarship on European literature .

name: EALC 460 Love , Self and Gender in Japanese Literature
description: Examines conceptions of love , self , gender , and sexuality in Japanese literature and culture of the modern and pre-modern periods with comparisons to European and Chinese literature .

name: Revolutions in Theater
description: Comparative study of groundbreaking contributions to modern theories of theater and performance in the context of other 20th century revolutions — aesthetic , cultural , and social .

name: COLT 357 The Avant-Garde
description: Study of the relationship between literary modes and other arts since 1900 , focusing on particular avant-garde movements .

name: COLT 373 Literature and Film
description: Examines literature and film as distinct modes of representation , narration , and structuring of time , language , memory , and visuality .

name: COLT 379 Nationalism and Postcolonialism in Southeast Asian Cinema
description: Cinema from Cambodia , Indonesia , Laos , Malaysia , the Philippines , Singapore , Thailand , and Vietnam in local and global cultural contexts .

name: Opera and Cultural Theory
description: Study of the words and plots of operas from the viewpoint of gender , postcolonial , and psychoanalytical theory . Special attention to contemporary stagings and film versions .

name: Representation and Cognition in Photography
description: Analysis of documentary photo- - representation in its historical context through study of the work of selected 20th century documentary photographers and of pertinent critical writings .

name: Soundtracks of Our Lives
description: The reciprocal , ideological relations between modes of listening , sounds , music ; and literature , film , culture . Examines a range of issues in auditory culture across a broad historical span .

name: COLT 470 Literature and Media in Latin America
description: Study of the relations between Latin American literature and different mass-media genres .

name: Dada and Surrealism
description: A comparative study of Dada and Surrealism in literature in relation to painting , sculpture , photography and cinema .

name: CLAS 370 Leaders and Communities : Classical Models
description: Examination of political and moral leadership in classical republican , democratic , and imperial communities ; consideration of how these models are useful to contemporary democracies .

name: COLT 375 Latin American Cultural and Literary Theory
description: Survey of cultural critique focused on Latin America as a cultural region and on Latin Americanism as a transnational academic practice .

name: COLT 377 Literature , Theory , Gender
description: Literary representations and theories of gender difference . - Examines questions of gendered voice in writing and the cultural construction of gender in various periods and cultures .

name: Psychoanalysis and the Arts
description: Introduction to psychoanalytic literature on the arts , including classic texts by Freud , Jones , Lacan , Derrida , and others . Readings of theoretical and fictional works .

name: Literature and Justice
description: Examination of literary and autobiographical texts that raise questions of justice in multicultural societies ; links to theories of justice in historical , political , or philosophical contexts .

name: Literary Criticism from Plato to Postmodernism
description: Survey of major texts in the literary criticism of the West from the Greeks to postmodern theories .

name: COLT 454 Aesthetic Philosophy and Theory
description: Introduction to philosophical and critical writings on the nature of art and aesthetic experience . Special attention to technology’s impact on art .

name: Literature , Theory , History
description: Examines the relation between historical and theoretical approaches to literary works .

name: Desire , Literature , Technology
description: Relations between technology , desire , power and literature through contemporary philosophers , theorists and literary critics . Examines literature and philosophy in relation to global technological planning .

name: Family in Theory and Literature
description: Representations of the family in literary works and films across different cultures and historical periods . Readings in anthropology , philosophy , psychoanalysis , and feminist and gender theory .

name: Deconstructive Thought
description: Deconstructive analysis of theories of language , representation , selfhood , the human , art and technology , politics and ethics . Study of works by Derrida and others .

name: Critical Image
description: Introduction to critical reflection on the image . Analysis of criticism , fiction , film , and visual artifacts .

name: MPKS 301 Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction on secondary instrument for music majors , on principal instrument for music minors and BA music majors .

name: Counterpoint I
description: The study of the techniques of modal counterpoint ; exercises in two- , three- and four-part writing in 16th century style .

name: MUCO 137a Composition I
description: Beginning exercises in composing , initial composition projects , study , lectures and class discussions of selected compositions from the repertory .

name: Counterpoint II
description: Studies in tonal counterpoint ; two- , three- and four-part counterpoint in 18th century style ; polyphonic variations ; inventions .

name: Orchestration I
description: Introduction to the principles of instrumentation ; ranges techniques , timbres ; transpositions of orchestral instruments ; beginning exercises in orchestration .

name: MUCO 237a Composition II
description: Composition in shorter forms , continuation of score analysis and listening assignments .

name: Orchestration II
description: Intermediate exercises in orchestration , including scoring for chamber ensembles and orchestra ; study of the history of orchestration .

name: MUCO 337a Composition III
description: Individual instruction in composition ; preparation for the senior recital .

name: Analytical Techniques
description: Selected analytical topics .

name: Counterpoint III
description: Canon and fugue ; 19th and 20th century developments .

name: MUCO 437a Composition IV
description: Individual instruction in composition ; preparation for the senior recital .

name: MTEC 474a Electronic Synthesizer Techniques
description: Electronic music procedures in a multi-track studio .

name: MTEC 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Keyboard Instruction II
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction ; development of reading , performance and improvisation skills necessary for proficiency examinations . Group and individualized instruction in a keyboard laboratory facility .

name: Instrumental Conducting I
description: Communicating musical ideas to instrumental ensembles ; reading and conducting from full score of orchestral compositions .

name: LING 285Lg Human Language and Technology
description: Study of human linguistic competence and technologies that simulate it . Grammar , parsing , text generation ; semantics , pragmatics , sense disambiguation ; phonetics , speech synthesis , speech recognition .

name: CSCI 104 L Data Structures and Object Oriented Design
description: Introduces the student to standard data structures (linear structures such as linked lists , (balanced) trees , priority queues , and hashtables) , using the C++ programming language .

name: CSCI 170 Discrete Methods in Computer Science
description: Sets , functions , series . Big-O notation and algorithm analysis . Propositional and first-order logic . Counting and discrete probability . Graphs and basic graph algorithms . Basic number theory .

name: CSCI 201 L Principles of Software Development
description: Object-oriented paradigm for programmingin- the-large in Java ; writing sophisticated concurrent applications with animation and graphic user interfaces ; using professional tools on team project .

name: Phonetics
description: miliarization with the articulation and transcription of speech sounds . Also vocal tract anatomy , acoustics , speech technology , non-English sounds , perception . Includes laboratory exercises .

name: New Horizons in Forensic Speaker Identification
description: Overview of methods used to identify voices on the basis of their characteristic speech patterns .

name: Logic and Meaning in Natural Language
description: Introduction to meaning in natural language and the methods from logic applied to its study .

name: CSCI 310 Software Engineering
description: Introduction to the software engineering process and software lifecycle . Covers project management , requirements , architecture , design , implementation , testing , and maintenance phase activities in team based projects .

name: CHEM 103Lgx General Chemistry for the Environment and Life
description: Chemistry for environmental studies , neuroscience and other life sciences : organic and inorganic structures , nomenclature , stoichiometry , solutions , gases , non-covalent interactions , equilibria , acid-base and redox reactions .

name: Systems Neuroscience : From Synapses to Perception
description: (Enroll in BISC 408 )

name: EE 150 L Engineering Computational Methods
description: Algorithms and computational methods for efficient solution of engineering problems . Introduction to engineering software tools .

name: CSCI 445L Introduction to Robotics
description: Designing , building and programming mobile robots ; sensors , effectors , basic control theory , control architectures , some advanced topics , illustrations of state-of-theart . Teamwork ; final project tested in a robot contest .

name: Advanced Studies of the Nervous System
description: Advanced topics on the structure and function of the nervous system examined from the viewpoint of computational systems science .

name: BME 575L Computational Neuroengineering
description: Introduction to computational modeling in neuroengineering , anchored in examples of brain function . Topics include transduction , synapses , spiking , networks , normalization , learning , Bayesian models , and Kalman filtering .

name: CSCI 561 Foundations of Artificial Intelligence
description: Foundations of symbolic intelligent systems , search , logic , knowledge representation , planning , learning .

name: CSCI 564 Brain Theory and Artificial Intelligence
description: Introduces neural modeling , distributed artificial intelligence and robotics approaches to vision , motor control and memory .

name: CSCI 574 Computer Vision
description: Description and recognition of objects , shape analysis , edge and region segmentation , texture , knowledge based systems , image understanding .

name: CSCI 662 Advanced Natural Language Processing
description: Computational models of natural language . Formalisms for describing structures of human language , and algorithms for learning language structures from data .

name: EE 559 Mathematical Pattern Recognition
description: Distribution free classification , discriminant functions , training algorithms ; statistical classification , parametric and nonparametric techniques ; artificial neural networks .

name: NSCI 524 Advanced Overview of Neurosciences
description: Study of the nervous system at multiple levels through the analysis of four themes : motor control ; emotion , motivation , and decision-making ; memory and learning ; and vision .

name: NSCI 531 Molecular and Cellular Neurobiology
description: Introduces fundamental principles of advanced molecular and cellular neurobiology including proteins and nucleic acids , cell biology of neurons and glia , synaptic transmission and neuronal signaling .

name: NSCI 532 Systems and Behavioral Neurobiology
description: Systems and behavioral neurobiology : hierarchical mechanisms controlling behavior , experimental techniques ; perceptual (visual , auditory , somatosensory) systems ; sensorimotor systems ; motivated behavior ; learning , memory and adaptation .

name: Learning and Cognition
description: IrregularSurvey of learning theory and research , including conditioning and information-processing approaches with human and animal subjects .

name: PSYC 540 Cognitive Neuroscience
description: An examination of the major components of cognition (e .g . , perception , memory , intelligence) in terms of the neural coding characteristic of the relevant brain areas .

name: PSYC 544 Psychophysiology
description: IrregularRecent research on relations between basic psychological states (e .g . , cognition , learning , emotion) and physiological response processes (e .g . , autonomic responses , covert muscle activity) .

name: Neuropsychology
description: IrregularBrain mechanisms underlying perceptual and cognitive functioning : brain damage , loss of function , and clinical assessment .

name: Functional Neuroanatomy
description: IrregularRegional organization and systems of the mammalian nervous system and their functions .

name: Decision Neuroscience
description: Neuroscientific studies attempting to understand the neural basis of judgment and decision-making , social behavior , and market economies .

name: Introduction to Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging
description: The physical and physiological bases of MRI and fMRI . Design and analysis of fMRI experiments . Operation of a magnetic resonance imaging system .

name: BISC 424 Brain Architecture
description: How the parts of the brain are interconnected to form a complex biological computer , from historical , evolutionary , and developmental perspectives .

name: BISC 461 Seminar in Molecular and Computational Biology
description: Topical seminar in molecular and computational biology .

name: BISC 462 Seminar in Neurobiology
description: Topical seminar in neurobiology .

name: Structural Bioinformatics : From Atoms to Cells
description: Introduction to computational and experimental methods for structural bioinformatics . Analysis of macro molecules and their complexes .

name: BISC 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Behavioral Genetics
description: IrregularInheritance and evolution of behavioral characteristics in man and other species .

name: Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
description: Introduction to concepts of randomness and uncertainty : probability , random variables , statistics . Applications to digital communications , signal processing , automatic control , computer engineering and computer science .

name: CSCI 270 Introduction to Algorithms and Theory of Computing
description: Algorithm analysis . Greedy algorithms , divide and conquer , dynamic programming , graph algorithms . NP-completeness and basic recursion theory and undecidability . Sorting lower bounds . Number-theory based cryptography .

name: CSCI 350 Introduction to Operating Systems
description: Basic issues in concurrency , deadlock control , synchronization scheduling , memory management , protection and access control , inter-process communication , and structured design . Laboratory experiences with Unix-like operating system . Duplicates credit in CSCI 402 .

name: CSCI 353 Introduction to Internetworking
description: Global Internet : design principles , layering , protocol design/analysis . Networked applications , Internet structure/architecture , Protocols for transport/congestion control , network layer/routing , link layer/MAC . Network security .

name: EE 457 Computer Systems Organization
description: Register Transfer level machine organization ; performance ; arithmetic ; pipelined processors ; exceptions , out-of-order and speculative execution , cache , virtual memory , multi-core multi-threaded processors , cache coherence .

name: EE 451 Parallel and Distributed Computation
description: Introduction to parallel programming techniques , models and optimization strategies ; Application mapping to multi-core , accelerator , GPU and cloud platforms ; High Performance Computing and Data Science applications .

name: EE 477L MOS VLSI Circuit Design
description: Analysis and design of digital MOS VLSI circuits including area , delay and power minimization . Laboratory assignments including design , layout , extraction , simulation and automatic synthesis .

name: CSCI 401 Capstone : Design and Construction of Large Software Systems
description: Group project with an outside stakeholder to develop real-world software solutions to large-scale problems . Topics include software engineering , professional preparation , and recent computer science research .

name: CSCI 404 Capstone : Creating Your High-Tech Startup
description: Capstone class in which students create their own technology startup , leveraging comprehensive CS knowledge and best industry practices .

name: EE 459Lx Embedded Systems Design Laboratory
description: Specification , design , implementation , testing and documentation of a digital system project using embedded processors , programmable logic , analog I/O interfaces and application specific hardware . Capstone design experience .

name: CSCI 420 Computer Graphics
description: Computer graphics , OpenGL , 2D and 3D transformations , Bézier splines , computer animation , rendering including ray tracing , shading and lighting , artistic rendering , virtual reality , visualization .

name: Computer Systems and Applications Modeling Fundamentals
description: Techniques and tools needed to construct/evaluate models of computer systems and applications . Analytical and simulation methods , capacity planning , performance/reliability evaluation , and decision-making .

name: Cryptography : Secure Communication and Computation
description: Introduction to modern Cryptography ; mathematical/algorithmic studies of methods for protecting information in computer and communication systems : Public-Key Cryptosystems , zero-knowledge proofs , data privacy .

name: CSCI 485 File and Database Management
description: File input/output techniques , basic methods for file organization , file managers , principles of databases , conceptual data models , and query languages .

name: CSCI 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: CSCI 491aL Final Game Project
description: Design , iterative prototyping , and development of a 1st playable level .

name: Special Topics
description: , 3 , 4Selected topics in computer science .

name: EE 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: EE 499 Special Topics
description: Course content will be selected each semester from current developments in the field of electrical engineering .

name: Building the High Tech Startup
description: Teach students the basic technologies and processes involved in building web and mobile startups . Students will be introduced to the different aspects of building a web startup including online business models , Product management , Agile development processes , technology platforms and operations , customer development and online marketing .

name: CSCI 356 Introduction to Computer Systems
description: Computer organization ; entity abstraction and representation ; program execution ; code optimization ; memory usage ; exception handling ; processing control ; computer performance ; hands-on work done in C and assembly .

name: Native Console Multiplayer Game Development
description: Implementation of AAA style multiplayer game running on consoles and DX11 . Console development in native C++ , console SDKs , engine components , gameplay , networking , data prediction/replication .

name: Introduction to Computer and Network Security
description: A broad overview of security threats and defenses , security systems and functionalities , as well as current security practices . Includes homeworks and in-class exercises to provide practical experience working with such systems .

name: EE 450 Introduction to Computer Networks
description: Network architectures ; layered protocols , network service interface ; local networks ; long-haul networks ; internal protocols ; link protocols ; addressing ; routing ; flow control ; higher level protocols .

name: ENGR 395ax Cooperative Education Work Experience
description: Supervised work experience in a professional environment related to a specific degree program , academic level , and career objective . Acceptance into Cooperative Education Program required .

name: ITP 368 Programming Graphical User Interfaces
description: Programming applications with dynamic graphical user interfaces . Topics include events , controls , resources , data bindings , styles , and user experience .

name: ITP 380 Video Game Programming
description: Underlying concepts and principles required for programming video games (topics include vectors , transformations , 3-D math , geometric primitives , matrices) .

name: ITP 435 Professional C++
description: Applications of advanced concepts in C++ including lambda expressions , template metaprogramming , secure coding , parallel programming techniques , and the boost library .

name: ITP 439 Compiler Development
description: Practical applications of techniques used to develop a programming language compiler .

name: ITP 485 Programming Game Engines
description: Techniques for building the core components of a game engine ; 2-D/3-D graphics , collision detection , artificial intelligence algorithms , shading , programming input devices .

name: EE 141L Applied Linear Algebra for Engineering
description: Introduction to linear algebra with engineering applications .

name: CSCI 281 Pipelines for Games and Interactives
description: Explores the aesthetic development/technical implementation necessary to achieve unique , compelling , intuitive visual design in games . Students will develop group visual game design portfolios .

name: CSCI 426 Game Prototyping
description: Developing games or technology based on current and relevant special topics .

name: CTIN 190 Introduction to Interactive Entertainment
description: Critical vocabulary and historical perspectives on interactive entertainment ; students articulate their own ideas , while wrestling with the larger conceptual issues at play within the field .

name: CTIN 484 L Intermediate Game Development
description: Advanced topics in game programming and implementation such as using game engines , creating digital prototypes , player controls and level design .

name: CTIN 488 Game Design Workshop
description: An introduction to making games . Students will explore the principles of game design through the entirely analog creation of card , board and tabletop games .

name: Intermediate Game Design Workshop
description: A follow-up to the introductory game design class , this course will introduce more advanced concepts in game design and game theories , including ideation , digital prototyping and level design .

name: ACCT 410x Foundations of Accounting
description: Non-technical presentation of accounting for users of accounting information ; introduction to financial and managerial accounting . Not open to students with course credits in accounting . Not available for unit or course credit toward a degree in Accounting or Business Administration .

name: Feasibility Analysis
description: Students develop , analyze , and validate entrepreneurial concepts (including marketing , operational , and financial considerations) using customer feedback and risk assessment to conclude worthiness to pursue .

name: BAEP 453 Venture Management
description: Design and application of organization structures and systems in management of new ventures .

name: DSO 431 Foundations of Digital Business Innovation
description: Foundational frameworks for understanding the planning and execution of digitally-enabled strategic initiatives .

name: DSO 433 Business Process Design
description: Analyzing and improving business processes with digital technologies ; use cases ; business case design .

name: DSO 443 The Business of Digital Entertainment
description: IrregularUnderstanding the entertainment and media industries , the effects of the internet , mobile and new information-communication technologies on the business models and management of these industries .

name: DSO 462 Managing a Small Business on the Internet
description: Foundational knowledge for managing a small business on the internet including strategies , tools , and resources integrated with hands-on skills for developing a small business website .

name: MKT 425 Marketing in a Digital World
description: An introduction to the changing world of a connected consumer . Understanding consumer online , social media and mobile behavior using marketing analytics and strategic tools .

name: SPAN 245 Spanish Through Social Issues in Costa Rica
description: (Costa Rica Summer Program only) . Intensive review of Spanish grammar with emphasis on four skills . Audiovisual materials , guest speakers , and readings related to the history and culture of Costa Rica .

name: SPAN 250x Spanish for Business Communication
description: Four-skills language and culture course for intermediate-high Spanish students interested in Business/Communications . Prepares students to communicate in the Spanish-speaking commercial market in a linguistically sensitive manner .

name: SPAN 261 Advanced Spanish : Society and the Media
description: Analysis of cultural issues in the Spanish-speaking world . Discussions , presentations , writing assignments , and grammar instruction designed to improve students’ proficiency in Spanish .

name: SPAN 270 Spanish for Native Speakers
description: For speakers with an advanced level of oral proficiency , but no previous formal study of Spanish . Focus on grammar , spelling and punctuation , reading , and writing .

name: AMST 135gmw Peoples and Cultures of the Americas
description: An introduction to cultures and people in the Americas ; the social , historical , economic and cultural formations that together make up the Latino/a American imaginary .

name: HIST 273g Colonial Latin America
description: Introduction to Colonial Latin America ; native American peoples , themes , issues , and evolution of Spanish and Portuguese colonial rule to ca . 1800 .

name: Afro-Latin Percussion Instruments
description: Instruction in the performance of percussion instruments associated with African , South American , and Caribbean music traditions , with special emphasis on adaptation to jazz music .

name: Modern Latin America
description: Exploration of major themes and events in Latin American history from independence to the present .

name: Aztecs , Mayas , and other Indigenous Peoples of the Americas
description: Introduction to Pre- Columbian Mesoamerica and the Andes , the causes and consequences of the Spanish conquest , and the establishment of colonial societies and economies .

name: Spanish America , 1492–1821
description: Topics in Spanish colonialism in Americas , with a focus on how religious , sexual , and racial differences shaped colonial policies and practices .

name: HIST 374 History of Mexico
description: The native cultures of Meso-America ; colonial government , economy , and society ; independence and 19th century liberalism ; the Mexican revolution , 1910 to 1950 .

name: HIST 451 The Mexican Revolution
description: OtherThe roots , trajectory and outcome of the Mexican revolution of 1910 .

name: The Spanish Inquisition in the Early Modern Hispanic World
description: The Spanish Inquisition in Spain and Colonial Latin America , major theories and interpretations .

name: Religion and Colonial Encounter
description: Survey of religious responses to colonial encounter in the Americas . Emphasis given to study of religious innovations of Amerindians , Africans , and Europeans .

name: SPAN 301 Introduction to Literature and Film
description: Introduction to critical reading and interpretation of poetry , narrative fiction , drama , and film from Spain and Latin America .

name: SPAN 304 The Art of Fiction
description: A survey of Spanish and Latin American fiction from the Middle Ages to the present , acquainting students with various critical and theoretical approaches to narrative . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 306 Performance from Street to Stage
description: A survey of Spanish and Latin American plays from the Middle Ages to the present , acquainting students with various critical and theoretical approaches to drama . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 308 The Art of Poetry
description: A survey of Spanish and Latin American poetry from the Middle Ages to the present , acquainting students with various critical and theoretical approaches to verse . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 372 Modern and Contemporary Latin American Fiction
description: Study of major trends in Latin American fiction from the 1930s to the present with a focus on narrative experimentation .

name: SPAN 380g Literature of Mexico
description: Principal writers and their works from Colonial times to the present . Non-majors may write assignments in English .

name: SPAN 385 The Culture of Food in Hispanic Los Angeles
description: Experiential learning and project-based course designed to familiarize students with the food culture of Hispanic Los Angeles . Students create Spanish language blogs about their experiences .

name: SPAN 462 Literary Cartographies of Latin America and Spain , 1810–1898
description: Comparative analysis of Spanish and Latin American literatures with a focus on trans-Atlantic relations and the rise of such movements as romanticism , realism , and modernismo .

name: SPAN 481 Literature and Popular Culture
description: An examination of popular culture and literary genres with an emphasis on the evolving canons and identities of Latin America and Spain .

name: SPAN 482 Literature and the City
description: An examination of the literary representations of urban spaces and cultures within the context of Iberian , Latin American , and U .S . Latino societies .

name: SPAN 483 Gender and Sexuality
description: An examination of gender , sexuality , and power in Iberian and Latin American literatures and cultures . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 484 Studies in Visual and Material Culture
description: An examination of the role of visual and material culture in cultural and social context in the Hispanic world , focusing on a selected time period and geographical region .

name: Mexico and its Relations with the United States
description: Analysis of Mexico and U .S .-Mexico relations , both historically and in the present day , to understand better the challenges in this key bilateral relationship .

name: The New Triangle : China , the U .S . and Latin America
description: China’s rise in the international political economy raises policy research questions , including an analysis of how this trend relates to U .S and Latin American relations .

name: Trade Politics in the Western Hemisphere
description: Focus on the dynamic process of trade integration that has occurred since the mid-1980s in the Western Hemisphere .

name: Contemporary Issues in Latin American Politics
description: Focus on current politics in Latin America . Address a range of themes : electoral democracy , citizenship , political inclusion , human rights , corruption , economic inequality .

name: Politics of Latin America
