description: Theories of development and nation-building ; revolutionary and evolutionary modernization ; role of history , culture , socioeconomic conditions in affecting political structures and functions .

name: Political Economy of Mexico
description: Examination of contemporary Mexico : the role of the state in the Mexican economy ; development of the government party and opposition groups .

name: Political Economy of Central America
description: Focus on economic , social , and political structures and processes in the region and in specific countries , especially Guatemala , El Salvador , and Nicaragua .

name: SPAN 320 Politics , Thought , Society
description: Introduction to the study of Iberian and Latin American cultural patterns through readings on such topics as history , gender , ethnicity , and politics . Conducted in Spanish .

name: Arts of the Ancient Andes
description: Survey of the art and architecture of the ancient cultures of the Andes in South America .

name: Colonial Latin American Art
description: A survey of the art , architecture , and visual culture of colonial Latin America , focusing on connections to culture and society .

name: Studies in Colonial Latin American Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within colonial Latin American art .

name: JOUR 465m Latino News Media in the United States
description: History and growing importance of Latino print and broadcast news media in covering immigration , discrimination , culture , social differences and other aspects of U .S . Latino life .

name: SPAN 302 Screen Cultures : From Film to the Internet
description: A survey of Spanish and Latin American cinema from the silent film era to the present , acquainting students with various critical and theoretical approaches to cinema studies . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 321 Sounds , Images , Objects
description: Introduction to the study of Iberian and Latin American cultural forms through readings on the visual arts , cinema , architecture , and music . Conducted in Spanish .

name: SPAN 466 Argentina , Society and the Arts
description: Study of the arts in the cultural landscape of Argentina and in the context of developments in Europe , Latin America and the United States .

name: From The Border to Broadway
description: An investigation of the role that Latina/o plays and performances have played in creating and documenting a contemporary American experience of the theatre .

name: The Impact of Remittances on Development in Mexico
description: Examines the nature of remittances and their effects . Can remittances promote development? Explores policy making focused on improving the quality of remittance expenditures in Mexico .

name: DANC 101 Colloquium : What is the Medium of Dance Today?
description: Topics related to dance techniques , repertory and varied art forms . Aimed at the interdisciplinary expansion of dance literacy and connections to allied art forms .

name: DANC 103 Conditioning for Dancers
description: Designed for the specific needs of the dancer in preparation for professional training , combining somatic work with the foundation of scientific principles .

name: DANC 105 Dance Science : Analysis of Dance Movement
description: A broad overview of the scientific principles of exercise physiology , functional anatomy , kinesiology , and bio-mechanics with applications to dance .

name: DANC 107 World Perspective on Dance Performance
description: The practice and aesthetics of international dance styles through lecture and participant-driven interaction .

name: DANC 110 Dance Technique I
description: Fundamental technique studies in a studio setting . Concentration on classical ballet , hip hop and its derivatives , partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers’ development . Placement audition required .

name: DANC 120 Repertory and Performance I
description: Study and guided practice of traditional and contemporary choreographic repertory . Emphasis in choreographic intention , stylistic approaches and performance technique .

name: DANC 130 Improvisation and Composition I : Introduction
description: An introduction to improvisational and composition skills that start to prepare students for the creative processes of dancing , dancemaking and performance .

name: DANC 131 Improvisation and Composition II : Introduction
description: Continued investigation and introduction to improvisational and compositional skills in preparation for the creative processes of dancing , dance-making and performance .

name: DANC 201 Colloquium : History of Performance and Cultural Context
description: Study of the historical and cultural context of selected dance techniques . Guest lectures and student presentations will inform class discussions .

name: DANC 210 Dance Technique II
description: Intermediate technique studies in a studio setting . Concentration on classical ballet , hip hop and its derivatives , partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers’ development .

name: DANC 218 Introduction to Dance for the Camera : New Media and Editing
description: Effective navigation and utilization of ubiquitous , portable digital technologies in film to create an individualized archive and portfolio of their choreographic projects and performances .

name: DANC 220 Repertory and Performance II
description: Continued studies and guided practice of choreographic repertory . Investigation of choreographic vocabulary , intention , stylistic approaches , and performance technique for group work .

name: DANC 230 Improvisation and Composition III : Intermediate
description: Expansion of improvisation and composition skills for the creative processes of dancing , dance-making and performance .

name: DANC 231 Improvisation and Composition IV : Intermediate
description: Further development of improvisation and composition skills for the creative processes of dancing , dance-making and performance .

name: Music for Dancers
description: Practical understanding and perception of music coupled with the ability to follow a score and understand the work in relation to dance .

name: DANC 301 Colloquium : The Role of the Dance Artist in Society
description: Examination of the role of the artist in society . Development of an individual understanding and guiding philosophy for professional development in the dance field .

name: DANC 310 Dance Technique III
description: Advanced technique studies in a studio setting . Concentration on classical ballet , hip hop and its derivatives , partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers’ development .

name: DANC 320 Repertory and Performance III
description: Study and guided practice of new works and developing roles . Emphasis on the dancer as collaborator in the creative process .

name: DANC 342g International and Historical Perspectives on Dance
description: Exploration of dance as an art form in its artistic , political , and socio-cultural climate . Studies of the continuum of dance within its historical context .

name: Dance Leadership
description: Preparation for leadership in the dance world including structuring companies , marketing choreography , obtaining financing as a dance-maker , collaborating dance initiatives , and leading in dance education .

name: DANC 480 Advanced Performance Studies : Senior Seminar
description: Seminar and studio course in preparation of the senior project to be presented in spring semester , in performance , choreography , scholarship or entrepreneurship .

name: DANC 485 Advanced Performance Studies : Senior Project
description: Development and presentation of senior project in performance , choreography , media , music , scholarship or entrepreneurial enterprise . Senior projects presented to faculty panel in open performance venue .

name: DANC 410 Dance Technique IV
description: Pre-professional technique studies in a studio setting with concentration on classical ballet , hip hop and its derivatives , and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers’ development .

name: DANC 420 Repertory and Performance IV
description: Study and guided practice of significant roles in new and existing choreography . Emphasis on refinement of partnering , solo and group performance technique .

name: DANC 285 Elements of Dance Production
description: Theoretical aspects of creativity , choreography , accompaniment , dance notation , and production ; application in individual and group composition .

name: DANC 305 Dance and New Media
description: An introduction to existing and emerging technologies used in creating and delivering dance works .

name: DANC 312gw African American Dance
description: Exploration of the discursive foundations , political motivations , and aesthetic strategies of dance writers and artists whose works have enabled the category of “black dance .”

name: DANC 330 Composition I : Advanced
description: Intermediate and advanced compositional systems for generating and modifying movement .

name: DANC 333g Origins of Jazz Dance
description: Examining the role that vernacular dance and music play in the creation of Jazz Dance , taught in lecture format ; practical studies in Jazz Dance , from recreational to professional settings .

name: DANC 345 Artist in Residence
description: Investigation and development of choreographic methods and practices through observation and active participation with the guest artist .

name: DANC 347 Artist Collaborative
description: Development of an artistic work of two or more media , working with colleagues and or faculty in allied disciplines .

name: DANC 355 Performance Lab
description: Intermediate and advanced solo and partnering techniques in classical , contemporary , and street dance .

name: DANC 362 Pilates Mat Training
description: Mat exercises designed to promote healthy movement practices , develop strength , balance , flexibility and coordination .

name: DANC 363g Dancing on the Screen
description: The study of dance in movies , television , internet , mobile devices and new media . Examining dance on screen , influenced by storytelling , camera technology and editing .

name: DANC 430 Composition II : Upper Level
description: Complex strategies for creating and analyzing choreographic composition , as well as processing and composing embodied information in real-time at the upper level .

name: Creativity , Culture , Commerce and Community
description: Exploration of artistic entrepreneurial mechanisms to initiate innovative endeavors in the professional dance world which are relevant to today’s culture , communities , customs , and business landscape .

name: DANC 442 International and Historical Perspectives on Dance II
description: Exploration of dance as an art form in its artistic , political , and socio-cultural climate . Studies of the continuum of dance within its historical context .

name: Dancing with Words
description: Development of descriptive and analytical skills for dance writing (journalism , education , scholarship , audience development , marketing) and refinement of social-media expertise to connect with relevant audiences .

name: DANC 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: DANC 495 Dance Internship
description: Practical experience linked with information and learned skills . Providing supervised field application of dance theories and practices within an employment context in dance .

name: DANC 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics of current interest .

name: DES 102 Design Fundamentals
description: Introduction to the basic elements and processes of visual communication and design . Instruction includes studio projects , lectures and readings . Various media used .

name: DES 202 Design II
description: Exploration of essential elements of traditional and digital design , including color and image-text integration , editing information , typography and sequencing .

name: DES 203 Digital Tools for Design
description: Exploration of the processes of germination , ideation and application/execution in design integrated with computer usage .

name: DES 213 Digital Tools in 3D Design
description: 3D digital modeling , rendering , digital capture and production methods for product , package and environmental design .

name: DES 230 3D Design : Materials and Tools
description: Introduction to the study of 3-D Design . Includes a wide investigation of materials , tools , and techniques specific to dimensional design as they apply to package , product , and environmental design .

name: DES 302 Design III
description: Advanced exploration of typography and image-text integration , including collaborative projects , pre-press and proofing techniques , narrative concepts and information architecture .

name: DES 303 Web Design
description: A workshop-based course that focuses on software applications in design and web design .

name: DES 322 Publication Design
description: Application of layout , typography , design principles and image making in the design and production of books , magazines , zines and digital books .

name: DES 323g Design Theory
description: A comprehensive study of visual communication focusing on graphic design from 1900 to the present . An introduction to design thinking , language and principles including political and cultural implications .

name: DES 332a Typography
description: The study of visual communication through the use of letterforms from historical tradition to contemporary experimental rebellion .

name: DES 402 Advanced Design Projects
description: Advanced information design within a flexible curriculum . Emphasis on team-oriented projects .

name: DES 413 Professional Practice in Design
description: A summation of one’s practice , with a focus on transitioning to a career as a professional designer .

name: DES 419 Professional Internship in the Arts
description: (Enroll in ART 419 )

name: DES 432 Special Projects in Design
description: Students work on projects for outside clients , and receive instruction in professional practices , advanced design techniques , and sophisticated technology . By invitation or portfolio review only . Only open to upper division students .

name: DES 494a Senior Thesis
description: Research and writing of a senior-level thesis or thesis project under the supervision of a faculty committee .

name: GEOL 315 L Minerals and Earth Systems
description: Minerals and their formation in Earth geosystems ; includes discussions of mineral properties , crystal structures , uses and bio geochemical importance .

name: EALC 110gp East Asian Humanities : The Great Tradition
description: Introduction to the major humanities traditions of China , Japan , and Korea through an examination of representative works drawn from literature , aesthetics , philosophy , religion , and historical writing .

name: EALC 125g Introduction to Contemporary East Asian Cinema and Culture
description: An introduction to and overview of the contemporary cinemas of East Asia : China (Hong Kong , the People’s Republic , and Taiwan) , Japan , and Korea .

name: EALC 130gp Introduction to East Asian Ethical Thought
description: Introduction to the history of Chinese , Japanese , and Korean ethical thought ; perspectives on human nature , historical writing , religious options , and aesthetic implications . Conducted in English .

name: EALC 150gw Global Chinese Cinema and Cultural Studies
description: Examination of the transnational production and circulation of Chinese-language cinema . Analysis of the larger sociocultural significance of films by engaging their historical context .

name: EALC 333g Introduction to Korean Film
description: Survey of Korean film , the film industry , and critical issues from the colonial period to the present .

name: EALC 340gp Japanese Civilization
description: Survey of the main characteristics and development of art , literature , philosophy , religion , political and social institutions through different periods . Conducted in English .

name: EALC 342gp Japanese Literature and Culture
description: Japanese literature from the earliest times to the present ; development of prose , poetry and the novel ; evolution of theatre ; Japanese literature under Western influence . Conducted in English .

name: EALC 344gp Korean Culture from Ancient to Modern Times
description: The history of Korean literature and culture from the ancient to the modern era .

name: EALC 350gp Chinese Civilization
description: Characteristics and aspects of Chinese civilization ; interpretation of philosophy , literature , religion , art , music . Conducted in English .

name: Advanced Modern Chinese II
description: Continuation of EALC 304  ; composition exercises in different styles of writing .

name: Advanced Korean II
description: Continuation of EALC 315  , with emphasis on the use of Chinese characters , translation , and composition exercises .

name: Advanced Japanese II
description: Continuation of EALC 320  . Improve and strengthen abilities to speak , listen , read and write , coping with more involved materials and situation .

name: Modern Korean Literature in Translation
description: Introduction to Korean literature , with discussion of critical approaches to literary discourse , historical contexts of literary production , and aspects of contemporary popular culture .

name: EALC 346g Hallyu , the Korean Wave
description: Critical overview of the Korean Wave (Hallyu) , the phenomenon defined as the growing , global circulation and consumption of Korean popular culture .

name: EALC 358g Transnational Chinese Literature and Culture
description: An introduction to Sinophone literatures and cultures (in English translation) from the Asia-Pacific region , including Taiwan , Hong Kong , Tibet , Southeast Asia , and North America .

name: EALC 360g Performing Japan : Bodies , Media , and Textuality
description: The classical foundations of Japanese performance , including noh , puppet theater , and kabuki ; exploration of how these genres are implicated in modern and contemporary Japanese performance .

name: EALC 374 Language and Society in East Asia
description: The interaction of language with society in countries of East Asia : language and identity , the politicization of language , language change , language and gender .

name: EALC 375 Women and Gender in China : Past and Present
description: An examination of changes in sex roles and in constructs of the female as influenced by traditional Chinese thought and later social developments .

name: Early Japanese Art
description: (Enroll in AHIS 386 )

name: Classical Japanese
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of classical grammar ; readings from various classical works , both poetry and prose ; translation practice .

name: Nature and the Ecological Imagination in Japanese Literature
description: Examination of cultural perceptions about nature and how they affect attitudes toward the environment : includes comparisons to Euro-American as well as other East Asian traditions .

name: EALC 430 Gender and Sexuality in Korean Literature and Culture
description: Examination of the changing representations of gender and sexuality in Korean cultural texts over the course of the 20th century .

name: Contemporary Japanese Literature and Global Modernity
description: Examination of historical currents in contemporary Japanese literature and popular culture and the role translation plays in their global circulation and redefinition .

name: Japanese Fiction
description: Japanese fiction from early to modern times ; literary , philosophical , and social aspects of tales and novels . Conducted in English .

name: Topics in Korean Visual and Cultural Studies
description: Examination of dominant and emergent critical issues in the study of modern and contemporary Korean visual culture .

name: Introduction to East Asian Linguistics
description: Survey of the sound systems , writing systems , grammatical systems , historical development , and social environments of the Chinese , Japanese , and Korean languages .

name: EALC 499 Special Topics
description: Instruction Mode : Lecture Grading Option : Letter

name: EALC 366 Chinese Professional Internship : Communication and Culture
description: Combined classroom discussion and supervised internship at companies . Practical experience in applying communication and cultural knowledge in a professional , “real world” employment context .

name: Advanced Modern Chinese III
description: Readings in modern Chinese literary , documentary , and epistolary styles ; stylistic and syntactic analysis ; composition ; translation .

name: Advanced Modern Chinese IV
description: Continuation of EALC 404  .

name: EALC 407 News and Web Chinese
description: Reading selections from newspaper articles and online reports to further develop proficiency in advanced Chinese and understanding of the society and culture .

name: Business Chinese
description: Practice in the basic vocabulary and idioms of foreign trade and other commercial transactions in Mandarin .

name: EALC 413 Business Japanese
description: Practical advanced level Japanese business terms and their usage in a variety of business situations ; cultural insights on Japanese customs that underline business transactions in Japan .

name: Korean Writing in Mixed Script
description: Selected readings in Korean texts written in mixed script ; a systematic study of Chinese characters and translation of text .

name: Newspaper and Documentary Korean
description: Selected readings from newspapers , magazines , and other journalistic publications ; analysis of styles and practice in writing articles .

name: Advanced Japanese III
description: Students develop advanced levels of Japanese linguistic knowledge and communication skills through speaking , listening , reading and writing activities using authentic Japanese texts and discourse .

name: Advanced Japanese IV
description: Continuation of EALC 422  . Students continue to improve their Japanese language competence in the course of acquiring Japanese pragmatic skills and cultural knowledge .

name: CHEM 203Lgx AIDS Drug Discovery and Development
description: Scientific principles underlying molecular approaches to diagnosis and treatment of diseases , using specific models within a societal (business , legal , ethical) context .

name: CHEM 350g Molecular Principles of Biochemistry
description: Biomolecular structures , protein and nucleic acid chemistry and functions , carbohydrates , lipids , membranes , enzyme catalysis and kinetics , coenzymes , biochemical signaling , major metabolic pathways , control of gene expression , replication , transcription , and translation .

name: EE 105 Introduction to Electrical Engineering
description: Electrical engineering overview : communications , computers , circuits , components , signals , electromagnetics , microelectronics ; data encoding and compression , USPS and UPC product codes , DVDs , semiconductor devices , and integrated circuits .

name: EE 155L Introduction to Computer Programming for Electrical Engineers
description: Introduction to solving engineering problems using computational methods . Survey of various programming languages and their strengths and weaknesses . Program structure , input/output , conditionals , loops , functions , arrays .

name: EE 250L Distributed Systems for the Internet of Things
description: Introduction to hardware , operating systems , signal processing and control , network protocols , mobile applications , databases , cloud computing , machine learning , and security for the Internet of Things .

name: EE 301 L Linear Systems
description: Representation and analysis of linear time-invariant systems primarily for the continuous time case . Convolution , Fourier series and transform , Laplace transform , controls and communications applications .

name: Electromagnetics I
description: Basic static and dynamic electromagnetic field theory and applications ; electrostatics , magnetostatics , Maxwell’s equations , energy flow , plane waves incident on planar boundaries , transmission lines .

name: EE 355x Software Design for Electrical Engineers
description: Object-oriented programming techniques , basic data structures , and elementary complexity analysis for the modeling , simulation , and solution of engineering problems .

name: EE 422 x Electromagnetic Systems Design
description: Applied electromagnetics for large- and small-scale electromechanical systems . Comprehensive design project . Capstone design experience .

name: EE 423Lx Loudspeaker and Sound-System Design
description: Project-based design of loudspeaker transducers , filters , and enclosures . Measurement of transfer functions , acoustical performance , distortion , Thiele-Small parameters , and power handling . Listening evaluations . Capstone design experience .

name: EE 434 Lx Digital Signal Processing Design Laboratory
description: Experiments and design project in digital signal processing (e .g . , real-time DSP , acoustics , video) including : systems specification , preliminary analysis , trade-off studies , implementation , presentation . Capstone design experience .

name: EE 447 Lx Mixed Signal Electronic Circuits
description: Application of solid-state electronic devices to the design of linear and mixed-signal systems . Laboratory experiments and projects involving the design of electronic hardware . Capstone design experience .

name: EE 484 x Communication System Design
description: Design and analysis of analog and digital communication systems . System models , requirements , development , performance analysis and component selection techniques . Comprehensive system design project . Capstone design experience .

name: EE 494a Undergraduate Thesis
description: For the undergraduate degree . Credit on acceptance of thesis .  IP (EE 494a) or letter grade (EE 494b) .

name: ENGL 261g English Literature to 1800
description: Intensive reading of major writers to 1800 .

name: ENGL 262g English Literature since 1800
description: Intensive reading of major writers , 1800–1950 .

name: Introduction to Environmental Engineering
description: Basic concepts of environmental engineering . Air , water , and soil pollution control technologies ; pollution prevention strategies . Design of simple water distribution and treatment systems .

name: ENE 410 Environmental Fluid Mechanics
description: Equation of motion ; continuity , momentum , energy principles ; dimensional analysis , similitudes ; groundwater flows ; transports in conduits and channels ; mixing , dispersion in environments ; manifold diffusers ; hydraulic transients .

name: Water Treatment Design
description: Predesign studies , precipitation softening , coagulation and flocculation , sedimentation , filtration , sludge handling , chlorination , chloramination , ozonation ; plant hydraulics , flow measurement , pumps , instrumentation and control , tertiary treatment .

name: Economics for Natural Resources and the Environment
description: An introduction to the economic tools and issues that affect natural resource use and environmental management .

name: Senior Seminar in Environmental Studies
description: Students form multidisciplinary teams and are asked to study and resolve a major environmental problem facing a particular region or target population .

name: HP 340L Health Behavior Statistical Methods
description: Intermediate statistics for health behavior studies ; topics include descriptive statistics , hypothesis testing , correlation and regression , and use of computer software in data analysis .

name: Environmental Health in the Community
description: Survey of occupational and environmental health . Introduction to epidemiology , exposure assessment , toxicology , policy development , risk assessment , and effects of urban development on health .

name: ENST 335 Science , Health and the Environment
description: Exploration of environmentally transmitted human diseases ; understanding the human/pathogen/environment nexus that leads to disease in human populations ; disease transmission reduction .

name: BISC 103Lgx General Biology for the Environment and Life
description: Study of common skills in biology , including basics of evolution , systematics , ecology , genetics , biochemistry and molecular biology , physiology , and anatomy .

name: GEOL 160Lg Introduction to Geosystems
description: Survey of natural geological/ environmental processes (systems) and variability active near the earth’s surface in the region that houses most life (the biosphere) .

name: POSC 270 Introduction to Environmental Law and Politics
description: Overview of environmental policy , law and politics at the international , domestic and local levels . Social science gateway to the environmental studies major .

name: ENST 344 Environmental Ethics
description: Explores issues concerning behavior of humans towards the nonhuman world . Examines a wide spectrum of ethical issues .

name: Global Climate Change : Policy and Society
description: Examines climate change policy at the international , national , state , and local levels , and explores the role civil society plays in climate change politics .

name: ENST 445 Earth Climate : Past , Present , and Future
description: Examination of the tools used to reconstruct past climate change and a thorough discussion of past climate changes on earth with an emphasis on the recent past .

name: Integrated Ecosystem Management in Micronesia
description: Field studies in ecosystem management tools used to investigate complex environmental problems in Micronesia . Historical , cultural , and scientific topics , direct observations of biological , physical , and chemical conditions .

name: ENST 492 Directed Environmental Policy and Science Internship
description: Provides opportunities for professional development in environmental policy and science and prepares students for career or graduate school in environmental-related fields . Students are placed in internships and guided before and during the internship period . Students gain practical experience and learn how government and nongovernmental organizations pursue and implement environmental policy and science work .

name: GEOL 470L Environmental Hydrogeology
description: Concepts in hydrogeology and application to environmental problems . Topics include groundwater and surface water hydrology , chemistry , and contamination . Includes labs , guest lectures , and field trips .

name: BISC 427 The Global Environment
description: Earth’s development as a habitable planet , from origin to human impacts on global biogeochemical cycles in the ocean , land , atmosphere . Discussion of environmental alternatives . Open only to biological sciences , environmental sciences , and earth sciences majors .

name: GEOL 425 L Data Analysis in the Earth and Environmental Sciences
description: Introduction to mathematical methods giving insight into earth and environmental data . Topics include probability and statistics , timeseries analysis , spectral analysis , inverse theory , interpolation .

name: GEOL 450 L Geosystems
description: Geosystems , such as mantle convection , active faults , climate , and the carbon cycle , will be studied using numerical models and concepts such as chaos , universality , emergence , and intermittency .

name: POSC 436 Environmental Politics
description: The political realities of selected environmental issues ; resolving and implementing social priorities ; interests , attitudes , strategies , and tactics of pressure groups ; institutional biases and opportunities .

name: Environmental Impact Assessment
description: Exploration of the role of the National Environmental Policy Act and the California Environmental Policy Act ; study of environmental impact assessments including the regulatory aspects , stakeholder and participatory processes , and legal framework .

name: Public Policy and Law
description: Institutional foundations and analysis of public policy issues ; policy formulation and implementation ; application of theories ; case analyses .

name: Analytic Foundations for Public Policy
description: Qualitative methods of analysis ; ethical and political implications of policy choices ; issue diagnosis and policy design skills ; critical reasoning and ethics ; policy leadership .

name: PPD 353 Philanthropy and Social Change
description: History , theories , philosophies , and practices of philanthropy ; relationship between philanthropy and nonprofit world ; grant-making procedures and relation to social innovation .

name: PPD 382 International Development
description: Definitions and measurements of development ; impact of globalization ; concept and practice of international and development administration and planning at local , national , and global governance levels .

name: Comparative Urban Development
description: Urbanization and urban development and growth through an international scope ; globalizing cities .

name: PPD 427 L Geographic Information Systems and Planning Applications
description: Basic GIS concepts , ArcView and other GIS software , planning applications and databases , basic cartography ; students select , research and prepare a planning GIS analysis project .

name: PPD 478 Social Innovation
description: Strategies and processes of social innovation and change ; examination of social change in the market , government , and within the nonprofit sector ; dynamics ; civic action and activism .

name: BISC 352 Conservation Biology
description: Principles of conservation science in marine and terrestrial ecosystems with emphasis on protecting biological diversity and balancing the needs of nature with those of humans .

name: ENST 310 Sustainable Fisheries Management
description: Examination of scientific , social , political , and economic factors of fisheries management , engaging students in key issues of coastal and marine sustainability .

name: Marine and Coastal Environmental Policy
description: Survey of major environmental policies both international and domestic as they relate to fisheries , shipping , pollution , seaports and coastal management .

name: BISC 315 L Introduction to Ecology
description: Organism-environment interactions ; dynamics of populations , communities , and ecosystems ; evolutionary forces .

name: BISC 447 L Island Biogeography and Field Ecology
description: Biogeography , geology , ecology , climate , flora , and fauna of terrestrial and marine environments of Catalina and the Channel Islands including laboratory and field techniques of ecology . Taught on Catalina Island .

name: BISC 469L Marine Biology
description: Oceanography and marine biology , sampling techniques , evolutionary adaptations , morphology , systematics .

name: MOR 466 Business and Environmental Sustainability
description: Focuses on how businesses both contribute to and can help address environmental sustainability challenges and the role of the broader political-economy in shaping that interaction .

name: GEOG 360 Environmental Disasters
description: Evaluates the causes , effects , and responses to international environmental disasters . Emphasis is on contemporary case studies in a theoretical context .

name: Ecological Security and Global Politics
description: Should environmental issues be treated as threats to security? Survey of recent literature explores global environmental politics using a security framework .

name: ART 494a Senior Thesis
description: Individual research under guidance of faculty member for senior-level BFA students , leading to a substantial paper or other project .

name: French IV
description: Introduction to French literature through the study of texts and audiovisuals organized around a central theme ; develops close-reading techniques and discursive skills ; reviews French grammar .

name: French Grammar and Composition
description: Grammatical structure and vocabulary building with practical application to written composition .

name: Critical Writing in French
description: Advanced composition through critical reading of literary texts ; comprehensive analysis of difficult grammatical structures and stylistics .

name: Media French
description: Analysis of French media . Practice in sustained conversation . Emphasis on spoken sentence patterns .

name: FREN 320g The French New Wave and its Legacy
description: Film-making in France from the earliest experiments to current trends . Emphasis on the political , social , historical context of French films . Taught in English . Reading knowledge of French recommended .

name: FREN 347 Race , Gender and Power in Francophone Literature
description: Study of post-colonialism as a ferment for literary creation in the literature of French expression from Africa , the Caribbean and Canada . Conducted in French .

name: Introduction to Research in French and Francophone Cultures
description: Introduction to research methods through the study of a specific topic in French and/or Francophone literature and culture .

name: Business and Technical French
description: ecific vocabulary and formulae used in international commerce . Attention given to developing vocabulary and standard forms appropriate to individual career objectives .

name: FREN 370gm Equality and Difference around the Enlightenment
description: 18th - and 20th century debates around the idea of equality and the notion of difference . Relevance of the Enlightenment to contemporary discussions of identity , citizenship , and human rights . Conducted in English .

name: FREN 373g Remembering Loss , Writing Memory
description: An exploration into how genocides and episodes of mass violence have been thought about , remembered and expressed in France and the Francophone world . Conducted in English .

name: FREN 375gmw Global Narratives of Illness and Disability
description: Study of difference as represented through French , Francophone and related narratives of disability and illness , with attention to race and gender . Conducted in English .

name: Paris Avant-Gardes
description: Exploration of experimental artistic collaborations between poets , novelists , art critics and artists of the Paris Avant-gardes in 19th and 20th century . Taught in French . Paris Semester .

name: FREN 383 French Women Writers
description: Major figures and their roles in French society and contributions to French literature . Conducted in French .

name: FREN 392 Seminar in Literary and Cultural Studies
description: Selected topics in French and Francophone literature and culture . Conducted in French .

name: Seminar in French Thought and Theory
description: Introduction to important trends in recent French philosophy , political and social theory , psychoanalysis , ethnology , semiotics , and media studies . Emphasis to be determined by department . Conducted in English .

name: FREN 401 Studies in Early Modernity
description: Study and analysis of representative works and major intellectual , cultural , and artistic trends from the early modern period (pre-1789) .

name: FREN 402 Studies in Modernity
description: Study and analysis of representative works and major intellectual , cultural , and artistic trends from the modern period (post-1789) .

name: FREN 403 Studies in Colonialism and Postcolonialism
description: Study and analysis of colonialism and postcolonialism in French and Francophone contexts .

name: Studies in an Author
description: Close readings in works of a single influential French or Francophone author . Focused study of style , creative developments , historical context . Conducted in French .

name: Actualités Françaises
description: Present day French life through readings in French periodicals and viewing of French films and art exhibits . Non-majors prepare assignments in English . Conducted in French . Spring semester in Paris only .

name: French Theatre
description: (Paris Semester only) A survey of French theatre from the 17th century to the present . Students read plays ranging from classical comedy and tragedy to modern movements . Live theatre performances will supplement class work . Taught in French .

name: FREN 445 Studies in Gender , Feminism and Sexuality
description: Major feminist thinkers and writers viewed from the perspective of the evolution of gender and sexuality in contemporary France . Conducted in French .

name: FREN 446 Contemporary French Thought
description: Readings in structuralism , post-structuralism , feminism , and deconstruction . Conducted in French .

name: FREN 448m France and Islam
description: Historical and theoretical analyses of the complex history of Western perceptions of Islam , focusing on France . Taught in French .

name: Studies in French Civilization
description: (Paris Semester only) An analysis of the prestige of Paris , past and present , based upon close examination of literary texts and graphic materials , and visits to sites and monuments .

name: FREN 464 Colloquium : French Civilization
description: Selected topics such as the press , educational institutions , French cinema today , and French colonial history . Conducted in French .

name: FREN 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: FREN 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics in French .

name: SWMS 210gmw Social Analysis of Gender
description: Multidisciplinary survey of gender assumptions in relation to sexuality , mental health , social and political relations , and artistic expression .

name: SWMS 212gp Studies in Gender and Sexuality : An Introduction
description: Examination of how gender and sexuality have been constructed , experienced , and legislated .

name: SWMS 215gp Gender Conflict across Cultural Contexts
description: Identification and examination of social and cultural conflicts through the lens of gender , and comparison of such conflicts across cultures , regions , and historical periods .

name: SWMS 301gm Feminist Theory : An Introduction
description: Theories of feminism ; historical , social and cultural perspectives of the women’s movement in America , Europe , and in developing countries ; men’s roles in the feminist movement .

name: Gender Studies and the Community : Internship
description: A combination of internships in the community and an intensive seminar on the relationship of the students in the academic community with the larger urban community of which it is a part .

name: Senior Seminar in Gender Studies
description: Study of a selected problem , period , or theme in the study of women and men in society by integrating perspectives from cross-cultural and interdisciplinary studies .

name: ECON 203g Principles of Microeconomics
description: Behavior of firms and consumers , functions of the price system , competition and monopoly , labor markets , poverty , government regulation , international trade , and the environment .

name: MATH 114x Foundations of Statistics
description: An introduction to the basic tools of statistics . Descriptive statistics ; probability ; expected value ; normal approximation sampling ; chance models ; tests of significance .

name: Visualizing and Experiencing the Built Environment
description: Methods for direct observation and recording of the directly experienced built environment through drawing , diagramming , photographing , and writing . Course includes exercises and field experience .

name: Principles of Spatial Design I
description: Introduction to design principles and processes ; sequence of exercises emphasizing development of basic skills , ideas , and techniques used in the creation of simplified urban space design projects .

name: Principles of Spatial Design II
description: Emphasis on developing advanced urban spatial design solutions set within contemporary urban conditions , with a particular emphasis on ecology , public space , neighborhoods and districts .

name: Urban Planning and Development
description: Gateway to BS , Public Policy , Management and Planning and minor in Planning and Development . City building and development process ; who plans , politics of planning and development ; major topics include land use , fiscal policy , transportation , sustainability , and economic development .

name: RED 417 History of Planning and Development
description: Historical evolution of planning and development . How changing modes of planning and development have shaped the built landscape throughout the century .

name: RED 425 Designing Livable Communities
description: Theories and concepts of livable communities and good city form ; case studies of historical and current best practices ; field visits ; collaborative design project .

name: SOCI 314Lg Analyzing Social Statistics
description: Sociological measurement , univariate description , elementary correlation , introduction to statistical inference .

name: SSCI 201 Principles of GeoDesign
description: Foundations of geodesign combining place-making , design , collective action , and the science of location-based information to improve human interaction with the functioning of the Earth .

name: SSCI 412L GeoDesign Practicum
description: Application of design concepts , planning protocols and spatial analysis skills to a complex planning or design problem sponsored by a local public , private or not-for-profit client in a studio setting .

name: ARCH 306m Shelter
description: Investigation of issues , processes , and roles of individuals , groups and communities in relation to present and future shelter needs and aspirations .

name: ARCH 447 Ecological Factors in Design
description: Lectures , laboratory exercises and field trips introduce basic knowledge of incorporating ecological factors in urban design and interaction of landscape science with the human environment .

name: Politics of Global Environment
description: (Enroll in IR 323 )

name: Conservation of Natural Resources
description: (Enroll in GEOG 345 )

name: Cities and Regions in World Politics
description: Cities and the rise of states ; globalization and localization ; federalism and decentralization ; comparative politics of urban regions in developed and developing countries .

name: PPD 361 Sustainable Communities , Policy and Planning
description: Policy and planning as shaped by sustainability theories ; sustainability indicators ; topics include water resources , air quality , land use regulations , environmental design , carrying capacity , ecological footprint analysis .

name: PPD 360 Urban Transportation Planning and Policy
description: Current transportation planning and policy critiques . Transportation planning ; the relationship to urban structure ; conventional and para-transit modes ; analysis of local plans .

name: Society and Population
description: World population trends and their consequences : determinants of fertility , mortality , and migration ; development of elementary models of population change .

name: SSCI 214g Human Populations and Natural Hazards
description: Introduction to the complex relationship between human development and natural hazards , which are increasingly causing damage and displacement to human populations throughout the world .

name: SSCI 350 International GeoDesign
description: Intensive living-learning research and field experience in Los Angeles and abroad ; application of GeoDesign strategies to local societal challenges .

name: Digital Tools for Architecture
description: Exploration of digital tools with an emphasis on building information modeling (BIM) , parametric modeling , and interoperability including special topics in Architecture/Engineering/Construction (AEC) and sustainable design .

name: HIST 393g Quantitative Historical Analysis
description: Reading and doing quantitative research with historical data . Covers research designs , appropriate statistical analysis , and software packages for the use of historians .

name: POSC 265gw Environmental Challenges
description: Examination of the challenges of environmental problem-solving at the personal , local , national and global scales , focused on the issue of climate change .

name: PPD 306 Visual Methods in Policy , Management , Planning and Development
description: Introduction to graphic design , photodocumentation , and geographic information systems as employed in planning , policy , and development . Visual explanations . Computer and by-hand applications .

name: SSCI 135Lg Maps in the Digital World
description: The role of formal reasoning , abstract representation and empirical analysis in building maps for sharing knowledge across the physical , life and social sciences and humanities .

name: GEOL 105Lg Planet Earth
description: Geologic structure and evolution of planet earth . Principles of plate tectonics , rocks and minerals , processes of mountain building , continent and ocean formation , earthquakes , volcanism , development of landforms by running water and glaciers .

name: GEOL 107Lg Oceanography
description: Physical , chemical , and geological character of the oceans and ocean basins . Origin of the oceans . Ocean processes and agents . Economic value of the oceans .

name: GEOL 108Lg Crises of a Planet
description: Impact of civilization on planet earth , and impact of earth’s natural evolution on society : earthquakes , volcanism , landslides , floods , global warming , acid rain , groundwater depletion and pollution ; mineral and fossil fuel depletion , formation of the ozone hole .

name: GEOL 125Lg Earth History : A Planet and Its Evolution
description: Basic principles of physics , chemistry , biology , and mathematics used in evaluating clues written in the rock record , and the processes that have shaped our planet .

name: GEOL 130Lg The Nature of Scientific Inquiry
description: Examination of the scientific process : what constitutes science ; evolution of ideas about the nature of space , time , matter , and complexity ; paradigm shifts in the biological and earth sciences .

name: GEOL 150Lg Climate Change
description: Climate systems from the beginning of earth history to the present ; tools and techniques used to reconstruct prehistoric climate records ; effects of climate variations on development of life forms on earth .

name: GEOL 240Lg Earthquakes
description: Causes of earthquakes and nature of large faults ; earthquake hazard and risk ; world’s great earthquakes ; understanding the Richter scale .

name: GEOL 387ag Undergraduate Team Research
description: Introduction to scientific inquiry , field research opportunities , and history of physical sciences ; strategies , research methodologies , and writing skills for proposals , abstracts , papers , and professional development .

name: GEOL 465L Field Geology
description: Ten days to four weeks of field study in an area of geological complexity , with preparatory instruction .

name: GEOL 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: GEOL 494 x Senior Thesis
description: Writing of a thesis under individual faculty super vision .

name: Introduction to Global Health
description: Introduction to concepts of global health and disease control . Issues of globalization , global governance , emerging diseases , infectious disease treatment , and outbreak challenges .

name: Biological and Behavioral Basis of Disease
description: Examination of the major systems of the human body ; disease processes and behavioral risk factors .

name: Case Studies in Global Health
description: Case study examination of programs and organizational structure underlying current international efforts addressing problems related to infection disease , chronic disease , global environmental change , emergencies and emerging disease epidemics .

name: IR 308w Economic Globalization
description: Globalization makes national borders and regulations increasingly obsolete . Analyzes the economic foundation of globalization , its consequences and efforts to manage it .

name: HP 350 L Health Behavior Research Methods
description: Introduction to the design , conduct and evaluation of health behavior research studies ; quantitative and qualitative approaches to research and analysis .

name: HP 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Theoretical Principles of Health Behavior
description: Overview and analysis of predictors and consequences of health-related behaviors ; theoretical viewpoints and strategies for behavior change .

name: HP 365gmw Culture , Lifestyle , and Health
description: Comparison of national and international differences in health status as influenced by cultural practices and lifestyles within geographic , economic , and political environments .

name: HP 370g Introduction to Epidemiology : Methods and Applications
description: Examines the primary goals and methods of epidemiology , the study of factors that influence health and disease in individuals and populations .

name: Cultural Competence in Medicine
description: Systematic development of specific professional skills for providing effective , culturally sensitive health services to diverse populations .

name: Maternal and Child Health
description: Health issues of women of childbearing age from pre-pregnancy through the postpartum period , and of children from their development in utero through early adolescence .

name: Behavioral Medicine
description: Examines behavioral risk factors for illness , health-enhancing and health-compromising behaviors , stress/coping in promoting health and preventing illness , and behavioral management of chronic illness .

name: Religion and Health
description: Differential relationships of religiosity and spirituality with health and risk behaviors , physical and mental health outcomes , coping skills and well-being across cultures and religions .

name: Sexually Transmitted Diseases : A Global Public Health Priority
description: An overview of the magnitude and impact of STDs including prevention , diagnosis , and treatment of common STDs , STD/HIV interrelationship , global burden , trends , public health challenges , and STD/HIV prevention and control strategies and programs worldwide .

name: Environmental Impacts on the Brain
description: An examination of the physical and chemical factors in the environment that contribute to neurodevelopmental disorders , cognitive function and neurodegeneration .

name: Issues in Prevention and Cessation of Drug Abuse
description: Examination of factors related to drug abuse behaviors ; overview and assessment of drug abuse prevention and cessation programs ; relapse prevention programs .

name: Drug Intervention Program Design and Evaluation
description: Strategies for drug abuse prevention and intervention ; introduction to techniques and research methods used in designing , conducting , and evaluating drug abuse prevention programs .

name: Health Promotion and Prevention Policy
description: Overview of health promotion and drug prevention policy at local , state , and federal levels ; methods for evaluating policy effectiveness and cost effectiveness .

name: HP 420m Gender and Minority Health Issues
description: Examines the nature and roots of health disparities among women , men , and different ethnic and age groups ; methods for reducing such disparities ; strategies for prevention services .

name: Violence as a Public Health Issue
description: Patterns and prevalence of violence ; psychosocial , environmental , and biological influences on violent behavior ; youth gangs ; drugs and violence ; family violence ; and prevention and intervention strategies .

name: AIDS in Society
description: Provides a broad examination of issues in HIV/AIDS , including behavioral , social , biological , clinical and ethical dimensions of the pandemic in the U .S . and elsewhere .

name: Obesity and Health
description: Examination of causes and consequences of obesity , with emphasis on health risks of type II diabetes and cardiovascular disease .

name: Behavior and Education Strategies for Nutrition and Fitness
description: Examination of dietary intake and exercise behaviors as they relate to health and illness ; methods for measuring diet and exercise .

name: Clinical Nutrition
description: IrregularMetabolism of carbohydrates , fats and protein ; introduction to vitamins , minerals and dietary modifications in various pathological conditions .

name: Advanced Topics in Nutrition
description: In-depth discussion of vitamins and minerals and their role in human nutrition ; introduction to the role of vitamins and minerals in selected pathological conditions .

name: Physical Activity and Health
description: Examination of the health impacts of physical inactivity ; participation rates across subgroups ; physical activity determinants ; and interventions , programs , and policies to promote physical activity .

name: Happiness , Well-Being , and Health
description: Explores human strengths that promote happiness/well-being and whether they influence physical health ; mind-body relationships ; and strategies for promoting hope , resilience , and quality of life .

name: Health Promotion in the Workplace
description: Covers phases of worksite health promotion ; research , design , implementation and evaluation ; concerns regarding escalating medical costs and the role of health promotion in offering solutions .

name: Chronic Disease Epidemiology
description: Overview of causative factors and demographic distributions of the major chronic diseases in the western world ; epidemiologic concepts and research designs .

name: Communicating Health Messages and Medical Issues
description: (Enroll in COMM 443 )

name: Poisons , People , and Politics
description: Case studies of toxic exposures and investigation of the role of government , scientists , labor and industry in protecting against health threats caused by toxic exposures .

name: Global Environmental Changes and Health
description: Discussion of global environmental changes , including climate change , air pollution , water pollution , radiation , and their impacts on human health .

name: Traditional Eastern Medicine and Modern Health
description: Overview of traditional Eastern approaches toward health and disease ; relevance to modern health issues , emphasizing a comparison between traditional Chinese and modern Western medicine .

name: Adolescent Health
description: Survey of the development of healthy and the prevention of health-risk behaviors during adolescence . Prevention and promotion techniques will be explored emphasizing cultural differences .

name: Health Status of Indigenous Peoples of America
description: Survey of indigenous people’s health , including health conditions , special cultural and ethical considerations , the Indian health system , and the politics of indigenous health .

name: Global Health and Aging
description: (Enroll in GERO 483 )

name: Global Health : Obesity and Nutrition
description: Overview of the epidemiology of obesity and related diseases and the etiology of obesity , including genetic , biological , behavioral , environmental and sociocultural correlations .

name: IR 307 Contemporary International Politics
description: Analysis of recent events , forces , and conditions in the international political system .

name: Global Governance
description: Introduction to global governance structure and institutions . Exploration of the appropriate role for states , international organizations , civil society and individuals within the global governance structure .

name: Public Health and International Relations
description: Examination of threats to global security , state sovereignty and population health posed by infectious diseases , natural disasters , war and civil conflict .

name: International Law and Politics
description: Exploration of international law and international politics , including sovereignty , war , international tribunals , the environment , and human rights .

name: Global Civil Society : Non-State Actors in World Politics
description: Examination of diplomatic and moral relationships between sovereign states and transnational non-state actors , both benevolent (humanitarian groups and philanthropies) and malevolent (mercenaries , pirates and terrorists) .

name: IR 424w Citizenship and Migration in International Politics
description: Changing notions of citizenship in the context of history , and of economic , political and sociological theories of international migration ; diaspora and migration case studies .

name: GERO 483 Global Health and Aging
description: Overview of the impact aging populations will have on global institutions from a variety of perspectives . Examination of public health policy issues .

name: POSC 442m The Politics of Human Differences : Diversity and Discrimination
description: A comparative perspective on social and cultural forces that affect American laws and policies concerning discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity , gender , sexual orientation , age , and disability .

name: Politics of Resources and Development
description: Comparison of relationships between rich and poor countries involving political and economic resources and prospects for development ; impact on industrialized states ; interdependence ; new international economic order .

name: POSC 456 Women in International Development
description: How various developmental theories analyze the role of women as producers and how Third World women are increasing their role in development .

name: PPD 250m Cities in the Developing World
description: The transition from traditional to modern cities in the developing world . Primacy and dualism ; comparative urbanism as an expression of cultural variation ; contrast in Western cities .

name: SOCI 460 Key Issues in Contemporary International Migration
description: Overview of contemporary patterns of international migration and its implications for receiving and sending countries , with a special emphasis on immigration to the United States .

name: SOCI 470 Social Change in Low-Income Countries
description: Theories and case studies on social , economic , political , and cultural development and change in the Third World : Latin America , Asia , or Africa .

name: ANTH 205g Introduction to Global Studies and Overseas Research
description: Cultural differences and social processes examined in global and regional networks . Issues are studied ethnographically , using materials from several disciplines .

name: Global Studies Research Methods
description: Methods for field research in international settings include ethnography , archival work , surveying and documentation ; preparation for overseas research and senior thesis .

name: Global Studies Senior Seminar
description: Preliminary analysis for research data for overseas research to compare results , discuss writing strategies and gain comparative perspective to prepare a senior thesis .

name: HIST 180gw The Middle East
description: Introduction to the history and the study of the Middle East from ancient to modern times .

name: Korea : The Modern Transformation
description: Examination of selected topics on Korea’s transition to the modern era ; focus on the traditional roots of 20th century developments .

name: HIST 384 Popular Culture in the Middle East
description: Examination of the Middle East through the prism of its popular cultures ; emphasis on audio , visual , and literary representations in relation to colonialism , nation-building , and globalization .

name: The Age of Revolution
description: IrregularThe French and industrial revolutions and their interaction in 19th century Europe .

name: IR 376 U .S .-Japan Encounters : War , Trade , and Culture
description: The significance of U .S .-Japan relations is addressed through historical and policy analysis of America , Japan , and the Asia-Pacific region .

name: Thought and Life of Islam
description: History , thought , institutions , and religious practices of Islam .

name: Women and the Islamic Tradition
description: Overview of social and legal status of women in Islamic society , past and present . Examination of social roles established both for and by Muslim women .

name: Introduction to the Religions of India
description: History , teaching , and practice of Hinduism , Buddhism , and other religious traditions of India .

name: Religions of East Asia
description: History , teaching , and practice of the religions of China , Tibet , and Japan .

name: Religions of Japan
description: The development of religious thought and practice in the Japanese islands , with Buddhism and Shinto being the most prominent .

name: Seminar in Buddhism
description: Seminar on selected aspects of the Buddhist tradition .

name: Seminar in South Asian Religions
description: Exploration of particular themes and/or traditions in South Asian religions .

name: ANTH 235g The Changing Pacific : History , Culture , Politics
description: Current social and political developments in the South Pacific analyzed from the perspective of the historical relationship between indigenous cultures and the West .

name: ANTH 250g Race and Sexual Politics in Southeast Asia
description: Southeast Asia is studied as a meeting place of different races and cultural traditions , with emphasis on the precolonial heritage of sexual equality and postcolonial reinterpretations of men’s and women’s worlds .

name: ANTH 273g Shamans , Spirits and Ancestors : Non-Western Religious Traditions
description: An intensive study of local systems of belief and knowledge in selected societies in the Pacific , Asia , Africa , the Caribbean and Latin America with emphasis on ideas of the spirit world .

name: The Performance of Healing
description: Survey of the performance of healing in cross-cultural perspective . The course culminates in field research to Spiritist centers outside the United States .

name: The Asia Pacific in World Affairs
description: The cultural , political , economic , and social aspects of the Asia Pacific’s rise to prominence in world affairs . Reasons for the “successes” of many Asian economies and the environmental and social problems accompanying their rapid transformation . The difficulties of interaction in complex cultural situations illustrated by participation in a computer-assisted simulation .

name: IR 463 Islam and Arab Nationalism
description: Historical , sociological and political processes that have shaped the emergence of and relationship between Arab nationalism and political Islam since the early 20th century .

name: Comparative Politics
description: Gateway to the major in political science . Comparative analysis of political institutions and processes in selected industrial , developing and socialist countries , in terms of contrasting ideologies , parties , elites , and economies .

name: POSC 248gw Human Rights
description: Overview of human rights controversies across the globe . Introduction to techniques of analysis for social issues , interdisciplinary research methods , and interpretation of complex political problems .

name: Critical Issues in Comparative Politics
description: Critical analysis of major issues in comparative politics such as dependency , crises in political legitimacy , political violence and terrorism , political corruption , genocide , and comparative revolutions .

name: POSC 255g Cultures , Civilizations and Ethnicities in World Politics
description: Theories and case studies of conflict and coexistence between cultures , civilizations and ethnic groups in the context of the countervailing force of Western socio-economic globalization .

name: Global Ethnic Politics
description: A comparative analysis of multi-ethnic societies through case studies of inter-ethnic conflict and coexistence , conflict resolution , prevention of genocide and defense of human rights .

name: Middle East Politics
description: Political development in the Middle East , emphasizing historical , cultural , and socioeconomic conditions affecting political structures and functions ; modernization and countervailing social , economic , and religious forces .

name: Politics of Southeast Asia
description: Theories of development and nation-building ; revolutionary and evolutionary modernization ; role of history , culture , socioeconomic conditions in affecting political structures and functions .

name: Politics of East Asia
description: Institutions and processes of advanced societies ; political culture , interest articulation and aggregation , the governmental process .

name: Politics of Sub-Sahara Africa
description: Theories of development and nation-building ; revolutionary and evolutionary modernization ; role of history , culture , socioeconomic conditions in affecting political structures and functions .

name: World Political Leadership
description: Comparative analysis of theories of power and leadership ; application to leaders from western democracies , Third World , and socialist countries . Societal consequences of their policies .

name: Asian Political Thought
description: Major systems of political thought in Chinese , Japanese , and other Asian cultural traditions . Confucianism , Buddhism , Islam , and other classical systems and their present-day adaptations under the impact of communism and democracy .

name: Political Change in Asia
description: Modernization and political development in China and Japan ; Asia’s economic “miracles” (Taiwan , Japan , Korea , etc .) ; nationalism and communist movements in East and Southeast Asia .

name: BISC 150Lgx The Nature of Human Health and Disease
description: The human organism ; the nature of inherited and acquired diseases ; the biological and societal basis for the AIDS epidemic ; therapy , drug design and the future .

name: PSYC 240gx Scientific Inquiry and Reasoning in Health Care
description: Critical analysis and reasoning skills required to solve scientific problems in human behavior , including presentation of data , logic of research design , statistics , and research ethics .

name: SOCI 242g Sociology , Demography , and Health
description: Sociological and demographic concepts focusing on the causes of disease , health and wellness . Empirical analysis of population composition and its connection to health .

name: ANTH 125g Social Issues in Human Sexuality and Reproduction
description: Examination of the “natural” (biological) and “unnatural” (social and cultural) dimensions of human sexuality and reproduction .

name: SWMS 225 Gender , Sex , and Science : A Gender Studies Approach
description: Study of sex , gender in relation to science and social sciences ; survey of scientific methods , approaches , current research ; investigation of gender influences on scientific research .

name: PSYC 367g Stress , Health , and the Mind-Body Connection
description: Introduction to psychological , biological , and behavioral processes affecting physical health , including stress , coping with disease , health behaviors , and socioeconomic and cultural influences on health .

name: Introduction to Clinical Psychology
description: IrregularIntroduction to the scientist-practitioner model of clinical psychology , including research methods , psychological assessment and diagnosis , psychotherapeutic interventions , and treatment of special populations .

name: Global and Transnational Sociology
description: Examines key issues in global and transnational sociology . Globalization is the empirical phenomenon where social , economic , and political interconnectedness across countries impacts the world .

name: Health , Gender and Ethnicity
description: (Enroll in SWMS 336 )

name: SOCI 200gm Introduction to Sociology
description: Basic concepts of sociology with special reference to group life , social institutions , and social processes .

name: SOCI 225gw Sociology of Health and the Body
description: Investigation of health as a social category and the varied ways that social and cultural factors shape bodies and health .

name: SOCI 360m Social Inequality : Class , Status , and Power
description: Inequalities in wealth , prestige , and power in the United States ; the American class structure and the extent of upward mobility in that structure .

name: Medical Sociology
description: Social and cultural factors in causation of disease , health care utilization and health care delivery .

name: GERO 320g Psychology of Adult Development
description: How psychologists study thinking , memory , emotions , personality , and behavior , and how people change in these throughout adulthood to old age .

name: Society and Adult Development
description: How social relationships affect adults of different ages ; the changing contract across generations ; interaction of culture , race , family and social values with adult development .

name: Policy , Values , and Power in an Aging Society
description: How Americans’ political values affect public policy . Studies of landmark legislation to explore the social contract between generations and role of governments in social welfare .

name: Social and Psychological Aspects of Death and Dying
description: Introduction and critical survey of the current issues , concepts , and research of the social and psychological aspects of death and dying .

name: GERO 380m Diversity in Aging
description: Exploring diversity in the older population and variability in the human aging process .

name: GERO 435m Women and Aging : Psychological , Social and Political Implications
description: Problems and resources of the middle-aged and older woman in a changing society ; including discrimination , stereotypes , employment , social interaction , etc .

name: Health Issues in Adulthood
description: Physiological , psychological , and social health problems of adults as they are impacted by health choices throughout life .

name: HBIO 301L Human Anatomy
description: Major organ systems ; functional implications of their relationships ; gross and microscopic examination with an emphasis on practical skills in recognizing , dissecting , and differentiating anatomical structures .

name: HBIO 302L Nutrition and Metabolism
description: Gastrointestinal physiology and energy metabolism as it relates to macronutrient intake . Theories and principles of nutrition and their impact on metabolic regulation .

name: BISC 450 L Principles of Immunology
description: Immune processes , humoral and cellular ; immunoglobulins ; antibody formation ; antigen-antibody interactions ; immune dyscrasias ; transplantation and tumor immunology ; basic hematology and immuno-hematology .

name: BISC 307 L General Physiology
description: Physiological functions of the circulatory , digestive , endocrine , integumentary , musculoskeletal , nervous , respiratory , and urogenital systems of animals .

name: HBIO 420L Applied Human Physiology
description: The physiology of the respiratory , cardiovascular , renal , musculoskeletal , digestive , endocrine , and nervous systems in humans , with application to human health and pathology .

name: Practicum in Geriatric Care
description: Supervised experience in a geriatric health care setting which allows students to put theories and ideas into practice . Graded CR/NC . Lecture , discussion , and fieldwork .

name: MDA 250 Internship for Liberal Arts : Work and Career — Theory and Practice
description: Students explore different understandings of work and career in American society while testing theories in an actual work setting .

name: POSC 395 Directed Governmental and Political Leadership Internship
description: Intensive experience in governmental and political offices . Minimum time requirement ; evaluation by office and intern report required . Permission of the Director of the Institute of Politics and Government required .

name: SOCI 450 Non-Governmental Organizations/Non-profits Field Practicum
description: Internship in a Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) . Students will conduct sociological research on issues surrounding NGOs and the work they do .

name: BISC 312x Molecular Biochemistry
description: Structure and function of biological macromolecules ; major metabolic pathways including glycolysis and photosynthesis . DNA replication , repair , and recombination ; gene expression , regulation and epigenetics .

name: BISC 406 L Biotechnology
description: Techniques in molecular biology and biochemistry applied to prokaryotic and eukaryotic model systems ; applications of recombinant DNA and genomic technology .

name: BISC 440 Biodemography of Aging
description: (Enroll in GERO 440  )

name: Drugs , Disease , and Medicine in History
description: IrregularAn overview of the role played by disease and the health sciences in history .

name: Global Ethics : Poverty , Health and the Human Condition
description: Ethical challenges and moral obligations of the public and private sectors in global development , access to healthcare , and promotion of civil , political , and economic rights .

name: Senior Seminar : Medical Ethics
description: Analysis of ethical problems related to new developments in medical science .

name: PSYC 337 L Adult Development and Aging
description: Genetic , physical , and social influences during adult years on perception , learning and memory , intelligence , personality , social roles , and normal and deviant behavioral patterns .

name: Social Psychology
description: Theoretical and experimental analysis of human behavior . Social processes involved in attitudes , conformity , compliance , interpersonal perception , liking , affiliation , aggression , altruism , and group dynamics .

name: SOCI 305m Sociology of Childhood
description: Social construction of childhoods ; children’s social relations and cultures ; issues of childcare , poverty , violence , and children’s rights ; effects of children on adults .

name: Cities
description: Organization of urban society , including such topics as segregation , urban decay , local politics , residential change , and community conflict .

name: SOCI 369 The Family in a Changing Society
description: Changing family patterns ; personality development ; family unity , predicting success in marriage ; the family in transition ; crises such as economic changes , death , divorce ; family reorganization .

name: SSCI 340 Community Health Scan
description: The social context of health and its determinants ; the uses of data analysis ; community capacity building , and the impact of policy on community health improvement .

name: POSC 333 Stigma and Society : Physical Disability in America
description: Political activity involving disabled persons ; development of public policy regarding disabled citizens .

name: Ethical Issues in Geriatric Health Care
description: Biomedical ethical issues that are encountered in working with geriatric patients . Examination of ethical theory and the application of theory to clinical settings .

name: The Narrative Structure of Social Action : Narrative , Healing and Occupation
description: Narrative as guide and structure of practical action . Special emphasis on chronic illness and disability and narrative structure of clinical interactions .

name: REL 319 Religious and Ethical Issues in Death and Dying
description: Analysis of religious and ethical approaches to death and dying , including refusal of treatment for competent and incompetent patients , voluntary and involuntary euthanasia , and resuscitation .
