name: Technology , Culture , and Ethics
description: Examination of value questions arising from the impact of technology on individuals , social institutions , and culture .

name: Ethical Issues in the New Medical Revolution
description: Multimedia-oriented analysis of issues ; definition of life and death ; research on human subjects , health care delivery , euthanasia , abortion , genetic counseling , behavior control .

name: PSYC 404 L Psychophysiology of Emotion
description: IrregularIntroduction to the scientific study of emotional behavior . Emphasizes research into relations between physiological and psychological variables underlying emotional experience .

name: BISC 290 Introduction to Biological Research
description: Experience in basic techniques through supervised research in the research laboratory of a departmental faculty member .

name: Introduction to Health Promotion and Disease Prevention
description: Introduction to strategiesfor promoting health and wellness . Includes self monitoring of health risk behavior , goal setting , and behavior changes .

name: HP 480 Internship in Health Promotion and Disease Prevention
description: Field placement in a community agency such as a county health services agency , a not for profit voluntary agency or a health care setting .

name: PPD 325 Fundamentals of Health Policy and Management
description: Institutions , policies , and processes affecting health care policy and management ; historical and philosophical roots ; management of health care delivery ; access and quality issues ; responsiveness to public needs .

name: PPD 330 Introduction to Health Care Systems
description: Concepts and determinants of health and illness ; health care delivery organizations and programs ; the role of the administrator ; issues in health care financing and access ; quality evaluation ; future trends .

name: Adolescent Development
description: The adolescent years from both an applied and a research-oriented perspective . Topics include physical , cognitive , and moral development ; socialization ; and sexual and sex-role development .

name: SOCI 350 Social Exclusion , Social Power , and Deviance
description: Current theories of origin , distribution , and control of deviant behavior ; examination of processes involved in the career deviance of drug addicts , alcoholics , sexual deviants , gamblers , and mentally disordered .

name: ECON 205g Principles of Macroeconomics
description: Unemployment , inflation and output determination and links . Effects of government taxation and spending on growth , investment , saving , consumption , and trade .

name: HIST 201 Approaches to History
description: Methods and theories of historical interpretation of evidence ; uses of archives ; modes of presenting the past to the public . Required of all history majors .

name: Teaching History in the Secondary Schools
description: Seminar in research methods , textbook and online research and teaching materials , and instructional approaches for teaching history in secondary schools .

name: HIST 240gp The History of California
description: A thematic approach to California history from precontact to present ; focus on peoples , environment , economic , social , and cultural development , politics , and rise to global influence .

name: Colonial North America 1600–1760
description: Colonial history of United States area , Canada , and Caribbean to 1760 ; Indians , European migration , plantation complexes , Puritan colonies , African slave migration , creole culture , borderlands , wars for empire .

name: 19th Century U .S . History
description: The social , political , and economic history of the United States from the formation of the Constitution to 1900 .

name: 20th Century U .S . History
description: Critical turning points in the 20th century ; sources of major social and political change . Course materials include primary documents and historic radio/television recordings .

name: Early Modern World History
description: Comparative patterns of historical change around the world , from ca . 1500 to ca . 1800 .

name: Modern World History
description: Comparative patterns of historical change around the world , from ca . 1800 to the present .

name: HIST 102gm Medieval People : Early Europe and Its Neighbors , 400–1500
description: Early Europe , c . 400– 1500 , with a focus on Europe’s diverse communities , cultural interactions among them , dealings between conquerors and conquered , and European contacts with non-Europeans .

name: HIST 103g The Emergence of Modern Europe
description: Political , intellectual , and cultural developments in Europe , 1300–1815 . Renaissance and Reformation ; absolute monarchy , scientific changes , and Enlightenment ; French Revolution and Napoleon .

name: HIST 275g The Worlds of the Silk Road
description: Exploration of the two millennia of economic exchanges and cross cultural interaction between Asia and Europe .

name: History of Japan to 1550
description: IrregularGrowth of Japanese civilization from the mythological “age of the gods” through the feudal “age of the samurai” ; foundations of a great Asian power .

name: China to 960 A .D .
description: IrregularThe origins of China’s distinctive civilization ; cultural and political ferment in the late Chou ; the greatness of Han and T’ang .

name: China , 960–1800 A .D .
description: IrregularPolitics and culture under the Sung ; Mongols , Manchus , and other invaders ; the golden autumn of a great civilization .

name: HIST 382 The Middle East , 500–1500
description: Major topics , themes , and representative writings in the history and literature of the Arabic and Islamic World during the Medieval period .

name: HIST 104gp Modern Europe
description: The Enlightenment , French Revolution , industrialization , Darwinism , socialism , nationalism , technological revolutions , mass culture , imperialism , race , fascism , communism , world wars , genocide , migration , the Cold War , terrorism .

name: History of Japan , 1550–1945
description: IrregularDevelopment of Japan as a modern world power ; tradition and change in Japanese life ; impact of Western culture , politics , and diplomacy from 1550 to 1945 .

name: History of China since 1800
description: Western impact and dynastic decline ; problems of the Chinese Republic ; nationalism and communism .

name: HIST 383 The Modern Middle East
description: Survey of major political , economic , and cultural developments in the Middle East on the basis of documents , literature , and film produced in the region .

name: POSC 100g Theory and Practice of American Democracy
description: Theoretical , institutional , and functional aspects of American national , state , and local government and politics ; contemporary issues . Recommended for freshmen and sophomores .

name: Principles , Institutions , and Great Issues of American Democracy
description: Underlying principles of American democracy ; major issues of contemporary public policy in national and state institutions .

name: Constitutional Law
description: Development of constitutional law by the courts ; leading cases bearing on major constitutional issues ; the federal system ; powers of government ; civil liberties .

name: Honors Thesis
description: Writing of the honors thesis ; for students in the History Honors Program .

name: HBIO 350 Nutrition and Homeostasis
description: Theories and principles of regulation of vitamin/mineral metabolism as it relates to homeostasis of organ systems .

name: HBIO 360 Nutrition and Disease
description: Principles of diet therapy for the prevention and treatment of human disease .

name: HBIO 407L Endocrinology and Metabolism
description: Regulation of metabolic pathways and endocrinology in health and metabolic diseases .

name: HBIO 408L Biomechanics
description: Kinematic and kinetic analysis of human motion . Emphasis on performance enhancement and injury prevention .

name: BISC 313 L Evolution and Population Genetics
description: History of evolutionary thought ; molecular basis for evolution ; dynamics of genes in populations ; speciation and macro evolution ; patterns of evolution .

name: HBIO 202Lg Nutrition for Life
description: To develop an understanding of Nutrition , especially as it pertains to optimal health and prevention of diseases . A study of macro and micro nutrients .

name: HBIO 250g The Pharmacology of Performance Enhancing Drugs
description: Evaluation of drugs , nutritional supplements , and ergogenic aids that are purported to enhance human athletic performance to promote weight and fat loss .

name: HBIO 320 Muscle Physiology
description: Analysis of the skeletal muscular system (anatomy , physiology , biochemistry , and development) and its functional properties under both normal and pathological conditions .

name: HBIO 400L Motor Control and Learning
description: Theories of control and learning applied to motor performance ; variables affecting performance in exercise , games , sports , and dance .

name: HBIO 401 Physiology and Biomechanics of Movement
description: Terminology , structure and function of muscle , bone and endocrine systems ; Effects of exercise and training on those systems .

name: HBIO 441L Prevention of Athletic Injuries
description: Application of scientific principles to conditioning , protecting , and rehabilitating the athlete .

name: BISC 423 Epilepsy to Ecstasy : Biological Basis of Neurological Disorders
description: Examination of various neurological disorders originating from developmental signaling and/or anatomical abnormalities .

name: HBIO 409 Metabolic Diseases
description: Examination of the etiology , prevention , and treatment of metabolic disorders such as diabetes mellitus and obesity that are major threats to public health .

name: HBIO 435 Neurobiology of Feeding Behavior and Obesity
description: Neurobiological systems that control feeding behavior and energy balance with an emphasis on the determinants of obesity .

name: HBIO 439L Human Performance and Bioenergetics
description: Application of physiology , biomechanics and perceptual-motor principles to the study of skill acquisition and human performance .

name: HBIO 442L Evaluation and Rehabilitation of Athletic Injuries
description: Application of scientific principles to evaluating and rehabilitating athletic injuries .

name: GERO 310 Physiology of Aging
description: Effects of normative aging processes on homeostatic mechanisms and how these changes relate to development of disorder and disease in later life .

name: GERO 440 Biodemography of Aging
description: Consideration of the biological and social-cultural factors that govern the evolution of life spans and the life of humans and selected animal models

name: Gerontology : The Science of Adult Development
description: Introduction to adult development through the lifespan ; biological , psychological , and social processes ; gerontology as a career for the future .

name: Administrative Problems in Aging
description: Analysis of the skills , approaches and issues involved in the planning , development , and implementation of programs directed at meeting the needs of older persons .

name: Case Management for Older Adults
description: Overview of the concepts , characteristics , skills , and clinical issues of case management in a variety of settings serving older persons .

name: GERO 491 Practicum
description: Supervised experience in one or more community agencies .

name: Senior Seminar
description: An in-depth integration of major research and professional themes in the study of human development and aging .

name: Neurobiology of Aging
description: Age-related changes in nervous system structure and function ; relationship of brain changes to changes in cognitive function and perception ; Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases . Lecture and discussion .

name: ITP 101 Introduction to Business Information Technologies
description: Business technologies . Operating systems . Networks . Application software .

name: ITP 102 Introduction to Creative Information Technologies
description: Creative technologies . Computer Graphics . Internet and Web . Mobile Systems . Digital Audio and Video .

name: Developmental Biology
description: Basic mechanisms of animal development are considered at different levels of analysis . Emphasis is on molecular , genetic , and cellular processes underlying vertebrate and invertebrate development . General concepts and evolutionary mechanisms are emphasized .

name: Honors Seminar
description: Advanced study of empirical approaches in gerontology . Preparation , progress , presentation , and evaluation of Senior Honors Thesis research .

name: Research Methods
description: An introduction to research methods and their application to gerontology including problem formation , research design , data collection , descriptive and analytic statistics , interpretation , and report preparation .

name: BISC 104Lgx How the Body Works
description: Structure and function of the human body , including the role of organ systems , tissues , and cells in normal function . Malfunctions relating to disease , substance abuse and lifestyle .

name: BISC 230Lgx The Biology of the Brain : Current Topics in Neuroscience
description: The structure and function of the mammalian brain including the role of the brain in regulating behavior , both in normal and diseased states ; in relation to mind ; and in comparison with machine forms of intelligence .

name: HBIO 205Lgx The Science of Sport
description: The physiological and nutritional basis of human performance . Factors that facilitate and limit athletic achievement .

name: Introduction to Industrial and Systems Engineering
description: A combination of plant tours , laboratory experiences , and lecture are used to introduce the philosophy , subject matter , aims , goals , and techniques of industrial and systems engineering .

name: Probability Concepts in Engineering
description: Techniques for handling uncertainties in engineering design : discrete and continuous random variables ; expectations , probability distributions and transformations of random variables ; limit theorems ; approximations and applications .

name: Engineering Statistics I
description: Sampling distributions ; parameter estimation , hypothesis testing ; analysis of variance ; regression ; nonparametric statistics .

name: ISE 315L Engineering Project Management
description: Techniques for planning , budgeting , scheduling , obtaining resources , monitoring and control of projects in a corporate environment . Use of software to evaluate performance and assess risks .

name: Introduction to Operations Research : Deterministic Models
description: Introduction to linear programming ; transportation and assignment problems ; dynamic programming ; integer programming ; nonlinear programming .

name: Introduction to Operations Research : Stochastic Models
description: Stochastic processes ; Markov chains ; queueing theory and queueing decision models ; probabilistic inventory models .

name: ISE 410 Planning and Scheduling
description: Production planning , forecasting , scheduling , and inventory ; computer integrated decision systems in analysis and control of production systems .

name: Discrete Systems Simulation
description: Model design to simulate discrete event systems with basic inputand output analysis using high order languages , applied to industrial systems analysis and design problems .

name: Work , Technology , and Organization
description: Impact of technology on work and organizational design ; effects of automation ; design of improvement programs ; information infrastructures ; teams ; individual behavioral outcomes . Upper division standing .

name: ISE 495a x Senior Design Project
description: Preparation and development of the senior project proposal . Open only to industrial and systems engineering majors .

name: ISE 382 Database Systems : Concepts , Design and Implementation
description: Data models for industry applications . Modeling and designing robust databases . Implementing and querying databases with SQL . Innovations in database applications .

name: DSO 435 Enterprise Data Architecture
description: Management of enterprise data architecture including data structures , conceptual data modeling , logical data modeling , structured query language (SQL) , and physical optimization of high performance data architecture .

name: ISE 370 L Human Factors in Work Design
description: Physiological systems and psychological characteristics ; ergonomics ; anthropometry ; effects of the physical environment on humans ; occupational safety and health ; work methods .

name: Human/Computer Interface Design
description: Essentials of human factors and computer interface for the design , development , implementation , and evaluation of integrated media systems .

name: ISE 335L Supply Chain Design
description: Design of Supply Chains . Product , distribution , transportation and site selection . Analysis and optimization of supply chain networks .

name: ISE 375L Facilities Design
description: Design of facilities for operations and distribution . Product , process flow , material handling , and facility location techniques that lead to making good decisions for facilities layouts .

name: Statistical Quality Control
description: Quantitative aspects of statistical quality control (process control , acceptance sampling by attribute and by variable , rectifying inspection) , quality assurance and the management of QC/QA functions .

name: ISE 232 L Manufacturing Processes
description: Basic manufacturing processes including casting , machining , forming and welding ; current trends in manufacturing processes including polymer , ceramic and composite material processing , and electronic device fabrication ; introduction to numerical control and computer integrated manufacturing .

name: ISE 327 Six Sigma and Lean Operations
description: Standardized methodology for problem solving , basic and advanced statistical tools for root cause identification and solution confirmation , key principles for quality management and organizational excellence .

name: ISE 350 Principles of Systems Engineering
description: Systems as complex collaborative ensembles of interconnected components . Theory and practice of requirements , design , implementation , testing , deployment , operation , and disposal . Case studies from real projects .

name: ITP 320 Enterprise Wide Information Systems
description: The role Information Systems play in an organization . Integration of Business Processes by using Enterprise Resource Planning Systems (ERP) .

name: ITP 482 Engineering Database Applications
description: Planning and implementation of engineering information systems that interface with a large database . Emphasis is placed on web-based data entry and retrieval .

name: ITP 487 Data Warehouses
description: Role of data warehouses in analytics . Modeling and building data warehouses . Extraction , transformation and loading data into cubes .

name: INF 250 Introduction to Data Informatics
description: Fundamentals of data informatics : representation of data and knowledge , role of a data scientist , data storage/processing/analytics , machine learning , big data , and data visualization .

name: ITP 383 Database Systems : Concepts , Design and Implementation
description: (Enroll in ISE 382 )

name: ITP 421 x Advanced Programming for Enterprise Information Systems
description: Object Oriented Programming for Enterprise information systems . Working with classes , objects , database tables , SQL . Designing reports and Graphical user interfaces . Leveraging service oriented architecture .

name: ITP 422L Configuring Enterprise Resource Planning Systems
description: Business process integration is the core advantage of using ERP systems . Analyze , configure , and test business processes for a company from the ground up .

name: ITP 454x Enterprise Resource Planning , Design , and Implementation
description: Process and requirements to implement an Enterprise Resource Planning System (ERP) . Set up server , implement ERP system , then transfer and configure database for case company .

name: ITP 486 Securing and Auditing Enterprise Resource Planning Systems
description: Management and technical issues related to the security of ERP systems . Students will audit ERP systems and apply appropriate security controls .

name: ITP 488 Managing Supply Chains with Advanced Planning & Optimization
description: Drivers and obstacles to the process of coordinating the flow of material/information along the logistics chain . Optimize the supply network , from raw materials to sales . Not available for major credit in engineering except toward undergraduate and graduate programs offered by the Epstein Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering .

name: ITP 300 Database Web Development
description: Fundamental theory and technologies for creating dynamic , database-driven Websites : Structured Query Language .

name: ITP 301L Interactive Web Development
description: Design , programming techniques for creating interactive , dynamic Web pages . Web development technologies and techniques include scripting fundamentals , Javascript , dynamic HTML , Actionscript , and Flash .

name: ITP 302 Advanced Web Publishing
description: Advanced topics in Web Publishing including HTML5 , CSS3 , and jQuery . Concept and theory of responsive design . Miscellaneous Webmaster topics including analytics , podcasting and search engine optimization .

name: ITP 310 Design for User Experience
description: Fundamental concepts , techniques , practices , workflows , and tools associated with the practice of user experience and interaction design in web and mobile applications .

name: ITP 404 Modern Technologies of Web Development
description: Provide students with the necessary skills to build web applications using modern techniques , frameworks , libraries , and tools that are used among developers within the industry .

name: ITP 411 Multimedia and Video Production
description: Visual communication and storytelling are essential skills , especially in the digital age . Overview of techniques and software to create , edit , and deliver compelling images and video .

name: ITP 460 Web Application Project
description: Skills to plan , analyze , build , and launch professional Web sites with actual clients . Includes project management , documentation , technology assessment , security , UI , Q/A , and various methodologies .

name: INF 351 Foundations of Data Management
description: Data modeling , data storage , indexing , relational databases , key-value/document store , NoSQL , distributed file system , parallel computation and big-data analytics .

name: INF 352 Applied Machine Learning and Data Mining
description: Foundational course focusing on the understanding , application , and evaluation of machine learning and data mining approaches in data intensive scenarios .

name: INF 429 Security and Privacy
description: Basic concepts in information security and privacy ; implications of security and privacy breaches ; security and privacy policies , threats , and protection mechanisms ; security and privacy laws , regulations , and ethics .

name: INF 454 Data Visualization and User Interface Design
description: Design of systems for data visualization ; user interface design for exploring and interacting with data .

name: CTIN 101 Fundamentals of Procedural Media
description: Introduction to the procedural nature of interactive media and games , though the coding language Processing . Students will develop proficiency in reading and creating computational media .

name: Animation Fundamentals
description: An introduction to the fundamentals of animation , covering such topics as timing , anticipation , reaction , overlapping action , and metamorphosis .

name: CTAN 443 L Character Development for 3-D Animation and Games
description: Development , modeling , and animation with an emphasis on character setup features : rigging , skeletons , deformers , and scripting . Applying principles of traditional animation to 3-D character rig/puppet .

name: CTIN 403 L Advanced Visual Design for Games
description: The scope of visual game design , including the role of characters , architecture , indoor and outdoor spaces , and environmental effects and sounds .

name: CTIN 404 L Usability Testing for Games
description: Concepts and methods of usability assessment . The emphasis will be on understanding the issues surrounding game interfaces , and utilizing usability assessment methods .

name: CTIN 405 L Design and Technology for Mobile Experiences
description: Critical and pragmatic insights into designing mobile experiences and technology . Design groups will develop a mobile project using principles from readings and class discussions .

name: CTIN 406 L Sound Design for Games
description: Introduction to the techniques , terminology , and implementation of sounds in games , including establishing a sense of place and concepts of realistic sound .

name: CTIN 485 L Advanced Game Development
description: Advanced concepts in 3-D game development : story and character progression , emergent game-play , comprehensive game mechanics , and artificial intelligence .

name: Alternative Control Workshop
description: Design of game projects using immersive input devices . Development of play mechanics , feedback systems and game design for immersive environments .

name: IML 346 Methods in Digital Research
description: Emphasizing rigorous multimedia research and authorship strategies , this course prepares students to undertake large-scale digital projects .

name: Statistical Analysis for Games : Storytelling with Numbers
description: An introductory course on using statistical analysis for user research and assessment of interactive projects .

name: CTIN 462 Critical Theory and Analysis of Games
description: Formal , aesthetic , and cultural aspects of digital games , critical discourse around gameplay , and the relationship of digital games to other media .

name: CTWR 410 L Character Development and Storytelling for Games
description: An exploration of characters and story worlds as they relate to gaming with an emphasis on emotionally rich environments in interactive entertainment .

name: CTIN 459 L Game Industry Workshop
description: Exploration of industry-related game play research questions . Student teams will develop concepts and materials to solve a research problem posed by an industry partner .

name: CTIN 491L Advanced Game Project I
description: Students work in teams on pre-production and production of a functional digital game suitable for showcases , festivals , and further development .

name: CTIN 492L Experimental Game Topics
description: Development of a game around a custom-made physical interface ; various technologies and techniques involved in a software/hardware integration ; peripheral design .

name: Leadership and Diplomacy
description: The role of leaders , diplomatic leadership and creativity in statecraft , providing a deep understanding of the theoretical and practical dimensions of diplomacy .

name: Research Design and Methods
description: Exploration of critical scholarship on research design , including case selection , hypothesis testing , and field research techniques .

name: Transnational Diplomacy and Global Security
description: Explores emerging “diplomatic” relations between nation-states and transnational (non-state) entities , such as non-governmental organizations (NGOs) , in the development of global peace and security policies .

name: International Relations Policy Task Force
description: Addresses unfinished question of public policy . Provides experience in interviewing and field research , oral presentation and collective discussion and deliberation . Open to juniors and seniors only .

name: Ethics and World Politics
description: Exploration of the relationship between ethics and politics . Special focus on religion , violence and human rights in international relations

name: Comparative Genocide
description: An interdisciplinary treatment of the tragic phenomenon of genocide . Subject matter includes historical cases and analysis of contemporary global efforts toward prevention .

name: Nationalism and Ethnic Conflict after Communism
description: Explores origins and nature of ethnic strife among post-socialist states (ethnicity and national revival , modern histories of East-Central Europe and Russia , problems and conflict resolution) .

name: International Courts and the Globalization of Law
description: Research-based analysis of dramatic development of international courts , exploring causes for their development , autonomy and political relations with states , compliance , effects on international relations .

name: SOCI 435m Women in Society
description: Women today in the labor force , in politics , and in the family . Past and contemporary attempts to expand the position of women in society .

name: SOCI 445 Political and Social Theory
description: Classical and contemporary theories of power , inequality , sociability , symbols and language in market , state , political , and civic organizations .

name: The Politics and Strategy of Weapons of Mass Destruction
description: Causes and effects of use and spread of nuclear , biological and chemical weapons ; responses to WMD , including deterrence , preventive war , and non-proliferation policies and negotiations .

name: U .S . Foreign Policy since World War II
description: Analysis of U .S . foreign policy since 1945 as a basis for understanding significant new trends . Explanation of contemporary issues in U .S . relations with other nations .

name: French Foreign Policy : 1945 to the Present
description: Introduction to historical , thematic perspectives of French foreign policy since 1945 including review of external and internal constraints influencing foreign policy . (Paris semester only) .

name: IR 410 The History of Modern International Relations
description: Explores modern international relations history , focusing on the role of the U .S . in the global politics . Provides training in historical research methods .

name: America's Pacific Century : Dialogues between the U .S . and Asia
description: A hands-on analysis of the contemporary U .S . foreign policy towards East Asia through lectures , interviews , and policy paper writing , including an exchange visit to Singapore .

name: Comparative Analysis of Foreign Policy
description: Comparative analysis of foreign policy determinants and decision-making ; empirical emphasis .

name: Formulation of U .S . Foreign Policy
description: Critical discussion of alternative approaches explaining the formulation and implementation of U .S . foreign policy : domestic politics , organizational processes , group dynamics , individual personality and perception .

name: U .S . Defense and Foreign Policy : Nonproliferation and Weapons of Mass Destruction
description: Policies and programs aimed at stopping the spread of weapons of mass destruction . Presentations by executive/legislative officials involved in formulation and implementation of non-proliferation .

name: American Religion , Foreign Policy and the News Media
description: (Enroll in JOUR 484 )

name: The Evolving Global Economic Architecture-Capital Mobility
description: Exploration of the evolving global economic architecture of the past seventy years ; overview of the possible future contours of economic and political globalization . Recommended preparation : Macro- and Micro-economics .

name: The Global Finance and Monetary Regime
description: The international financial and monetary regime , its evolution and the problems facing it today .

name: The Global Economy 2030
description: Examination of key ideas from economics , demography and technology . Guest lecturers illuminate possible conditions of the global economy in 2030 .

name: IR 428 China's Political Economy
description: Critical issues surrounding China’s economic rise and the implications for international relations ; the unique strengths and vulnerabilities of China’s political-economic model ; prospects for change .

name: The Politics of International Trade
description: Economic approaches and political processes are used to explain observed international trade policy choices . Topics covered include globalization , regionalism , labor standards , the environment and sanctions .

name: The International Political Economy of Development
description: Provides a critical introduction to scholarship on international political economy (IPE) , the interaction of states and markets in a global context .

name: ECON 338 Political Economy and Social Issues
description: Contending politico-economic perspectives in modern Western thought and culture ; absolutist , liberal , democratic , Marxist , anarchist , and other traditions , topics and issues .

name: International Trade
description: Determinants and economic consequences of international trade patterns ; effects of trade restrictions and trading blocs ; trade negotiations and arrangements .

name: International Finance
description: Consequences of trade deficits ; theories of capital and currency markets , exchange rate regimes , and international monetary coordination .

name: International Relations of the Great Powers in the Late 19th and 20th Centuries
description: Introductory analysis of the interactions of the great powers during the period ; initial focus on Europe , with expansion to include global relations .

name: IR 304 Espionage and Intelligence
description: The role and evolution of espionage and intelligence as tools of statecraft are examined . Open , covert , clandestine , counterintelligence programs and oversight processes are considered .

name: Religions and Political Violence
description: An introduction to debates about the intersection of religion and conflict in politics and international affairs ; theoretical , classical , and contemporary issues .

name: Violent Conflict
description: Origins and evolution of violent conflict among humans ; modern efforts to end conflict ; recent research in archaeology , anthropology , biology , economics , political science and psychology .

name: Asian Security Issues
description: Introduction to key security trends in the Asia-Pacific region , emphasizing strategic competition between U .S . , Russia , and China ; regional military capabilities ; rise of neutrality politics .

name: IR 386 Terrorism and Counterterrorism
description: Examination of terrorism and responses to terrorism , including how societies understand and deal with terrorism ; focus on ethical and normative issues .

name: Strategic Studies
description: Strategic theory and its application to national security and warfare from Western and non-Western perspectives . Topics include strategic culture , political decision-making , cyber operations , and non-state challenges .

name: The Politics of Peace
description: Issues of social justice , large-scale social change , high technology , impacts on human survival , and uses of national and international institutions . Human rights .

name: Islam in France
description: (Paris Semester only) Historical overview of interactions between Muslims and Europeans . Islam : origins , history and circumstances that led to its revival . France’s immigration policy .

name: Germany East and West
description: Study of the ideological , economic , social , and cultural differences between East and West Germany between 1945 and 1990 and their impact on today’s unified Germany . In English .

name: The Age of the French Revolution and Napoleon
description: Europe in the Old Regime ; causes and course of the French Revolution ; rise of Napoleon ; revolutionary impact on Europe , 1715–1815 .

name: France and the French from Napoleon to Mitterand
description: IrregularSocial , cultural , and political history of France from 1789 to the present .

name: HIST 332 British Empire from the Mid-19th Century
description: OtherPolitical and economic development of the British Empire since Victoria ; rise of the British Commonwealth .

name: The Era of the First World War
description: The background , causes , course , and aftermath of the First World War , with attention to the events in the United Kingdom and continental Europe .

name: European Political Thought I
description: Basic concepts of Western political thought from Plato through the contract theorists .

name: SPAN 350 Cultural Cross-Currents of the Iberian Middle Ages
description: Selected readings from 1040 to 1499 examining the rich cultural diversity of the Iberian Middle Ages in the symbiosis of Christian , Moslem and Jewish traditions .

name: Economic Development of the Middle East
description: Contemporary economic problems of the Middle East : comparative and historical perspectives on issues of institutions , investment , oil , trade , migration , finance , inequality , labor and capital markets .

name: HIST 480 Seminar in Middle East History
description: A readings and research seminar dealing with one topic in the history of the Middle East . Topics will change each time the course is offered .

name: Korean Civilization
description: Survey of the main characteristics and development of Korean art , literature , philosophy , religion , political and social institutions through different periods . Conducted in English .

name: EASC 360 Global East Asia
description: Summer study abroad program to China , Japan or Korea with a focus on globalization .

name: Economic Development of East Asia
description: Contemporary economic problems of East Asian countries : management , labor , technology , trade , investment . Determinants of their high growth rates in the late 20th century .

name: Japan since 1945
description: IrregularSurvey of the impact of World War II , American occupation , and rapid economic growth on Japan’s politics , society , economy , and culture ; Japan as a post-modern nation .

name: Politics in the People's Republic of China
description: The Chinese revolution ; social , political , and economic developments in post-1949 China ; China after Mao Zedong (Mao Tse-tung) .

name: Introduction to Statistics for Economists
description: Introduction to statistical methods appropriate for analyzing economic data : probability theory , random variables and probability distributions , sampling , estimation , statistical inference .

name: BUAD 215x Foundations of Business Finance
description: Principles and practices of modern financial management ; use of financial statements ; valuation of investment ; asset pricing under uncertainty ; elements of financial decisions .

name: Government and Business
description: American mixed capitalism , welfare , market failure , and the role of government in business ; regulation and the public utilities , antitrust policy , and current topics in regulation-deregulation .

name: International Business Law
description: Introductory course on the legal and regulatory environment of international business transactions .

name: Financial Policies and Corporate Governance
description: Presentation of the theory and institutional details of corporate finance , with emphasis on debt and dividend policies , governance/voting rights , and security issuance and retirement .

name: Corporate Financial Strategy
description: Linkage between financial theory and policy and corporate strategy , the role of financial managers in developing corporate strategy ; applications of concepts and techniques using cases .

name: Financial Management of Multinational Corporations
description: International scope and dimension of financial planning ; working capital management ; financing and investment decisions of multinational corporations .

name: Trading and Exchanges
description: Theories , practices , and technologies of trading at exchanges and in dealer networks . Sources of liquidity , volatility , profitability , and institutional change . Domestic and international public policy issues .

name: Introduction to Forecasting and Risk Analysis
description: Introduction to econometric tools and versions of Capital Asset Pricing Models to estimate financial risk , stock market risk premia and to project economic activity .

name: Topics in Economic Analysis of Business Strategy and Policy
description: Development of economic analysis to define and analyze strategy and policy options . Topics may include pricing and investment strategy using game-theory , and employee compensation and motivation , or investment in emerging markets .

name: Law , Finance and Ethics
description: Law and ethics of agency , partnerships , corporations , limited liability companies , governmental regulation , mergers , creditor rights , secured transactions , bankruptcy , securities regulation , and antitrust .

name: Mergers , Acquisitions and Restructuring
description: Practical understanding of the major strategic , economic , financial , human resources , and governance issues of mergers , acquisitions , and restructuring .

name: FBE 462 International Trade , Finance and Commercial Policy
description: Commercial policies , treaty relationships , examination of policies influencing world trade and finance , the international financial system , exchange rates .

name: MKT 402 Research Skills for Marketing Insights
description: Creating and interpreting qualitative and quantitative research to gain insight into marketplace challenges , such as testing advertising , identifying new product opportunities , and understanding customer decisions .

name: MKT 405 Advertising and Promotion Management
description: Role of advertising in the marketing mix : determining objectives , strategies , and plans from situation analysis through research and creative processes , media selection , and sales promotion .

name: MKT 410 Professional Selling
description: Learn the principles of business to business selling and its function in marketing strategy and the marketing mix ; explore professional selling as a career option .

name: Marketing Analysis and Strategy
description: Synthesis of concepts and applications relating to the analysis of market opportunities and the development of product , promotion , distribution , pricing strategies . Recommended during student’s final semesters .

name: New Product Development and Branding
description: This class examines how new product ideas are developed , test marketed , and , ultimately , brought to the marketplace . Issues about why new products fail and how brand images are managed in the marketplace are discussed . Legal aspects of brand management such as trademark protection and infringement are also addressed .

name: Consumer Behavior and Marketing
description: Examines the relationship of consumer behavior to acquisition , usage , and disposition of products and the psychological , social and cultural influences that affect these decisions .

name: MKT 465 Global Marketing Management
description: Product and service mix in multinational business ; promotional alternatives ; channel of distribution systems ; pricing policies and legal barriers ; multinational marketing opportunities ; problems and information sources .

name: Mastering Decision Making
description: Understand the nature , causes , and consequences of deviations from rational choice . Develop frameworks for controlling biases , improving your decision-making , and influencing other people’s decisions .

name: Management Consulting
description: Role of professional consultants ; data gathering methods ; consulting approaches from strategy , finance , operations , information systems , marketing , and human resources ; action planning ; ethical and career issues .

name: Organization Change and Development
description: Theories and methods of introducing change in organizations . Techniques for analyzing organizations , developing change programs , and implementing changes . Ethical and career issues of change management .

name: MOR 467 Strategic Management of Innovation
description: How firms in different industries manage strategic innovation for competitive advantage . Analysis of industry dynamics . Crafting and implementing innovation strategy .

name: Global Leadership
description: Major theories and practices of leading people in multinational firms . Skills for facilitating cooperation , communication , and motivation among people from different cultures .

name: Managing and Developing People
description: Management of the human resource function for organizational performance .

name: Power , Politics and Influence
description: Theories and practices about how power , politics and influence affect organizational life . Knowledge and skills for diagnosing and managing these features of an organization .

name: Designing and Leading Teams
description: Theories and practices for developing and leading teams . Skills for creating team structures and facilitating team processes . Knowledge for diagnosing team problems and devising solutions .

name: Global Strategy
description: Examination of corporate strategy practices in an international context . Effects of cultures , political systems , markets , and economic systems on developing effective global strategies .

name: The Global Economy
description: Economic and political concepts necessary to the understanding of the modern global economy . Topics include international trade , foreign investment and migration .

name: The World Economy
description: International cooperation and conflict in the world economy . Global economic problems of growth and development , trade and finance , migration , economic stability , and the environment .

name: Intermediate Macroeconomic Theory
description: The determinants of aggregate income , employment , and inflation ; economic fluctuations ; fiscal and monetary policy ; financial markets ; the national debt .

name: Economics of Less Developed Countries
description: Causes of economic underdevelopment : historical , institutional , structural , ideological , technological , cultural . Patterns and theories of development . Role of government , international trade , and education in economic growth .

name: Economic Development of Sub-Saharan Africa
description: Contemporary economic problems of sub-Saharan African economies : policies and endowments . Focus on issues of poverty , agriculture , health , macroeconomy and political economy .

name: Economics of Transition and Development : China
description: A focus on the Chinese economy , its reform and transition to a market economy , its relation with East Asian countries and integration into the world economy .

name: Italian I
description: Introduction to current Italian . Oral practice , hearing and reading comprehension ; grammar necessary for simple spoken and written expression .

name: Italian II
description: Continuation of Italian I .

name: Italian III
description: Continuation of Italian II . Review of structure of the language , drill in aural and reading comprehension , practice in oral expression .

name: Italian Composition and Conversation
description: Practice in composition and conversation ; organized around a set of themes ; develops close-reading techniques and discursive skills ; reviews Italian grammar .

name: Critical Writing in Italian
description: Advanced composition through critical reading of literary texts ; comprehensive analysis of difficult grammatical structures and stylistics .

name: Contemporary Italy
description: Italian literature and arts in Italy following World War II . Conducted in English .

name: ITAL 350g Italian Renaissance Literature in Translation
description: Readings of major texts of Italian literature of the 15th and 16th centuries , including works by Petrarch , the Humanists , Lorenzo de Medici , Ariosto , Machiavelli , Castiglione , and Tasso .

name: The Holocaust in Italian Fiction and Film
description: The transformation of the Italian Jewish community before , during and after World War II , through an examination of modern novels , essays and films . Taught in English .

name: ITAL 360 Italian Cinema
description: Survey of Italian cinema in its relation to social transformation , from the silent era to the present . Weekly screenings , lectures , and discussions . Conducted in English .

name: Italian Women Writers
description: Selected poetry , prose , and drama by outstanding Italian women authors and their role in Italian society from the Middle Ages to 20th century . Taught in Italian .

name: ITAL 381 Storytelling in the Italian Tradition
description: Reading and close textual scrutiny of major short stories from Boccaccio’s Decameron to the present . Conducted in English .

name: ITAL 382g Dante
description: Analysis of the Divina Commedia and other works . Conducted in English . (Duplicates credit in former ITAL 450)

name: Seminar in Literary and Cultural Studies
description: Selected topics in Italian literature and culture . Conducted in English .

name: Seminar in Italian Thought
description: Introduction to important trends in recent Italian philosophy , political and social theory , and media studies . Emphasis to be determined by the department . Conducted in English .

name: ITAL 401 Studies in Early Modernity
description: Study and analysis of representative works and major intellectual , cultural , and artistic trends from the early modern period (pre-1800) . Taught in Italian .

name: ITAL 402 Studies in Modernity
description: Study and analysis of representative works and major intellectual , cultural , and artistic trends from the modern period (post-1800) . Taught in Italian .

name: ITAL 403 Studies in Colonialism and Postcolonialism
description: Study and analysis of colonialism and postcolonialism in Italian contexts .

name: Futurism and Fascism in Italy
description: Literature , theatre , visual arts , and politics , from the Futurist Avant-Garde through the reign of Mussolini .

name: Italian Theatre
description: Italian dramatic literature from the earliest written documents to the present . Reading and close textual scrutiny of plays by major dramatists from the Renaissance to the present . Taught in Italian .

name: ITAL 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: ITAL 499 Special Topics
description: ecial topics in Italian literature , culture , and society . Conducted in Italian .

name: MUJZ 153 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and performance forum .

name: MUJZ 253 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and performance forum .

name: MUJZ 353 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and performance forum .

name: MUJZ 453 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and performance forum .

name: Vocal Jazz Ensemble
description: Study and performance of vocal ensemble literature from the Jazz idiom , with emphasis on improvisational techniques .

name: MUEN 326 Guitar Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and performance of literature composed , transcribed and arranged for small ensembles , including literature for small ensembles of guitar and other instruments , as well as voice .

name: MUEN 329 Jazz Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and performance of literature written for large jazz ensemble .

name: MUEN 332 Jazz Chamber Music
description: Preparation and performance of literature for jazz chamber groups .

name: Drumming Proficiency for the Popular Musician
description: Beginning and elementary instruction in drum set techniques .

name: Introduction to the Music Industry
description: A survey of the music business with emphasis on distribution of recorded music , music publishing , performance rights societies , record companies , agents , personal managers and contracts .

name: Basic Keyboard Skills for the Improviser
description: Reading skills related to jazz accompanying , including the ability to identify and play chords on the piano utilizing different voicings .

name: MUJZ 195L Jazz Elements I
description: Study of compositional , improvisational , performance , and arranging elements found in jazz . Students will model influential groups and jazz artists .

name: Advanced Jazz Theory
description: Analysis and transcription of jazz performances and scores , encompassing questions of style , form , harmonic and melodic language , and considerations of rhythm .

name: MUJZ 395 Jazz Elements II
description: Advanced study of compositional , improvisational , performance , conducting , and arranging elements found in the jazz repertory . Students will be encouraged to forge individual musical expressions .

name: MUJZ 400 Arranging for Jazz Ensemble
description: Scoring for jazz ensemble with emphasis on writing for sections of like and mixed instruments as well as full ensemble .

name: MUJZ 443 Jazz Pedagogy
description: Concepts , methods , and resources ; examination and comparison of textbooks , recordings , tapes , and materials related to the study and teaching of jazz .

name: Introduction to MIDI Sequencing
description: Introductory course where students will learn to use professional MIDI sequencing software to sequence , edit , and realize music compositions .

name: Introduction to Audio Recording and Editing
description: Introduction to the techniques and applications of recording , editing and mixing sound on personal computers .

name: Introduction to Music Notation
description: Introduction to the skills and techniques required to prepare musical scores and parts using industry standard music notation software .

name: Introduction to Web Design for Musicians
description: Introductory course where students will learn to use professional web languages , tools , and techniques to create musical artist and band websites .

name: MTEC 443 Desktop Music Production
description: Intermediate course where students will learn to use professional MIDI sequencing and digital audio software to compose , edit , and mix songs and other music compositions .

name: Non-Linear MIDI Sequencing
description: An in-depth course focusing on the principles and techniques of sequencing and performing musical compositions using a non-linear sequencer .

name: Advanced Desktop Music Production
description: Students will learn to apply their musical and technical skills to create professional quality computer-based arrangements in a variety of musical styles .

name: MTEC 446a Computer Assisted Recording and Editing
description: Techniques and applications of recording and editing sound on personal computers . Hardware , software , editing for song , sound effects and dialog for film .

name: Careers in Music
description: A study of the practical aspects of the music business , including the history , procedures , standard practices , economics and technologies employed by the music industry .

name: MUJZ 350g A History of Jazz Music
description: A history of jazz music and the styles of music considered antecedents to jazz .

name: MPPM 350g A History of Popular Music
description: The history of popular music particularly as developed in America in the 20th and early 21st centuries .

name: MUSC 102gw World Music
description: Exploration of music and cultures of the world . Engagement with international musicians , global issues , field work and musical diasporas in Los Angeles .

name: MUSC 115gp Western Music as Sounding History
description: An introduction to Western art music and culture from the Medieval , Renaissance , Baroque , Classical , Romantic and Modern eras through reading , listening , analyzing and writing about music .

name: MUSC 200gmw The Broadway Musical : Reflections of American Diversity
description: A uniquely American genre , the Broadway musical serves as a catalyst for inquiry into human diversity , cross-culturalism , and significant social and political issues .

name: MUSC 210g Electronic Music and Dance Culture
description: The origins and development of EDM and its relatives such as disco , house , techno , rave and electronica , focusing on cultural and technological influences .

name: MUSC 250gmw The Music of Black Americans
description: A chronicle of the musical contribution of Africans and African Americans to American society and to the foundations of musical genres and styles throughout the world .

name: MUSC 371g Musical Genre Bending
description: The aesthetic and ethical issues of genre-bending music in 20th and 21st century rock , classical , jazz , and folk music .

name: MUSC 372g Music , Turmoil and Nationalism
description: An exploration of musical practices and styles which reflect and shape national identities and which focus on those created in response to political turmoil in many forms .

name: MUSC 373g Writing About Popular Music
description: Immerses students in criticism , scholarship , and creative writing dealing with popular music .

name: Film Music : History and Function from 1930 to the Present
description: A survey of the art and craft of film music as practiced by outstanding composers in motion pictures .

name: Music , Television and American Culture
description: An exploration of the social and cultural impact of music written for , popularized by , or exploited by American television from the 1950s through today .

name: JS 100gp Jewish History
description: Major ideas , personalities , and movements in Jewish history from antiquity to the present in light of the interaction of the Jews with the general culture .

name: JS 180gp Introduction to Judaism
description: Jewish beliefs , practices , and history from the biblical period to the present ; Judaic contributions to Western civilization .

name: Introduction to the Study of Religion
description: Survey of academic approaches to the study of religion . When possible this course will be taken during the first year of the major or minor .

name: REL 401 Seminar in Religious Studies
description: Survey of methods and selected issues in the field of religious studies ; required of all majors during their junior or senior year .

name: JS 258gp Food , Faith and Conflict
description: Investigates how food and food traditions create and cross religious and social conflicts between Jews , Christians and Muslims by exploring faith , practice , thought and ethics .

name: JS 314gp Holy War And History : Jews , Christians , Muslims
description: Investigates the engagement in war by Judaism , Christianity and Islam by examining history and theology and looks at religious justifications and condemnations of war .

name: JS 321 Gender and Judaism
description: An investigation into the ways in which gender has structured Jewish religious , social , political and intellectual life from the Biblical period through the present .

name: Scripture and Polemic in Judaism , Christianity and Islam
description: Origins of Scriptures and their polemical environments in earliest Judaism , Christianity , and Islam . Scripture as polemic and legitimation , and cross-religious/cross-cultural interpretation and argument based on scriptural themes .

name: Messiah : The History of an Idea
description: Exploration of the history of the idea of a messiah in Judaism from antiquity to today .

name: JS 382 Judaism as an American Religion
description: The development of American expressions of Judaism as part of the American religious context , from the perspective of the social scientific study of religion .

name: Modern Jewish Thought
description: Foundations of modern Jewish thought from the Western European Enlightenment to the present .

name: REL 311g The Bible in Western Literature
description: Comparative analysis of biblical works and how they were employed by various writers in major works of Western literature .

name: REL 312 Biblical Wisdom Literature
description: Survey of and inquiry into the biblical wisdom literature ; emphasis on the Book of Job .

name: REL 359g Culture in Diaspora : The Jews of Spain
description: Course traces the Jewish diaspora from Spain and Portugal with particular attention to how Sephardic Jews maintained ties of culture , commerce , language , and identity .

name: Religion and Ethics
description: Traces the development of how religious ideas have informed ethics , or accounts of the good life , including notions of justice , righteousness , virtue , duty , charity and happiness .

name: Advanced Hebrew Bible Studies
description: Consideration of specific topics in Old Testament studies ; particular topics determined each semester .

name: Modern Hebrew Language (Hebrew IV)
description: Examines Hebrew in depth and introduces students to Modern Hebrew literature through major poems , novels and films from the 20th and 21st centuries .

name: HIST 305 From Goddesses to Witches : Women in Premodern Europe
description: Social , cultural and political contexts of women’s spiritualities in Europe from the Paleolithic to the Reformation . Topics include : goddess-worship ; Christian and Jewish contexts ; male attitudes .

name: Cultural Heritage , Religion , and Politics in the Middle East
description: (Enroll in REL 402 )

name: Race and Religious Riots in Modern World History
description: Origins of riots against Mexicans , Chinese , Jews and other minority groups in Asia , Europe , Australia and the Americas .

name: Mass Violence and Comparative Genocide in Modern World History
description: Systematic exploration of origins , developments , forms , and aftermath of mass murder of large population groups , one of the dark elements of modern world history .

name: Resistance to Genocide
description: Examination of theoretical approaches to and historical accounts of resistance to genocide . Students conduct original research on how people oppose or resist mass atrocities .

name: JS 211gw The Holocaust
description: Historical background and responses to the Holocaust , with special emphasis on ethical implications .

name: Zionism , Israel , and the Modern World
description: Ideas about nationalism , Zionism , and society-building ; emphasis on self-definition in the Jewish state .

name: American Jewish History
description: Patterns of immigration , acculturation , religious forms , and ethnic expression in America from the colonial period to the present .

name: JS 315g Anti-Semitism , Racism and Other Hatreds
description: History and contexts of anti-Semitism , racism and other discourses about difference examined through religious , national and cultural forms in Europe and in the US .

name: Jewish Power , Powerlessness , and Politics in the Modern Era
description: Explores the relationship between the Jewish people and political powers . Topics include politics in exile , changing relationships to power , and relations with the modern nation-state .

name: Modern Jewish History
description: A survey of the major trends and themes of modern Jewish history . Examination of Jewish culture , society and politics from the Spanish Expulsion to the Second World War .

name: Reading in Two Directions : Connecting Law and Literature in Jewish Tradition
description: Investigates understandings of law , legal interpretation and the integration of law and narrative in Jewish texts by exploring how to examine legal and literary texts .

name: JS 360m Identity , Community , and Service : Jews and Other Americans
description: Examination of relationships between identity , community and service by investigating ethno-religious organizations’ attempts to serve members of their group and confront issues of injustice in society .

name: Terror and Resistance in Literature and the Media
description: Investigation of the multiple ways that people experience and represent incidents of terror in literature , film , music , and social media .

name: JS 379gm Mixing and Matching : Intermarriage in the 21st Century
description: An investigation into interethnic , interracial , and inter-religious marriage in the 21st century .

name: The Jew in American Society
description: The changing sociological profile of the American Jew and changing organization of the American Jewish community as they developed over the 19th and 20th centuries .

name: JS 383 Jews in American Popular Culture
description: Social and cultural history of American Jewish contributions to the arts , science , literature , economics and politics .

name: Culture and Society in Israel : Inventing the Dream
description: Examination of the social forces that shaped and continue to shape culture and society in contemporary Israel .

name: Special Problems
description: , 2 , 3 , 4Supervised , individual studies . No more than one registration permitted . Enrollment by petition only .

name: The American Jewish Experience in Film
description: A survey of American Jewish history through the medium of film , with particular emphasis on the experience of the post-war generation .

name: Blacks and Jews : Conflicts and Alliances
description: Examination of the relationship between the American Jewish and African-American communities and what it teaches about race and coalition politics in American society .

name: JS 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Special Topics
description: Selected topics in Judaic Studies .

name: Introduction to Jewish Music
description: Development of Jewish music from biblical times to the present , with emphasis on liturgical practices , traditions of itinerant musicians and the adaptability of community song .

name: REL 324g Sex and the Bible : Gender , Sexuality , and Scripture
description: Role the Bible has played in debates about sex , gender , and sexuality in Western history .

name: JOUR 201 Culture of Journalism : Past , Present and Future
description: Understanding key moments , debates and ideas that have shaped journalism in the United States from the Revolutionary War period through today . Examination of the social , cultural , political and technological aspects of journalism and its impact on the profession and public service .

name: JOUR 207 Reporting and Writing I
description: Provides students with foundational skills to report , write and produce journalism content across multiple platforms , including broadcast , digital and text .

name: JOUR 208 Media Law and Ethics
description: Introduction to the basics of the U .S . legal system and contemporary case law and ethics ; impact of the Web on the practice of journalism ; understanding essential legal frameworks and the rights and responsibilities of journalists .

name: JOUR 307 Reporting and Writing II
description: Report , write , produce and distribute in-depth stories produced off beats on multiple platforms for diverse audiences ; enhance understanding of news judgment ; develop and maintain sources ; engage communities through field reporting and emerging digital tools .

name: JOUR 320 Introduction to Coding for Storytelling
description: Introduction to basic web technologies ; conceive , design , code and produce an advanced multimedia story package .

name: JOUR 321 Visual Journalism
description: Video for digital platforms , principles of photography , design for web and mobile platforms . Introduction to principles of digital news design , interactivity and presentation in interactive storytelling .

name: JOUR 322 Data Journalism
description: Overview of the basic data journalism techniques and tools for statistical analysis ; understanding of numbers and basic statistics as they relate to journalism . Proficiency with gathering , analyzing and visualizing data .

name: JOUR 323 Creating your Digital Footprint and Brand
description: Build a personal website that features a culmination of your previous undergraduate journalism work ; craft a professional digital profile using various social media platforms ; understand the economics of the news business ; prepare to enter the industry .

name: JOUR 372 Engaging Diverse Communities in the Digital Era
description: Explores how to engage diverse local communities through participatory journalism and communication strategies . Focuses on using digital tools to increase engagement with communities via field reporting and mobile platforms to produce stories across platforms .

name: JOUR 408 Advanced Media Law in the Digital Age
description: Advanced examination of the rights of journalists in the American legal system ; understanding the First Amendment and seminal case law to provide a framework for the practice of journalism ; recognizing ethical dilemmas confronting members of the media

name: JOUR 414 Advanced Digital Media Storytelling
description: Production of a well-reported advanced multimedia package , with a blend of text , audio , video , photos , navigation and interactivity ; final projects will be published by the Annenberg Media Center .

name: SPAN 260 Advanced Spanish : Arts and Sciences
description: Development of students’ oral and writing skills using literary and scientific materials ; grammar review .

name: SPAN 290gp Introduction to Latin American and Iberian Studies
description: Introduction to the cultural history of Spain , Portugal and Latin America with a focus on literature and visual works from the early-modern period to the twenty-first century .

name: PORT 300 Introduction to Social and Literary Studies
description: A third year Portuguese course aimed at advanced-level students in Portuguese . Examines and reviews the more complex Portuguese grammatical points , usage , and provide the students further opportunity to perfect their reading , writing and speaking abilities .

name: PORT 302 Introduction to Brazilian Literature
description: An introduction to Brazilian literature and culture exploring how Brazil has been understood and represented through spatial categories that have become , as it were , “common places” in Brazilian literary studies : the rural Brazil of the backlands , the tropical Brazil of the Amazon , the urban and cosmopolitan Brazil of the large cities , and how they relate to questions of identity and difference in the context of Brazilian society .

name: PORT 342 Brazilian Cinema
description: Survey of Brazilian cinema , designed to introduce students to major themes and issues within Brazilian studies through the examination of important Brazilian films within their historical , social and political contexts .

name: Special Problems
description: , 2 , 3 , 4Supervised , individual studies . No more than one registration permitted . Enrollment by petition only .

name: SPAN 311 Advanced Spanish Through Contemporary Issues : Oral Emphasis
description: (Summer sessions abroad .) Advanced Spanish with emphasis on grammar and oral communication .

name: SPAN 341 Advanced Conversation and Culture
description: Conversation based on study of Spanish art and architecture . Field trips .

name: SPAN 352 The Transatlantic Golden Age : New Worlds Real and Imagined
description: Selected readings from 1500 to 1700 exploring Renaissance and baroque visions of the classical and new worlds .

name: SPAN 373 Modern and Postmodern Spanish Fiction
description: An exploration of the literary and filmic narratives of contemporary Spain focusing on the major historical and cultural movements of the 20th century .

name: SPAN 375 Latin American Cultural and Literary Theory
description: (Enroll in COLT 375 )

name: SPAN 382 The Aesthetics of Violence in Latin America
description: An exploration of representations of violence and violent representations in Latin American narrative , poetry , music , and film .

name: SPAN 390 Special Problems
description: , 2 , 3 , 4Supervised , individual studies . No more than one registration permitted . Enrollment by petition only .

name: SPAN 391 Introduction to Contemporary Spanish Literature (USC Madrid Center)
description: Readings in contemporary Spanish literature . Includes lectures by recognized Spanish writers and scholars .

name: SPAN 405 History of the Spanish and Portuguese Languages
description: Development of sounds , forms , words , meanings and structures from their origins to modern Spanish and Portuguese .

name: SPAN 455 Picaresque Itineraries : Empire and Its Discontents
description: A study of the rise of the picaresque novel in Spain and Latin America as a medium for social , political , and cultural criticism .

name: SPAN 460 Don Quijote : Text and Film
description: A close reading of Cervantes’ masterpiece and analysis of film adaptations of the novel .

name: SPAN 464 Introduction to Contemporary Spanish Theatre
description: (Madrid Center only) Historical evolution of the contemporary Spanish theatre ; readings of dramatic texts supported by attendance at live stage performances .

name: SPAN 465 Cultural Perspectives of the Iberian Peninsula
description: (Madrid Summer Program) Study of cultural plurality in the Iberian Peninsula .

name: SPAN 469 Immigration in Spain
description: Sociopolitical issues of immigration in Spain , including economic impact , legal evolution , history , geographic location , and culture .

name: SPAN 470 Literature and Media in Latin America
description: (Enroll in COLT 470 )

name: SPAN 471 Postdictatorship Spanish and Latin American Cinema
description: A study of the historical , cultural and political context of post-dictatorship Spanish and Latin American cinema by focusing on debates on memory and trauma . Taught in Spanish .

name: SPAN 472 The Sixties in Latin America
description: Study of the explosive Latin American cultural formations of the sixties (literary boom , third cinema , protest song , theories of armed struggle) .

name: SPAN 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: SPAN 495 Seminar for Majors and Minors
description: Two options : (1) Study of a major work or writer , a principal literary theme or movement ; or (2) a selected topic in Spanish language and linguistics .

name: SPAN 499 Special Topics
description: Instruction Mode : Lecture Grading Option : Letter

name: Paintings in the Prado Museum
description: Irregular(Madrid Center only) From Romanticism through Goya in relation to European and Mediterranean antecedents using paintings in the Prado Museum . Field trips in conjunction with classwork .

name: AMST 133g Religions of Latin America
description: (Enroll in REL 133g)

name: HIST 353m Race and Racism in the Americas
description: (Enroll in AMST 353 )

name: HIST 371 Culture in Diaspora : The Jews of Spain
description: (Enroll in REL 359 g)

name: HIST 473 Colonial Latin America Seminar
description: The history of colonial Latin America , focusing on the transformation of native Americans and Europeans into participants in a new colonial tradition .

name: Sex , Gender , and Colonialism in Latin America , 1492 to 1820
description: Seminar overview of the historical literature on women , gender , and sexuality in colonial Latin America .

name: PORT 250g Cultures of Brazil and Lusophone Africa
description: Comparative study of Brazil in the context of the Lusophone (Portuguese-speaking) world , especially Portugal’s former colonies in Africa . Materials drawn from literature , visual culture , music and cultural theory .

name: Languages of the World
description: Introduction to the world’s linguistic diversity ; number of languages spoken and where ; grammatical structure and social function of selected languages .

name: LING 401 Advanced Phonology
description: Advanced study of topics in phonology .

name: LING 402 Advanced Syntax
description: Advanced study of topics in syntax .

name: LING 403 Advanced Semantics
description: Topics in the theory of meaning in natural language

name: LING 410 Second Language Acquisition
description: Theories of second language acquisition in children and adults ; comparison of first and second language acquisition including psychological , social , and individual factors .

name: Word and Phrase Origins
description: Introduction to historical-comparative word study ; history of ideas concerning language relationships ; types of semantic change ; hidden metaphors in English word-stock .

name: Field Methodology
description: Elicitation techniques and methodological principles ; recording and analysis of phonological , syntactic , and semantic structures ; practical approaches to procedures used in urban , rural , and “primitive” settings .

name: Honors Thesis
description: Writing of the honors thesis . Registration is restricted to honors students .

name: LING 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: LING 322g Language Contact and Language Acquisition
description: The emergence of new languages , spoken and signed , in socio-historical situations , where linguistic input is degraded and insufficient to support the ordinary language acquisition process .

name: LING 325g Language and Number
description: Analysis of the formal properties of linguistic expressions of number with the goal of understanding the structures that underlie language and numerical reasoning .

name: Geometry and Transformations
description: The Euclidean plane and its isometries . Models for the hyperbolic metric , isometries , linear fractional maps , geodesics . Gluing constructions . Knot theory and invariants .

name: History of Mathematics
description: Evolution of mathematical ideas and techniques as seen through a study of the contributions of eminent mathematicians to the formulation and solution of celebrated problems .

name: AME 101 L Introduction to Mechanical Engineering and Graphics
description: Gateway to the bachelor of science degree in mechanical engineering . Introduction to mechanical engineering disciplines and practice ; graphical communication and layout of machine parts ; introduction to computer-aided drafting and drawing .

name: Turbine Design and Analysis
description: Physics of turbine operation ; design and analysis for the development of turbine hardware for propulsion and power generation .

name: Mechanical Design
description: Design and analysis of mechanical elements including shafts , bearings , springs , screws , belts and gears ; strength , fatigue and deflection considerations in machine design .

name: Senior Design Project
description: Modeling , analysis , integration , layout and performance analysis of a mechanical system to meet specified design requirements .

name: Engineering Design Theory and Methodology
description: Product planning and task clarification , voice of customers , quality function deployment , conceptual and embodiment design , axiomatic theory of design , product quality and manufacturability , design decision-making .

name: Dynamics of Machinery
description: Kinematics and dynamics of machines ; balancing of rotating and reciprocating machinery ; gyroscopic effects ; critical speeds ; energy variation in machinery ; introduction to mechanism design .

name: AME 423 L Loudspeaker and Sound-System Design
description: (Enroll in EE 423Lx )

name: IML 201 The Languages of Digital Media
description: An in-depth investigation of the close interrelationships among technology , culture and communication to form a solid foundation for digital authoring .

name: IML 230 Fundamentals of Media Design
