description: Introduction to the methods of visual design with respect to digital media authorship . Exploring the creative process through various conceptual workflows and hands-on techniques .

name: IML 288 Critical Thinking and Procedural Media
description: Investigation of the potentials of computational media to define new aesthetics , modes of representation and structures of communication .

name: IML 295Lm Race , Class and Gender in Digital Culture
description: Critical analysis of the categories of race , class and gender within the diverse digital spaces of contemporary culture , from video games to the digital divide .

name: IML 300 Reading and Writing the Web
description: An introduction to a broad range of technical and theoretical issues surrounding the production of web-based content .

name: IML 328 Sonic Media Art
description: Survey of audio culture and sound technologies , focusing on developing sonic literacy and creating artwork using sound as a primary modality .

name: IML 335 Digital Narrative Design I
description: An introduction to audio and video techniques for digital storytelling across various platforms . Students will create multiple short-form projects using contemporary tools and technologies .

name: IML 354 Introduction to 3-D Modeling
description: An introduction to the history , theory and critical context of 3-D spatial representation , as well as foundational authoring skills in modeling interactive 3-D spaces .

name: IML 202 Media Arts and Practice Studio I
description: Intermediate laboratory exploring the foundations of visual culture through a series of critical design prompts . Emphasis on the creative process , project documentation and the development of a personal design methodology .

name: IML 203 Media Arts and Practice Studio II
description: Intermediate laboratory exploring computational systems through a series of critical design prompts . Emphasis on digital representation , time-based processes , abstract data and the relationship between humans and computers .

name: IML 310 Professionalism for Media Arts
description: Development of documentation and archival strategies , with an emphasis on techniques of personal and professional representation .

name: IML 404 Tactical Media
description: Examination of existing and emergent media technologies , focusing on creative and critical tactics for empowering users to explore the full potentials of software and hardware .

name: IML 428 Exploring and Creating Sonic Environments
description: Exploration of spatial sound practices , focusing on sound installation art , sonic visualization and audio storytelling techniques .

name: IML 435 Digital Narrative Design II
description: Exploration of advanced techniques in digital audio and video storytelling . Emphasis on nonlinearity , computer graphics , sound design and networked media .

name: IML 436 Hypercinemas Studio
description: A hands-on exploration of emerging cinematic technologies , situated within a historical context through both theoretical and practical analysis .

name: IML 454 Advanced Techniques of Spatial Representation
description: Studio class exploring spatial perception and advanced techniques of 3-D representation , stereoscopy , panorama , projection mapping , modeling for real-time environments , parametric modeling , and 3-D fabrication .

name: IML 441 Thesis Project I
description: Exploration of theoretical and practical concerns of advanced digital media authorship .

name: IML 444 Thesis Project II
description: Production of a digital thesis project .

name: IML 309 Integrative Design for Mobile Devices
description: Hands-on investigation of opportunities and challenges offered by mobile interaction within both cultural and ideological contexts .

name: IML 320 Designing and Writing for Transmedia Narratives
description: Creating a story that uses three or more digital platforms (video , social media , games , comics , et cetera) with strategies drawn from entertainment , art and activism .

name: IML 365 Future Cinema
description: Examination of the history of cinematic experimentation to provide a framework for understanding contemporary virtual reality , augmented reality , interactive installations and large-scale urban screens .

name: Design Fiction and Speculative Futures
description: The history , theory and methods of design fiction , focusing on design videos and physical prototypes as tools for exploring contemporary social , political and ethical life .

name: IML 422 Information Visualization
description: Visualizing information through diverse media platforms , with a focus on critical analysis and hands-on visualization .

name: IML 450 Critical Play and Documentary Games
description: Investigation of the history and theory of games designed to prompt social change , with a hands-on component in the creation of documentary game projects .

name: IML 456 Nature , Design and Media
description: Investigation of the impact of natural patterns on digital media design . Explores the relationships among chaos , harmony , beauty , proportion , spirituality , holistic systems and shaped experience .

name: IML 458 The Embedded Story : Designing Digital Landscapes and Languages
description: Exploration of the imagined territories where language and landscape originate , converge and are transformed . Students will collaborate to create media in cross-platform environments .

name: IML 475 Media Arts Research Lab
description: A hands-on mentored research lab experience within the context of media art and in association with a real-world project .

name: IML 477 Embodied Storytelling and Immersive Docu-Narratives
description: Examination of art , media , and theatre , to create an immersive , installation-based intervention utilizing the embodied 360-degree docu-narrative form .

name: IML 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics in multimedia literacy .

name: ARAB 252 Arabic IV
description: Continuation of Arabic III . Continued development of speaking , listening , reading , and writing skills in Modern Standard Arabic .

name: IRAN 250 Persian IV
description: Continuing Intermediate Persian (Farsi) . Building conversational skills , listening and reading comprehension , grammar and vocabulary necessary for intermediate level spoken and written expression .

name: MDES 301g The Global Middle East
description: Explores the modern Middle East by focusing on the process of globalization .

name: CLAS 378 Ptolemaic Egypt
description: Social , cultural , and political history of Egypt from Alexander to Cleopatra ; state formation ; immigration and cultural interaction between ethnic groups .

name: COLT 437 Arabic Autobiography : Writing and Interpreting the Self
description: Exploration of twentieth-century Arabic autobiographical writings and interrogation of the complex ways by which such works unsettle fundamental assumptions of literary history and modernity .

name: COLT 447 Traveling Genres : Politics/Poetics of Modern Arabic Prose
description: Introduction to nineteenth-century Arabic travel-writing and investigation of its role in the reconfiguration of the Arabic tradition at the interface of aesthetics and politics .

name: MDES 312 Shadow of God on Earth : Religion/Politics in Medieval Persia
description: Political and dynastic history of Iran from the Arab conquest in the 7th to the 18th century .

name: MDES 313 Modern Iran : Fall of Monarchies and Rise of Islamic Republic
description: History and culture of modern Iran from the nineteenth century to present through historical and ethnographic approaches to Iran today , richly contextualizing events and people .

name: MDES 314p Political Thought in the Middle East
description: Major strands of Islamic political thought from early Islam through the classical Islamic period to contemporary developments and transformations .

name: Classical Persian Literature in Translation
description: Introduction to literary culture of premodern Persia , from about 800–1800 AD . Emphasis on poetry , the most extensive , prestigious , and influential medium of Persian literature .

name: MDES 325g Politics of Film and Literature in Modern Iran
description: Explores contemporary Iranian society through the study of social tensions created by poverty-wealth , tradition-modernity , masculinity-femininity , and notions of religio-political authority as reflected in the literature and films of the country .

name: MDES 343g Modern Arab State and Society II : Culture and Literature
description: Examines contemporary Arab state-society relations using literature to illustrate how people construct meanings and portray issues of national , social , and cultural significance .

name: MDES 461 Topics in Ancient Iranian Languages and Cultures
description: Studies and readings in one or more pre-modern Iranian languages and their cultural and historical contexts . Specific topics vary ; may be repeated for credit .

name: History of Islamic Law
description: Examines legal methods and religious sources used in Islamic law . Emphasis is placed on the way cultural developments affect legal thought and the administration of justice .

name: IR 464 US-Middle East Foreign Policy Issues
description: U .S . and Middle East perspectives on Middle Eastern affairs after the creation of the state of Israel .

name: MDES 340 Perspectives on US Foreign Policy in the Middle East
description: Presents critical perspectives to analyze U .S . foreign policy in the Middle East , including the discourses surrounding energy security , military interventionism , globalization , democracy promotion , and terrorism .

name: MDES 342g Modern Arab State and Society I : Media and Intellectual Works
description: Surveys prominent debates in the Arab world , examining how media and intellectual production reflect , shape , and/or contest prevailing ideas and practices in the public sphere .

name: ARAB 300 Introduction to Translation
description: Introduces students to the fundamentals of Arabic-English translation and offers analytical , linguistic and cross-cultural factors affecting interpreting and translation .

name: ARAB 322 Advanced Arabic I
description: Advanced expression in written and spoken Arabic , including reading of original texts , understanding different registers , and exposure to modern Arabic cultures .

name: ARAB 333 Colloquial Arabic : Regional Dialects
description: Introduction to a regional Arabic dialect , focusing primarily on verbal skills .

name: ARAB 334 Media Arabic
description: Introduction and development of language skills encountered in print and broadcast media Arabic .

name: ARAB 352 Advanced Arabic II
description: Continuation of Advanced Arabic I .

name: IRAN 320 Advanced Persian I
description: Advanced verbal and written expression in Persian , including deeper understanding of Persian culture .

name: IRAN 350 Advanced Persian II
description: Continuation of Advanced Persian I .

name: MDES 345p Sovereignty in the Middle East
description: The evolution of the concept and practice of sovereignty in the Middle East , pre-modern to the present , focusing on reciprocal nature of power and authority .

name: MUHL 231 Music History
description: A study of the musical styles and genres from antiquity to c . 1680 within their historical context . Detailed analysis of selected works .

name: MUHL 232 Music History II
description: A study of the musical styles and genres from c . 1680 to c . 1850 within their historical context . Detailed analysis of selected works .

name: MUHL 331 Music History III
description: A study of the musical styles and genres from c . 1850 to the present within their historical context . Detailed analysis of selected works .

name: MUHL 332 Studies in Musical Culture
description: ecial musical repertoires , issues , and critical problems ; emphasis determined by the department .

name: Communications in the Music Industry
description: A survey of the music industry communications including radio , television , film , satellite communications , records , compact disc , cassette , cable and any future forms of transmission and delivery systems .

name: Introduction to Music Law
description: A study of entertainment law with a focus on the music industry . Areas of study include contracts , domestic practices , international practices , copyright protection , trademarks .

name: MUIN 450 Practicum in Music Industry Issues (Internship)
description: Field application of music industry theories and practices ; part-time employment . Project jointly defined by student , employer and professor .

name: Music Publishing and Licensing
description: A contemporary survey of the methods used to monetize music through licensing/media placement , covering music publishing , songwriter agreements , performance rights and licenses for traditional/new media .

name: Radio in the Music Industry
description: A survey of radio ; its operation and effect on the music industry . Topics include advertising , playlists , program direction , FCC , networks , news , promotion , payola and format development .

name: Live Music Production and Promotion
description: A survey of the presentation of the live musical experience . Both classical and popular concert presentation will be examined including venue selection , promotion and security .

name: Artist Management and Development
description: A study of issues relating to the personal management of music artists including negotiating contracts , image , career development , agents , touring , merchandising , fees and duties .

name: Manufacture and Distribution of Musical Products
description: An in-depth study of musical instrument manufacture and distribution in the United States . Topics covered include sheet music , instrument rentals , lessons and band operations .

name: Arts Management
description: A survey of the management of non-profit and for-profit arts organizations with emphasis on funding , donor development tax status and promotion .

name: The Business of Music for Visual Media
description: Introduction to music designed for synchronization to picture including history of music in cinema , music editing , supervision , performance rights licensing , production , and music scoring procedures .

name: International Music Industry
description: A survey of international operations of music distribution , publishing , touring , law , promotion , customs and practices .

name: Web Design for the Music Industry
description: A hands-on experience in which students work in teams to create web sites specifically designed to promote , market , and sell musical artists’ products online .

name: MTEC 175 Fundamentals of Audio Recording
description: Introduction to the principles and techniques of audio recording . Students will gain a basic understanding of signal flow , gain structure , microphones , monitoring systems , signal processing , mixing .

name: MTEC 176 Critical Listening
description: Introductory course where students will develop an understanding of audio quality , the musical aspects of audio production and the vocabulary necessary to offer audio critique .

name: MTEC 275 Fundamentals of Audio Engineering
description: Fundamentals of Audio Engineering is an intermediate course in the principles and techniques of professional audio production as related to music .

name: The Business and Economics of the Recording Industry
description: Economic considerations of home , studio and location recording . Equipment , labor , facilities , media , legal and tax considerations will be explored .

name: Introduction to Sound Reinforcement
description: An introduction to the practical application of large scale sound reinforcement for concerts , sporting events , church services and convention situations .

name: MTEC 389 Digital Equipment and Recording
description: Digital equipment including computers , sequencers , digital signal synthesis , MIDI , and rotary and stationary digital recording .

name: MTEC 392a Acoustics and Speaker Design
description: Principles of acoustics relating to studio construction , wall treatment , and furnishings ; natural reverberation , speaker materials , passive and active crossovers and time alignment .

name: MTEC 442 Operation of the Radio Studio
description: An in-depth study of radio studio technical operations . Topics include consoles , microphones , transmission considerations , networks , satellites , and digital and analog production situations .

name: Advanced Sound Reinforcement
description: Special problems of multimedia mixing with simultaneous audio re-processing for live performance situations including rigging , house mix , monitor mix , venues and power distribution .

name: MTEC 477 Remote Recording Techniques
description: ecial problems of location recording ; specialized equipment ; microphone design and operation .

name: MTEC 478 Advanced Multichannel Remix
description: ecial problems of multi-channel re-mixing with simultaneous audio re-processing . Album , film , television and multimedia formats will be covered .

name: MTEC 479 Audio Mastering
description: A survey of the final creative steps of an audio CD . Concepts of acoustics , mastering suite design , critical listening , frequency , dynamics and sequencing .

name: MTEC 494 Classical Music Recording
description: Principles of classical music recording with emphasis on history , equipment , techniques , and locations . Differences in orchestral , choral , opera , and small ensemble recording .

name: Music Media Solutions
description: Group study of one current music media issue , focusing on possible solutions with practical applications . Stress on leadership , critical thinking , and professional practices .

name: BAEP 450 Fundamentals of Entrepreneurship
description: Starting and managing one’s own business : developing a viable concept , organizing the enterprise , market and financial planning , and controlling the organization .

name: BAEP 451 The Management of New Enterprises
description: Development of analytical and conceptual skills in entrepreneurship and venture management .

name: MPPM 100 Popular Music Forum
description: A weekly lecture series addressing a wide range of special topics and issues confronting the popular musician .

name: MUIN 497 Current Topics , Case Studies , and Analysis
description: Exploration of emerging topics and trends in business and technology in the music and entertainment industries .

name: MUIN 372 Business and Legal Aspects of the Music Industry
description: An intermediate/advanced-level survey of music copyright law , artist contract analysis , infringement case studies as they affect modern/emerging business models and global music licensing .

name: MUIN 444 Music Supervision
description: An advanced focus on the music supervisor’s role , working with directors , producers , licensing representatives and executives to select , budget and clear songs for broadcast/new media .

name: Advanced Concert Management
description: Application of theories , technologies , and practices of the live music industry . Focus on the business , management , marketing , promotion , and production of professional concert events .

name: MUIN 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: MTEC 486 Computer-Assisted Music Editing for Picture
description: Techniques and applications of recording , editing and synchronizing music and sounds to film , video or games , using time code and personal computers .

name: MTEC 493 Audio Signal Processing Equipment
description: Principles and design characteristics of digital and analog signal processing equipment including plate reverb , digital reverbs , synchronizers , digital editing systems and mastering systems .

name: MKT 385x Marketing of Creative Disruption and Innovation
description: Learn to use fundamental principles of marketing , branding , and consumer behavior to successfully market disruptively innovative products including goods , services , and ideas .

name: Marketing , Branding and Strategic Alliances in Music
description: An in-depth study of music marketing , non-traditional revenue streams for artists , musicians , and labels including artist endorsements , artist tour sponsorships , digital music programs , music licensing , merchandise , and a primary focus on brand partnership deals in the music space .

name: DIY Music Marketing
description: An exploration of the most current and effective marketing strategies and online branding tools for promoting , monetizing , and sustaining the career of the independent creative artist .

name: Classic Rock : Popular Music of the Sixties and Seventies
description: Critical examination of the lyrics , structure , associated mythology , technology , and evolving styles of popular music reflecting the turbulent societal changes during the Sixties and Seventies .

name: MUSC 424 Iconic Figures of Popular Music
description: Music , life , recordings , and attendant musical , cultural and political influences of a seminal musician or group in 20th or 21st century popular music .

name: American Roots Music : History and Culture
description: IrregularThe history , genre , styles , songs , lyrics , and influences of American vernacular music in the 20th century , including the background that spawned these musical genres .

name: Beginning Pop/Rock Guitar
description: Introduction to the performance technique of pop/rock guitar as well as music theory fundamentals , exploring repertoire by artists such as The Beatles and Dave Matthews .

name: Intensive Beginning Pop/Rock Guitar
description: Introduction to the performance technique of pop/rock guitar as well as music theory fundamentals , exploring repertoire by artists such as The Beatles and Dave Matthews .

name: Beginning Piano
description: Techniques of performance , note reading , and basic musicianship .

name: Keyboard Proficiency for the Popular Musician
description: Development of practical keyboard skills , including reading and realizing chord symbols , basics of voice leading , study of various harmonic and rhythmic styles .

name: Intermediate Drum Set Proficiency
description: Intermediate level instruction in drum set performance including accompaniment techniques , fills , beat and brush patterns in jazz , Afro-Caribbean and Brazilian styles , interpreting drum charts .

name: MPVA 141 Class Voice
description: Introduction to the fundamental principles of singing : breath control , tone production , diction , and the use of appropriate song material .

name: MPVA 241 Intermediate Class Voice
description: Continued development of the fundamentals of singing , diction , and repertoire building .

name: MUCO 101 x Fundamentals of Music Theory
description: An introductory course in music theory required for those majors in need of remedial training , and available to the general student who wishes to develop music writing skills .

name: MUCO 130a x Basics of Music Theory
description: Introduction to music theory ; scales , intervals , principles of common practice and popular music harmony ; melodic , harmonic , and structural analysis ; 20th century developments .

name: Songwriting I
description: Development of musical and lyrical skills , composing , listening , analysis , and critiques of popular original music .

name: MUSC 355 Songwriting II
description: Continuation of Songwriting I ; particular emphasis on the analysis of the techniques of important popular songwriters and the application of these techniques to original songs .

name: MUSC 455 Songwriting III : The Performing Songwriter
description: Continuation of Songwriting I and II with emphasis on the development of performance skills of original popular music in preparation for songwriting showcases .

name: Final Capstone Project
description: Culmination of the four-year course of study . Affords students the opportunity to experience guided work to meet the professional demands of the industry .

name: Music Production I
description: Study of small ensemble (rhythm section , vocal , background vocals) music production in a variety of popular music styles .

name: Music Production II
description: all group instruction to develop the student’s arranging , production and project management skills as related to small budget music and multimedia projects .

name: MTEC 430 Advanced Instrumental Recording
description: An in-depth study of the standard practices and techniques used in contemporary multi-track recording .

name: MTEC 491 The Recording Console
description: Introduction to professional analog audio consoles and their use in recording and mixing music for records , video and film .

name: Harmony in Popular Music
description: Study of harmony used in the popular music idiom , as well as diminished chord patterns , modulation techniques , basic modal theory , and principles of melodic construction .

name: MPPM 325a Arranging in Popular Music
description: Principles and techniques of arranging for voice and rhythm section in the popular music idiom .

name: Senior Project
description: Culmination of the four-year course of study intended to afford students the opportunity to pursue a mentored project to advance their future careers .

name: Aesthetics and the Film
description: Problems in the philosophy of art raised by film , such as the notion of “cinematic” ; the nature of interpretation of films ; criteria for evaluating films .

name: CTWR 412 Introduction to Screenwriting
description: Introduction to the formal elements of writing the short film .

name: Advanced Writing
description: Principles of the feature film ; creating theme , character and structure that combine into a feature-length story treatment .

name: ENGL 105x Creative Writing for Non-Majors
description: Introductory workshop in writing poetry , short fiction and nonfiction for love of the written and spoken word .

name: Writing Narrative
description: Introduction to the techniques and practice of writing narrative in fiction and literary non-fiction .

name: ENGL 402 Narrative Composition
description: Intermediate practical workshop concentrating on the creation of narrative in fiction and literary nonfiction .

name: Playwriting I
description: Essential elements of playwriting through weekly assignments , students’ initiative , occasional productions of scenes , and extensive classroom analysis .

name: Playwriting II
description: Continuation of the work begun in THTR 365  .

name: Religion in the Borderlands
description: (Enroll in REL 333 )

name: Chinese Fiction
description: Development of Chinese fiction and readings from English translations of major Chinese novels such as the Dream of the Red Chamber , All Men are Brothers , and others . Conducted in English .

name: ENGL 444m Native American Literature
description: Survey of Native American literature , including oral traditions and print genres , such as short story , poetry , novel , and autobiography , from 1700 to the present .

name: GERM 360g 20th Century German Prose : Texts and Films
description: Aesthetic and historical analysis of major German 20th century novels , complemented by brief study of cinematic adaptation of each text . Texts in English ; films with subtitles .

name: THTR 210 Theory and Practice of World Theatre I
description: A multicultural and transnational examination of the history , theory and practice of theatre from its origins to the age of Shakespeare and Zeami .

name: THTR 211g Theory and Practice of World Theatre II
description: A multicultural and transnational examination of the history , theory and practice of theatre from the Renaissance to the 19th Century .

name: Ancient Epic
description: Representative epics of the Greek and Roman world ; development of the character of the hero ; later influences .

name: CLAS 337gp Ancient Drama
description: Tragedies and comedies of the ancient world ; later influences .

name: Approaches to Myth
description: Advanced study of uses and interpretations of myth . Approaches include myth and ritual ; psychology ; gender ; myth in literature , film and art .

name: English Literature of the 18th Century (1660–1780)
description: Selected studies in poetry , prose , and fiction of such writers as Defoe , Dryden , Fielding , Richardson , Pope , Swift , and Johnson .

name: English Literature of the Romantic Age (1780–1832)
description: Selected studies in major writers , including Blake , Austen , Wordsworth , Coleridge , Byron , Mary Shelley , P .B . Shelley , and Keats .

name: English Literature of the Victorian Age (1832–1890)
description: Selected studies in the prose and poetry of such figures as Tennyson , Dickens , the Brontes , the Brownings , Hopkins , Arnold , Ruskin , and Newman .

name: Modern English Literature (1890–1945)
description: Studies in English literary modernism , including the prose of Conrad , Joyce , and Woolf and the poetry of Pound , Eliot , Yeats , and Auden .

name: Shakespeare
description: Major history plays , comedies , and tragedies .

name: American Literature to 1865
description: American poetry and prose to the Civil War with special attention to Irving , Cooper , Poe , Hawthorne , Emerson , Thoreau , Melville , and Whitman .

name: American Literature , 1865 to 1920
description: American poetry and prose with special attention to Twain , James , Dickinson , Henry Adams , Crane , and Dreiser .

name: German Prose Fiction from Goethe to Thomas Mann
description: Examines German prose fiction from the late 18th to the early 20th centuries , with particular emphasis on how narrative texts are constructed . In English .

name: GERM 372g Literature and Culture in Berlin in the 1920s
description: Literature , culture , and society through works by figures such as Kaiser , Toller , Brecht/Weill , Piscator , Th . Mann , Doeblin , Lukacs , Heidegger , etc . Films : Caligari , Metropolis , Berlin , M , Blue Angel . In English .

name: SLL 344g Tolstoy : Writer and Moralist
description: Tolstoy’s major works in the context of his ethical views . Readings and lectures in English .

name: SLL 345g Literature and Philosophy : Dostoevsky
description: Dostoevsky’s novels as psychological and philosophical analyses of modern alienated man . Readings in Dostoevsky and selections from Gide , Kafka , Camus , and Sartre . Conducted in English .

name: Russian Drama and the Western Tradition
description: Representative plays from the 18th century to the present . Development of the Russian theater in the European context . Conducted in English .

name: EALC 354g Modern Chinese Literature in Translation
description: Readings in modern Chinese poetry , fiction , and drama since 1919 .

name: ENGL 361g Contemporary Prose
description: Study of prose written in English since 1945 , principally fiction of the past two decades .

name: ENGL 363g Contemporary Drama
description: Selected British , Irish , and American drama from the post World War II period (1945 to the present) .

name: SLL 348g The Novels of Vladimir Nabokov
description: Survey of Vladimir Nabokov’s novels written in Europe and America from the 1920s–1960s . Primary focus on the structure of the novels and their themes of art and emigration . Readings in English .

name: THTR 300 Introduction to Modern Drama
description: An investigation of the ideas , forms , genres , and thematic concerns of modern drama . Equal emphasis is placed on the plays and their historical contexts .

name: ENGL 492 Narrative Studies Capstone Seminar
description: Individual research , reading , writing and project development as a senior capstone experience in the study of narrative .

name: MDA 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research , reading , writing and project development .

name: MDA 494 Directed Creative Project
description: Individual research , reading , writing and project development , guided by a faculty member with expertise in the area , who may be tenure-track or nontenure- track .

name: BISC 408 Systems Neuroscience : From Synapses to Perception
description: Sensory systems to illustrate basic concepts regarding the functional organization of the brain , from the microscopic arrangement of neural circuits to global processes such as perception .

name: Applications of Molecular Biology to Medicine
description: Advances and trends in the understanding , diagnosis and treatment of human diseases .

name: Advanced Cell Biology
description: The synthesis , transport and assembly of the complex structures that mediate eukaryotic cellular function . Electrical and biochemical mechanisms underlying intercellular communication .

name: BISC 422L Neurobiology Laboratory
description: Experimentation on excitable cells , synapses , and neural circuits ; intracellular and extra cellular techniques for recording , stimulation , and identification of nerve and muscle cells .

name: BISC 426 Principles of Neural Development
description: Basic phenomena and principles of neural development , their relation to functional development of neural circuits , behavior , and disease . General concepts and experimental approaches are emphasized .

name: Neuroaffective Disorders of Aging
description: Methods of studying , evaluating , and treating cognitive , psychiatric , and behavioral problems associated with medical conditions of old age .

name: Mathematical and Computational Methods for Neuroscience
description: Differential calculus of multivariable functions , optimization , elementary linear algebra and matrix theory , principal component analysis , elementary differential equations , systems , qualitative theory , numerical methods , scientific computation .

name: NEUR 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: PSYC 426 Motivated Behaviors and Addiction
description: OtherSocial , environmental , and physiological influences on behaviors associated with aggression , eating , reproduction , and sleep . Will focus on behavioral disorders such as addiction .

name: ECON 238xg Political Economy and Social Issues
description: Contending politico-economic perspectives in modern Western thought : conservatism , liberalism , radicalism , and their relevance for contemporary policy issues including government and markets , class , race , gender , poverty and inequality .

name: American Environmentalism
description: (Enroll in GEOG 255 )

name: Introduction to Environmental Law and Politics
description: (Enroll in POSC 270 )

name: IR 101gxw International Relations
description: Basic concepts of world affairs for non-majors . Development of competency to understand and critically evaluate global relations and international events , stressing empirical approaches .

name: PHIL 141gp The Professions and the Public Interest in American Life
description: The study of the nature and role of professionals in life and society , forces that shape and direct them , foundations and applications of professional ethics .

name: SOCI 150gm Social Problems
description: Analysis of factors in current American social problems : crime , delinquency , prostitution , family disorganization , race relations , mental illness .

name: SOCI 255g Sociology of Globalization
description: This course examines globalization through social and economic processes and its consequences for social conflict , economic development , human rights , social movements , and national identity .

name: SOCI 313L Sociological Research Methods
description: Logic of theory construction , research design , elementary data collection and analysis .

name: History of Modern Political Philosophy
description: Analysis of some of the main political philosophies of the modern era ; emphasis on the ethical and metaphysical foundations of political philosophy .

name: Social and Political Philosophy
description: The nature of man and society , the nature and justification of state and government , political rights and political obligation , justice and equality .

name: POSC 380 Political Theories and Social Reform
description: or 4Political theories and philosophies in modern times and their relation to public policy and social reform .

name: Sociological Theory
description: Historical and contemporary approaches to sociological theory ; analysis of conceptual frameworks applied to the study of society and social interaction .

name: SOCI 250gmw Grassroots Participation in Global Perspective
description: Theory and history behind the ideal of “the local , grassroots volunteer” : a direct link between theory and research using Los Angeles as a case study .

name: SOCI 408 Volunteers , Non-Governmental Organizations , and Everyday Pol
description: Theory , practice , and history of civic life . Examines communication , personal obligation , collective imagination , and political representation , in grassroots , state-sponsored , and non-governmental organization-sponsored civic associations around the world .

name: ANTH 357g Cultures of Genocide
description: The comparative analysis of genocide in different cultures and historical moments in order to understand the processes through which genocide has been perpetuated , as well as different cultural responses to it .

name: PHIL 340 Ethics
description: Study of major philosophical theories of moral right and wrong , such as utilitarianism , Kantianism , egoism , virtue ethics , and theological ethics .

name: Urban Political Problems
description: Social problems and governmental policy in the urban environment , emphasizing such problem areas as education , environment , race , police and the system of criminal justice , and poverty .

name: International Law
description: Nature , origin , and development of international law ; basic principles analyzed and illustrated with cases .

name: POSC 347 Environmental Law
description: Introduces students to central concepts and theories in environmental law and regulation ; analyzes present environmental laws and regulations .

name: POSC 381 Sex , Power , and Politics
description: An evaluation of the ways in which different ideologies , institutions , and policies contribute to differences in political power between men and women .

name: SOCI 402 Human Trafficking
description: Interrogates the social construction of the legal category “human trafficking ,” examining the ideological foundations , the social contentions , and political issues surrounding the issue .

name: SOCI 429 Immigration , Work and Labor
description: Examination of the experiences of racial minorities in the labor market , niche concentration , the effects of globalization on labor migration , entrepreneurship , discrimination , and minorities in white-collar occupations .

name: SOCI 430m Work and the Workplace
description: Contrasting views of work in contemporary societies ; technological change in the workplace ; opportunity , inequality , conflict , and alienation in different occupations .

name: SOCI 464 Sociology of Gender and Work
description: Examination of gender inequality in the U .S . labor market ; work-family conflict ; employer remedies ; comparative social policy .

name: Introduction to Social Entrepreneurship
description: Analysis of social enterprise models from micro-finance to job development . Analysis of basic issues regarding the difference between socially responsible companies , for-profit , and non-profit-run enterprises .

name: Business Communication Management for Nonprofits
description: Communication environment ; communication activities for fundraising and visibility ; research and evaluation methods ; grant proposals ; strategies for communicating social mission to media , government and for-profit partners .

name: Public Communication Campaigns
description: Theory and research in public health communication campaigns ; design , implementation , and evaluation ; extensive discussion of historical case studies and reasons for success or failure .

name: Communication and Social Movements
description: Social and political movements as rhetorical phenomena ; ideology , organization , and influence of such movements as civil rights , “New Left ,” feminism , “New Right ,” environmentalism .

name: Communication and Global Organizations
description: The role of communication in global organizations ; information , networks , and communication technologies for global organizing ; computer-based collaborative work and virtual organizations .

name: Policy and Program Development in Aging
description: Policy trends and changing roles of local , state , and federal agencies in planning , managing , and evaluating programs in comprehensive , coordinated systems of service for older persons .

name: POSC 323 Applied Politics
description: Provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become active in politics based on understanding the history , theory , and practices of public participation .

name: PPD 318 Financial Accounting in Public and Nonprofit Organizations
description: Basic accounting principles and concepts necessary for the preparation and understanding of financial statements ; accounting for service organizations in the public/nonprofit sector ; fund accounting .

name: Organizations : Bureaucracy and Alternatives to Bureaucracy
description: Importance of organizations in social life ; techniques for using and changing organizations ; examination of strategies for building and sustaining nonbureaucratic organizations .

name: SOCI 425 Crowds , Publics , and Social Movements
description: Spontaneous , expressive and creative forms that support or revolutionize society , including topics such as audiences , student unrest , tax revolts , patriotism , uprisings , and women’s movements .

name: Adolescent Gang Intervention
description: The incidence of gangs (particularly in the Los Angeles area) , gang interventions , and policies developed to address the growing gang situation .

name: Medical Terminology for Health Professions
description: Foundation of medical terminology and hospital abbreviations useful for practice in health care .

name: OT 251 x Across the Lifespan : Occupations , Health and Disability
description: Exploration of the transformative power of occupation throughout the lifespan for all individuals .

name: OT 260 Human Functional Anatomy for Allied Health Professions
description: Lecture and cadaver lab-based , human anatomy course focused on the interaction of anatomical systems relative to functional activity , health and wellness .

name: OT 261 Human Physiology for Allied Health Professions
description: Overview of human physiology emphasizing systems that sustain homeostasis and motion with a focus on biological foundations for a healthy lifestyle . Relevant pathophysiologic issues discussed .

name: OT 405 Foundations : Occupation
description: Introduction to basic tenets of occupational therapy history and practice , the profession’s language , and foundations of occupational science ; incorporates experience and self-analysis of occupation .

name: OT 406L Foundations : Creativity , Craft and Activity Analysis
description: Exploration of craftsmanship in both historical and contemporary contexts ; engagement in the craft experience to encourage creativity and to develop proficiency in analysis of performance .

name: OT 440L Foundations : Kinesiology
description: Review of joint and muscle structure and function ; application of basic biomechanical , neuromuscular and musculoskeletal principles to the analysis of everyday activities and therapeutic interventions .

name: OT 441L Foundations : Neuroscience
description: Application of basic neural function to the analysis of daily living tasks and activities ; review of pathological conditions that interfere with performance in occupation .

name: OT 511 Therapeutic Use of Self
description: Exploration of efficacy , therapeutic use of self , empathy and mindfulness ; development of self-awareness to support the art , craft and skill of effective therapeutic relationships .

name: OT 515 Neuroscience of Behavior
description: Foundation for understanding neural functions involved in typical/atypical behaviors ; review of neural circuitry , experimental methods , basic behavioral systems , higher order cognitive functions and associated disorders .

name: OT 518 Quantitative Research for Evidence-Based Practice
description: Traditions and methods of quantitative research ; emphasis on formulation of clear clinical questions ; finding , evaluating , and applying evidence to a clinical problem ; includes journal club .

name: OT 521 Clinical Reasoning
description: Dynamic look at creation and application of professional knowledge and expertise ; examines interrelationship between theory and practice ; incorporates narrative and illness experiences in clinical reasoning .

name: OT 523 Communication Skills for Effective Practice
description: Principles of written , verbal and non-verbal communication with professionals , clients and families , from a personal and professional perspective ; group interventions ; interview skills ; advocacy as communication .

name: OT 525 Qualitative Research for Evidence-Based Practice
description: Traditions and methods of qualitative research ; development of skills for research design , implementation and dissemination ; critique of qualitative research for evidence-based practice and occupational science .

name: OT 501L Practice Immersion : Adult Physical Rehabilitation
description: Scientific and theoretical underpinnings and knowledge and skills necessary for occupational therapy evaluation and intervention in adult rehabilitation and geriatrics ; incorporates related Level I Fieldwork .

name: OT 502L Practice Immersion : Mental Health
description: Scientific and theoretical underpinnings and knowledge and skills necessary for occupational therapy evaluation and intervention in mental health practice ; incorporates related Level I Fieldwork .

name: OT 503L Practice Immersion : Pediatrics
description: Scientific and theoretical underpinnings and knowledge and skills necessary for occupational therapy evaluation and intervention in pediatrics ; incorporates related Level I Fieldwork .

name: MPGU 257 Classical Guitar Performance Class
description: Technical problems ; solo and ensemble literature ; interpretation ; professional preparation . Required of first and second year Classical Guitar majors each semester in residence .

name: MPGU 457 Classical Guitar Performance Class
description: Technical problems ; solo and ensemble literature . Required of all third and fourth year classical guitar majors each semester in residence .

name: Functional Skills for Studio Guitarists I
description: Study of technique , theory and aural skills as applied to guitar ; fingerboard organization of melodic and chordal topics ; sight reading .

name: Functional Skills for Classical Guitarists I
description: Fundamentals of music theory experienced through the medium of the classical guitar . Topics include analysis of important guitar works , basso continuo realization , arranging , and improvisation .

name: Advanced Classical Guitar Techniques
description: An in-depth exploration of the most advanced facets of classical guitar technique .

name: Classical Guitar Pedagogy
description: Teaching techniques and literature ; function of the hands ; acoustical properties of instruments .

name: MPGU 426 Classical Guitar History and Literature
description: A survey of music for the guitar , lute and vihuela from 1500 to the present .

name: MPGU 427 Advanced Topics in Classical Guitar History and Literature
description: An in-depth study of major works for lute , vihuela and classical guitar , with emphasis on early music and the music of the 20th century .

name: Functional Skills for Classical Guitarists II
description: Advanced theory and composition on the guitar . Weekly analysis exercises , arranging projects and studies in improvisation and ornamentation are directed toward creating an original solo or chamber work for guitar .

name: MPWP 252 Individual Instrument Performance Class I
description: Solo and orchestra repertoire , professional preparation , reed making , and other matters appropriate to group study . Required of all first and second year wind and percussion majors each semester in residence .

name: MPWP 452 Individual Instrument Performance Class II
description: Solo and orchestra repertoire , professional preparation , reed making , and other matters appropriate to group study . Required of all third and fourth year wind and percussion majors each semester in residence .

name: MUEN 323 University Wind Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and participation in concert programs .

name: MUEN 325 Wind and Percussion Chamber Music
description: Performance of chamber music for wind and percussion instruments .

name: Instrumental Conducting II
description: Principal composers and representative instrumental works since the 18th century ; studies of styles and interpretations based on scores and the performance of works in class .

name: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors I
description: Sight-reading and principles of style as related to intermediate literature ; c-clef and open score reading ; improvisation and functional harmony . Introduction to standard reference works , periodicals . Required of all keyboard majors .

name: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors II
description: Sight-reading and principles of style as related to lower advanced literature ; extended score reading ; improvisation and functional harmony . Mini survey ; basic keyboard literature .

name: MUEN 328 Keyboard Collaboration
description: Preparation and performance of literature for piano with voice and string , woodwind , brass and percussion instruments .

name: Introduction to Piano Repertoire and Performance
description: Survey of basic piano repertoire and styles through lecture , discussion , and performance . a : Late Baroque through Beethoven ; b : Schubert to the present .

name: MPKS 228 Four-Hand Keyboard Repertoire
description: Preparation and performance of literature for piano duets and duo-piano .

name: Accompanying
description: Techniques of vocal and instrumental accompanying .

name: Piano Pedagogy : Introduction and Practicum
description: The learning process at the keyboard ; pedagogy and methodology of beginning methods . Studio/group instruction : children/adults . Survey and observation .

name: Piano History and Literature
description: Solo piano literature ; emphasis on composers’ influences , performance practices and the development of the pianoforte . Late Baroque through Beethoven .

name: MPKS 481 Interpretation of Baroque Music
description: Repertoire and performance practice in music of the period : style , phrasing , embellishments , dynamics , improvisation , tempi . Performance in class of solo and ensemble works , instrumental and vocal .

name: MPPM 120 Popular Music Performance I
description: Study of musical elements appropriate to the performance of popular music in a collaborative , interactive environment .

name: MPPM 153 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction .

name: MPPM 253 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction .

name: MPPM 320 Popular Music Performance II
description: Development of ensemble and communication skills through the performance and interpretation of American popular music in concert and studio settings . Development of original compositions .

name: Final Project
description: Major collaborative performance project in popular music .

name: Guitarists in the U .S .
description: Study of the lives and music of influential guitarists ; analysis of musical and technical details .

name: MPGU 258 Functional Skills for Studio Guitarists I
description: Melodic and chordal topics applied to the total fingerboard ; successful completion required for junior standing .

name: MPGU 358 Performance Practices for Studio Guitarists
description: Rehearsal procedures ; stage deportment ; interpretation of solo and ensemble literature ; preparation for recitals and professional performance .

name: Studio Guitar Pedagogy
description: Teaching techniques and literature ; function of the hands ; acoustical properties of instruments .

name: MPGU 416 Evolution of the Guitar in the United States
description: Historical survey of styles , literature and performance practice ; emphasis on playing technique and interpretation . A time-line study relating guitar to popular music and historical events .

name: Improvisation and Arranging for Guitarists
description: Principles of improvisation and impromptu arranging ; comparison and application of techniques and musical styles of the various kinds of guitars and related fretted instruments .

name: Current Electric Guitar Styles
description: Analysis and performance of music and techniques currently in use in the recording , TV and motion picture studios ; includes study of recordings , videos and guitar equipment .

name: MPGU 301 Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction on secondary instrument for music majors , on principal instrument for music minors and BA music majors .

name: MUEN 327 String Chamber Music
description: Preparation and performance of small ensemble literature for strings .

name: String Pedagogy
description: Survey of teaching literature ; techniques of teaching beginning , intermediate , and advanced students .

name: MPST 472 Orchestra Repertoire – Strings
description: Orchestral literature for string players , covering a broad spectrum of the repertoire ; emphasis on preparation for auditions .

name: MPST 262 Double Bass Performance Class
description: Study of solo and orchestra repertoire , professional preparation , and teaching techniques . Required of all first and second year double bass majors each semester in residence .

name: MPST 462 Double Bass Performance Class
description: Continuation of MPST 262  . Required of all third and fourth year double bass majors each semester in residence .

name: MPST 263 Harp Performance Class
description: Study of solo and orchestra repertoire , professional preparation , and teaching technique . Required of all first and second year harp majors each semester in residence .

name: MPST 463 Harp Performance Class
description: Continuation of MPST 263  . Required of all third and fourth year harp majors each semester in residence .

name: MPVA 153 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and vocal performance forum .

name: MPVA 253 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and vocal performance forum .

name: MPVA 353 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and vocal performance forum .

name: MPVA 453 Individual Instruction
description: Weekly individual instruction and vocal performance forum .

name: MPVA 203a Acting for Singers I
description: Use of dramatic techniques in the interpretation and performance of music ; basic acting techniques for the operatic and recital stages ; sensory exercises , movement , improvisation , relaxation and make-up .

name: MPVA 404 Word and Music in Opera
description: IrregularPerformance class for singers and pianists ; analysis of recitatives , arias , and ensembles of various operatic styles ; study of the technique of effective musical delivery . By audition only .

name: MPVA 438 Foundations of Vocology
description: Voice physiology , voice hygiene , voice acoustics , and the cognitive substrates of Motor Learning .

name: MPVA 440 Italian and French Diction
description: Principles of pronunciation and enunciation ; use of international phonetic alphabet .

name: English and German Diction
description: Principles of pronunciation and enunciation ; use of international phonetic alphabet .

name: MPVA 479 Song Literature
description: Song literature of Italy , France , Germany , Russia , Norway , Sweden , England , America ; comparative analysis of various composers and their influence on song literature .

name: French I
description: Introduction to current French . Oral practice , listening and reading comprehension ; grammar necessary for simple spoken and written expression .

name: French II
description: Continuation of FREN 120  .

name: RXRS 302 Pharmacology and Drug Development
description: Introduction to drug development . Drug/Receptor interactions , pharmacodynamics , pharmacokinetics , toxicology , therapeutic interventions , biotransformation , pharmacogenomics , FDA , regulatory requirements and challenges , intellectual property , global challenges of drug development .

name: RXRS 402 Human Pharmacology : Challenge of Therapeutics in Society
description: Principles of human pharmacology/toxicology related to prescription , over the counter medications ; nutraceuticals ; drug-drug interactions ; polypharmacy ; hot topics related to recently approved drugs .

name: RXRS 413w Globalization of the Biomedical Industry
description: Globalization ; pharmaceuticals , biologics , medical devices , and combination products in advanced , emerging , and developing markets ; regional and national regulations , global and regional harmonization efforts , ethical considerations .

name: RXRS 304 Mysterious Deaths : Toxicology , Poisons , Literature , History
description: Poisons in classical literature helped shape , modify or change history . Presented in the context of pharmacological/toxicological principles of drug action .

name: RXRS 403 Neuropharmacology in Health and Disease
description: Neuropharmacological treatments of brain disorders including neurodegenerative disorders , injury , and disease ; influence of environment and experiences on neuroplasticity and brain development ; drug discovery .

name: RXRS 407 The Discovery , Development and Marketing of Medicines
description: Principles , concepts , challenges and short comings of modern day drug discovery and development of medicines . Inter-relationships with regulatory , ethical and societal sectors presented .

name: RXRS 408 Immunology and Immunotherapeutics
description: Principles of human immunological responses to maintain wellness and perturbation in disease . Focus on discovery , development and use of pharmacological therapeutic strategies targeting immune mechanisms .

name: RXRS 409 Neuroimmunology : Focus on Disease and Therapy
description: Newly evolving science focusing on the role of neuroimmune communication in the pathophysiology of the central nervous system (CNS) disorders . Neuroinflammation as a target for novel therapeutic approaches .

name: RXRS 410 Cancer Biology and Pharmacotherapy
description: Cancer and the complex molecular basis leading to tumor oncogenesis , invasion and metastasis ; current therapeutic strategies and strategies on the horizon .

name: RXRS 416 Medical Products : From Idea to Market
description: Progress of medical product development through intellectual property , animal and clinical trials  and commercialization . Emphasis on safety , quality systems and efficacy .

name: RXRS 420 Organ Physiology , Drug Delivery , and Drug Action
description: Principles of cellular and organ physiology . Interplay between the physiology of these organ systems , drug delivery , and drug action .

name: RXRS 411 Innovations in Medical Product Development
description: Developing new medical technologies ; political , regulatory , financing and reimbursement issues that may be associated ; case studies looking at the newest medical technologies .

name: RXRS 405 Pharmacology and Sociology of Drug Abuse
description: Social , psychological , economical , biological reasons associated with drug use/abuse ; prevention strategies ; pharmacology and pharmacotherapy successes/ challenges ; current trends ; case studies ; roles of health care professionals .

name: RXRS 406 Clinical Pharmacology and Medication Management
description: Comprehensive Medication Management Applications in Pharmacotherapy ; evidence-based , pharmacist driven medication selection ; improved and/or optimized medication therapy ; patient compliance ; better and safer health outcomes .

name: RXRS 412 Twenty-First Century Medical Issues and the Law
description: Difficult issues in the law are examined regarding medical and healthcare controversies such as euthanasia , abortion , embryonic stem cells , human experimentation , and the death penalty .

name: RXRS 418 Plant Medicines in Modern Medicine
description: Plant medicines ; how discovered ; activity ; pharmacology , toxicity and human benefit ; emphasis on the US , Europe and China .

name: RXRS 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research , reading , writing and project development .

name: Introduction to the Philosophical Classics
description: An examination of philosophical works which have had a profound impact on the nature of Western thought .

name: History of Western Philosophy : Ancient Period
description: Major figures in the history of Western philosophical thought from the pre-Socratics to the Hellenistic period ; emphasis on Plato and Aristotle .

name: History of Western Philosophy : Modern Period
description: The development of philosophy from the 16th to the 19th centuries ; emphasis on Continental Rationalism , British Empiricism , and the philosophy of Kant .

name: Epistemology and Metaphysics
description: Examination of problems in metaphysics and/or epistemology . Conducted at the intermediate level .

name: PHIL 120g Introduction to Formal Logic
description: Introduces formal tools for distinguishing between good and bad arguments or inferences . Covers both propositional logic and predicate logic .

name: PHIL 222g Logic and Language
description: Introduces symbolic logic and explores its application to the philosophy of language , plus meta-logical and philosophical results about its scope and limits .

name: Intermediate Symbolic Logic
description: Systematic study of the metatheory of quantificational logic , with applications to questions of decidability and completeness of formal systems including Godel’s Incompleteness Theorems .

name: Greek Ethics
description: Examination of the progress of the ethical thought and legal and political institutions of ancient Greece with an emphasis on the Nichomachean Ethics of Aristotle .

name: Existentialism
description: A critical survey of major 19th and 20th century existentialist writers , including Kierkegaard , Dostoevsky , Tolstoy , Kafka , Nietzsche , Camus , and Sartre .

name: Early Greek Thought
description: A study of the Greek thinkers from Homer to the age of Socrates ; emphasis on the pre-Socratic philosophers .

name: Plato
description: Detailed study of the evolution of Plato’s thought as revealed in selected dialogues .

name: Aristotle
description: Intensive study of selected topics taken from Aristotle’s writings in natural philosophy , in metaphysics , and in other areas of philosophy .

name: Continental Rationalism
description: Development of philosophy on the continent from the 17th to the 19th centuries ; emphasis on the philosophical works of Descartes , Leibniz , and Spinoza .

name: 19th Century Philosophy
description: Leading figures and movements in 19th century philosophy ; works of such philosophers as Hegel , Schopenhauer , Mill , Nietzsche , and Bradley .

name: American Philosophy
description: Leading figures and movements in American philosophy ; works of such philosophers as Jonathan Edwards , Charles Peirce , William James , John Dewey , and C .I . Lewis .

name: 20th Century Anglo-American Philosophy
description: The nature and function of analysis as a philosophical method ; the development of major metaphysical , epistemological , and ethical views ; Russell , Wittgenstein , Carnap , Quine and others .

name: Anglo-American Philosophy Since 1950
description: The maturing of the analytic tradition from the later Wittgenstein through Ryle , Strawson , Hare , Austin , Grice , Quine , Davidson , Kripke , and beyond .

name: History of Ethics to 1900
description: An historical and critical study of the great moral philosophers , including Plato , Aristotle , Aquinas , Kant , and the British moralists .

name: Wittgenstein
description: A detailed study of the philosophical works of Ludwig Wittgenstein .

name: Theories of Law
description: Examination of some of the major classical and contemporary theories of the nature and functions of law and of its relation to morality .

name: Theoretical Models of Leadership
description: Political philosophers and social theorists on leadership : political obligation ; the art of government ; leadership in civil society and counter-cultural dissent ; models of cosmopolitan leadership .

name: Political Economy and Social Issues
description: (Enroll in ECON 338 )

name: Philosophy in Literature
description: Philosophical content in representative European and American literature ; philosophical problems about literature such as the nature of truth and meaning in fiction .

name: Philosophy of Religion
description: The existence of God ; mysticism , miracles and the possibility of disembodied existence ; the problem of evil ; religion and morality ; the meaning of religious language .

name: Philosophy of Law
description: Philosophical theories about the nature of law , relations between law and morality , and analysis of normative concepts central to law , such as responsibility , punishment , negligence .

name: Law , Society , and Politics
description: A systematic presentation of the main philosophical perspectives on the interactions between law and the social-political aspects of our lives .

name: Contemporary Ethical Theory
description: Ethical theories in the 20th century ; contemporary theories of value and obligation ; metaethical theories ; intuitionism , naturalism , and non-cognitivism ; concepts of justice , human rights , and freedom .

name: Value Theory
description: The evaluation of individual and social ends ; consideration of such topics as values and rational choice , the good of a person , hedonism , welfare , ideals , and utopias .

name: Philosophy of Perception
description: Philosophical investigation of sense perception as it relates to issues in epistemology , metaphysics , the philosophy of mind , and the philosophy of science .

name: Science and Rationality
description: Examination of the rationality of the scientific enterprise , and of the relation between science and human values .

name: Metaphysics
description: Systematic introduction to basic concepts , including identity , difference , existence , individuals , substance , quality , and relation ; emphasis on idealism , materialism , and the ontology of intentionality .

name: Theory of Knowledge
description: Examination of contemporary accounts of the nature , scope , sources — and value — of human knowledge and justified belief .

name: Philosophy of Mathematics
description: The nature of mathematical truth and the nature of mathematical entities .

name: Development of Physical Science
description: Concepts central in the advance of physical science such as the concepts of space , time , mass , force ; philosophical problems concerning quantum mechanics .

name: PHIL 240g Mind , Self , and Consciousness
description: Explores philosophical questions about the human mind and consciousness , and how they relate to the brain and to the physical world more generally .

name: POSC 130g Law , Politics and Public Policy
description: Interaction between law and politics ; overview of the American legal system ; value conflicts and public policy questions which arise within it .

name: History of Western Philosophy : Medieval Period
description: Central themes in Jewish , Christian and Islamic philosophy from late antiquity through the scholastic period .

name: 20th Century European Philosophy
description: Main philosophers and movements from 1900 , including the major developments within phenomenology and existentialism , the emergence of structuralism and hermeneutics .

name: LAW 101w Law and the U .S . Constitution in Global History
description: By examining key constitutional moments involving race , rights , and revolutions , students will explore how legal meaning changes over time .

name: Political Parties , Campaigns , and Elections
description: Organization and function of political parties , nominations and elections , strategy and tactics of campaigning , professional candidate management finance , political machines , voting behavior .

name: The United States Supreme Court
description: Role of the court in American politics ; overview of major decisions ; the politics of appointment ; the process of decision-making ; impact of judicial decisions .

name: POSC 444 Civil and Political Rights and Liberties
description: An examination of debates and controversies surrounding the nature and scope of civil rights and civil liberties .

name: Comparative Law and the Judicial Process
description: Analysis of courts in comparative perspective ; judicial decision-making and development of public policy through the judicial process ; theories of law and jurisprudence .

name: Law in Film
description: Analysis of the depiction of law in film ; use of film to explore topics in jurisprudence and the politics of law and courts .

name: POSC 452 Critical Issues in Law and Public Policy
description: Intensive examination of special topics in the field of law and public policy .

name: SWMS 349 Women and the Law
description: Discussion of the relationship between women and the law in light of feminist jurisprudence , U .S . Supreme Court decisions , and cross-cultural perspectives .

name: Concepts in American Law
description: The main concepts and topics in American law , in the historical , economic and cultural contexts in which they have developed . Open only to students enrolled in the Philosophy , Politics and Law (PPL) major .

name: PHYS 440 Introduction to Condensed Matter Physics
description: Irregular , SpCrystal structures , x-ray diffraction , thermal properties of solids , diamagnetism and paramagnetism , free-electron model of metals , semiconductors , ferromagnetism , super-conductivity , imperfections in crystals .

name: PHYS 493L Advanced Experimental Techniques
description: Development of modern experimental techniques , including computer interface with data acquisition hardware and data analysis by software , applied specifically to experiments in modern physics . Emphasis on laboratory work with discussion of theoretical background .

name: EE 352L Computer Organization and Architecture
description: Computer organization and architecture . Concepts include : computer evolution and performance , system busses , cache memory , internal and external memory , input/output , operating system support , computer arithmetic .

name: PHYS 495 Senior Project
description: An original project will be constructed applying computer technology (in either hardware or software) to produce a result useful in the physics classroom or laboratory .

name: Intermediate Microeconomic Theory
description: Decision-making by business firms , consumer preferences and behavior , uncertainty , competition , monopoly , labor and resource markets , efficient resource allocation , externalities , and government policy .

name: Macroeconomic Analysis for Business Decisions
description: Behavior of economic indicators over business fluctuations , economic growth , monetary and fiscal policy , exchange rate movements .

name: The Political Economy of Institutions
description: Social functions served by the rules , laws , regulations , and customs that constrain human activity . Processes whereby such institutions adapt , or fail to adapt , to changing circumstances .

name: Contracts , Organizations and Institutions
description: Contract law and economic organization , determinants of firm boundaries , transaction cost economics , agency theory , incomplete contracting , business strategy , bureaucracy , institutional environment , politics and property rights .

name: Public Finance
description: Role of the government ; income and corporate taxation ; direct versus indirect taxation ; optimal tax structure ; public goods ; public sector pricing ; public debt and macroeconomic stability .

name: Urban Economics
description: Urban trends and problems , including changing urban form and function , urban public finance , housing , renewal , poverty , race , transportation , and the environment .

name: Economic Policy Issues
description: Selected policy dilemmas , including welfare reform , urban renewal , government budget deficits , regulation and deregulation , environmental problems , immigration , and global development . Lectures by leading authorities and weekly discussion sessions .

name: State Politics
description: American state politics from a comparative perspective . Examines political processes , differing policy outcomes and the impact of social change on system performance .

name: Interest Groups and Elite Behavior
description: Introduction to interest group and elite views of the American system , including recent interest group theory and findings and the general critiques of power distribution in American society .

name: PPD 357 Government and Business
description: Interrelated roles of business and public institutions ; effects of public policies and laws on business sector ; incorporates public and business perspectives .

name: ECON 487 Resource and Environmental Economics
description: Management and extraction of renewable and non-renewable natural resources ; environmental externalities and regulation of air , water , and land pollution ; market incentives versus direct regulation .

name: Legislative Process
description: Individual behavior and decision-making within legislatures ; changing executive-legislative functions ; legislative functions ; relationships to political systems in comparative perspective .

name: Mass Media and Politics
description: Analysis of political content of mass media . Audience response to alternative sources of political information . Consideration of the institutional and economic as well as political aspects of the mass media .

name: POSC 110g Ideology and Political Conflict
description: Modern political ideologies ; their assumptions , perceptions , and prescriptions regarding political stability and social injustice : anarchism , communism , socialism , liberalism , conservatism , and fascism .

name: PSYC 316 L Non-Experimental Research Methods
description: Non-experimental research methods in psychology . Observational , survey and data analysis exercises .

name: MATH 117g Introduction to Mathematics for Business and Economics
description: Functions , graphs , polynomial and rational functions , exponential and logarithmic functions , matrices , systems of linear equations .

name: Public Policy and Management
description: Institutions , legal context , and processes of public policy and management . Contemporary theories of public policy formulation , implementation , and evaluation . Public managerial challenges and reforms .

name: PPD 240g Citizenship and Public Ethics
description: , SpReview of legal and ethical traditions of citizenship with emphasis on the latter ; consideration of implications for current practice of public policy-making and management .

name: PPD 245g The Urban Context for Policy and Planning
description: The urban context for planning and policy decisions . Socioeconomic , physical , and spatial structure of cities ; and the underlying demographic , economic , and social processes that drive their ongoing transformation .

name: PPD 300 Social Justice Issues in Public Policy and Urban Planning
description: Social justice issues through the lens of public policy and urban planning with main focus on Los Angeles ; critical thinking skills about the fields and their relevance to social justice

name: PPD 301 PPD Practices : Internship Seminar
description: Policy , planning , and development skills for practice ; internship seminar ; leadership , group dynamics and presentation skills ; application of management ; organizational diversity ; reflection on experiences .

name: PPD 303 Statistics for Policy , Planning , and Development
description: Statistical applications applied to the real world ; techniques including probability , sampling ; hypothesis formation and testing ; correlation , and linear regression .

name: PPD 373 Public Policy and Planning Analysis
description: Applied analytic modeling and data manipulation ; visual presentation ; interpretation of data ; needs assessment and market failure analysis ; indexing ; extrapolation and simple forecasting ; simple risk analysis ; benefit-cost analysis .

name: PPD 431 Undergraduate Policy , Planning , and Development Studio
description: Application of methods in the exploration of a specific project , policy , or organization from the multiple perspectives of the five tracks in the undergraduate program .

name: Health Policy
description: Health policy analysis and challenges ; price of health ; structure of major sectors in health care ; role of insurance in policy debates ; trade-offs with policy decisions .

name: Financial Management of Public and Nonprofit Organizations
description: Time value of money , risk , government bonds and tax-exempt financing , cost of capital , budgeting , financial statement analysis , and working capital management .

name: PPD 413 Administration of Health Care Organizations
description: Theory and practice ; role of governing bodies , medical staffs and quality review committees ; current trends ; community responsibility ; regulatory and oversight agencies .

name: Mental Health Law
description: Issues at the intersection of law and psychology , both civil — e .g . , civil commitment — and criminal — e .g . , the insanity defense . Emphasis on ethical issues .

name: PPD 320 Organizational Behavior in Public Administration
description: Understanding human behavior in public organization : motivation , roles , communication ; group behavior and decision-making in public context ; managing conflict ; leadership and change in public complex organizational systems .

name: PPD 403 Management Analysis I
description: Introduction to organizational and systems analysis ; historical perspective ; systems theory ; information systems , procedure analysis ; management planning ; introduction to models .

name: Community Health Policy and Planning
description: Historical perspectives on and the contemporary practice of community health planning ; impact of culture , socioeconomics , and environment ; policy dimensions ; urban planning’s role in enhancing and sustaining health .

name: PPD 371 The Nonprofit Sector and the Public Interest
description: Theories of the voluntary nonprofit sector in society and its relationship to government and business ; public policies toward the sector .

name: Management of Public and Nonprofit Organizations
description: Contemporary management theory ; the nature of complex organizations ; organizational and intergovernmental arrangements ; roles and responsibilities of managers ; managerial and organizational effectiveness ; organizational structure and dynamics .

name: PPD 372m Public Service in an Urban Setting
