description: Voluntary service in an urban , multicultural context : diverse meanings and practices , history , motivations , relationship to charity and change , dilemmas , public policies ; service learning project required .

name: PPD 313 Finance of the Public Sector
description: Justifications for and effects of government policies ; tax and spending sides of government budgets ; public goods ; externalities ; social insurance ; redistribution and welfare ; tax policy .

name: LAW 200w Law and Society
description: Sources and structure of law ; history of Bill of Rights emphasizing effect on criminal justice system ; limits of law in solving problems in American society .

name: PPD 342 Crime and Public Policy
description: Public policy agenda-setting , alternatives formulation , and implementation for crime and criminal justice ; analysis of specific issues including crime control , death penalty and gun control .

name: Economic Analysis of Law
description: Common law and property ; rationing of justice , resource allocation between prevention and enforcement ; division of decision making between public and private sectors .

name: PPD 439 Housing and Community Development
description: Evolution of government housing and community development programs ; present practices , e .g . , housing elements , economic development , neighborhood rehabilitation ; housing needs and market analysis ; housing and health .

name: PPD 485m U .S . Immigration Policy
description: Examination of the historical and contemporary components of U .S . immigration policy with emphasis on policies addressing legal permanent immigrants , refugees , asylees , the undocumented .

name: PPD 404 Empirical Methods for Public Policy
description: Introduction to multivariate regression analysis for policy analysis ; course begins with Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) estimation and covers some advanced topics such as panel data and experimental methods ; application of these tools in a variety of policy contexts such as education , labor , and health .

name: PPD 344 Environmental Policy and Sustainable Development
description: Introduction to critical issues of environmental policy in looking toward a more sustainable future ; the science and policy of climate change ; equity and justice ; the greening of industry , governing for sustainable development ; policy tools in addressing issues of environmental protection and sustainability .

name: PPD 358 Urban and Regional Economics
description: Basic concepts of urban and regional economies ; how planners intervene in the urban market ; housing , transportation , public goods ; land use politics ; fiscal issues ; cost-benefit analysis .

name: PPD 380a International Perspectives on Urban Problem Solving
description: IrregularResearch on comparative urban public policy and administration utilizing case study approach ; field research includes study in various foreign cities .

name: PPD 421 Land Use , Environment , and Housing in Developing Countries
description: Comparative analysis of issues in the built environment in the US and abroad ; development , land use , and the supply of housing ; housing affordability ; land tenure .

name: PPD 422 Transportation and Technology and the Future of Mobility
description: Introduction of the role that technology will play in facilitating shared mobility , disrupting transportation markets , and reshaping multi-modal urban transportation systems ; analyses of governance issues ; the interaction between private markets and regulators ; changes in the nature of infrastructure and urban planning that will be required to accommodate the wired future of transportation .

name: PR 209 Effective Writing for Strategic Public Relations
description: Focus on the unique writing requirements of social , online , broadcast , print and other media in public relations/strategic communication ; emphasis on judgment , context and audience understanding .

name: PR 250 Strategic Public Relations : An Introduction
description: Strategies and practices in the growing field of public relations/strategic communication , including landmark cases ; special emphasis on historical roots , evolution , current and future practice .

name: PR 351a Strategic Public Relations Media and Content
description: Introduction to media relations , social media and influencer engagement ; intensive writing and creating multimedia content for traditional , emerging and social media .

name: PR 428 Social , Legal and Ethical Foundations of Public Relations
description: Covers the complex intersection of legal standards and regulations , ethical practices and decision making , and social responsibilities for public relations/strategic communication practitioners .

name: PR 429 Business and Economic Foundations of Public Relations
description: Relationship between public relations/strategic communication and other organizational disciplines ; understanding business goals and objectives ; economic literacy ; financial/investor relations ; how PR/communication agencies are built and managed .

name: PR 450 Advanced Strategic Public Relations
description: In-depth study of methods for planning , managing and evaluating strategic communication campaigns ; critical analysis of contemporary cases ; development of campaigns for real world clients .

name: PR 463 Strategic Public Relations Research , Analysis and Insights
description: Identification of key strategic insights that drive successful communication campaigns , based on research techniques including surveys , content evaluation and social media monitoring .

name: QBIO 105 Introduction to Quantitative Biology Seminar
description: Introduction to quantitative biology including a definition of its role within the Biological Sciences and relationship with Chemistry , Computer Science , Engineering , Mathematics , Medicine and Physics .

name: Statistical Inference and Data Analysis I
description: Probability , counting , independence , distributions , random variables , simulation , expectation , variance , covariance , transformations , law of large numbers , Central limit theorem , estimation , efficiency , maximum likelihood , Cramer-Rao bound , bootstrap .

name: Statistical Inference and Data Analysis II
description: Confidence intervals , hypothesis testing , pvalues , likelihood ratio , nonparametrics , descriptive statistics , regression , multiple linear regression , experimental design , analysis of variance , categorical data , chi-squared tests , Bayesian statistics .

name: Computational Genome Analysis
description: Introduction to and applications of algorithms and statistics to genome analysis . Analysis of physical and genetic maps , DNA sequencing , sequence comparisons , DNA chips .

name: BISC 321 Multidisciplinary Seminar : Science , Technology and Society
description: Builds upon a basic science background to provide students with an awareness of cutting edge scientific research , its technological applications and its societal ramifications .

name: BISC 407 Cellular and Molecular Neuroscience
description: An examination of individual nerve cell development , target location , and establishment of functional synapses ; how dysfunction in these processes contributes to neurological and neuropsychiatric diseases .

name: BISC 434 Introduction to Genome Science
description: Characterization of the sequence , function and evolution of genomes ; study of the molecular basis of phenotypes and the relationship between genomics and synthetic biology .

name: BISC 444 Practical Analysis of Biological Data in R
description: Instruction in the open-source statistical program environment R to analyze biological data ; manipulation of large datasets and customization of statistical tests using simulations .

name: BISC 473L Biological Oceanography
description: Biological , physical , chemical dynamics and analysis of the ocean ; primary production of phytoplankton , secondary production by zooplankton , bacterial remineralization ; physiology , ecology of fishes , marine mammals .

name: RED 362 Real Estate Development Fundamentals
description: Real estate overview ; evolution of cities and neighborhoods ; product types ; introduction to valuation .

name: RED 375 Real Estate Development Analysis
description: Real estate development feasibility and analysis ; underwriting local fundamentals including neighborhood and city change , real estate capital flows

name: RED 435 Analyzing Real Estate Markets
description: Macro and micro-analysis of urban property markets ; demographics ; location choice ; regulation

name: RED 437 Advanced Finance and Investment for Real Estate Development
description: Advanced real estate principles . Underwriting property valuation and deal structure including risk and return . Debt and equity markets ; difference between development and existing assets .

name: REL 134g Introduction to Buddhism
description: Focus primarily on works of Buddhist literature written in a variety of genres . Introduction of basic teachings that link Buddhist traditions across time and space .

name: REL 138g Japanese Religions and Culture
description: Major religious traditions of Japan (such as Buddhism , Shinto , Christianity , Confucianism) and their broader social and cultural contexts .

name: REL 141g Global Religions in Los Angeles
description: Congregational and individual expressions of religion in Los Angeles .

name: REL 147g Religion , Media and Popular Culture
description: Exploration of the manner in which the media frame discussions and understandings of ethical issues , moral dilemmas , spirituality and religious imagination .

name: COMM 425 Communicating Religion
description: Genres of religious communication , including sermon , prayer , ritual , polemic , and revival . Impact of technological and cultural change on religious advocacy , beliefs , and practices .

name: EALC 431 The Taoist Tradition
description: Close reading of primary text(s) of early Chinese Taoist thinkers (in translation) , along with analysis of relevant secondary scholarship .

name: HIST 482 Jesus in American History and Culture
description: The place of Jesus Christ in diverse American cultures from colonial times to the present : Jesus as cultural icon , secular inspiration , Christian Son of God .

name: Introduction to Shiism
description: Examination of the major branches of Shiism , the second largest articulation of Islam , both historically and in the world today .

name: Themes in the Religions of China
description: A study of selected themes in the history of Chinese religions and culture . Compares cases and materials from several historical periods and religious traditions .

name: Gender , Religion , and Sexuality
description: The construction of gender and sexuality in Western religious traditions ; its continued impact on contemporary intellectual , cultural , and social life .

name: Mysticism and Religious Desire
description: How human appetites for sex , food , community or immortality are articulated as mystical desires in different religions , either within institutional structures or working against them .

name: Studies in the History of Christianity
description: In-depth exploration of one of the pivotal moments in the history of Christianity and Western society .

name: Introduction to Indian Philosophy
description: An introduction to Indian philosophy , including major schools of thought in Hindu , Buddhist , and Jain philosophies . No previous knowledge of Indian religions or philosophy required .

name: Religion and Social Change
description: Empirical and theoretical analysis of social change and its effect on religious institutions as well as the impact of religious movements on society .

name: Religion and Visuality
description: Examination of the deep connections between visuality and religions , including visions , controversies over religious images , and other connections between religion and visual art .

name: Religious Thought After the Enlightenment
description: Changes in religious thought between the late 18th and early 20th centuries in the wake of the emergence of modernity in the West .

name: Christian Thought in the 20th Century
description: Examination of dynamic new directions taken by Christian understandings of self , God , and salvation in response to the novel conditions of modern culture , politics and philosophy .

name: Origins of Modern Theology
description: th century liberal , rationalist , and historical theology .

name: Religion and Science
description: Explores whether religion and science offer competing or complementary models for understanding the world and the human place within it .

name: Philosophy of Religion : Bases of Belief and Disbelief
description: Rational and empirical foundations for religious faith and for skepticism .

name: Religion and Violence
description: Religious and moral perspectives on war , pacifism , violent and nonviolent protest , and religion-based terrorism and militia .

name: REL 468 Sociology of Religion
description: The role of religion in modern society from the standpoint of sociological theory and research .

name: Jesus
description: A study of major interpretations of the figure of Jesus , with focus on the interaction between religious traditions and culture .

name: Advanced New Testament Studies
description: Consideration of specific topics in New Testament studies . Particular topics determined each semester .

name: Seminar in Christian Thought
description: Studies a theme , period , or problem from the history of Christian thought within its intellectual and social context .

name: History of Religion in America
description: Intellectual , institutional , and social history of religion in America from colonial times to the present .

name: REL 499 Special Topics in Religion
description: Selected topics in religious studies .

name: Business Russian
description: Language and culture course for intermediate Russian level students interested in business . Prepares students to communicate in Russian-speaking business settings in a linguistically sensitive manner .

name: Russian Culture
description: Survey of Russian civilization from the beginnings to the Soviet period focusing on major cultural and artistic trends .

name: SOCI 325 Applied Social Research Methods
description: Use quantitative analysis skills to study major social issues using large existing survey data sets . Become conversant in describing data to a variety of audiences .

name: Social Institutions
description: Cultural and interactional aspects of social institutions as complex social systems ; religious , political , industrial , and familial institutions .

name: SOCI 351 Public Policy and Juvenile Justice
description: Past and current theories of youth crime ; gangs and other forms of youth deviance ; the changing response of the police , courts , and public to these behaviors .

name: SOCI 353 Public Policy and Criminal Justice
description: Nature and trends in crime , policing , courts , and correctional agencies in relation to past , current , and prospective changes in society .

name: SOCI 480 The Sociology of Risk and Disaster
description: Is there such a thing as a “natural” disaster? Examination of both natural and technological disasters , and exploration of the centrality of risk in industrialized societies .

name: SOCI 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: SOCI 494 Sociology Honors Seminar I
description: Advanced seminar involving extensive reading , research and discussions . Selected subjects ; offered in fall only and restricted to honors students . Acceptance into the Honors Program .

name: Sociology Honors Seminar II
description: Seminar in workshop form to accompany completion of Senior Honors Thesis under faculty guidance . Acceptance into Honors Program .

name: SOCI 499 Special Topics
description: An interdisciplinary examination of selected emerging issues .

name: SPAN 310 Structure of Spanish
description: A systematic study of the structure of Spanish . Topics include fundamental aspects of the sound system ; word classes ; sentences and their meaning ; linguistic change and variation ; standard and colloquial usage .

name: Introduction to Acting
description: Study of genres , terminology , and disciplines of acting ; fundamental techniques necessary for performance ; scene study from contemporary plays .

name: Communicating Theatrical Design Concepts
description: The visualization and communication of design ideas through free-hand and mechanical drawing , including orthographics , isometrics , perspective , shades and shadows , plans , sections and elevations .

name: Costume Construction
description: Historical survey , theory and practice in construction of costume , emphasis on period and style .

name: Stage Lighting
description: Theory and practice of theatrical lighting design including electricity , radiant energy , refraction , reflection , absorption , chromatic variation , and electronic controls .

name: THTR 335 Scenic Construction
description: Technology , organization , and operation of the theatrical scene shop centered around the proper and safe use of tools , the choosing of materials , and methods of construction .

name: Introduction to Scene Study
description: Application and consolidation of the skills , knowledge and techniques acquired in the study of fundamentals of acting encountered in THTR 101  .

name: Intermediate Acting I
description: Polishing the actor’s skills through analysis and class performance of scenes from plays .

name: Basic Voice
description: Examination of the individual voice centering on resonance , tone , flexibility , and support through dramatic selections for transmitting meaning and emotion of character .

name: Intermediate Acting II
description: Building and sustaining character in drama .

name: Acting Shakespeare
description: Basic approach to the acting and analysis of the highly formalized texts of William Shakespeare .

name: Acting Shakespeare II
description: A continuation and deeper investigation of the analysis and performance of the highly formalized texts of William Shakespeare .

name: Dialects
description: The study of standard American stage dialect using the international phonetic alphabet .

name: Advanced Movement for Actors
description: Advanced physical training for the B .A . actor utilizing various movement techniques through improvisation .

name: Stage Combat
description: Introduction to safe and effective portrayals of violence for the stage . Training and practice of unarmed stage combat skills .

name: Alexander Technique for Performers
description: Training and practice in the work of F .M . Alexander . A clear and systematic look into the underlying principles that govern human movement .

name: THTR 424 The Stage Artist as Entrepreneur
description: Explores all the tools required to forge a career as a stage artist , with an emphasis on producing new work .

name: Voice-over Acting
description: Acting techniques , recording studio technology and editing for the field of voice acting and voice-overs .

name: Advanced Acting
description: Intensive investigation and performance of audition techniques . Scene study skills developed , including cold readings , first readings , rehearsal procedure , performance process , camera/taping .

name: Stage Sound
description: Basic audio engineering science , how sound is measured , basic transducers and signal flow . Operation of recording and playback equipment used in theatrical sound design/mixing .

name: THTR 303 Projection Design I
description: Investigation of the projection design process , equipment , multi-media , digital technology concepts , and related documentation .

name: THTR 330 Scene Design I
description: Historical styles , methods , and dramatic analysis for scene design as applied in contemporary practice .

name: Costume Design I
description: Historical styles , methods , and dramatic analysis in costume design as applied in contemporary practice . Execution of costume designs for assigned works .

name: Lighting Design I
description: Historical styles , methods , and dramatic analysis in lighting design as applied in contemporary practice .

name: Introduction to Sound Design
description: The art and techniques of theatrical sound design . The use of music and ambient sound in theatrical presentations . Design elements as metaphor .

name: THTR 402 Projection Design II
description: Projection design process , software , equipment , multi-media and digital technology concepts , and related documentation .

name: THTR 407a Drawing and Rendering for the Theatre
description: Drawing and rendering techniques appropriate for theatre designers . Drawing and drawing theory .

name: Scene Design II
description: Continuation of THTR 330  . Evolution of scene design through analysis of script , environmental factors , and styles .

name: Costume Design II
description: Evolution of costume design through analysis of script , environmental factors , and styles .

name: Lighting Design II
description: Continuation of THTR 332  . Evolution of lighting design through analysis of script , environmental factors , and styles .

name: Advanced Theatrical Drafting
description: Drafting style and complex graphic communication . Emphasis on creating professional plates , developing an individual style and graphic problem solving .

name: THTR 436 Sound for Theatre
description: Introduction to electronic sound and sound reinforcement . ,including basic equipment , recording , editing , and show operation

name: Advanced Sound Design
description: Advanced exploration of theatrical sound design theory and related technology ; creative uses of music , sound effects , and audio equipment in modern theatres .

name: THTR 409 Advanced Drafting : Vectorworks
description: An exploration of computer aided drafting (CAD) software , including drafting standards as achieved with Vectorworks and related software .

name: THTR 131a Advanced Theatrical Production
description: Advanced understanding of non-performance areas of theatrical production (administrative , design , and technical fields) through hands-on participation in USC productions .

name: Art of Theatrical Design
description: A guided student exploration of the fundamentals of applied design elements and their use as creative tools in the design process .

name: Methods and Materials
description: Cutting-edge and traditional methods and materials that enhance both the planning stages and realization of the theatrical design .

name: Seminar in Theatre Design
description: Research into the application of contemporary topics relevant to theatrical design within the diverse cultural environment of the greater Los Angeles area .

name: Periods and Styles
description: A survey of the influence of historical and cultural events on the evaluation of theatrical styles . Classical to Jacobean .

name: THTR 213 Corset Construction
description: Design and construct period corsets , along with the materials and terminology needed to sew (machine and hand) corsets .

name: Scene Painting
description: Techniques , materials , and equipment of the scenic artist , including both historic and modern methods .

name: Stage Properties
description: Organization , management , and construction of properties for the theatre .

name: Stage Management I
description: Basic skills , including assembly of prompt book , blocking notation , and organizational and communication procedures applied in theatre production .

name: Stage Management II
description: Application of stage management procedures required in the professional theatre .

name: Production Management
description: The context and scope of work done by a Theatrical Production Manager . Students will learn about different types of theatrical organizations and how they are structured .

name: Taking it on the Road and Beyond
description: Specific instruction to prepare Stage Managers for the rigors and processes of Touring and Opera productions as well as other non-theatrical team-based collaborations in entertainment .

name: Theatre Organization and Administration
description: Budgets , contracts , box-office procedures , public relations ; personnel and executive policies of the school , community , and professional theatre .

name: THTR 425 Dynamics of Technical Theatre
description: Advanced technical direction topics involving the technical analysis and design of moving scenery and theatrical systems .

name: Technical Theatre
description: Theory and practice of technical theatre . Emphasis is on technical problem solving and graphic solutions to technical theatre .

name: ARCH 304 x Intensive Survey : Prehistory to the Present
description: An intensive historical overview of architecture from prehistory to the present , emphasizing interrelationships of various global cultures and how social considerations were translated into form .

name: DANC 280g Introduction to Dance as an Art Form
description: Gateway to the minor in dance .  An interdisciplinary overview of dance relating to the aesthetic and art in various subjects . Applications of the elements of dance studies , art criticism , and viewing productions to explore topic such as architecture , photography , poetry , technology , cinematic arts , sports , medicine , and more .

name: People , Places and Culture : Architecture of the Public Realm
description: Critical observation of the architecture of public buildings and places and the importance of design in promoting a better contemporary public life .

name: ARCH 440m Literature and the Urban Experience
description: Post-industrial revolution urban environments and dynamic relationships in cities such as Manchester , Paris , St . Petersburg , New York , and Los Angeles , as revealed in novels , architecture , and urban forms .

name: ARCH 444 Great Houses of Los Angeles
description: An introduction to the architectural philosophies of seven influential California architects through readings and site visits to significant case studies .

name: Contemporary Asian Architecture
description: Exploration of various “Asian” architectures , comparisons of areas , identifying current trends and impact of Asia on Southern California and Los Angeles .

name: ART 362 Ideas in Intermedia
description: An examination of the impact of digital media on contemporary culture , with attention to a particular , changing topic each semester .

name: Philosophy of the Arts
description: Principal theories of the nature of , and response to , art ; examination of form and content in various arts ; consideration of the role of criticism .

name: CTPR 409 Practicum in Television Production
description: Television production laboratory course covers operating cameras , creating graphics , technical operations , controlling audio and floor-managing live productions . Students plan and produce actual Trojan Vision programs .

name: CTWR 100g Story : Character , Conflict , and Catharsis
description: Fundamentals course on the elements of scene writing , story structure , and character development .

name: Breaking the Story
description: Examination of the fundamental elements of a good story , and how to use those elements to develop new screenplay ideas .

name: Introduction to Hour-Long Television Writing
description: The fundamentals of writing for dramatic episodic television . Writing scenes from popular television shows and examination of television story structure .

name: Writing the Screenplay
description: Development of synopsis and treatment for a theatrical or documentary screenplay : theme , plot , character , mise-en-scene and utilization of cinematic elements .

name: CTWR 421 Writing the Hour-Long Dramatic Series
description: Writing an episode of an existing dramatic television series within the hour-long format with an emphasis on conception , pitching , characterization and structure .

name: CTWR 434 Writing the Half-Hour Comedy Series
description: Writing an episode of an existing half-hour comedy series , with emphasis on the anatomy of a joke , comedic structure , and character .

name: CTWR 305 Advanced Screenwriting : The Relationship Screenplay
description: An inquiry into the complex nature of human relationships by writing an original feature length screenplay that examines the multidimensional world of characters and the ties that bind them together .

name: CTWR 437 Writing the Original Situation Comedy Pilot
description: Advanced workshop for writing an original half-hour comedy series , including a pilot script , summary of characters , and story lines for first season .

name: CTWR 439 Writing the Original Dramatic Series Pilot
description: An advanced workshop in which students create an original dramatic series , including a first script and a summary of characters and storylines .

name: CTWR 449 Rewriting the Original Dramatic Series Pilot
description: An advanced workshop in which an original hour-long television pilot will be rewritten with emphasis on character , world creation and future story lines .

name: CTWR 453 Advanced Feature Rewriting
description: An advanced workshop in which a feature length screenplay will be rewritten using a specific methodology that focuses on a macro to micro approach to revision .

name: Senior Thesis
description: Creation of feature-length treatment and first draft senior thesis screenplay , including “pitching” experiences .

name: Senior Thesis in Dramatic Television
description: Advanced workshop developing an original hour-long dramatic series including characters , world , and story lines for season one . Final assignment is completed hour-long pilot episode .

name: CTWR 420a Senior Thesis in Half-Hour Television Comedy
description: Intense study in developing an original half-hour television comedy pilot including special attention to development of multiple seasons and character evolution .

name: Entertainment Industry Seminar
description: Examination and analysis of various topics , issues and resources pertaining to creative , legal and business perspectives for writers in the entertainment industry .

name: Foundations of Comedy
description: Study of comedy theory and practical applications in film , television , and social media . Lectures and screenings of comedic forms tracing past , present and future .

name: Creating the Comedic Character
description: Utilization of various techniques for character to emerge naturally in scene and stories . Creating multiple comedic characters to generate future stories .

name: Script Coverage and Story Analysis
description: Evaluation of completed scripts prior to their production . Coverage and analysis of scripts as potential properties from the perspective of a production company .

name: CTWR 422 Creating the Dramatic Television Series
description: Examination and creation of the world , characters , and concept for an original hour-long dramatic series . Writing an outline for an original dramatic pilot .

name: The Writer in American Cinema and Television
description: American and international writers in cinema ; screenwriting ; political and economic aspects of the writer in the motion picture industry . Lectures , guest speakers , screenings .

name: CTWR 431 Screenwriters and Their Work
description: Detailed investigation of a specific screenwriter’s style and the works they’ve influenced . Lectures include screenings and visiting screenwriters .

name: CTWR 432 Television Writers and Their Work
description: Detailed investigation of various television writers’ styles , the worlds they have created , and the works they’ve influenced . Lectures include screenings and visiting television writers .

name: Adaptations : Transferring Existing Work to the Screen
description: An examination of motion picture adaptations ; problems attendant upon translating a novel , play , or other creative forms into screenplays .

name: CTWR 435 Writing for Film and Television Genres
description: Preparation of proposals and scripts for different types of film or television programming : emphasis on conception , structure , characterization and format .

name: CTWR 438 Linked Narrative Storytelling for the Web
description: Create , develop , and execute episodic video content for the web . Focus on content and characters that are viable in the internet landscape .

name: CTWR 468 Screenwriting in Collaboration
description: Writing an original screenplay or pilot collaboratively with a partner , with special attention paid to the writing team dynamic and the ‘third’ writer’s voice .

name: CTWR 477 Staff Writing the Sketch Comedy Show
description: Staff writing a sketch comedy show with emphasis on creating comedic characters , political humor , monologue writing , and joke construction . A live show will be produced .

name: CTWR 487 Staff Writing the Multi-Camera Television Series
description: Working on the writing staff of an original multi-camera television series , with emphasis on the writers’ room experience and how to executive produce an episode .

name: CTWR 497 Staff Writing the Single-Camera Half-Hour Series
description: Working on the writing staff for an original single-camera half-hour television series , with emphasis on the writers’ room experience and challenges of single-camera half-hour television .

name: CTWR 499 Special Topics
description: Detailed investigation of new or emerging aspects of cinema and/or television ; special subjects offered by visiting faculty ; experimental subjects .

name: Roman Law
description: History and elements of Roman law , including persons , property , obligations , and inheritance , in context of social structure (family , gender , class , slavery , empire) .

name: Law and Society in Classical Greece
description: Investigations of the legal culture of classical Greece , focusing on regulation of social practices and on the role of social values in defining crime .

name: CLAS 320gmp Diversity and the Classical Western Tradition
description: Political , ethical , and ideological aspects of classical Western attitudes towards human diversity . Relationship between classical tradition and - contemporary discussions of diversity and unity .

name: Cult and City in Ancient Greece
description: Explores the relationship between civic and religious institutions in ancient Greece : city planning , warfare , mystery cults , drama , sacrifice , and women’s rituals .

name: Ethics and Politics in Ancient Rome
description: Introduction to ethical and political thought of classical Roman writers . Relationship between theory and practice . Implications for contemporary society .

name: CLAS 348g Athens in the Age of Democracy and Empire
description: Democratic Institutions and practices , empire building , and cultural innovations of fifth and fourth century B .C . Athens using historical , rhetorical , dramatic , philosophical , and artistic sources .

name: Democracies Ancient and Modern
description: Democratic and republican governments in Athens and Rome ; their influence on republicanism in early modern Italy and 18th-century America ; their relevance for contemporary democracies .

name: ENGL 355g Anglo-American Law and Literature
description: Examination of legal problems and concepts in English and American literature .

name: HIST 210gw How to Be An American : Global Histories of U .S . Citizenship
description: History of United States citizenship from its origins to the present day , with particular attention to relationship between law and culture .

name: HIST 220 Murder on Trial in America
description: Examination of high-profile murders and murder trials in order to explore major social , political , and cultural issues from the colonial period to the present .

name: The American Revolution
description: Origins , course and consequences of the American Revolution ; the post-war establishment of the Constitution .

name: HIST 377 Law and Society in Premodern China and Japan
description: A broad but deep look into the nature and development of law in two great East Asian civilizations , China and Japan , up to the modern era .

name: HIST 385 Anglo-American Law before the 18th Century
description: OtherThe evolution of discourse , practices , and institutions in Anglo-American legal history from the later Middle Ages to the 18th century .

name: American Legal History
description: An introduction to the study of law from a historical perspective ; explores the interaction of law , culture , and politics from the Revolution through the New Deal .

name: The Constitutional History of the United States
description: Historical influences on changes in the structure , practice , and interpretation of the American Constitution , including debates about institutional powers and civil/political rights and liberties .

name: The American Founders : Visions , Values and Legacy
description: Analysis of the political thought of the American Founders ; consideration of alternative visions of patriarchalism , republicanism , and liberal democracy ; exploration of Founders’ core values and their impact on issues of race , class , and gender .

name: American Political Thought
description: Historical and topical review of American political philosophy from the Puritans to the present . Special emphasis on such recurrent themes as equality , democracy , and racism .

name: POSC 441m Cultural Diversity and the Law
description: Jurisprudential approach to the study of cultural differences . Consideration of circumstances under which law should accommodate cultural diversity in the United States and abroad .

name: Transgender Studies
description: Analysis of transgender behaviors , from androgyny and transvestism to transexuality . Discussion of changing laws , representations , medical standards , and social attitudes towards transgender and intersex people .

name: Advanced Modern Chinese I
description: Reading selections from different styles of modern Chinese writings , analysis of stylistic techniques and syntactic structure , composition , and translation .

name: Advanced Korean I
description: Advanced reading in modern Korean materials ; improvement of skills in conversation , composition , and translation .

name: Advanced Japanese I
description: Strengthen intermediate Japanese language proficiency . Oral/aural communication skills as well as reading and writing skills . Promote an understanding of the present-day Japanese culture .

name: Classical Chinese I
description: Introduction to the classical styles , selections from classical style writings , contrastive analysis of modern and classical Chinese , translation and writing practice .

name: Classical Chinese II
description: Continuation of EALC 400  .

name: Advanced Korean III
description: Selected readings in Korean texts , pre- modern and modern , in various literary and non-fiction genres ; focus on developing reading and translation skills .

name: Advanced Korean IV
description: Continuation of EALC 415  .

name: EALC 335m Korean American Literature
description: Survey of Korean American literature from the mid-20th century until the most recent years . Focus on issues and topics central to Korean American experience .

name: EALC 352g Chinese Literature and Culture
description: Readings of Chinese poetry , prose , novels and drama ; influence of the West on Chinese literature and culture in modern times . Conducted in English .

name: Studies in Chinese Thought
description: Chinese thought , particularly as formulated in the three great traditions : Confucianism , Taoism , Buddhism .

name: Studies in Japanese Thought
description: Influence of native traditions and imported Chinese traditions on Japanese civilization ; religious , ethical , aesthetic , and political aspects .

name: Cultural Topics in East Asian Literature
description: Selected themes , genres , and periods in East Asian literature , e .g . , Taoism and Buddhism , women , folktales .

name: Readings in Modern Korean Literature
description: Selected readings from modern Korean short stories , novels , plays and essays . Readings will be in English and Korean .

name: ECON 318 Introduction to Econometrics
description: Application of statistical methods to economic data : estimating economic relationships using regression analysis , testing hypotheses involving economic behavior , forecasting economic variables .

name: Food Retailing Management
description: Strategic techniques of merchandising , pricing , and distributing products in the food industry with emphasis on new product development , including market segmentation and positioning .

name: Food Industry Financial Accounting and Analysis
description: Analysis of financial statements from food industry ; cost and management accounting techniques in business planning , decision-making , cost control , and performance evaluation .

name: Food Marketing Research
description: Application of marketing research tools and techniques to problems of the food industry . Development of a major consumer research project .

name: Food Industry Decision-Making
description: Involvement with specific management situations related to the food industry , its environment , and its consumers . Emphasizes managerial functions and decision-making through case studies .

name: Introduction to Digital Studies
description: An introduction to the expressive range of screen languages in their cultural , historical , and technological contexts .

name: Workshop in Multimedia Authoring
description: Introduction to the expressive potential of multimedia as a critical and creative tool , supplementing traditional forms of academic work .

name: IML 440 Interdisciplinary Thesis
description: Production of an interdisciplinary digital thesis project . Open to students in the Honors in Multimedia Scholarship Program only .

name: ART 442 Art and Technology
description: An interdisciplinary course between art and engineering that addresses creative thinking in the manipulation of media and the communication of ideas .

name: ART 120 Painting I
description: Practical introduction to oil and acrylic pigments , painting equipment , processes , and media . Primary experience in : color , composition and perception through representational and abstract painting .

name: ART 151 Digital Photography
description: An introductory course exploring the processes and practices of digital capture , imaging and printing , from web-based image posting to large-scale printing .

name: ART 210 Drawing II
description: Drawing methods and concepts , with emphasis on observing and rendering the human form and anatomy . Continued acquisition of skills , with compositional , gestural , and interpretive elements .

name: ART 310 Advanced Drawing
description: Directed examination of personal approaches in drawing ; emphasis on making visual and artistic decisions and developing an appropriate attitude towards individual expression .

name: ITP 280 Video Game Production
description: History of video games ; overview of game genres ; phases of video game development (concept , preproduction , production , post-production) ; roles of artists , programmers , designers , and producers .

name: Concept Design for Animation
description: Creating characters and environments for animation , live action , and video games .

name: CTAN 455 L Organic Modeling for Animation
description: The art of digital sculpting for animated characters , with visual effects integration .

name: Character Design Workshop
description: The basics of character design for animation : anatomy , poses , facial expressions , silhouettes , and anthropomorphism . Development of a portfolio .

name: CTAN 463 L Creative Workflow in Visual Effects
description: Spherical panoramic photography , 3-D digital environment techniques and a range of visual effects work while providing the stage for the student’s storytelling .

name: CTAN 464 L Digital Lighting and Rendering
description: Concepts , tools and techniques used to create cinematic lighting and rendering in computer-generated imagery (CGI) .

name: CTAN 465 L Digital Effects Animation
description: All aspects of digital effects animation , including particles , dynamics , and fluids . Creating water , fire , explosions , and destruction in film .

name: CTAN 485 L Pipeline and Character Modeling for Animation
description: Modeling and pipeline integration for 3-D animation props , sets and characters . Prior knowledge in Maya preferred .

name: CTAN 497 L Generative Animation
description: Introduction to software packages and practices exploring current animation techniques that leverage simulation systems . Artificial intelligence as a tool for animation .

name: CTAN 502L Experiments in Immersive Design
description: An in-depth exploration of aesthetics and techniques involved in the conceptualization , design and creation of immersive media and stereoscopic imaging .

name: CTAN 508 L Live Action Integration with Visual Effects
description: Survey of the digital techniques required to successfully marry live action shooting with CGI elements and green screen footage .

name: CTAN 564 L Motion Capture Fundamentals
description: Fundamental principles of motion capture technology explored while working through a structured series of assignments based around performance , gesture and motion .

name: CTAN 565 L Motion Capture Performance
description: The art of directing , acting , and creating story for motion capture will be explored while learning the technology behind bringing virtual actors to life .

name: ART 140 Sculpture I
description: Practical and theoretical introduction to sculpture as dimensional manipulation . Primary exploration of form , mass , gravity , surface , structure and associative recognition in three-dimensional art .

name: ITP 215L 3-D Modeling , Animation , and Special Effects
description: Developing a 3-D animation from modeling to rendering : Basics of surfacing , lighting , animation and modeling techniques . Advanced topics : compositing , particle systems , and character animation .

name: ART 260 Video and Time-based Media
description: An introductory course exploring contemporary processes and practices of video experimentation including the camera , desktop production , and editing . Experimentation with multiple modes of execution , presentation , and distribution .

name: ART 361 Internet Studio and Online Experimentation
description: A technically and conceptually intensive studio exploring contemporary processes and practices of Internet art and online expression .

name: CTIN 493L Advanced Game Project II
description: Students work in teams to polish and finalize a functional digital game suitable for distribution via the web and/or submission into independent games festivals .

name: ART 142 Modeling and Mold Making
description: Introduction to plaster mold making using clay and wax for both ceramics and sculpture . Exploration of various casting materials .

name: ART 240 Sculpture II
description: Continued examination of the concepts of three-dimensional art : interrelation of material and image , public , human and intimate scale .

name: ITP 415 3-D Design and Prototyping
description: Explore the range of 3-D printing and prototyping technologies , and their application in modern industrial , design , and creative fields .

name: ITP 305 Advanced 3D Modeling , Animation , and Special Effects
description: Advanced modeling , surfacing , and animation techniques as well as dynamics , scripting , and other advanced 3D automation procedures .

name: ITP 315 x 3D Character Animation
description: Advanced exploration of the process of bringing 3D characters to life from concept to model , and through production to finished performance .

name: ITP 360 3D Compositing and Visual Effects
description: Advanced techniques for 3D animation and visual effects development including 3D pre-visualization , match moving , dynamics , multi-pass rendering , and digital compositing .

name: ITP 450 Advanced 3D Texturing , Compositing , and Image Processing
description: Modern digital compositing , texturing , and image making techniques as they have evolved from legacy and analog media into state of the art digital formats .

name: ITP 470 Information Technology Practicum
description: Independent technology project related to specific topics under the direction of a faculty member .

name: ITP 480 Information Technology Internship
description: max 8Practical experience in applying information technology skills in real-world settings . Supervised internship at companies and start-ups . Balancing academic rigor with corporate challenges and deadlines .

name: BUAD 200 x Economic Foundations for Business
description: Examines fundamental concepts of both microeconomics and macroeconomics as they pertain to business and financial decisions .

name: BUAD 305 Abridged Core Concepts of Accounting Information
description: Uses of accounting information in decision-making ; accounting issues concerning income and cash flows , economic resources and capital .

name: ACCT 415x Intermediate Financial Accounting for Non-Accounting Majors
description: In-depth study of balance sheet , income statement , and cash flow statement issued from the perspective of a user (not preparer) of corporate financial reports .

name: PR 340 Introduction to Advertising
description: History and development of advertising ; basic advertising campaigns showing relationships of marketing , creative , print and electronic media .

name: PR 341 Advertising Copywriting
description: Writing and editing for advertising and commercial copy for all media .

name: PR 342 Advertising Media and Analysis
description: Selling , planning , buying for the media ; advertising’s relationship to society and business ; media choice .

name: PR 343 Advertising Design and Production
description: Production of advertising materials ; emphasis on the creation and design of advertising elements .

name: MKT 406 Practicum in Advertising and Promotion Design
description: Provides real-life marketing experience as a member of a student managed marketing/advertising/promotions agency . Work with a client organization on the design of an advertising/promotions campaign . Requires market research , creative design , implementation planning , and client presentation .

name: Animation Theory and Techniques
description: Methods for creating animation blending traditional techniques with contemporary technologies .

name: ITP 449x Data Mining : Descriptive and Predictive
description: Examine and compare practical methods in data mining - data preparation , classification , clustering . Knowledge discovery process is to find patterns and regularities from large datasets .

name: DSO 424 Business Forecasting
description: A variety of forecasting techniques used by a variety of businesses . Emphasis on learning to apply these techniques to real data .

name: DSO 428 Essentials and Digital Frontiers of Big Data
description: An overview of key concepts of big data and related digital technologies and their applications to different business problems . Hands-on experience at introductory level .

name: ITP 489 In-Memory Database Systems for Real Time Analytics
description: Examines the design , architecture , and capabilities of in-memory databases and their application to real-time analytics .

name: Web Analytics for News and Nonprofit Organizations
description: Introduction to using Web traffic and other audience behavior data to manage Websites and social media for news and nonprofit organizations .

name: PR 478 Social Media Analytics : Data and Content Creation for Real-time Public Relations
description: Application of monitoring tools to become social media analysts and real-time content creators ; interpretation of large data sets drawn from the social web ; understanding of how to present data visually for optimal impact .

name: ITP 125L From Hackers to CEOs : Introduction to Information Security
description: Introductory course in computer security . Fundamentals of information security management . Threats to information integrity . Ethical hacking concerns and practice . Policies and Procedures .

name: ITP 325 Ethical Hacking and Systems Defense
description: Hacking from a defense perspective . Hacker ethics and laws . Penetration testing . Vulnerability assessment . Securing workstations , servers , and networks .

name: ITP 357 Enterprise Network Design
description: Network technologies . Strategies for managing thousands of systems . Routers and managed switches . Integrated operating systems (IOS) . Windows and Linux networking . Subnets .

name: ITP 370 Information Security Management
description: Management techniques for security projects . Security team management . Laws and regulations for information security . Disaster recovery . Security Audits .

name: ITP 375 Digital Forensics
description: Forensic science techniques . Digital evidence preservation and presentation . Processes and methodologies for digital analysis .

name: ITP 425 Web Application Security
description: Web application security techniques . eCommerce vulnerabilities . Online fraud . Solutions to spam and identity theft .

name: Network Security
description: Network policy and mechanism , firewalls , malicious code ; intrusion detection , prevention , response ; cryptographic protocols for privacy ; risks of misuse , cost of prevention , and societal issues .

name: ITP 475 Advanced Digital Forensics
description: Advanced forensic techniques . Live image analysis . Network level forensic investigation . Server forensic techniques . Deposition and trial .

name: Theatre in Education
description: Exploration of the theory and practice of theatre arts in the learning environment . Design and implement projects to support elementary and secondary education .

name: Theatre and Therapy
description: Explores theatre as a healing art form . Techniques include games , improv , playback theatre , Boal’s and Moreno’s drama therapy , and Jungian dream theatre to name a few . Work with incarcerated youth , gay/lesbian/bi teens , elderly , disabled and other populations .

name: ARCH 106 x Workshop in Architecture
description: Introduction to the ways architecture is created and understood , for minors and non-majors . Hands-on discussion and laboratory session with some drawing and model building .

name: Games and Economics
description: Analysis of strategic economic interactions . Topics include bargaining , insurance , patents , voting , environmental depletion , strategic trade , learning , reputation , strikes , corporate takeovers , and the provision of public goods .

name: Neuroeconomics
description: Introduction to the methodology used in experimental neuroeconomics and discussion of neural correlates of decision-making .

name: Behavioral Economics
description: Examination of the traditional and behavioral theories of decision-making and the state of the art in the field .

name: Experimental Economics
description: Examination of economic theories and patterns of behavior useful in building new theories .

name: Economics of Happiness
description: What is happiness? How does it vary by socio-economic status and over the life cycle? This course will develop insight into the nature and determinants of subjective well-being .

name: The Financial System
description: Financial intermediaries in the flow of funds ; aggregate financial asset analysis ; money markets and interest rates ; government debt and its economic effects .

name: Managerial Economics
description: Application of microeconomic theory to problems of the firm , quantification of demand and cost relationships ; pricing policies .

name: BUAD 201 x Introduction to Business for Non-Majors
description: Introduction to the principles and practices of businesses , sequence of exercises developing the basic skills , and influence of the economy on business and individual decisions .

name: Management of Financial Institutions
description: Management problems of banks , savings and loans , and insurance companies ; pricing of services ; branching ; lending criteria ; asset and liability management .

name: Corporate Governance and CEO Pay
description: Explores how value is created (or destroyed) through incentive compensation and corporate governance . Focus on bonuses , stock options , executive compensation , and financing policies .

name: Principles of Employment Law
description: Survey of current employment law topics including employment discrimination arising within modern workplaces . Legal and business strategies for managing diversity for organizational success .

name: Online Commerce and Intellectual Property
description: Introductory course on the legal and regulatory environment of online commerce , intellectual property , patents , copyright , trademarks , domain names , entertainment , multimedia , digital and Internet law .

name: BUAD 315x Basics of Project and Operations Management for Non-Majors
description: Introduction to tools and methods for the design , production , and delivery of goods and services . Techniques for planning , monitoring , and controlling complex projects .

name: DSO 401 Business Information Systems – Spreadsheet Applications
description: Applied understanding of how spreadsheets are used to analyze business information . Create real world software applications for use in accounting , finance , marketing and operations .

name: DSO 402 Business Information Systems – Database Applications
description: Applied understanding of how work group databases are used to analyze business information . Create real world software applications used in accounting , finance , marketing and operations .

name: ART 130 Ceramics
description: Practical and theoretical exploration of the nature of surface , form , volume and mass as fundamental elements of clay sculpture and the ceramic object .

name: ART 230 Wheel Throwing
description: An introductory course using wheel throwing techniques for ceramics to explore a variety of forms through three-dimensional exercises .

name: ART 330 Advanced Ceramics
description: Directed examination of aesthetic concepts and investigation into personal ideas as they relate to the development of a creative visual language in ceramics .

name: ART 331 Clay and Glazes
description: A foundation in the formulation of clay bodies and glaze materials through lectures and studio exercises to suit specific needs with the artist in mind .

name: ART 430 Topics in Advanced Ceramics
description: Continued directed examination of aesthetic concepts and investigation into personal ideas as they relate to the development of a creative visual language in ceramics .

name: ART 434 Sound Art
description: A survey of developments in non-traditional musical instrument making in clay including design , fabrication and composition , culminating in a musical performance .

name: Chinese Language Through Films and Television
description: Enhancement of functional , advanced-level Mandarin proficiency for vocabulary , grammar , listening , speaking , reading , writing , and cultural awareness through selected Chinese-language films and television programs .

name: Chinese Language through Films and Television II
description: Further enhancement of functional , advanced-level Mandarin proficiency for vocabulary , grammar , listening , speaking , reading , writing , and cultural awareness through selected Chinese-language films and television programs .

name: HP 345 Health Issues in Entertainment Media
description: Study of major chronic illnesses and their risk factors as a foundation for discussions about the portrayal of health and illness in entertainment media .

name: CTPR 301 Creating the Non-Fiction Film
description: Research and writing challenges of non-fiction film (documentary , educational , industrial , political , etc .) , from treatment to finished script .

name: Functions of a Director
description: Theoretical considerations of the director in relationship to the multiple facets of film production .

name: Documentary Production
description: Pairs produce , direct , shoot , and edit a short documentary on a subject of their choice . Finished projects will be suitable for broadcast/festivals .

name: CTWR 315 x Filmwriting
description: The basics of screenwriting : theme , story structure , characterization , format , dialogue , and scene description . A character profile , short treatment , and first 30 pages of the screenplay are written . Lectures , screenings , and in-class readings .

name: Japanese Anime
description: Explores the visual , dramatic and social conventions of Japanese animation in film and television . Examines anime fan communities , manga and their impact .

name: CTCS 466 Theatrical Film Symposium
description: Lectures and readings on creative problems in the motion picture industry ; current films ; interviews with visiting producers , directors , writers , performers .

name: CTCS 467 Television Symposium
description: Lectures and readings on creative problems in the television industry ; study of current and historical trends , interviews with producers , directors , writers and performers .

name: CTPR 327 Motion Picture Cinematography
description: Use of high definition motion picture equipment to explore the fundamentals of shot design , movement and lighting . In class group projects .

name: Motion Picture Editing
description: Theory , techniques , and practices in picture editing ; use of standard editing equipment ; individual projects .

name: CTPR 460 Film Business Procedures and Distribution
description: Financing , budgeting , management as applied to films ; problems of distribution , including merchandising , cataloging , evaluation , and film library management .

name: Managing Television Stations and Internet Media
description: Managing electronic media , including radio and television stations , broadcast and cable networks , and the Internet .

name: CLAS 160gp Ancient Lives
description: The lives of prominent Greeks , Romans and others in their ancient historical and biographical contexts and in modern reevaluations through various written and visual media .

name: PHIL 115g Ancient Greek Culture and Society
description: Focus on the literary achievement from the beginning of Greek literature to the fourth century with a special emphasis on the philosophers .

name: Liberal Arts Reading Salon
description: Critical readings of a series of texts in the liberal arts designed to promote discussion of important themes , theoretical approaches , research directions , and interdisciplinary connections .

name: CORE 400 Capstone
description: Guided study of select works of classical literature in relation to contemporary issues and concerns . Capstone for minor in Classical Perspectives .

name: CLAS 300 Women in Antiquity
description: Theoretical approaches to women’s history ; evidence for the daily life , legal status , and religion of ancient Greek and Roman women ; the female in literature and art .

name: COMM 330 Rhetoric in Classical Culture
description: Theories of communication and persuasion in ancient Greece and Rome ; cultural and social contexts of classical rhetorical theory ; major historical figures and concepts .

name: THTR 197g Comedy and Performance
description: Comedy and Performance traces the history of comedy in performance from its earliest incarnations to the present day .

name: THTR 322 Improv 2 : Advanced Improv
description: An in depth study of improvised comedy scene work . An exploration of the primary tools and structure for creating improvised scenes and developing characters for stage and screen .

name: THTR 474 Introduction to Stand Up Comedy
description: An introduction to the discipline of conceiving , writing , and creating original Stand Up Comedy routines .

name: THTR 422 Improv 3 : Long Form Improvisation
description: Emphasis on  Full Length Improvised Performances including the styles of various playwrights , genres of films , “the Harold ,” improvised plays and musicals . Building on the groundwork of THTR 122  Improvisation and Theeatre Games and THTR 322  Improv 2 , students apply the techniques to long form unscripted performances .

name: THTR 423 Magic
description: The dramatic art of making an audience believe something is impossible . The history and performance of magic including illusion , mentalism , vanishing , coin and card tricks .

name: THTR 469 Satire and Parody in Performance
description: A survey of the history and implementation of American satire and parody in performance from Mark Twain to Jon Stewart and beyond . Building on the past , students will learn the structures and techniques for parodying and satirizing the contemporary world through writing and performance .

name: Sketch Comedy for Theatre
description: A writing-performance workshop in which the students create , rehearse , and perform original sketch comedy material .

name: Sketch Comedy in Performance
description: A workshop in the techniques of performing humorous sketches , in collaboration with writers , directors , and technicians in the production of a live sketch comedy show .

name: THTR 482 Stand Up 2 : Honing Your Act
description: Enhancement and extension of the student’s comedic set using new forms and structures to develop the student’s comedic sensibility and content culminating with 15 minutes of original stand up comedy content .

name: THTR 483 Characters of Comedy
description: An in depth study of the performance of archetypal characters of comedy focused on the lineage from commedia to sit-com .  Students will create original characters from archetypal forms and explore their relatiohships in classis and contemporary comedic performance .

name: Acting in Television Commercials
description: An on-camera , workshop-style introduction to techniques , perspectives and theories unique to performing in television commercials .

name: Directing for Television
description: Preparation of director’s preproduction blockout ; study of direction for live , tape , and film production , for both dramatic and informational television .

name: CTPR 464 Directing the Television Sketch Comedy Show
description: Concepts and skills in directing sketch comedy shows , using the techniques of live television . Hands-on experience on live weekly shows .

name: Directing The Comedic Scene
description: Directing comedy : casting , rehearsing , directing actors , scene analysis , staging , shooting , and editing , leading to the filming of a two-person comic scene .

name: CTWR 324 Introduction to Half-Hour Television Writing
description: The fundamentals of writing for comedic episodic television . Writing scenes from popular comedy series and examination of half-hour television comedy story structure .

name: ART 360 Video Studio
description: An intensive video studio in the understanding and method of timebased , narrative and non-narrative art .

name: COMM 321 Communication and Social Media
description: Social media within the broader social , political , and historical contexts ; key themes include labor , Web 2 .0 , self-branding , celebrity , participation , privacy , online shaming , and activism .

name: Communication Technology and Culture
description: Examination of philosophies and popular representations of technology from the origins of western culture to the present and identifies the complex attitudes toward technology .

name: The Cultures of New Media
description: Cultural implications of computer-mediated communication and related media . Ideological responses to media innovation ; debates over artificial intelligence , virtual communities , and virtual reality .

name: COMM 375 Business and Professional Communication
description: Oral and written communication skills demanded in the workplace including informative and persuasive speeches ; interviewing ; team communication ; and training material preparation .

name: DES 313 Graphic Design in Fashion
description: An intensive studio and lecture course focusing on the applications of graphic design in fashion and related fields .

name: DES 333 New York Design Study Tour
description: Historical and contemporary aspects of the New York design world , including a one-week trip to New York City to visit design firms , studios and museums . Airfare and accommodations extra . By application only .

name: DES 433 International Design Study Tour
description: An immersive experience in the design culture of a global city or region that includes a short (two-week or less) international trip .

name: Social and Economic Implications of Communication Technologies
description: Social and economic impacts of information and communication technologies ; social factors that shape technological change ; issues include access , privacy , freedom of expression , productivity , democratic control .

name: Legal Communication
description: Analytical and communicative aspects of judicial argument ; philosophy and techniques of jury trials , cross examination , and appellate advocacy ; research , preparation , and presentation of case briefs .

name: Legal Issues and New Media
description: Examines laws and regulatory policies shaping new media , especially the Internet ; impact of regulation on development and use of communication technology .

name: COMM 427 Topics in Media Economics , Law and Policy
description: Selected current topics in the overlapping areas of media economics , law , and policy .

name: Campaign Communication
description: Problems in political communication : creating an informed electorate , use of mass media , factors in voter persuasion . Guest experts in political analysis , opinion polling , communication evaluation .

name: Law of Mass Communication
description: Press law ; government controls on the news media ; legal responsibilities of the journalist .

name: Video Games : Content , Industry , and Policy
description: Introduction to the medium ; history of video games ; video games as aesthetic products , cultural products , economic outputs ; policy issues , effects , and sites of community .

name: Global Strategy for the Communications Industry
description: Addresses the practical and theoretical aspects of the international economy that are most relevant to management strategy in the communications industry .

name: COMM 449 Perspectives on the Networked Press
description: Critical survey of the forces defining today’s networked press , examining the people , technologies , and institutions that produce news in today’s online environments .

name: Human and Technological Systems in Organizations
description: How communication and information technologies are linked to organizational control , design , cultures ; technology and competitive advantage ; ethics and policy issues ; technology-mediated work .

name: Ethical Issues in Entertainment and Communication
description: Examines social and political controversies over conflicting ethical standards for communication in a variety of media : mass-media , communication technology , and entertainment .

name: Cyber Law and Privacy
description: Cyber legal issues , search and seizure , 4th amendment and digital evidence , private searches , case law relating to search and seizure .

name: Macintosh , OSX , and iOS Forensics
description: Digital forensics . Digital evidence . Apple . Mac . Macintosh . OSX . iOS . iPhone . iPad .

name: Cyber Breach Investigations
description: Cyber breaches . Data theft . Enterprise data analysis . Network forensic analysis . Server forensics .

name: Mobile Device Security and Forensics
description: Mobile device security . Mobile device forensics . Android . Blackberry . Windows phone . Symbian .

name: Cyber Litigation Support
description: Civil Litigation . Digital and Electronic Evidence . Electronic Discovery . eDiscovery . Electronically Stored Information .

name: ITP 365 Managing Data in C++
description: Overview of basic data structures and algorithms including linked lists , stacks , queues , binary trees , and hash tables .

name: ITP 341 App Development for Phones and Tablets
description: Develop phone and tablet applications for opensource platforms such as Android that utilize the core functionality of mobile devices such as GPS , accelerometers , touch gestures .

name: ITP 342 Mobile Application Development
description: Develop applications for mobile devices such as iPhones and iPads (iOS) and other smart phones (Android) . Build a mobile application from start to finish .

name: General Construction Estimating
description: Theory of estimating . Quantity surveying ; unit cost synthesis and analysis . Bid organization and preparation ; competitive simulations and exercises .

name: Construction Methods and Equipment
description: Current procedures in selected fields of construction ; organization and planning ; equipment economics ; machinery .

name: Sustainable Design and Construction
description: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) ; Green Building strategies ; Carbon Footprinting ; calculating the embodied energy of building materials ; cyclical processes in design and construction .

name: Building Information Modeling and Integrated Practice
description: Building Information Modeling , current BIM technologies ; coordination of design and construction ; information management throughout building lifecycle ; project delivery systems and technologies for integrated practice .

name: FBE 400x Introduction to Real Estate Finance and Development
description: Case analysis examining economic and financial aspects of real estate decisions for non-business majors . Focuses on dynamics of financing , markets and the development process .

name: CE 404 Business and Intellectual Property Law for Engineers
description: An examination of legal issues confronting the professional engineer . Topics include the legal system , contracts , risk management , forms of doing business , capital formation and intellectual property rights .

name: Construction Law and the Property Development Process
description: Legal aspects of property development and construction : land use , construction practices and specifications , architecture and engineering contracts , agency , subcontracting , professional registration , liability , insurance , liens , and bonds .

name: American Popular Culture
description: (Enroll in HIST 380 )

name: Persuasion
description: Theories and research in social influence ; strategies and tactics of persuasive communications in such settings as politics , public relations , advertising , business .

name: Introduction to Digital Logic
description: (Enroll in EE 101 )

name: PSYC 451 Formation and Change of Attitudes
description: IrregularEffects of socialization , personal influence , propaganda and social structure on private attitudes and public opinion .

name: PSYC 456 Conservation Psychology
description: Examination of theories , research , interventions regarding psychology of environmental sustainability including cognition , emotion , behavior , attitudes , persuasion , values , social identity , consumerism , and science of happiness .

name: SOCI 155gm Immigrant America
description: Examination of the immigrant experience in the United States . Comparative analysis of social context of migration , formation of immigrant communities , and social integration of immigrants .

name: SOCI 210g Science , Technology , and Social Conflict
description: Science and technology change society and how we understand ourselves . In turn , social struggles influence science . We will explore the interplay between these forces .

name: DENT 412 Fundamentals of Craniofacial and Dental Technology
description: Biomedical engineering and technology applied to oral health professions . Dental biomaterials , CAD-CAM , digital dental technology and tissue engineering applications to craniofacial diseases , disorders , and enhancements .

name: Basic Tissues and Histology and Embryology
description: Histology of basic tissues , oral histology , orofacial embryology , orofacial clefts and functional correlates .

name: Introduction to Dentistry
description: History and current role of dental science in the health services field ; review of research ; overview of dental procedures with laboratory experience and practice observation .

name: Engineering Biology Matters
description: Engineering students will learn biological phenomena in the context of engineering principles and explore biological mechanisms and processes as analogies for designing engineered systems .

name: Alexander the Great : Leadership , Personality and World Conquest
description: Ancient sources on Alexander’s life , personality and conquests . Modern evaluations of his achievements as a prototype for - autocracy and empire-building from antiquity to today .

name: MDA 325 Case Studies in Modern Leadership
description: Study of a single leader or small set of leaders , including the strengths and weaknesses that distinguish them and the cultural forces that nurture them .

name: Presidents and the Presidency
description: Presidential coalition ; sources of presidential power ; recent leadership styles ; decision-making within the presidency .

name: The Art and Adventure of Leadership
description: Areas of knowledge and kinds of competencies that are fundamental to the study and practice of leadership in a variety of settings .

name: MDA 475 The Future of California
description: Challenges facing California ; options for governmental and constitutional reform ; opportunities for economic growth ; demographic and cultural changes ; education , environment , and other policy issues .

name: Critical Approaches to Photography
description: IrregularSelected problems in the history , theory and criticism of photography ; recent scholarship considered in relationship to specific photographers and photographic images .

name: The Rhetoric of Ideas : Ideology and Propaganda
description: Techniques of propaganda in public discourse ; communication strategies through which ideas become ideologies ; case studies in wartime and corporate propaganda , imperialism , and cultural colonialism .

name: COMM 395m Gender , Media and Communication
description: Issues of gender in communication , including : media representations of femininity and masculinity ; and gender’s role in communication at the interpersonal , public , and cultural levels .

name: HIST 225g Film , Power , and American History
description: U .S . motion pictures as both a response to and comment upon major events , problems , and themes in 20th century America .

name: HIST 255g The Evolution Debates
description: IrregularHistorical perspective for current debates on evolution , investigating the contexts for the emergence and development of evolutionary theory and its subsequent impact on society .

name: Entertainment , Communication and Society
description: Theoretical foundation for understanding the construction , consumption , and consequences of entertainment from classical to contemporary times ; situates entertainment within the ecology of information and communication .

name: COMM 306 Innovation , Entertainment , and the Arts
