description: Explorations of innovation in the entertainment business . The effects of digital mobile media on TV , movies , music , advertising , social networks and art .

name: Advertising and Communication
description: Advertising as a mode of communication ; U .S . advertising history and institutions ; economic and policy contexts (domestic and global) ; critical analysis of advertising texts .

name: Media Consumption
description: Theoretical approaches to the study of media consumption and audiences ; examines international media and consumption practices ; explores new media’s impact on consumption .

name: Global Entertainment
description: Survey of economic , political , and cultural dimensions of the global entertainment marketplace ; focuses on the international production and distribution of media products and services .

name: Home Entertainment
description: History and impact of television and ancillary home entertainment (pay television , cable television , home video , DVD , DVR , video-on-demand , etc .) on media industries and consumer experience .

name: Music as Communication
description: Examines music’s unique characteristics as a communicative form and the cultural , economic , political and social influences in music interpretation and production .

name: COMM 457 Youth and Media
description: Exploration of youth media and culture , including television , movies , video games , toys , magazines , music , social media . Examines representations of youth and youth as audience .

name: Entertainment , Business and Media in Today's Society
description: An examination of the symbiotic relationship of the entertainment business and the media ; press coverage of the entertainment industry ; Hollywood’s relationship with news media .

name: JOUR 493 Comics and Graphic Storytelling
description: Focus on comics as a medium to tell a broad range of stories and speak to diverse kinds of audiences . Develop a core vocabulary for thinking about comics as a medium and analyze how artists have drawn on that vocabulary in a range of contexts .

name: Comparative Regionalism
description: Analysis of the factors that provide different forms of regional arrangements in different parts of the world (e .g , NAFTA , FU , ASEAN) .

name: HIST 438 Seminar in Pre-Modern Japanese History
description: A readings and research seminar dealing with one topic in the history of Japan before 1550 . Topics will change each time the course is offered .

name: Culture , Money , and Power : Japanese-American Relations since 1853
description: Examination of the role of cultural , economic , and military forces in shaping relations between two of the most important nations in the Asia/Pacific regions .

name: Japanese Politics
description: Contemporary Japanese politics , political economy , and political processes . How political systems are organized ; roles of bureaucrats , politicians , interest groups , and social activists in policymaking .

name: ARTL 310 Music and Dance In Paris Salon Culture
description: During this twenty-four day Maymester course in Paris , students will explore moments in Parisian salon culture as sites of artistic inspiration and collaboration .

name: DANC 170 Choreography and Performance
description: Compositional methods and approaches to developing choreographic ideas ; integration of improvisational techniques as a means to generate movement ideas and expand movement vocabulary , edit choreographic material , and evaluate and execute choreography and performance .

name: DANC 175 Choreography for the Screen
description: Creative choreography of theatrical dance for the screen . Emphasis on rhythmic analysis , versatility , composition , notation techniques , and stylizing .

name: DANC 483 Dance Performance
description: Preparation , rehearsal , and performance of experimental choreography in main stage repertory .

name: DANC 183a Ballet
description: An introduction to Classical Ballet technique with beginning-level barre and center work , focusing on correct body alignment and musicality . Development of a basic knowledge of ballet history and terminology .

name: DANC 185a Hip Hop Dance
description: An introduction to elements of Hip Hop Dance , including technique , movement , musical rhythm , tempo , and phrasing , as well as the historical context required to develop the skills needed to practice and perform this popular dance form .

name: DANC 186 Afro Cuban Dance
description: An introduction to Afro Cuban Dance techniques , basic drum rhythms , and musicality , with an understanding of cultural practices and vocalizations . Afro Cuban Dance examines the traditions related to specific ethnic groups in Latin Europe and West Africa , and the influences of Rumba and Salsa Dance on the form .

name: DANC 187 Bollywood Dance
description: An introduction to basic and intermediate Bollywood Dance , including technique , movement , musical rhythm , phrases , and choreography . Inspired by the high energy music from Indian films , Bollywood is a fusion form that combines traditional Indian folk and classical dances with Hip Hop , Jazz , Latin , and Middle-eastern dance .

name: Visual Culture and Communication
description: Examines issues of visual images in communication related to history , modernity , cityscapes , news media , advertising , evidence , science , digital technology , and globalization .

name: ART 250 Photography II
description: Continued examination of the conceptual , technical , aesthetic and historical tools necessary for a well-informed deliberate art practice with an emphasis on color photography . Work is in digital or analog .

name: ART 350 Advanced Photography
description: Continued examination of the conceptual , technical , aesthetic and historical tools necessary for a well-informed deliberate art practice with an emphasis on color photography . Work is in digital or analog .

name: ART 460 Post-Material Studio
description: Advanced studio and discussion course that affords the student a conceptual and practical platform from which to discuss and realize a major work or series .

name: ART 312 Comics Project
description: All aspects of comics will be covered , from writing and composition to inking and marketing through the production of an individual 15-page comic creation .

name: ART 315 Studies in Drawing and Painting
description: A studio examination of rotating topics in drawing/painting , either media-based or content-driven , with individual and collaborative projects ; topics change each semester .

name: ART 370 Printmaking
description: Introductory course in various printmaking techniques ; necessary skills and inherent expressive qualities of different printmaking methods are explored .

name: ART 410 Topics in Advanced Drawing
description: Continued directed examination of personal approaches in drawing , emphasis on making visual and artistic decisions and developing an appropriate attitude toward visual expression .

name: ART 470 Topics in Advanced Printmaking
description: Directed examination of specific printmaking media in relation to personal aesthetic goals and expressive concepts .

name: English Literature of the Middle Ages (1100–1500)
description: Selected studies in major figures , genres , and themes of Middle English literature to Malory , with special emphasis on Chaucer .

name: English Literature of the 16th Century
description: Selected studies in the non-dramatic literature of Renaissance England , with emphasis on Sidney , Spenser , and Shakespeare .

name: English Literature of the 17th Century
description: Selected studies of prose and poetry in the age of Bacon , Donne , Jonson , Herbert , Browne , Marvell , and Milton .

name: HIST 309 Britain and Ireland , 1100–1500 C .E .
description: OtherEnglish and Irish culture , economics , and politics during the expansion of the Norman-English kingdom , the colonization of Ireland , and subsequent development toward the English nation-state .

name: The Renaissance
description: IrregularThe flowering of arts , literature , and learning at the end of the Middle Ages .

name: HIST 325 Early Modern Britain
description: OtherA survey of one of the most pivotal eras in British history : reform , regicide , and revolutions ; new ideas , new religions , and new worlds .

name: The British Empire : 1588–1834
description: Emergence of the British Empire , emphasizing colonies in the Americas ; the development of imperial economy , imperial wars , slavery and abolitionism .

name: The Age of Humanism and Reformation
description: IrregularThe thought , art , politics , and religion of western Europe in the 16th and 17th centuries ; emphasis on the contribution of Christian humanism .

name: AHIS 430 Studies in Renaissance Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Renaissance art and architecture .

name: AHIS 433 Studies in Medieval Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of Medieval art and architecture .

name: AHIS 453 Studies in Baroque Art
description: In-depth exploration of specified topics within the area of 17th century art and architecture .

name: English Drama to 1800
description: Representative plays , especially those of the Elizabethan , Jacobean , and Restoration periods .

name: The English Novel to 1800
description: Theory and practice of fiction in works of writers such as Defoe , Richardson , Fielding , Sterne , Burney , and Smollett .

name: HIST 307 Women in Medieval Europe , c . 1000–1500
description: OtherThe influences of cultural , social , economic , familial , religious , and political factors on medieval women , as well as consideration of differences among them .

name: Early American Indian History
description: Relations of European settlers with native Americans from the 16th into the early 19th centuries ; cultural contacts , trade and eventual conflicts .

name: MPEM 450 Collegium Workshop
description: Study and rehearsal of music of the Middle Ages , Renaissance , and Baroque ; technique , interpretation , improvisation , and ornamentation .

name: ENGL 497 Senior Seminar in Early Modern Studies
description: Intensive engagement with current research , problems , and methodologies in Early Modern discourses and cultures . Required capstone seminar for interdepartmental minor in early modern studies . Open only to seniors ; open only to early modern studies minors .

name: GEOL 241Lg Energy Systems
description: Energy resources from a global perspective , including fossil fuels , nuclear , and renewable energy .

name: GEOL 351 L Climate Systems
description: Introduces systems behavior in the context of climate dynamics . Modules of instruction geared to climate system application to real world problems .

name: The Global Environment
description: (Enroll in BISC 427 )

name: Environmental Communication
description: Communication about environmental controversies in the public sphere : history of environmentalism ; forms of citizen participation ; media coverage ; advocacy campaigns and movements ; scientific and industrial discourses .

name: Global Issues : Impact on Educational Outcomes
description: Situates U .S . education within the global context and examines the impact of global issues on national and international schooling in the 21st Century .

name: Social Change , Difference and Access to Schooling
description: Examines access to schooling and quality education in international contexts across student difference indexed by race , class and gender .

name: Unrealized Promise and Hope for Education in 21st Century
description: Investigation of how educational promise has been historically realized and derailed is reviewed , with focus on technologies of new media in designing equitable social futures .

name: Educational Inquiry
description: Introduction to the skills and knowledge required to be competent consumers and producers of education research . Students will be asked to design an educational study .

name: CNTV 375 Breaking Into the Entertainment Industry
description: An overview of the entertainment industry and the tools needed to secure jobs and survive and succeed in the market .

name: The Business of the Entertainment Industry : Motion Pictures , Television , Animation , Video Games , and Interactive Entertainment
description: An in-depth analysis of the history , evolution , and current state of the motion picture , television , animation , video game , and interactive entertainment industries .

name: The Art and Commerce of Independent Film
description: A comprehensive analysis of the development-to-release life cycle of independently produced films .

name: Art and Industry of the Theatrical Film
description: Detailed analysis of one theatrical film from conception through critical reception to develop an understanding of motion pictures as art , craft , and industry .

name: The Entertainment Entrepreneur : Getting Your First Project Made
description: The practical aspects of entrepreneurial producing in the entertainment industry . Identifying and understanding the pitfalls and benefits of creating one’s own projects .

name: CNTV 474 Digital DNA : Media Redefined
description: A practical , hands-on learning experience in creating media content and turning that content into a myriad of viable businesses .

name: Production Planning
description: Theory , discussion , and practical application of production planning during preproduction and production of a film .

name: Venture Initiation : Launching and Scaling Your Startup
description: Learn to build a startup from concept to reality . Focus on real-world entrepreneurial action and execution .

name: Digital Playbook for Entrepreneurs : Creating a Tech Startup
description: Learn to use digital tools and technologies , such as social media , mobile , cloud computing , and e-commerce , to start and grow entrepreneurial ventures .

name: Practicum in Business Issues (Internship)
description: Combined classroom discussion and field application of business theories and practices ; part-time internship employment . Project to be jointly defined by student , employer and professor .

name: BAEP 499 Special Topics
description: Current developments in the field of entrepreneurship : topics to be selected each semester .

name: BISC 419 L Environmental Microbiology
description: Qualitative and quantitative appraisal of microbial activities in pure and contaminated environments ; microbial community and its development ; interspecific relationships ; effects of microorganisms on their surroundings .

name: CE 443 Environmental Chemistry
description: Chemistry of water , gas , liquid and solid wastes . Chemical principles applicable to environmental engineering .

name: ENE 201 Introduction to Applied Environmental Science and Engineering
description: Gateway to BS in Civil Engineering (Environmental Engineering) , BS , Environmental Engineering , and Minor in Environmental Engineering . Fundamental concepts of environmental science and engineering . Pollution control and remediation for air , water and soil . Pollution remediation for developing countries .

name: Seminars in Environmental Engineering
description: Hazardous waste management , biodegradation of environmental pollutants , groundwater problems , waste minimization , energy resources , and air pollution control .

name: HIST 271g Telling Native American Stories
description: An exploration of the history of Native America peoples and the ways they understood and explained the changes in their lives from 1492 to 1840 .

name: ANTH 332g Anthropology and Narrative Medicine
description: Exploration of illness , disability , and healing narratives , how narratives are culturally shaped , and their significance for western biomedical practices .

name: ANTH 409 Indigenous Languages in the Contemporary World
description: Examination of indigenous languages in Northern Ireland , with a focus on the sociopolitical dimension of revitalization movement .

name: German Folklore and Popular Culture
description: Survey and analysis of folklore and cultural phenomena , including tales , legends , and myths ; folk and popular music ; beliefs and customs . In English .

name: The Armenian Heritage : History , Arts , and Culture
description: A multidisciplinary exploration of the Armenian cultural heritage through the ages — folklore , traditions , religious practices , literature , architecture , painting , sculpture , music , theatre , film and dance .

name: PSYC 165Lg Drugs , Behavior and Society
description: IrregularAn integrative systems perspective of drugs ; including their historical , economic , and cultural importance , psychopharmacology , addiction , relationship to crime , and therapeutic use in treating psychological disorders .

name: SOCI 142gm Diversity and Racial Conflict
description: Introduction to the causes and effects of contemporary race relations in a diverse U .S . society . Exploration of racial conflict at the personal and institutional levels .

name: Law and Psychology : Examining the Criminal Justice Process
description: Examination of the capacity of the criminal justice process to produce accurate verdicts . Application of psychological research on witnesses , detectives , suspects , judges and jurors .

name: PSYC 363 Criminal Behavior
description: Genetic , biological , psychological , and sociological characteristics of those who evidence criminal behavior ; theoretical formulations to be reviewed and appraised .

name: PSYC 365 Introduction to Forensic Psychology
description: Survey of current topics , technologies and techniques . Students acquire a basic understanding of how forensic psychologists contribute their unique expertise to the American legal system .

name: Psychology and Law
description: Explores issues of responsibility and credibility . Intentional and unintentional behavior . Clinical biases . Topics include witness credibility , confessions , cults , hostages , battered persons , and repressed memories .

name: PPD 340 The American System of Justice
description: IrregularIntroduction to the system of justice administration : components — police services , judiciary , corrections ; interrelationships and issues ; management strategies for change .

name: Politics of Local Criminal Justice
description: Roles and behavior of major legal and political participants in the criminal justice system including the police , the legal profession , judges , and the public .

name: IML 575 Graduate Media Arts Research Lab
description: A hands-on mentored graduate research lab experience within the context of media art and in association with a real-world project . Open only to graduate students .

name: CTWR 405 Storytelling for Virtual and Augmented Reality
description: Storytelling for the 360-degree visual arena . Focus on immersive worlds , challenges of virtual and augmented reality , and active audience engagement .

name: IML 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: Games for Animation
description: Contemporary examples and theories of the crossover between animation and video game practices .

name: MTEC 277x Introduction to Music Technology
description: A survey of the technology used to create , prepare , perform , and distribute music , with an emphasis on recording , MIDI , music production , mastering and Internet technologies .

name: Audio Expression
description: Foundational aesthetic principles and creative technologies for game audio . Processing , mixing , and controlling sound for games for expressive effect .

name: CTPR 473 Spotting Music for Cinema
description: A real world approach to spotting music for film : why film music exists and the many ways it is used in storytelling . For filmmakers as well as composers .

name: MUCO 221a x Composition for Non-Majors
description: Introduction to the composition of concert music . Includes set exercises , free composition , study of selected compositions . Intended for interested , qualified students not majoring in composition .

name: CTIN 497 Interactive Media Startup
description: Pitching , production planning , forming a company and seeking funding for your creative media idea .

name: Studies in Art , Science , and Technology
description: Examination of the connections between art , science , and technology , focusing on a specific time period and/or set of questions .

name: SWMS 310 Gender and Social Justice
description: Exploration of the ways in which developments and policies , including neoliberalism , the carceral state , and economic precarity , are connected and gendered .

name: BISC 483 Geobiology and Astrobiology
description: Relationships between microbiota and the earth environment including the hydrosphere , lithosphere and atmosphere , with consideration of the potential for life on other planets .

name: GEOL 433 L Paleontology and Evolution in Deep Time
description: Origin and evolution of life ; Precambrian life ; evolutionary history of major groups during the Phanerozoic ; mass extinctions ; deep time and evolutionary processes .

name: BISC 474L Ecosystem Function and Earth Systems
description: General principles of ecosystem function , energy flow and materials cycling in marine systems at various scales and the importance of microbial processes in these systems . Taught on Catalina Island .

name: GEOL 460 L Geochemistry
description: Composition , origin , and evolution of the earth ; principles of physical chemistry applied to aqueous systems ; reaction-diffusion modeling and problems in sedimentary geochemistry ; global (bio)geochemical cycles and environmental problems .

name: GEOL 316 L Petrologic Systems
description: Formation and identification of igneous , metamorphic and sedimentary rocks ; interpretation of tectonic and environmental settings based on rock type and chemistry .

name: GEOL 321 L Structural Geology and Tectonics
description: Field and theoretical aspects of rock deformation , analysis of structural systems , and stress and strain ; orogenic belts and plate tectonics ; introduction to field techniques and construction of geologic maps .

name: GEOL 440 L Geophysics and Geoengineering
description: Plate tectonics , magnetic and gravity fields , earthquakes , seismic waves , reflection and refraction seismics , heat transport , mantle convection , deep Earth structure , data analysis . Includes field trip .

name: German III , Conversation and Composition
description: Intermediate German . Increasing emphasis on listening and speaking skills and a review of basic structures of German . Discussion of cultural aspects .

name: Conversational German IV
description: Conversational German in a variety of topical settings and vocabulary domains .

name: Business German I
description: Introduction to German business language structure including correspondence and oral communication . In German .

name: Business German II
description: Continuation of GERM 310  . Terminology and style of commercial and legal texts , analyzed and applied in oral and written work . In German .

name: Advanced Composition and Stylistics
description: Development of competence in written expression ; fundamentals of style in expository writing . In German .

name: Composition and Conversation on Contemporary Affairs
description: Practice in oral and written German , emphasizing contemporary cultural and social developments in the German-speaking countries of Europe . In German .

name: Composition and Conversation in Cultural History
description: Practice in oral and written German , emphasizing the cultural history of the German-speaking countries of Europe . In German .

name: Introduction to Literary Studies
description: Review of essential literary terms , concepts , and critical methods through analysis and discussion of selected primary and secondary works . In German .

name: Colloquium on Poetry
description: Definition and analysis of lyric genre through a study of major poets , such as Goethe , Schiller , Heine , Rilke , and Hofmannsthal ; poetic traditions from the 17th century to the present . In German .

name: Colloquium on Prose
description: Study of German prose from the 18th century to the present ; emphasis on narrative and thematic perspectives in relation to social change and on modernism since Kafka . In German .

name: Profile of German Literature I
description: Survey of major trends in German literature within their historical and cultural contexts from the beginnings to the Baroque period . In German .

name: Profile of German Literature II
description: Survey of major trends , figures , and authors in German literature and culture of the 18th and 19th centuries within the European context . In German .

name: Life and Death in Nazi Germany
description: Social , cultural and medical history of Nazi Germany , emphasizing the Nazi vision of a racially pure national community .

name: COMM 324mw Intercultural Communication
description: Cultural variables and social psychological processes that influence intercultural interaction ; relationship between communication and culture in diverse settings including business , medicine , and education .

name: COMM 385 Organizational Communication
description: How communication processes both create organizations and are constrained by them . Theory and research into topics such as culture , technology , power , leadership and decision-making in a variety of organizational contexts .

name: Communication and Social Change in China
description: Examines social , political , and cultural implications of media and communication on Chinese society ; regulations relevant to Chinese communication ; market reforms , telecommunication , Internet and creative industries .

name: MDA 110 Contemporary Issues and Cases in Health Care
description: An introduction to the major areas of health care ; the provider’s relationship to choices in professional practice ; ethics and historical context .

name: Preparation for the Clinical Experience
description: Discussion and exercises in clinically relevant topics (professional behavior , patient privacy , medical ethics , cultural competency , teamwork , etc .) in preparation for experience in the clinical setting .

name: Challenges in the Forefront of Biomedical Ethics
description: Examination of fundamental ethical concepts and principles in clinical health care and biomedical research . Use of film , case studies and discussion .

name: The History of Medicine : a Doctor's Perspective
description: Explores the role of medicine/surgery in society , whose ideas about health and disease have undergone enormous changes from antiquity to the present day .

name: MEDS 300g Statistical Methods for Biomedical Research
description: Fundamental basis for various statistical tests , underlying assumptions , and statistical analyses used in biomedical and clinical research .

name: Human Cadaveric Anatomy
description: Anatomical structure and function of the major regions of the human body as related to health and disease , using clinical cases , lectures and cadaveric demonstrations .

name: MEDS 330 Bionics : Solutions to Enable the Disabled
description: Focused examination of medical bionics with emphasis on solutions that enable the disabled and detailed discussions and evaluations of the social and technological aspects of bionic medical devices .

name: Human Development : From Stem to Sternum
description: An introduction to transformation of a single cell into a mature organism .

name: The Brain in Health and Disease
description: Study of the human brain with emphasis on structure-functional relationships , illustrative case studies , current imaging techniques , with illustrative laboratory exercises using specimens and slides .

name: MEDS 350 Neurochemistry of Addiction : Drugs , Brain , and Behavior
description: The neurochemistry of psychiatric illness and addiction , introduction to brain and nervous system biochemistry , anatomy and disease states . Covers prescribed medications and drugs of abuse .

name: From Bench to Bedside : New Frontiers in Biomedical Research
description: A theoretical basis of laboratory approaches that help the biomedical or physician scientist in understanding the etiology of disease and targeting disease processes .

name: Organ Failure : Non-Communicable Chronic Disease
description: An examination of frequently treated diseases with the greatest impact on society . Involvement of medical specialists and actual patients as guests .

name: Stem Cells : Fact and Fiction
description: Exploring how stem cells and regenerative medicine are portrayed in culture , the scientific underpinnings of what is currently possible , and visions into the future .

name: MEDS 420 Clinical Pediatrics
description: Explores enduring and fascinating topics in Pediatrics through a modern lens , incorporating first hand patient-care experiences in clinics and hospitals , and didactic case-based discussions .

name: MEDS 425 Medical Examiner-Coroner : Investigating Death
description: Emphasizes the team-based approach used by forensic scientists , medical examiners and coroners to investigate the circumstances and determine the cause/manner of death .

name: MEDS 440 Introduction to Surgical Principles
description: Introduction to the spectrum of surgical care , taught by surgeons , with the goal of developing an appreciation of the role that surgery plays in society .

name: MEDS 445 Cancer : Introduction to Oncology in the Modern Era
description: Introduction to the spectrum of clinical and scientific issues surrounding contemporary cancer care – molecular diagnostics , genomic medicine , modern therapeutics , and community/patient engagement .

name: OB/GYN : The Medicine and Surgery of Reproduction
description: An introduction to the practical realities of modern obstetric and gynecology practice from the point of view of practicing surgeon scientists at USC .

name: Emergency Health Care
description: Principles of emergency medical services , ranging from prehospital care and advanced life-saving , to minor injuries and illnesses . Interactive experience with ER physicians/emergency health care providers .

name: Wilderness and Survival Medicine
description: Medical physiology principles of people under “extreme” wilderness conditions , factors affecting remote medical care , and basic survival strategies , led by Emergency Medicine physicians .

name: MEDS 490x Directed Research in Biomedical Science
description: Individual research and readings .

name: COMM 443 Communicating Health Messages and Medical Issues
description: How communication — interpersonal , mass media , and information technologies — shapes health behavior . Topics : doctor-patient consults ; public campaigns ; health issues in entertainment , news , and on the Internet .

name: Interpersonal Communication
description: Analysis of face-to-face interaction ; role of communication in the development , maintenance and destruction of relationships ; communication processes in managing interpersonal conflict .

name: Communication and Conflict
description: Nature and functions of communication in human conflict ; development of communication skills for managing conflict productively in interpersonal , organizational and intercultural contexts .

name: Health Communication
description: Behavioral approaches to health communication ; communication competencies in health care settings , theories of risky behaviors , and behavioral change programs ; special emphasis on AIDS-related issues .

name: Nonverbal Communication
description: Theory and research ; examination of the influence of environmental factors , physical behavior , and vocal cues on human communication .

name: HIST 215g Business and Labor in America
description: Expansion of business enterprise from colonial merchants to modern corporations ; evolution of the labor force from artisans to skilled and unskilled industrial workers .

name: HIST 266gp Business and East Asian Culture , 1800-Present
description: Business history of East Asia (China , Japan , Korea , Taiwan , and Hong Kong) as related to culture , politics , and society .

name: ECON 348g Current Problems of the American Economy
description: A comprehensive investigation of problems stemming from changing composition of the work force , urban decline , new technologies , inequalities , ethnic relations , government deficits . Prospects for continued growth .

name: Work , Leisure , and Violence in Industrializing America
description: IrregularRise of industrial America from 18th to 20th centuries : changing work ethics , rise of factories , women workers , mass leisure , consumer culture , urban and industrial violence .

name: The Dynamics of American Capitalism
description: IrregularEconomic growth and institutional change in American capitalism from the Colonial era to the present .

name: HIST 442 The Ethics of Financial and Political Accountability
description: Examination of how kingdoms , empires and great companies have risen and fallen due to good or poor financial and political accountability .

name: MOR 385gm Business , Government and Society
description: Explores business-government-society interaction . Examines how diverse interests and identities (social class , race , nationality and gender) affect the conduct and organization of business .

name: BUCO 333mw Communication in the Working World — Managing Diversity and Conflict
description: Communication strategies to manage workplace diversity and conflict . Historical , social , legal precedents . Institutional barriers to diversity . Race , gender , sexual orientation , age , physical disabilities , culture .

name: International Business Communication
description: Explore the cultural dynamics and organizational communication models that contribute to successful business practices in multinational corporations and other global settings .

name: Family , Work , and Leisure in Russian History
description: IrregularChildren and parents , love and marriage , work and leisure in the Russian village and city before and after the Revolution .

name: Cross-Cultural Negotiations : Communication and Strategy
description: (Enroll in COMM 468 )

name: IR 100gx The United States and World Affairs
description: The changing character of contemporary international political issues from the Cold War to the future and U .S . foreign policy options for the future ; exploration of competing perspectives .

name: SSCI 401L Geospatial Intelligence
description: Introduction to basic geospatial intelligence knowledge and related practical applications that assist in informing decision‐making in a variety of human security settings .

name: Aerospace Studies IV : National Security Forces in Contemporary American Society
description: Military professionalism and the context in which defense policy is formulated and implemented ; national security policy , political/social constraints , and military justice .

name: IR 319 Human Security and Humanitarian Intervention
description: Explore causes of human security threats , challenges to state sovereignty , and actions to address failed states , conflicts and protect people through humanitarian intervention .

name: MS 401 Leadership and Management I
description: Develops student proficiency in planning and executing complex operations , functioning as a member of a staff , and mentoring subordinates . Students explore training management , methods of effective staff collaboration , and developmental counseling techniques .

name: MS 402 Leadership and Management II
description: Study includes case study analysis of military law and practical exercises on establishing an ethical command climate . Students must complete a semester long Senior Leadership Project that requires them to plan , organize , collaborate , analyze , and demonstrate their leadership skills .

name: Leadership and Management I
description: Principles of human relationships ; principles of decisionmaking and management at the junior officer level ; theory and techniques of leadership .

name: Leadership and Management II
description: Introduction to primary duties of junior naval officers ; counseling and interviewing techniques ; review of basic administrative responsibilities at the division officer level .

name: CTIN 290 Digital Media Workshop
description: Exploration of a variety of moving image aesthetics and methodologies in order to highlight how the language of cinema shapes contemporary digital and interactive media practices .

name: Immersive Game Development
description: Implementation of a console multiplayer game leveraging input devices such as Kinect , PSMove , Console + IPad/PSVita , Cloud Computing , to achieve creative design .

name: CTAN 504L Creative Production in Virtual Reality
description: A creative studio course in producing both a linear cinematic virtual reality short film and associated real-time immersive experience .

name: Audio Design for Animation and Immersive Media
description: Experimental and traditional audio design practices for animation , culminating in an immersive audio project utilizing acoustic design , surround sound , and professional recording and editing tools .

name: Documentary and Activist Games
description: How interaction design and games document reality . The unique abilities of interactive media in the realms of non-fiction , documentary , and activism .

name: CTIN 503 Interactive Entertainment , Science , and Healthcare
description: Overview of foundational concepts required for design , development and evaluation of interactive entertainment and transmedia-based interventions at the intersection of neuroscience , public health and medicine .

name: IML 543 Transdisciplinary Media Design Practicum
description: Collaboration of artists and designers with non-art professionals to develop cross-disciplinary , media-based creative interventions .

name: ITP 496 The Startup Launchpad Lab
description: A real world , hands-on learning experience on what it’s like to actually start a high-tech company . Students will work in teams to design , prototype and implement version 1 .0 of a high tech web or mobile startup .

name: BAEP 496 The Digital Startup Launchpad
description: Real-life challenge of imagining , prototyping , testing and iterating , building , pricing , marketing , distributing and selling a digital product or service .

name: BISC 102Lgx Humans and Their Environment
description: An examination of the physical and biological laws that influence agriculture , pollution , population dynamics (including humans) , climate , biodiversity and ecosystem structure and function .

name: PHIL 166gw Current Moral and Social Issues
description: Critical study of controversial social issues such as abortion , euthanasia , the death penalty , war and terrorism , sexual morality , affirmative action , and economic justice .

name: PHIL 172gmw Social Ethics for Earthlings and Others
description: A systematic study of contemporary issues in social and political philosophy engaging multimedia works of science fiction to illuminate classic Western moral and political theories .

name: Politics and the Economy
description: Major techniques , politics , and values involved in the allocation of social and economic resources . Includes such topics as determination of priorities in budgetary processes , economic regulation , control of environmental change , and policies for science .

name: Political Development
description: Choice of models in nation-building ; party and other means of mass mobilization ; elite recruitment and differentiation ; peculiarities of cultures and subcultures ; integration of ethnic and other minorities ; political socialization and secularization ; legitimization .

name: ANTH 405 Evolutionary Medicine
description: (Enroll in HBIO 405 )

name: ANTH 300 Evolution , Ecology , and Culture
description: (Enroll in HBIO 300 )

name: The United Nations and World Order
description: The contribution of the United Nations to world order , focusing on its history , principal organs , relationships with global actors , and prospects for reform .

name: PPD 476 Politics and Administration
description: Administrative relationships to the policy processes ; influence of political and economic pressures on administrative policy determination ; political behavior by administrators ; case analysis .

name: PPD 482 Comparative Public Administration
description: Methodology , theories , and models of comparison ; functional processes of administration in developing and developed nations compared ; role of bureaucracy in development and nation-building ; ecology of administration .

name: PPD 411a Sacramento Semester
description: IrregularExploration of political , economic , and administrative climate of the state government ; basic processes and functions considered through seminars , research projects , visitations , group discussions , and internships .

name: MUJZ 150 Beginning Jazz Improvisation
description: Development of beginning improvisational skills including underlying principles of theory , harmony , jazz ear training , and jazz style .

name: MUJZ 301 Individual Instruction
description: Intermediate and advanced instruction : secondary emphasis for music majors , principal emphasis for music minors and BA music majors .

name: MUJZ 450 Intermediate Jazz Improvisation
description: Development of intermediate improvisational skills including underlying principles of theory , harmony , jazz ear training , and jazz style .

name: COMM 392 Media and Migration in Times of European Crisis
description: Investigates the implications of the perceptual process of mass media generated immigration discourse in Europe

name: Visual Communication and Social Change
description: Analysis of photography’s evolution ; new strategies for the photographic image , photo documentary work and global social issues ; analysis of images on blogs and Websites .

name: JOUR 468m The American Press and Issues of Sexual Diversity
description: Examines how news media reflect and affect perception of gay/lesbian issues ; provides historical-contemporary context ; arms students to bypass rhetoric and knowledgeably evaluate facts .

name: JOUR 484 American Religion , Foreign Policy and the News Media
description: Exploration of the influence of American religion on foreign policy from Colonial Era to present ; how the news media , reporting on international stories , shapes public opinion .

name: COMM 367 Community Engagement and Service Learning
description: Students engage with a community partner , bridging classroom learning with “real world” experiences by working within the diverse community surrounding USC .

name: JOUR 470 Community Journalism
description: Survey of how local journalism functions in a community . Students work as editors/mentors to high school students , writing for school newspaper and other media .

name: PR 455 Public Relations for Non-Profit Organizations
description: Introduction to the specialized field of public relations for non-profit and non-governmental organizations ; emphasis on case studies , strategic and critical thinking , and campaign development .

name: JOUR 460 Social Responsibility of the News Media
description: News media as instruments of constructive social change ; standards of ethics and aesthetics ; interactions between news media and cultural settings ; social responsibility of news media personnel .

name: Money , Markets and Media
description: Practical approach to understanding and writing about economic concepts through current events , case studies and historical examples .

name: EASC 150gp East Asian Societies
description: Main patterns of change in modern China , Japan , and Korea ; historical framework and the insights of geography , economics , political science , and other disciplines .

name: HIST 105g The Korean Past
description: A topical and chronological study of the major political , social , and intellectual forces that have shaped the history of Korea .

name: Gender in Korean Film and Literature
description: Changing representations of gender in Korean films and literary works over the course of the 20th century .

name: Seminar in Korean History
description: IrregularExploration of issues and sources in Korean history ; work on an individual research paper through an incremental process .

name: HIST 498 Seminar on Selected Historical Topics
description: Advanced study in historical analysis and writing on selected topics and themes . Seminar enrollment limited to 15 students .

name: IR 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics in various special areas within international relations , which may vary from semester to semester or within semesters .

name: The Landscape Imaginary
description: A cross-cultural introduction to ideas about and attitudes toward nature , landscape and the environment .

name: The Natural Landscape
description: Lectures , laboratory exercises and field trips introducing basic knowledge of the continually transforming landscape as a base for human settlement .

name: The Landscape Planning Process
description: Methods of assessing urban places regarding natural , social , cultural and political factors ; identification of landscape architecture planning and project implementation issues and strategies .

name: Urban Landscape : Process and Place
description: Projects are examined as incremental interventions in the formation and qualities of the evolving urban landscape . Case studies are explored to understand purposes , typologies , catalytic capacities , and strategies for urban landscape design .

name: Urban Landscape : Contemporary History and Prospect
description: Explores contemporary landscape architecture propositions and projects in the context of cities . The exploration methodology includes the study of epochal projects and theoretical texts organized by central themes of nature and culture .

name: Urban Nature
description: Interactions of cities and nature : introduction to the ecology of cities ; major threats to urban biodiversity interacting with human attitudes ; review of restoration and conservation projects .

name: ARCH 565 Global History of Landscape Architecture
description: Understanding of the global history of landscape design in relation to social , political , religious , environmental and aesthetic principles ; current design theory , projects and their historical references are critically reviewed and analyzed .

name: ARCH 566 Cross Cultural Topics in Landscape Architecture History
description: Comparative analysis and appreciation of landscape architecture as a manifestation of nature , society , and design . Topics and world regions vary from year to year ; may be repeated for credit when subject matter is different .

name: Global Democratization
description: Exploration of the global experience with democracy . Meaning of the term “democracy ,” explanations of the rise and fall of democracy , its current trends and future challenges .

name: Introduction to LGBTQ Studies
description: Interdisciplinary analysis of LGBTQ issues ; examination of the intersections of gender and sexuality with social class , race , religion , and nationality .

name: HIST 302 From Sappho to Stonewall : Lesbians in History
description: OtherThe cultural , social , and personal meanings of same-sex relations between women in Europe and the United States , from archaic Greece to the 1960s .

name: SWMS 358 U .S . Gay and Lesbian History
description: Exploration of shifting social organization and cultural meanings of same-sex desire and cross-gender behaviors in the U .S . , primarily during the 20th century .

name: Queer Los Angeles
description: Interdisciplinary study of queer Los Angeles through examination of histories , memoirs , essays , fiction , poetry , documentaries , narrative films , and local archives .

name: PORT 316 Portuguese for Business and the Professions
description: Aimed at advanced-level students in Portuguese who wish to develop a working knowledge of Portuguese for business and/or for the professions .

name: MOR 465 Dynamic Strategies for the Business Lifecycle
description: Theories and methods for analyzing and developing strategy . Fundamental tools for strategic planning . Advanced methods for analyzing industries and competitors , and determining the scope of the firm .

name: Ethics and Professional Communication
description: Study the intersection between business and professional leadership , language , and ethics . Analyze and present results to public audiences through publications , professional conferences , ethics case competitions .

name: Economics of Labor Markets and Human Capital
description: A human capital interpretation of labor demand and supply ; wage determination , differentials , and discrimination ; job turnover and occupational mobility ; unions and collective bargaining .

name: BISC 431L Aquatic Microbiology
description: Introduction to the habitat , phylogenetic , physiological and metabolic diversity of microbial life in aquatic environments .

name: BISC 457L Methods in Marine Biology and Biological Oceanography
description: Introduction to standard methods used in oceanography and marine biology through a combination of lectures , laboratory exercises and field experiences .

name: ENST 298aL Introduction to Scientific Diving
description: Extensive academic preparation in the physics , physiology , safety , and methodology for in-water scientific diving .

name: BISC 140 Our Blue Planet in a Changing Climate
description: Introduction to biological oceanography and marine ecosystems . Impact of climate changes on marine ecosystems . Analysis of ocean-related case studies being discussed by mainstream media .

name: BISC 437 L Comparative Physiology of Animals
description: Control of the internal environment of animals in relation to their external environment . Thermal regulation , osmoregulation , excretion , and ion balance . Offered on Catalina .

name: BISC 460 Seminar in Marine and Environmental Biology
description: Topical seminar in marine and environmental biology .

name: Advanced Seminar in Bacterial Survival and Evolution
description: Literature-based seminar in current topics in microbial evolution and adaptation .

name: BISC 499 Special Topics
description: Lecture and discussion in specialized areas of the biological sciences . Students cannot register more than twice for this course .

name: ENST 490x Directed Research
description: Individual research and readings .

name: ENST 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics dealing with environmental issues and problems .

name: GEOL 499 Special Topics
description: ecial topics in the earth sciences . Field trip required when appropriate to the topic .

name: Economic Analysis for Business Decisions
description: Theory of the firm in the enterprise system ; profits , demand , and cost analysis ; market competition and resource allocation ; problems of size efficiency and growth .

name: Money , Credit , and Banking
description: The money , bond , stock , and other financial markets ; portfolio choice ; determinants of asset prices and interest rates ; inflation ; interactions between financial markets and government policies .

name: Financial Markets
description: General equilibrium analysis of economies with financial markets ; decision making under uncertainty ; methods of risk reduction ; portfolio theory and valuation of securities ; efficiency of security markets .

name: Topology
description: Cardinals , topologies , separation axioms . Compactness , metrizability , function spaces ; completeness ; Jordan curve theorem .

name: CTWR 211g The Television Writer : An Agent of Change
description: The television writer as an agent of change across current social issues including , but not limited to : race , gender , and class .

name: Documentary Animation Production
description: Examination of the history , techniques , and methods of documentary animation production . Collaboration on a short film project .

name: Introduction to Media and Social Change
description: The history and theory of media and social change , including various disciplines and approaches : social marketing , communication campaign design , entertainment-education and specific media .

name: CTWR 402 Writing and Social Change
description: An introductory course in writing for the screen with an emphasis on social issues .

name: Media , Money , and Society
description: Money as communication ; social scientific analysis of money and financial markets ; money and popular culture ; the business press ; representations of Wall Street in Hollywood cinema .

name: PR 473 Emerging Media Strategies for Communication and Public Relations
description: In-depth , hands-on study of emerging tradigital , social and owned media channels ; Emphasis on the evaluation of such media as effective tools for audience engagement . Open only to juniors and seniors in the School for Communication and Journalism .

name: PR 491 Transmedia , New Media and Strategic Public Relations
description: Study of the new rules of message development and dissemination in strategic communication and marketing : Participatory Culture , Transmedia Branding , Spreadable Media , and Crowdsourcing . Open only to seniors and master students in public relations and strategic public relations .

name: Mobile Application Technologies
description: Technologies , devices , operating systems , and tools of mobile applications , as well as the mobile industry . Students will use tools to create apps for different mobile devices .

name: ITP 442 Mobile App Project
description: Capstone course for Mobile App Development minor . Work in project teams to develop new mobile app from start to finish . Meet with client , create app design , develop , test , and demonstrate app to client .

name: ITP 344 Advanced Topics in Mobile App Development
description: Advanced topics in mobile app development such as using REST services , security , cloud integration , NFC (near field communication) , wireless networking for mobile apps , monetizing apps , and the latest frameworks to create advanced apps .

name: ITP 382 Mobile Game Programming
description: Concepts and techniques required to develop games for smartphones and tablets . Topics include sprites , collision detection , mobile input , artificial intelligence , and augmented reality games .

name: MUIN 272x Basics of the Music Industry
description: Introductory survey of the music business . Topics include : copyright , record companies , contracts , music publishing , performance rights societies , managers , agents , and other artist team/income considerations .

name: MTEC 378 Introduction to Mixing and Mastering
description: Fundamental principles and techniques used to fuse multiple audio elements into clear , comprehensive final products .

name: SCOR 403 Introduction to Scoring Movies and Television
description: Practical composition course covering the unique art , craft , and technology involved in writing and integrating music for animated and live-action visual media .

name: SCOR 405 Introduction to Scoring Video Games
description: Practical composition course covering the unique art , craft , and technology involved in composing and integrating video-game music .

name: MPVA 402 Musical Theatre Workshop I
description: Study of the acting , musical and movement elements involved in the performance of the Broadway musical repertoire .

name: MPVA 412 Musical Theatre Workshop II
description: Stylistic and technical features of dramatic and musical elements involved in performance of the Broadway musical and standard operetta repertory ; staging of scenes .

name: Musical Theatre Audition
description: Designed to give students confidence and integrity for auditions in musical theatre . Choosing appropriate material and preparation for the audition and performance . Audition required .

name: EE 337L Engineering Nano-Systems
description: Methods to control and exploit the phenomena of nanoscience , and the integration of nano-technology into systems . Development of fundamental concepts through a series of experimental modules .

name: Journalism Ethics Goes to the Movies
description: Ethical issues facing journalists in the complex world of legacy media , social media and the Internet as dramatized in the movies and in the newsroom .

name: JOUR 375 The Image of the Journalist in Popular Culture
description: The impact of conflicting images of reporters in movies and television on the American public’s perception of newsgatherers in the 20th century . A decade-by-decade evaluation .

name: Nutrition and Health
description: Nutrition as it relates to health promotion across the lifespan and disease prevention . Discussion of nutrients , factors affecting food choices , food safety and global nutrition issues .

name: Introduction to Occupational Science and Occupational Therapy
description: Introduction to concept of occupation and overview of human drive for meaningful activity ; impact of occupations on health and wellbeing ; analysis of personal occupational patterns ; selected therapeutic applications .

name: OT 280 Essential Occupations of Emerging Adulthood
description: Examination of challenges associated with the emerging adulthood stage of development through an occupational science lens ; strategies to promote health and well-being for this population .

name: Occupational Expressions of Diverse Identities and Lifestyles
description: Exploration of the diverse ways occupational practices become central to identity , reify standard social ideologies , and are manipulated to redress conventional standards .

name: Creativity Workshop
description: Theories and practice of the creative process in varied media , genres and occupations . Explores creativity in the arts , sciences , professions , evolution , daily life , and culture .

name: Creating a Sustainable Lifestyle
description: Scientists and policymakers advocate lifestyle changes as crucial to solving the environmental crisis . Investigation into the development of habits that promote environmental sustainability and personal wellbeing .

name: The Nature of Human Occupation : Form , Function , and Meaning
description: The complex nature of human occupation is covered from an interdisciplinary perspective . Emphasis is on how occupation contributes to human experience in a lived world .

name: The Brain : Mind , Body , and Self
description: Exploration of neuroscience as it impacts everyday living , from the fundamentals of neurons and synapses , to the neural basis of language , empathy , and social interaction .

name: Perspectives on the Daily Life of Families
description: Examines family structures and processes , the occupational dimensions of families , and the meanings embedded in the acts of daily life of contemporary families .

name: Sports Ethics
description: Critically examines ethical issues central to the world of sports that range from matters of fair play and cheating to performance-enhancing drugs and gene-doping .

name: OT 340 Occupational Foundations of Human-Animal Interaction
description: Explores how interactions with companion animals expand human capacity for action and contribute to human health , well-being and participation ,in different cultural contexts , across the life-span .

name: Disability , Occupations , and the Health Care System
description: Exploration of the ways in which ablebodyism , sexism , racism , classism and homophobia contribute to occupational opportunities or barriers and weave their way into health care .

name: OT 355 x Occupational Reconstructions and Social Transformations
description: The use of occupations — meaningful , purposeful activities — to restore identity , agency , health , well-being , skills , and political power to populations in problematic situations , such as wars and natural disasters .

name: Creating the Self through Narrative : Acts of Life Story Production
description: Analysis of life stories , life histories , and testimonies in social interactions , texts , and films . Life stories are an occupation to re-create the “Self” in response to conflict and change .

name: OT 370 Understanding Autism : Participation Across the Lifespan
description: Introduction to Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) from a neurodevelopmental perspective , with a focus on the daily living experience and occupational participation for individuals with ASD .

name: DSO 482 Supply Chain Management
description: Issues in supply chain management . Supply chain performance and dynamics . Tools for planning , control and coordination . Supply chain design and strategy .

name: DSO 483 Operations Consulting
description: Study of concepts and techniques for improving operations , formulation and implementation of operations strategy , and development of frameworks for process design , selection and performance evaluation .

name: DSO 427 Designing Spreadsheet-Based Business Models
description: Application of decision analysis , simulation , and optimization techniques to managerial problems . Learn how to create and present useful spreadsheet models to analyze practical business problems .

name: ART 220 Painting II
description: Continuation of practical and theoretical skills introduced in Painting I . Color in personal expression , perception , and content ; cultural subjects/objects and symbols signifying a personal language .

name: ART 320 Advanced Painting
description: Directed examination of aesthetic concepts ; investigation into personal ideas related to the development of a creative visual language in painting .

name: ART 420 Topics in Advanced Painting
description: Directed painting with continued emphasis on personal choices regarding appropriation of conceptual images and arrangement , material processes , scale , number of paintings . Ongoing critical response to painting .

name: BAEP 472 The Science of Peak Performance
description: Ingrains expertise and application of the science of peak performance , broadens preparation for personal challenge , and builds business-centered critical thinking and applied analytical skills .

name: PSYC 201Lg The Science of Happiness
description: Evaluates scientific research on human happiness . Integrates research from psychology , economics , and neuroscience in the evaluation of personal and public policy choices .

name: GESM 140g Seminar in the Life Sciences
description: Scientific understanding of a full range of living systems from molecules to ecosystems , prokaryotes to humans , past and present . (Satisfies GE-D , Life Sciences) .

name: PHIL 258g Probability and Rational Choice
description: Explores formal tools for thinking about uncertainty . In an uncertain world , how is it rational to form our beliefs , make decisions , and interact with others?

name: PSYC 499 Special Topics
description: Selected topics in the various specialty areas within psychology . Topic will vary from semester to semester .

name: Physical Conditioning
description: Improvement in cardiorespiratory endurance , body composition , muscle endurance and flexibility ; running , circuit training , resistance exercises ; fitness principles and nutrition to develop individualized program .

name: Stress Management for Healthy Living
description: Instruction on the effects of stress as it relates to work , sport and academics ; coping strategies are discussed and applied through physical conditioning interventions .

name: THTR 201 Introduction to the Theatre
description: Gateway to the majors and minors in theatre . Introduction to and exploration of the creative elements of theatre art : playwriting , acting , directing , and design of scenery , lighting , and costume . Research on a selected area .

name: PTE 462 Economic , Risk and Formation Productivity Analysis
description: Principle of economic evaluation , risk analysis , reserves estimation , decline curves , energy prices , and well transients for flow prediction .

name: Reasoning and Logic
description: Study of reasoning as a strategy for arriving at knowledge in dependence upon logical theory . Logical theories are developed alongside historically influential strategies of reasoning . Not open to freshmen .

name: Logic and Language
description: Introduction to modern symbolic logic , with applications to the philosophy of language , plus meta-logical and philosophical results about its scope and limits .

name: JOUR 422 Advanced Visual Journalism
description: Emphasis on photographic storytelling in print , video and Web-based media ; understanding of visual thinking and imagery techniques .

name: ART 150 Introduction to Photography
description: Introduction to the practice of photographic image-making within fine arts . Emphasis on developing technical skills in relation to personal vision . Work in black and white .

name: ART 450 Topics in Advanced Photography
description: In-depth exploration of photographic and artistic concepts as they apply to the articulation of personal work .

name: Solo Performance
description: A writing-performance workshop in which students write , develop , and rehearse original , autobiographical and character monologues and perform them at the end of the semester .

name: Regulation of Elections and Political Finance
description: The role money plays in elections and public decisions : disclosure requirements , limits on campaign contributions and expenditures , regulation of radio/television time , tax incentives , public funding .

name: Political Attitudes and Behavior
description: The citizen’s political world ; political socialization , opinion formation and dissemination ; development of political cultures and subcultures ; political mobilization ; personality and politics .

name: Political Psychology
description: Psychological forces shaping politics and persons , processes and interactions ; emphasis on political socialization and cognitive and affective orientations to politics .

name: POSC 220g Critical Issues in American Politics : Presidential Election in Real Time
description: Examination of enduring political issues , as well as the political processes and institutions .

name: POSC 420 Practicum in the American Political Process
description: Fieldwork in governmental institutions and processes .

name: POSC 439 Critical Issues in American Politics
description: Intensive examination of critical issues of particular interest in the field of American politics .

name: Small Group and Team Communication
description: Group process theories relevant to communicative behavior in small group/team settings , including information exchange , decision making , leadership , and meetings ; student team projects testing theoretic propositions .

name: Ethics in Human Communication
description: Value perspectives on communication in varied settings : interpersonal , organizational , and public . Issues of truth and responsibility in family and social interactions , advertising , and governmental communication .

name: PR 352 Public Relations Media and Content for Non-Majors
description: Learn advanced public relations writing and editing , basic design skills and sophisticated video planning , shooting , editing and production skills . Open only to declared Public Relations minors .

name: American Social History
description: IrregularThe social history of the American peoples from Colonial times until the 20th century , to include industrialization , urbanization , women , families , workers , immigration , ethnicity , racism , radicalism .

name: Urbanization in the American Experience
description: IrregularThe American city in interdisciplinary perspective ; emphasis on growth and change in relation to architecture , urban planning , demography , and ethnic politics .

name: Medieval and Early Modern Russia
description: The politics , society , and culture of medieval and early modern Russia ; the emergence of empire and the roots of its Eurasian identity .

name: AHIS 477 Studies in Visual and Material Culture
description: In-depth exploration of selected topics in visual and material culture .

name: CTAN 423L Principles of Digital Animation : Visualizing Science
description: Principles of 2-D and 3-D digital animation applied to scientific themes and research topics .

name: Introduction to Clinical Geriatrics
description: Medical problems of older adults emphasizing common geriatric syndromes , chronic illness , and alternative approaches to primary health care of older persons and their families . Upper division standing .

name: Managed Care for an Aging Society
description: Examines key legislation , policies , practice , and outcomes of managed care and how population aging affects health care delivery .

name: Writing Workshop in Creativity and Imagination
description: Students will explore a variety of problem solving techniques to strengthen their creative work and apply these techniques to individual writing projects .

name: ART 242 Metal
description: Introduction to metal in fine art . Emphasis on technical proficiencies and effective solutions working in a variety of metals .

name: ART 243 Construction Techniques
description: Exploration of art fabrication and the techniques and philosophies of working with a variety of materials .

name: ART 340 Advanced Sculpture
description: Directed examination of three-dimensional aesthetic concepts ; development of an individual creative vision .

name: ART 440 Topics in Advanced Sculpture
description: Individual direction of the study of aesthetic issues in sculpture ; investigation of an individual creative vision .

name: BAEP 497 Field Project in Entrepreneurship
description: Individual or team projects solving real problems for an enterprise . Situation analyses ; research proposal composition ; field research techniques ; statistical analysis ; oral and written presentations .

name: BAEP 471 Social Innovation Design Lab
description: Introduction to design thinking as applied to innovation and entrepreneurship . Hands-on projects to create solutions to specific societal problems faced by underprivileged communities .

name: HIST 344 The Vietnam War , 1945–1975
description: OtherAnalysis of causes , conduct , and consequences of war in Southeast Asia ; of participants’ experiences ; and of post-war debate .

name: The Architect's Sketchbook
description: The architect’s sketchbook as a portable laboratory for perceiving and documenting space introduces the study of the built environment . On-site sessions develop drawing , observation , and visualization skills .

name: Spatial Sciences Internship
description: Intensive experience in local public agency , private firm , or nonprofit agency engaged in applied geospatial analysis , modeling and mapping work .

name: JOUR 350 Introduction to Sports Media
description: Highlight norms , routines of content , including print , broadcast , video . Focus on opportunities , constraints posed by roles of reporters , fans , players , publicists , agents , leagues , teams .

name: Sports and Social Change
description: Application of critical , sociological and rhetorical theories to sports events and sport media ; examination of the role of sports in enacting social change .

name: JOUR 380 Sports , Business and Media in Today's Society
description: An inside look at the important stories , topical issues , trends and historical developments related to the growing influence of business and media on college and professional sports ; identifying the key components and meeting the influencers in class that help shape the business side of sports , while recognizing the role the media plays in providing daily coverage across multiple platforms .

name: Sports Commentary
description: Techniques of reporting and writing sports columns and commentary for print , video , radio and Web-based media .

name: JOUR 441 Sports Reporting
description: JOUR 302  News and feature coverage of sporting events , including social and economic factors influencing sports in America .

name: JOUR 480 Sports and Media Technology
description: Examine and analyze the ever-changing technology sector of the sports business and sports media world .  Identify emerging technologies being developed in the sports industry and how they are being utilized to enhance the fan experience .

name: PR 453 Public Relations Strategies for Working with Athletes
description: orts Public Relations isn’t only getting press for a team or player ; it’s managing communications among influencers . Complements overview course giving students advanced look at practitioners’ role with professional athletes .

name: PR 454 Sports Public Relations
description: Introduction to the field of sports information and promotion , including lectures , media assignments , role-playing , and presentations by sports professionals .

name: Issues in Contemporary Sport
description: Explores social , political and ethical issues in elite sports and how issues are addressed through popular media ; examination includes the relationship between sports and politics .

name: COMM 383m Sports , Communication and Culture
description: Rhetorical and critical approaches to sports and public discourse ; application to sports organizations , the news and popular media ; representations of gender and race in sports .

name: Critical Theories of Sport
description: Focuses on critical theories that examine social and political roles of sport in society and how these roles play out in media and broadcast platforms .

name: The Business of Sports
description: Addresses the business side of the sports industry ; examines professional sports franchises , amateur athletics , and collegiate sports and how they relate to corporate America , the media , and the public sector .

name: Foundation of TESOL
description: Introduction to the ways in which sociocultural context , language systems and acquisition influence English language learning and teaching .

name: Instructional Methods in TESOL
description: Introduction to approaches in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages and methods for teaching reading , writing , listening , speaking , along with a practical fieldwork component .

name: Engineering Law , Finance and Ethics
description: An examination of the legal , financial and ethical issues regularly considered by all practicing engineers .

name: Patent Law for Scientists and Engineers
description: Tools for engineering and science graduate students to make informed decisions about obtaining and enforcing patent protection for their future inventions : validity , infringement , unenforceability .

name: ENGR 493x Dean's Seminar in Entrepreneurship
description: Overview of starting and developing a new business . Discussions with successful business leaders and entrepreneurs . Not available for students admitted to the Entrepreneur Program . Open only to seniors or graduate students in business or engineering .

name: ISE 344 Engineering Team Management
description: Examine team formation and team dynamics including organizational behavior , group dynamics , psychology , and business management , all in the context of engineering development ; decision-making and negotiation .

name: Vectors that Influence Early Childhood Development
description: Investigating early childhood issues from professional perspectives : historian , journalist , premedical , and law .

name: The Effects of Curriculum and Institution on Early Childhood
description: The study of research , philosophy , and pedagogy that informs political , parents , community members , schools and their curriculum .

name: Early Childhood and Contemporary Society
description: Consequences of “corporate world” on developing expectations of young children as consumers and scholars , an emphasis on films , television , and toys that effect intellectual growth .

name: Early Childhood : Action Research Focus
description: Selecting an instructional or developmental problem of young children to investigate through an action research design .

name: Modes of Inquiry
description: Modern tools of cultural and discursive analysis which seek to demystify “the natural ,” as it appears in the formation of cultures , their institutions , and individuals .

name: Pagans and Christians
description: The Christian reception and transformation of pagan religious and philosophical thought .

name: Literature and Culture in Vienna at the Turn of the Century
description: Literature , culture , and society in Vienna 1890–1925 ; works by figures such as Schnitzler , Hofmannsthal , Kafka , Musil , Kraus , Schönberg , Kokoschka , Freud , Wittgenstein , and others . In English .

name: ENGL 373g Literature and Society
description: Theoretical and applied studies of literature in English as social activity and cultural production ; its expression of , and influence upon , social values , concepts , and behavior .

name: ENGL 374m Literature , Nationality and Otherness
description: English literature written about or in the British colonies and their post-colonial nations , including African , Asian , Pacific , and American countries . Emphasis on texts by other than British and United States authors . Completion of general education literature requirement highly recommended .

name: ENGL 372 Literature and Related Arts
description: An examination of how literature and related arts intersect in a particular cultural milieu . Selected topics .

name: ENGL 379 History of Literary Criticism
description: Philosophies of literary criticism from Plato to the end of the 19th century ; the relationship between literary criticism and its contemporary literature .

name: ENGL 380 Modern Literary Criticism : Theory and Practice
description: Analysis of philosophies and methods of modern schools of criticism ; writing critical essays .

name: Madness and Society in the Modern Age
description: The shifting place of insanity and “the mad” in Europe and the United States from the French Revolution to the anti-psychiatry movement .

name: Contemporary Political Thought
description: th century political philosophy dealing with major movements in psychological , existential , socialist , and nationalist thought as they bear upon the crisis of political authority in our time .

name: CTIN 191 Survey of Themed Entertainment
description: Introduction to the field of themed entertainment and education design , covering its history , and , especially , current practice .

name: CTIN 452 L Themed Entertainment Design
description: The fundamentals of design , technology , operations and process for the creation of themed entertainment experiences and story-centric place-making .

name: Game Design for Business
description: Designed to provide the business professional with effective communication skills in working with the designers of games and game related venues .

name: Introduction to Art Direction
description: Introduction to computer drafting , set design , rendering and model-making for students with diverse abilities . Guest lectures , group discussions and hands-on workshop .

name: Introduction to Special Effects in Cinema
description: Introductory workshop in the aesthetics and practices of special effects , embracing both the classical and contemporary modes .

name: Theories of Art
