description: Explores the sector of digital social media and online communities , with a focus on user experience , social impact , strategic content creation , and models for success .

name: DSM 520 Managing Technologies for Digital Media
description: Students learn strategy and decision-making for the technical development and management of online sites and mobile apps , including management of platforms , languages , products , and tools .

name: DSM 596 Final Project Capstone
description: Teams of students develop working sites or apps . Development includes pitching , conceptualizing , developing , and launching of funded , final projects . Open only to digital social media majors .

name: DSM 550 Analytics and Research Methodology
description: Teaches the use and interpretation of digital analytics as well as the use of research design , methodology , and basic statistics for digital sites and apps .

name: DSM 560 Digital Media Policy , Law , Practices , and Regulation
description: Explores laws , policies , and regulations affecting digital social media , including intellectual property , finances , digital content , and gaming .

name: LAW 570 ADR Legal Principles
description: Survey course for students who have not earned a J .D . in a U .S . law school to gain an understanding of the legal framework for the dispute resolution processes in which they participate .

name: LAW 573 ADR Specialized Study
description: ADR Specialized Study projects reflect substantial research and study which result in meaningful written work , generally 10 to 15 pages in length per unit of credit .

name: LAW 715 ADR Law and Policy : Mediation and Arbitration
description: Exploration of the origin , development , and practice of mediation , arbitration and other forms of ADR , emphasizing the policies underlying these increasingly significant and evolving areas .

name: LAW 819 ADR Ethics
description: , 2Provides law students , lawyers and professional neutrals with an in-depth examination of the rules guiding our behavior in various dispute resolution processes .

name: LAW 829 Cross-Cultural Dispute Resolution
description: Brings an international perspective to understanding the impact of culture in the most commonly used international and domestic dispute resolution practices (negotiation , mediation , and arbitration) .

name: LAW 572 Practical Mediation Skills Clinic
description: Students learn basic and advanced mediation skills , practice their skills in simulated mediations , and upon certification by the instructor , mediate in the Los Angeles Superior Court . (Note : LAW 570  must be taken prior to or concurrently with enrollment in LAW 572 , unless the student has previously earned a J .D . from a U .S . law school .)

name: LAW 626 International Investment Law and Arbitration
description: Provides students with understanding of protection offered to foreign investment and investors through bilateral investment treaties and multilateral and regional investment and free trade agreements .

name: LAW 712 Negotiation Theory and Application
description: Develops enhanced negotiation skills and a working understanding of ADR processes and procedures in an interactive classroom experience .

name: LAW 813 Arbitration in the United States
description: Introduces students to the range of issues addressed by the Federal Arbitration Act and state arbitration laws .

name: LAW 817 International Arbitration
description: Examines methods of dispute resolution used in other countries and compares them to those employed in the United States .

name: LAW 824 Arbitration Advocacy
description: , 2Helps students understand the basic approaches to preparing and presenting cases in the arbitration context .

name: LAW 503 Contracts
description: The interpretation and enforcement of promises and agreements .

name: LAW 505 Legal Profession
description: , 3 , 4Functions of the lawyer in modern society ; history and organization of the legal profession ; the adversary system ; equal access to justice ; other problems of ethics and professional responsibility .

name: LAW 521 Topics in American Law
description: This course provides LLM and MCL students with a survey of various topics in American law , including criminal law , evidence , family law , constitutional law , torts , wills and trusts , administrative law and property law . Open to LLM and MCL students only .

name: LAW 528 Constitutional Law
description: Covers the delineation of spheres of responsibility between three branches of the federal government , the federal government and the states and the government and individuals .

name: LAW 602 Criminal Procedure
description: Criminal procedure in the courts , and the regulation of law enforcement by the courts through rules of evidence and interpretation of the Bill of Rights .

name: LAW 603 Business Organizations
description: Organization of economic activity — especially the modern corporation — as institutions of social power . The roles of managers , owners , and public regulatory agencies in shaping processes of decision-making .

name: LAW 607 Gifts , Wills , and Trusts
description: or 4Gratuitous transfer of wealth , especially the transmission of wealth from one generation to the next as a settlement of family affairs . Comparative analysis of the legal mechanisms of gifts , wills , and trusts . Introduction to problems of fiduciary administration .

name: LAW 608 Evidence
description: or 4The purpose and character of trial . Problems of adversary presentation and the nature of proof . The basis for admission and exclusion of evidence in judicial proceedings .

name: LAW 625 Remedies
description: or 4Comparison of the remedial goals of contracts , torts , and property and the impact of procedural devices in law and equity . Damages , injunctions , specific performance and restitution . Remedial theory and transactional application .

name: LAW 642 Secured Transactions
description: , 3 , 4This is a course on Chattel paper and secured transactions involving personal property under Article 9 of the Uniform Commercial Code and some related bodies of law .

name: LAW 705 Community Property
description: , 2 , 3The law of community property , including disposition of property on dissolution of the marriage and questions of conflict of laws . May be offered as a reading course .

name: LAW 727 Partnerships and Limited Liability Companies
description: Deals with the formation , features and functions of general partnerships , limited partnerships and limited liability companies . Also focuses on business planning , recognizing business and legal objectives and selecting the appropriate entity to accomplish these objectives .

name: LAW 778 Sales
description: Analysis of the buying and selling of goods both in domestic and international transactions with a heavy focus on Article 2 of the Uniform Commercial Code .

name: LAW 871 First Amendment
description: Freedom of expression (political speech , symbolic expression , obscenity , commercial speech , defamation) , rights of access to the media , religious protection and prohibition of establishment of religion .

name: BAEP 591 Social Entrepreneurship
description: Lead and manage with entrepreneurial methodology for charities , non-government organizations , social oriented enterprises and not for profit organizations .

name: GSBA 520 Business Fundamentals for Non-Business Professionals
description: An overview of concepts , tools and principles of business management to develop a general management point of view . Open only to non-business graduate students .

name: LAW 571 Organizational Conflict
description: Origin and types of conflicts which arise within organizations . Designing systems to prevent conflict from developing or escalating and developing a culture of collaboration and creativity .

name: Human Resources Management in Public and Non-Profit Sectors
description: Merit principles , position classification , recruitment and selection , compensation , organizational development , labor relations ; challenges and strategies for managing a diverse workforce .

name: Intersectoral Leadership
description: Roles of public , private , nonprofit , and civil society sectors in policy , planning , and development . Leadership skills in negotiation , conflict resolution , institutional design , problem solving .

name: Economics for Policy , Planning and Development
description: Microeconomic theory as applied to policy , planning , and development ; concepts of efficiency ; macroeconomic issues .

name: PPD 509 Problems and Issues in the Health Field
description: Principles of epidemiology ; disease trends , treatment efficacy , influences on utilization ; health promotion , disease prevention and health protection ; intergovernmental relationships ; management of public health programs .

name: Finance of Real Estate Development
description: Theory and methods of real estate finance and investment . Real estate investment analysis , real estate entities , taxation ; introduction to securization of real estate equities , debt .

name: Real Estate Capital Markets
description: Explore structure , instruments and institutions of real estate capital markets . Consider linkages between real estate and capital markets . Assess role of Real Estate Investment Trusts .

name: Applications of Real Estate Finance to Problems of Development
description: Advanced topics in finance applied to cases and problems of real estate development ; emphasis on structuring , finance and evaluation of various types of development projects .

name: Project Management and Construction
description: Managing the building phase of development . Architectural and engineering aspects of construction management for the real estate developer .

name: The Approval Process
description: Approval process for real estate development including land use entitlement , site selection , zoning , environmental review , community and government relations , infrastructure financing , ethical issues , negotiation skills .

name: RED 562 Legal Issues in Real Estate Development
description: Ownership and transfer of real estate ; formation and enforcement of contracts ; business associations ; environmental regulation ; taxation of property transfers ; acquiring , financing , leasing of commercial property .

name: RED 573 Design History and Criticism
description: The concepts , language and metaphors of design-related disciplines are examined in relation to design and construction values and choices in real estate development .

name: RED 574 Building Typologies
description: The exploration of categories of building types , including retail , industrial , residential , office and institutional , using key examples or case studies from each .

name: RED 575L Community Design and Site Planning
description: Physical implementation of development projects . Students will develop concept plan , preliminary design and marketing plan for selected domestic and/or international development sites .

name: RED 598 Real Estate Product Development
description: An evaluation of various real estate development types . Case studies and site visits .

name: MUEN 550 Early Music Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and performance of vocal and instrumental ensemble music of the Renaissance and Baroque , with emphasis on chamber music for solo voices and bowed or plucked strings . Instrumentalists are required to perform on either their own or the school’s historical instruments .

name: Seminar in Historical Musical Notation
description: Performing , reading , and editing historical notation from original sources .

name: Seminar in Renaissance Repertories and Performance Practice
description: Study and discussion of Renaissance music sources and performance practice treatises .

name: Master's Thesis
description: Credit on acceptance of thesis .

name: Mathematical Methods in Economics
description: Introduction to quantitative methods for analyzing economic equilibria ; comparative statics and dynamics . Utility theory , consumer behavior , and profit maximization . Model formulation in micro and macroeconomics .

name: Microeconomic Analysis and Policy
description: Theories of the household and the firm ; product and factor markets ; perfect and imperfect competition ; welfare criteria .

name: ECON 601 Microeconomic Theory I
description: Optimization of the consumer and the firm ; duality and imputed value ; perfect and imperfect competition in product and factor markets .

name: Macroeconomic Analysis and Policy
description: Theories of aggregate economic activity ; design and use of macroeconometric models ; stabilization and control of inflation , unemployment , and growth .

name: ECON 602 Macroeconomic Theory I
description: Aggregate demand , supply and government policy ; theories of economic growth and business cycles ; static and dynamic implications of government policies .

name: Mathematical Methods in Dynamic Economics
description: Movement of economic systems over time ; differential and difference equations ; introduction to the optimal control of economic processes ; dynamic programming and optimal strategies ; selected applications .

name: Topics in Dynamic Optimization
description: Theory and numerical methods for dynamic optimization and control ; selected applications in economic analysis and econometrics .

name: Applied Econometrics
description: Use of quantitative models to describe and forecast economic activity ; estimation and application of such models to selected policy problems .

name: ECON 609 Econometric Methods
description: Review of statistical methods of estimation and inference , linear regression with multicollinearity and serial correlation ; multivariate regression and simultaneous equations .

name: Practice of Econometrics
description: Application of econometric tools using standard econometric software packages for microcomputers ; empirical applications to selected economic problems of estimation and inference .

name: Economic History and Development
description: Historical trends in developed and developing societies in various aspects of modernization such as human resources , capital , technology , resource allocation , income distribution , international relations .

name: Contracts , Organizations , and Institutions
description: Information , property rights , bargaining , transaction costs , incentives , free-riding and contracting in organizations ; the nature of cooperation ; bureaucracies .

name: Economic Development
description: Development , underdevelopment and the problems thereof ; agriculture , industry , trade , population , human capital , capital formation ; structural , technological , environmental and institutional changes ; political economy of the state .

name: ECON 634 Political Economy of Institutions
description: The functions of laws , rules , customs , conventions , and other restrictions on economic and social activity . Theories of institutional evolution .

name: Economic Development Programming and Policy Planning
description: Model construction and application to policy and planning : open economy macroeconomics , trade and investment , institutions , technology , income inequality , environment , policy reforms , political economy .

name: Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master’s degree . Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department .

name: ECON 692 Seminar in Economic Development
description: Current research in international , regional , and urban development economics presented by faculty , students and outside scholars .

name: International Trade Theory
description: General equilibrium theory applied to theory and practice of commercial policy , economic growth , and trade .

name: International Monetary Theory
description: Balance of payments concepts and measures ; price theory and the foreign exchange market ; international monetary systems ; adjustment mechanisms ; speculation and official intervention .

name: Ethical and Legal Issues in Counseling
description: Examination of current legal , ethical , and other professional issues in the practice of counseling and psychotherapy .

name: Theories in Counseling
description: Theory , research , and practice of psychological counseling .

name: Foundations of Higher , Adult , and Professional Education
description: Contemporary issues in higher , adult , and professional education in the United States ; analytic perspectives from various disciplines (history , philosophy , sociology) ; implications for policy and practice .

name: The Politics of Difference
description: Explores strategies for restructuring institutions of higher education to improve student support and achievement among historically marginalized groups .

name: Student Affairs Work in College
description: Principles , services , and organizational patterns of student affairs programs and services for two-year , four-year and professional higher education institutions .

name: The Community College
description: The community college movement ; history ; aims ; curriculum ; types of administrative organization ; teaching procedures ; relation to lower and higher institutions ; profiles of faculty and students ; evaluation .

name: EDHP 587 Fieldwork in Higher , Adult , and Professional Education
description: Structured participation in supervised teaching or administrative activities . Assignments matched with student’s goals , training , experience .

name: Master's Seminar
description: An examination and analysis of research and literature in the student’s area of focus . Required for all master’s candidates who do not enroll in the Master’s Thesis (EDHP 594a  , EDHP 594b  , EDHP 594z ) .

name: Master's Thesis
description: Required for all master’s candidates who do not enroll in the Master’s Seminar (EDHP 593a  , EDHP 593b ) .

name: Student Development in Higher Education
description: Theories of college student development and application of developmental models to program design , interventions , outreach , and research programs .

name: Learning and Individual Differences
description: Theory and research in learning , development , and individual differences , and social psychology related to education or training contexts .

name: EDUC 500 The Counseling Process
description: Theoretical foundations , models , values , and assumptions underlying psychological counseling ; cross-cultural perspectives , ethical and legal considerations .

name: Creating Communities of Interest
description: Framing the graduate experience for master’s students . Establishing a professional foundation and philosophy as educators .

name: EDUC 547 Career Development : Theory and Process
description: Theories and process of career development ; principles of career and leisure planning and counseling applicable throughout life .

name: Research Methods and Data Analysis
description: Various research designs and their appropriateness for addressing different research questions . Threats to validity and other challenges in research . Basic statistical methods and their use .

name: Academic Advising in Postsecondary Education
description: Contemporary issues in academic advising in postsecondary education . Examines and analyzes relevant theories , policies , and practices related to academic advising .

name: EDUC 637 Group Counseling : Theory and Process
description: Theory , research , and practice of group counseling . Includes laboratory experience .

name: EE 503 Probability for Electrical and Computer Engineers
description: Rigorous coverage of probability , discrete and continuous random variables , functions of multiple random variables , covariance , correlation , random sequences , Markov chains , estimation , and introduction to statistics .

name: Stochastic Processes
description: Probability theory and stochastic processes , including renewal theory , Markov chains , Brownian motion , martingales , and stochastic calculus . Applications in communication networks , queuing theory , and financial systems .

name: Mobile Communications
description: The mobile communication channel ; techniques used to combat the channel ; cellular communications ; multiple-access techniques ; example mobile communication systems .

name: EE 554 Real Time Computer Systems
description: Structure of real-time computer systems ; analog signals and devices ; scheduling , synchronization of multiprocessors ; reliability , availability ; serial/parallel computations ; real-time operating systems and languages ; design examples .

name: Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master’s degree . Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department .

name: Stochastic Network Optimization
description: Optimization of wireless and ad-hoc mobile networks ; opportunistic scheduling , flow control ; back-pressure routing ; queue stability ; energy-delay and utility-delay trade-offs .

name: Introduction to Power Systems
description: Components of power systems . Analysis techniques in electrical power generation transmission and utilization . Environmental and economic considerations in system operations and planning .

name: Power Systems Technology
description: Comprehensive assessment of the technical , environmental , and regulatory challenges that affect the future delivery and utilization of electric power . Case-study analysis .

name: Power Systems Analysis and Design
description: Power system planning , studies , and design ; time-domain modeling and analysis of power-system networks ; power flow , stability , fault , and economic dispatch analysis ; symmetrical components .

name: High-Voltage DC Transmission Systems
description: AC/DC conversion processes , converter technologies , and design ; harmonics , controls , and protection ; AC/DC interactions and system performance ; modeling , application , and installation ; current-source versus voltage-source converters .

name: Transients in Power Systems
description: Overvoltages during faults , voltage recovery , arcing faults , restrikes , theory of switching surges . Systems grounding , traveling waves , lightning and surge protection , insulation coordination .

name: Power System Protection
description: Theory of system and equipment protection , characteristics of relays , relay coordination , and system considerations .

name: Renewable Energy in Power Systems
description: Renewable energy sources and their integration in electrical networks . Power-flow control from highly variable resources . Cost analysis and planning .

name: High-Voltage Technology
description: High voltage engineering basic concepts ; theoretical , design , and practical aspects of overvoltages , travelling-waves , insulation , and aging ; breakdown mechanisms ; insulation coordination .

name: Power Electronics
description: Fundamentals of switched-mode power converters operating under steadystate and transient conditions . Feedback control systems . Magnetic circuit design .

name: EE 482 Linear Control Systems
description: Analysis of linear control systems ; continuous and sampleddata systems , various stability criteria ; frequency response and root locus compensation techniques .

name: Net-Centric Power-System Control
description: Control and stability of large-scale systems such as the electric power grid . Integration with information networks .

name: EE 543aL Digital Control Systems
description: Design , analysis , and implementation of digital control systems using microcomputers ; Z-transform methods ; frequency domain and state space approach ; computational aspects ; sampling and quantization .

name: EE 585 Linear System Theory
description: Analysis of linear dynamical systems by state-space techniques ; controllability , observability , stability , passivity . Application of feedback control and network synthesis .

name: EE 593 Robust Multivariable Control
description: Sensitivity and complementary sensitivity matrices ; uncertainty representation ; singular values ; Bode plots . Parameterization of internally stabilizing controllers . Algebraic Riccati Equations . Modern Wiener-Hopf and H-infinity designs .

name: Flight Vehicle Stability and Control
description: Response of flight to linear , nonlinear , and randomly defined disturbances . Generation and measurement of error signals in navigational systems . Stability and control techniques .

name: EE 522 Immersive Audio Signal Processing
description: Fundamentals of digital audio signal processing , room acoustics , and psychoacoustics . Algorithms for real-time implementation of immersive audio systems for integrated media applications .

name: EE 586L Advanced DSP Design Laboratory
description: Real-time adaptive signal processing design projects using special purpose DSP processors . Suitable project areas include acoustics , speech , arrays , image compression and biomedical signal processing . Permission of instructor required .

name: Wavelets
description: The theory and application of wavelet decomposition of signals . Includes subband coding , image compression , multiresolution signal processing , filter banks , and time-frequency tilings .

name: Advanced Topics in Automatic Speech Recognition
description: Advanced topics in automatic speech recognition , speaker recognition , spoken dialogue , conversational multimedia interfaces .

name: Multimedia Data Compression
description: Lossless compression , audio/speech coding , vector quantization , fractal compression , JPEG and JPEG-2000 , video compression techniques and MPEG standards , video transmission over wired and wireless networks .

name: Geometric Modeling
description: Mathematical models and computer representations for threedimensional solids ; underlying topics from set theory , geometry , and topology . Fundamental algorithms ; applications to CAD/CAM and robotics .

name: EE 448 L Communication Electronics
description: Analysis , design , and experimental evaluation of transistor-level communication circuits and micro-systems . Transmission lines , impedance matching , noise , distortion , tuned amplifiers , mixers , oscillators , phase-locked loops .

name: EE 504 L Solid-State Processing and Integrated Circuits Laboratory
description: Laboratory oriented with lectures keyed to practical procedures and processes . Solid-state fabrication and analysis fundamentals ; basic device construction techniques .

name: Integrated Communication Systems
description: Analysis and design of high-speed integrated communication systems at circuit and system levels . Emphasis on broadband wireless applications . Transceiver architectures , amplifiers , oscillators , frequency synthesizers .

name: Analog Integrated Circuit Design
description: MOSFET and BJT operation and models ; elementary amplifier configurations ; biasing and references ; frequency response ; feedback ; operational amplifiers .

name: Solid State
description: (Enroll in MASC 501 )

name: Advanced Solid State
description: (Enroll in MASC 502 )

name: EE 506 Semiconductor Physics
description: Semiconductor bonds , crystallography , band structure assumptions , group theory , band structure results , k .p . method , quantum wells , wires and dots , superlattices , amorphous , organic semiconductors , defects , statistics , surfaces .

name: Introduction to Quantum Electronics
description: Fundamentals of light amplification ; laser amplifiers and oscillators ; atomic pumping ; maser and laser systems ; definitions of coherence ; measurements in quantum electronics .

name: EE 601 Advanced Semiconductor Device Physics
description: Fundamentals and limitations of nanoscale electronic and photonic semiconductor components . Engineering classical , mesoscale , and quantum electron and photon dynamics in advanced devices .

name: Foundation of Medicine : Anatomy , Physiology , and Pathology
description: Fundamentals of physiology , chemistry , anatomy , biochemistry and microbiology , as well as pharmacological issues , mathematical basis of lab instruments or techniques , and computational modeling .

name: MEDS 597a Health Technology Internship
description: Internship course on the use of new technology based on sensors and wireless communications to the healthcare industry .

name: Speech Recognition and Processing for Multimedia
description: eech production , acoustics , perception , synthesis , compression , recognition , transmission . Coding for speech , music , and CD-quality . Feature extraction . Echo cancellation . Audio , visual synchronization . Multimedia , internet use .

name: EE 564 Digital Communication and Coding Systems
description: Digital modulations . Optimal reception . Performance analysis . Classical and modern codes . Viterbi , forward-backward , and iterative decoding . Practical designs for channels with memory or nonlinearities . Example systems .

name: EE 567 Communication Systems
description: Analysis of communication systems operating from very low to optical frequencies . Comparison of modulation and detection methods . System components description . Optimum design of communication systems .

name: Basic Concepts in Global Health
description: Exploration of global health issues facing resource-poor societies ; emphasizes contributing factors including behavioral and physiological bases , economic , social , and political context .

name: Critical Issues in Global Health
description: Evaluation of government and non-government organizations’ new global health responses , and critical issues affecting global health including : environment , workforce conditions , obesity , nutrition , drugs , poverty .

name: Global Epidemiology of Diseases and Risk Factors
description: Survey of major populations’ crises and risk factors accounting for global health challenges . Evaluation of case studies of global health interventions and effective methodologies .

name: Simulation Methods for Stochastic Systems
description: Project-oriented investigation of simulation methods used for the analysis and design of complex stochastic systems whose operation and performance are affected by random events .

name: Introduction to Digital Signal Processing
description: Fundamentals of digital signal processing covering : discrete time linear systems , quantization , sampling , Z-transforms , Fourier transforms , FFTs and filter design .

name: Statistical Signal Processing
description: Characterization of discrete-time random processes . Parametric and non-parametric spectral estimation , adaptive filtering , signal subspace methods , independent components analysis , non-Gaussian signal processing .

name: Radio Frequency Filter Design
description: Theory and realization of passive and transconductancebased active filters for radio frequency communications . Distributed and quasi-distributed passive filters . Circuit testing via scattering parameters .

name: Radio Frequency Systems and Hardware
description: Elements of radio frequency communication systems : modulation/demodulation strategies , transmission-channel impairments , performance criteria , hardware (low-noise amplifiers , mixers , oscillators) , digital back-end , contemporary case studies .

name: ISE 500 Statistics for Engineering Managers
description: Framing engineering management situations with statistical methods . Experiments , distributions , regression , ANOVA , hypothesis .

name: Engineering Project Management
description: Applying industrial and systems engineering skills to problems drawn from industry , while working in teams of 3–4 students . Teach project management skills and provide direct experience in managing and executing a group project .

name: Management of Engineering Teams
description: Design and management of engineering teams . Group decision-making , motivation , leadership , infrastructural requirements , performance measurement , team diversity , conflict , and integration .

name: Economic Analysis of Engineering Projects
description: Economic evaluations of engineering systems for both government and private industry ; quantitative techniques for evaluating non-monetary consequences ; formal treatment of risk and uncertainty .

name: ISE 536 Linear Programming and Extensions
description: Linear programming models for resource allocation ; simplex and revised simplex methods ; duality ; sensitivity ; transportation problems ; selected extensions to large scale , multiobjective , and special structured models .

name: BAEP 552 Cases in Feasibility Analysis
description: Study of analytical techniques used to evaluate business concepts and new business development .

name: BAEP 554 Venture Initiation
description: Learn to launch and scale a new business through entrepreneurial action and execution .

name: BAEP 555 Founder's Dilemmas : Anticipate and Avoid Startup Pitfalls
description: Delves into founders’ early decisions about when and whether to found , co-founders , hires , and investors that tend to get them into trouble down the road .

name: BAEP 563 Corporate Entrepreneurship
description: How established organizations build successful new businesses through corporate venturing and intrapreneurship . Learn to apply an entrepreneurial mindset and entrepreneurial frameworks within an established organization .

name: MOR 554 Leading Innovation and Change
description: Practical knowledge on helping organizations develop innovations and lead change to leverage them . Exploration of innovation and change in different organizations and competitive environments .

name: BAEP 557 Technology Commercialization
description: Identification , evaluation and commercialization of new technologies . Emphasis will be placed on the legal , financial and marketing aspects of technology transfer and development .

name: BAEP 558 The Entrepreneurial Advisor : Problem Solving for Early-Stage Companies
description: Experiential course designed to develop skills in framing and solving complex problems in young companies . Apply skills to real ventures participating in course projects .

name: BAEP 559 Investing in New Ventures
description: Focus on the entrepreneurial skill set applied to new venture opportunities . Taught from the business plan reader’s point of view ; focus on selecting opportunities , structuring the relationship , adding value and realizing the value of that investment .

name: BAEP 560 Acquiring Your Own Business or Opportunity
description: Issues faced by the entrepreneur who wishes to acquire an enterprise ; appropriateness of an enterprise , understanding funding sources and valuation methods , developing a plan for due diligence , negotiating and consummating the transaction . The acquisition process , approaches to valuation , and the roles of the various parties in negotiating and consummating an acquisition of an existing business .

name: BAEP 561 Entrepreneurship in Innovative Industries : Life Sciences
description: The challenges of new venture creation in the biotechnology , medical device , and healthcare areas ; experience , evaluate , and analyze profits of current impact in the life sciences .

name: BAEP 599 Special Topics
description: IrregularCurrent developments in the field of entrepreneurship : topics to be selected each semester .

name: Technology Development and Implementation
description: Principles and practices of technology development and implementation , with application to products and systems in manufacturing and services .

name: ISE 555 Invention and Technology Development
description: This project-oriented course elaborates on the process of engaging creative thought , tools and techniques for invention , and issues involved in bringing inventions to the production phase .

name: MKT 525 Consumer Behavior
description: Theories and applications of consumer behavior in marketing ; psychological , social , cultural and ethnic factors influencing consumer behavior .

name: MKT 528 Sales Management : The Art and Science of Sales
description: Emphasis on creating a sales strategy , planning and delivery of sales presentations , and techniques to persuade people to change their opinions in face-to-face meetings .

name: MKT 530 New Product Development
description: Systematic approach to product development and management ; processes , techniques , and concepts firms use to develop , test , and introduce products and to manage products over their lifecycle .

name: MOR 565 Alliances and Cooperative Strategy
description: Essential issues and problems of cooperative strategy . Recognize and evaluate collaborative opportunities to develop and assess an overall cooperative strategy . Readings , cases and group project .

name: MOR 567 Interpersonal Influence and Power
description: Legitimate and effective use of power to resolve conflicts and mobilize action through understanding the talent and self-interest of people involved in decision-making . Readings , cases .

name: MOR 570 Leading Effective Teams
description: Analytical and behavioral tools that will enable students to effectively diagnose complex work group dynamics and take action to improve group performance .

name: Environmental Risk Analysis
description: Analyzes various potential environmental risks and examines how science , government , and business measure and prepare for environmental risks .

name: Environmental Science I
description: Exposes students to critical scientific principles , concepts , and issues related to pollution control , remediation , and ecology .

name: Environmental Science Seminar I
description: A series of biweekly guest lectures on critical scientific principles , concepts , and issues related to pollution control , remediation , and ecology .

name: Environmental Science II
description: A continuation of ENST 501  . Exposes students to critical scientific principles , concepts , and issues related to pollution control , remediation , and ecology .

name: Environmental Science Seminar II
description: A continuation of ENST 502  . A series of biweekly guest lectures on critical scientific principles , concepts , and issues related to pollution control , remediation , and ecology .

name: Advanced Environmental Science Seminar
description: Ties together science , technology , and finance with risk assessment and policy .

name: MOR 569 Negotiation and Deal-Making
description: Strategies and dynamics of deal-making ; practical skills necessary to win in a range of business transactions conducted in domestic and international settings . Cases , role-playing , films and simulations .

name: Statistics for Environmental Analysis
description: This course introduces graduate students to the various quantitative techniques and methodological approaches used in pollution control , natural resources management , and environmental protection .

name: Introduction to Environmental Studies
description: This course introduces students to the major environmental issues and problems society faces today . Business , industry , and government actions concerning these issues and problems are examined .

name: Environmental Law and Policy
description: Introduces students to the central issues , concepts , and theories in environmental law and policy and analyzes present environmental laws and regulations .

name: California Coastal Zone Science and Policy
description: Science and policy issues used to characterize and manage California coastal resources . Key issues include : coastal pollution , public health , ecosystem management , and marine reserves .

name: Seminar in Environmental Policy
description: Issues and theories involved in the formulation , implementation , and effectiveness of different environmental policies .

name: PPD 621 Environmental Impacts
description: Legal , political/institutional , and technical aspects of environmental impact reports for urban planning .

name: PPDE 632 Sustainable Cities
description: Exploration of environmental problems linked to urbanization , drawing on historical analysis , social theory , scientific research , and city planning/design practice . Alternative policy options for urban sustainability .

name: Multivariate Analysis
description: Causal inference and modeling in international relations and political science ; assumptions and problems of multivariate regression analysis in both cross-sectional and time series cases .

name: Quantitative Methods and Statistics
description: Introduction to the logic and methods of quantitative analysis in sociology ; covers the basic elements of designing and research , summarizing and exploring patterns in data , and making generalizations about populations based on characteristics of samples .

name: FBE 506 Quantitative Methods in Finance
description: The development of mathematical and statistical methods used in modern finance and economics .

name: Money and Capital Markets
description: Review of financial institutions and markets , the determinants of interest rates , the impact of government regulation and policy on the financial system .

name: Financial Analysis and Valuation
description: An applications-oriented course to develop the financial and accounting tools required to do financial planning valuation and assessment of financial performance .

name: Corporate Financial Policy and Corporate Governance
description: Advanced analysis of the determinants of corporate capital structure and payout policies , allocation and value of corporate control , and security issuance and retirement .

name: Forecasting and Risk Analysis
description: Application of econometric tools and versions of Capital Asset Pricing Models to estimate financial risk and stock market risk premia for portfolio management .

name: Investment Analysis and Portfolio Management
description: Analysis and management of common stocks and fixed income securities ; development of modern portfolio theory and the efficient market hypothesis ; organization of securities markets .

name: Venture Capital and Private Equity
description: Advanced analysis of the economics of the private equity markets . Consider and value private securities in venture capital , initial public offerings , and leveraged buyouts .

name: Entrepreneurial Finance : Financial Management for Developing Firms
description: Internal financial management of developing firms . Cash flow analysis ; capital budgeting ; sources of financing ; risk analysis ; measurement of profits ; and mergers and acquisitions .

name: Corporate Financial Strategy
description: Linkage between financial theory and policy and corporate strategy ; the role of financial managers in developing corporate strategy ; applications of concepts and techniques using cases .

name: CEO Pay , Corporate Governance , and the Politics of Finance
description: Explores how value is created (or destroyed) in organizations , focusing on compensation and incentive systems and the causes and consequences of government (and populist) intervention .

name: FBE 535 Applied Finance in Fixed Income Securities
description: The basic principles underlying fixed income securities and how these principles apply to the practical aspects of fixed income management .

name: Hedge Funds
description: Introduction to the investment strategies used by hedge funds , the quantitative tools and business plans used to implement them .

name: Trading and Exchanges
description: Theories , practices , and technologies of trading at exchanges and in dealer networks . Sources of liquidity , volatility , profitability , and institutional change . Domestic and international public policy issues .

name: FBE 557 Business Law and Ethics
description: Business law of traditional and e-contracts , UCC , crimes , torts , employment , ethics , social responsibility , intellectual property , digital law , e-commerce , accountants’ liability , property , estates , and government regulation .

name: FBE 558 Law for Structuring , Financing , and Managing Businesses
description: Legal environment of agency law , general and limited partnerships , limited liability companies , corporate formation and financing , corporate governance , securities law , acquisitions , bankruptcy , and business ethics .

name: Management of Financial Risk
description: Analysis of commodity , futures , and options contracts ; theoretical and empirical approaches ; spot and futures price relationships , speculation and hedging strategies ; market efficiency .

name: Mergers and Acquisitions
description: Practical application of the critical components of mergers and acquisitions : deal flow strategies , preliminary negotiations , deal structures , due diligence , valuation , post-merger integration , and regulations .

name: FBE 562 Current Issues in International Finance
description: International monetary relations , financial markets , and institutions ; theory and evidence of alternative approaches to balance of payments ; current policy evaluation .

name: FBE 563 Theory of International Trade
description: Comparative advantage and gains from trade ; factor proportions and efficiency ; factor price equalization ; terms of trade ; tariffs , customs , unions and trade agreements .

name: FBE 571 Introduction to Financial Analysis : Practicum
description: This introductory financial analysis (tools , techniques) practicum , emphasizes practical application of asset valuation and portfolio management techniques for those with little previous experience .

name: Financial Engineering
description: Concepts underlying the economic analysis of engineering projects ; applications to call and put options ; utility theory and mathematical optimizations models ; and simulation .

name: Mathematics and Tools for Financial Engineering
description: Students will build a mathematical background for studying financial engineering . Emphasis is on analysis , proofs and examples . Mathwork’s financial toolbox will be introduced .

name: Economic and Financial Time Series I
description: Simultaneous equation models , dynamic structural econometric models , vector autoregressions , causality , forecasting , univariate and multivariate nonstationary time series , tests for unit roots , cointegration , autoregressive conditional heteroscedasticity models , time series models with changes in regime .

name: CE 645 Uncertainty Modeling and Stochastic Optimization
description: Introduction to the mathematical foundations , numerical algorithms , and computational tools necessary for solving problems of optimization under uncertainty .

name: EE 500 Neural Learning and Computational Intelligence
description: Computational intelligence techniques that include neural systems , deep learning , adaptive pattern classification , fuzzy function approximation , simulated annealing and evolutionary computing , and hybrid systems .

name: EE 517 Statistics and Data Analysis for Engineers
description: Statistics and data analysis emphasizing computation and problem solving : confidence intervals , hypothesis tests , bootstrap and Monte Carlo estimation , regression , Bayesian and statistical learning techniques .

name: EE 556 Stochastic Systems
description: Stochastic system models , Dynamic programming , Linear quadratic control , Kalman filtering and estimation , System identification , approximate dynamic programming methods , adaptive control and online learning .

name: Stochastic Elements of Simulation
description: Simulation techniques combined with probabilistic analysis for solving problems in inventory theory , queuing theory , financial engineering , decision analysis , and other fields having a stochastic element .

name: ART 520 Individual Studies
description: Investigation of creative problems through various media . Course may be repeated .

name: Making and Curating Art : Pedagogy and Praxis
description: (Enroll in CRIT 525 )

name: ART 530 Global Art Seminar : the Globalization of Art and Culture
description: An examination of the emergence of the idea of “globalism” through the lens of art practice and theory .

name: ART 535 Group Critique
description: Presentation and critique which builds students’ skills in presenting and contextualizing their artwork for peer review ; analytic discussion regarding directions in contemporary art .

name: ART 594a Master's Thesis
description: Credit on acceptance of Thesis .

name: SSCI 581 Concepts for Spatial Thinking
description: The unique characteristics and importance of spatial information as they relate to the evolving science , technology , and applications of Geographic Information Systems .

name: SSCI 582 Spatial Databases
description: Design , implementation , and interrogation of relational , object-oriented and other types of geospatial databases .

name: SSCI 587 Spatial Data Acquisition
description: Role of global positioning systems , maps , geocoding , and other kinds of sensors as geospatial data sources . Includes field data acquisition excursion on Catalina Island .

name: Master's Thesis
description: Credit on acceptance of thesis .

name: SSCI 583 Spatial Analysis
description: Provides the knowledge and skills necessary to investigate the spatial patterns which result from social and physical processes operating at or near the Earth’s surface .

name: SSCI 584 Spatial Modeling
description: The use of spatial models to describe social and environmental processes , patterns and systems at multiple spatial and temporal scales .

name: SSCI 585 Geospatial Technology Project Management
description: Concepts , principles , and use of project management tools and the people issues encountered running GIS projects .

name: SSCI 586 GIS Programming and Customization
description: Design , coding , and implementation of GIS-based software and models using the Python programming language .

name: SSCI 588 Remote Sensing for GIS
description: Principles of remote sensing , satellite systems , and role of remote sensing data in GIS applications .

name: SSCI 589 Cartography and Visualization
description: Principles of visual perception , spatial cognition and cartographic design and their contributions to the maps , animations , virtual reality and multimedia displays produced with modern GIS .

name: SSCI 591 Web GIS
description: Design and implementation of locally served and cloud-based geospatial web applications . Construction of web maps , mashups , and Volunteered Geographic Information interfaces .

name: Mobile GIS
description: Design , coding , and implementation of mobile GIS applications using the Java and Javascript object-oriented programming languages .

name: SSCI 593 Geospatial Data Integration
description: Role of crowdsourcing , volunteered geographic information , spatial data infrastructures , and web portals in helping with the collection , storage , curation , and distribution of geospatial data assets .

name: GDEN 710 Knowledge Assessment for GDEN Students
description: Review of topics explored in the first two years of the program , including lectures and practical demonstrations or simulations and examinations of overall discipline knowledge .

name: GDEN 711a Case Portfolio Preparation for GDEN Students
description: Examination of clinical cases of geriatric patients through online conferences . Development and defense of portfolio of multiple cases . Open only to master’s and professional dental students .

name: GDEN 712a Capstone Research Project for GDEN Students
description: Production and defense of a research plan that demonstrates significant understanding of a topic in geriatric dentistry .

name: Internal Medicine and Systemic Disease for Dental Residents
description: (Enroll in OFPM 722 )

name: Epidemiology , Nutrition and Aging for Dental Residents
description: (Enroll in OFPM 725 )

name: MEDS 503 L Core Principles System I
description: Introduction to basic medical concepts and biological system functions ; examination of core principles of science and medical treatment .

name: MEDS 504 L Core Principles System II
description: Continuation of concepts from MEDS 503  . Basic medical concepts and biological system functions ; examination of core principles of science and medical treatment .

name: BAEP 550 Entrepreneurship and Venture Management
description: Develop conceptual and practical knowledge in entrepreneurship and new venture management .

name: BAEP 551 Introduction to New Ventures
description: Study and development of analytical and conceptual skills in the management of new enterprises and new ventures within large organizations .

name: Non-communicable Diseases
description: A conceptual framework for understanding global challenges faced in the management of non-communicable diseases , including heart disease , diabetes , chronic lung disease , and cancer .

name: MEDS 580 Interprofessional Team Dynamics in Healthcare
description: Examination of typical composition and function of interprofessional healthcare teams . Exploration of roles of team members and purview of care issues and common challenges , including medication management , inpatient/outpatient decision making , and care plan implementation .

name: MEDS 581 Case Studies in Interprofessional Healthcare
description: Survey of the specific roles each member of an interprofessional health team plays in the provision of care , based on their professional training . Application of diverse health professional expertise to case studies in healthcare .

name: DSO 582 Service Management : Economics and Operations
description: Examination of the service industry from a managerial and entrepreneurial perspective ; emphasis on the tactical decisions needed to design and deliver successful and profitable services .

name: Global Health Modules , Malaria
description: Critical issues in international control and treatment of malaria . Exploration of biological and epidemiological fundamentals of human-parasite interaction , including dynamics of transmission among populations .

name: Global Health Modules , Tuberculosis
description: Exploration of biological and epidemiological fundamentals of tuberculosis including dynamics of transmission among populations . Overview of clinical manifestations , diagnosis , and treatment of infections .

name: Global Health Modules , Maternal and Child Health I
description: Biopsychosocial , cultural and economic aspects of women’s health : pregnancy , childbirth , marriage . Examination of health promotion and policy efforts to improve women’s health globally .

name: Global Health Modules , Maternal and Child Health II
description: In-depth examination of women’s health issues ; health promotion and policy efforts to improve women’s health globally .

name: Global Health Modules , Tropical Disease
description: Examination of prevalent tropical diseases : epidemiology , clinical manifestations , treatment , impact on economies of tropical countries . Key issues related to these diseases ; World Health Organization responses .

name: Global Health Modules , HIV/AIDS
description: HIV epidemiology , basic biology of transmission and pathophysiology , associated opportunistic infections , and challenges to providing care in the developing world , including government responses .

name: Cultural Competence in Health and Medicine
description: Practical approach to the development of professional skills for providing culturally sensitive clinical health services to ethnically and linguistically diverse patients .

name: Health and Human Rights
description: The relationship between health and human rights , and the study of human rights issues relevant to health care professionals .

name: MEDS 518 Children in Emergency Situations : Global Policies and Programs
description: Focuses on children in emergency situations , including natural and man-made disasters , such as floods , earthquakes , conflicts , or war , with an emphasis on the poorest and most vulnerable children .

name: MEDS 519 Global Oral Health
description: Better understand the key issues impacting global oral health , how better care can help reduce the disease prevalence , and ways to prepare the next generation of global health leaders to address the key issues .

name: MEDS 520 Medical Spanish for the Health Professions
description: Spanish language course for students planning to enter the health professions .

name: Emerging and Re-emerging Infectious Diseases
description: Exploration of the threat of major worldwide epidemics and diseases with a focus on the recent emergence of new plagues .

name: Human Hepatitis Viruses
description: Human hepatitis and the viruses that cause them , how they are spread , symptoms , treatment , and prevention .

name: Global Toxicity and Carcinogenesis
description: Covers the occurrences of toxic substances and the toxicity/diseases they cause , and chemical carcinogens and the types of cancer they cause worldwide .

name: Grantwriting for Non-Government Organizations
description: Instruction on the process and methods of writing effective grants from identifying appropriate funders to implementing project upon receipt of funding award .

name: Global Mental Health
description: Examines the major mental health diagnoses from clinically relevant perspectives and their prevalence in specific geographical regions around the world .

name: Alternative and Eastern Medicine : A Biomedical Approach
description: Exploration of issues of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) and traditional Eastern medical views of health and illness from a Western biomedical perspective .

name: MEDS 527 Zoonotic Infectious Diseases
description: Background information on a group of infections that are transmitted via animal contact . Understanding of the epidemiology , clinical manifestations , treatment , and impact of the diseases on the economies of the countries in which they are found .

name: Global Health Modules , Sexually Transmitted Infections
description: Examines clinically relevant perspectives from distinguished international authors on STI issues and the devastating effect on particular geographical regions around the world .

name: MEDS 529 Refugee Health Care
description: Introduction to refugee health care and life events which impact health . Discuss medical needs of long-term displaced populations with specific case studies .

name: MEDS 531 The Politics of Global Health
description: Examines the impact of politics on global health progress and declines .

name: MEDS 533 Emerging Cell-based Therapeutics
description: Examination of microbial and human cells as versatile therapeutic engines , including their novel applications : autologous and allogenic immunotherapies , stem cell technologies , and human microbiome transplantations .

name: Global Biotechnology Entrepreneurship
description: Examination of the entrepreneurial process in biotechnology , including : industry overview , idea generation , business plan formulation , intellectual property protection , funding , personnel management , and regulatory body interaction .

name: Culture , Lifestyle , and Health
description: Overview of national and international variations in health status indicators in regard to cultural and lifestyle differences .

name: Clinical Medicine and Health Care Reform in Taiwan
description: Two-week in-depth study abroad in Taipei , Taiwan , focused on understanding Taiwan’s health care system , health priorities , and needs .

name: Clinical Medicine and Socioeconomic Factors in Uganda
description: Two-week course that provides students with hands-on experience in clinical medicine/public health and exposure to the various socioeconomic factors impacting health in the developing world .

name: Clinical Medicine and Health Care Reform in Jordan
description: A two-week , in-depth study abroad course that explores the economic , social , political , and health issues in the Middle East region and specifically Jordan .

name: Clinical Medicine and Health Care Challenges in India
description: Two-week study abroad course that explores the health dynamics and health care settings of India .

name: MEDS 554 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Delivery in Panama
description: A two-week course providing students with hands-on experience in the practice of rural medicine as they gain exposure to the various socio-economic factors present in Bocas del Toro , Panama .

name: MEDS 555 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Access in Honduras
description: A three-week hybrid course providing students with hands-on experience in clinical medicine/public health and exposure to the various socio-economic factors impacting healthcare delivery in the developing world , specifically in Honduras .

name: MEDS 556 Global Health Field Study , New York
description: Two-week course providing students with a solid understanding of the United Nations’ major agencies influential in global health , their mandate , their strengths and challenges . Includes field visit to selected UN organizations all located in NYC .

name: MEDS 557 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Dynamics in Denmark
description: Two-week course that provides a venue for careful examination and assessment of the economic , social , political , and specific health issues currently faced by countries in the European Region .

name: MEDS 558 Clinical Medicine and Translational Research in Argentina
description: Two week in-depth course examining and assessing the economic , social , political and unique health issues faced by the Latin- American Region especially Argentina .

name: MEDS 559 Clinical Medicine and Healthcare Determinants in China
description: A two-week intensive course abroad in Shanghai , China , focused on understanding clinical realities of Chinese medicine , health determinants and healthcare delivery .

name: Innovating in Healthcare in Malaysia
description: Two-week study abroad course in Malaysia that examines the capacity of local communities to address health needs and to address health priorities with innovation .

name: MEDS 561 Global Healthcare Development and Practices in Nepal
description: Two-week course providing a multi-faceted understanding of the delivery of essential services to underserved populations , particularly women and children , in the challenging Nepalese healthcare landscape .

name: MEDS 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master’s degree . Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department .

name: Healthcare in Thailand
description: Two-week course that provides students opportunities to analyze and gain exposure to public health and health systems infrastructure in Thailand .

name: Global Healthcare Development and Social Justice in Italy
description: A two-week course analyzing global healthcare access and delivery through the lens of development economics , social justice , health advocacy , and Italian medical history and research .

name: Health Behavior and Healthcare in Germany
description: Two-week course that exposes students to public health and health systems infrastructure in Germany and Switzerland , including analysis of health behaviors .

name: MEDS 566 Healthcare in Fiji
description: Two-week study abroad course in Fiji that examines the public health and healthcare systems of Fiji and its neighbors .

name: MEDS 599 Special Topics
description: Lecture and discussion focused on specific topics within global medicine . Course topic will vary from semester to semester .

name: MEDS 567 Global Nutrition
description: A systematic survey of basic and clinical nutrition that provides an overview of critical public health-nutrition issues in both the developing world and industrial society .

name: MEDS 568 Global Issues : Aging
description: Examination of medical issues in aging through a nation-specific survey of how various countries treat the elderly in health policy and healthcare .

name: MEDS 569 Interdisciplinary Medical Literature Evaluation
description: Focus on the importance of evidence-based practice in healthcare . Development of critical thinking and analysis of scientific literature to enable the identification and appropriate implementation of medical , cultural , and ethical interventions in healthcare , particularly through interdisciplinary collaboration .

name: MEDS 570 Introduction to Narrative Medicine
description: Introduction to the field of narrative medicine . Examination of theoretical and literary texts and the practice of narrative and reflective writing to enhance narrative competency and gain an understanding of the role of narrative in people’s experiences with illness .

name: DSO 586 Global Healthcare Operations Management
description: Application of operations management tools and techniques to improve the performance of healthcare delivery systems . May include international travel .

name: MOR 542 Strategic Issues for Global Business
description: Globalization strategies from entry to maturity ; alternative approaches from going alone to alliances ; strategy implementation issues in different cultures and political systems . Cases , videos and speakers .

name: ISE 507 Six-Sigma Methods and Applications
description: Comprehensive study of Six Sigma and Lean metrics , methods , and systems with their applications to manufacturing , services , quality improvement and management .

name: ISE 508 Health Care Operations Improvement
description: Improving operations , patient flow , quality and processes . Students will become familiar with methods for implementing change in health care settings such as hospitals or clinics .

name: MKT 565 Global Marketing
description: Variations in markets and trade patterns around the globe ; product development and adaptation , pricing , promotion , and distribution issues across national cultures and international markets .

name: DSO 549 Application of Lean Six Sigma
description: Application of Six Sigma practices and techniques to improve operations in organizations . Open only to graduate business students .

name: DSO 557a Global Supply Chain Management in International Settings
description: Study of global logistics infrastructures – water , rail , road , and air – through readings , team research and presentation , international site visits , and final written report . Open only to Global Supply Chain Management majors .

name: DSO 581 Supply Chain Management
description: Issues in supply chain management . Supply chain performance and dynamics . Tools for planning , control and coordination . Supply chain design and strategy . Open only to business majors .

name: Enterprise Wide Information Systems
description: The role of enterprise resource planning systems (ERPs) in an organization and the task of implementing and managing the IS function .

name: DSO 505 Sustainable Supply Chains
description: Sustainability concepts and frameworks , design for environment , closed-loop supply chains , sustainability in sourcing , green facilities , renewable energy , facility location and transportation decisions , strategic sustainability implementation . Web registration open only to graduate business and accounting students .

name: DSO 506 Sourcing and Supplier Management
description: Factors to consider when making sourcing decisions (costs , prices , ethics , globalization) ; impact of sourcing on other activities such as product design or inventory management . Open only to graduate business students .

name: DSO 520 Logistics Management
description: Gives students a managerial knowledge of basic logistics concepts and principles . Some topics include management of logistics cost integration , transportation , distribution , and customer service . Open only to graduate business students .

name: DSO 534 Discrete-Event Simulation for Process Management
description: Application of discrete-event simulation models to events that occur randomly over time . Representation using process flow diagrams . Use of simulation methodology to improve process performance .

name: DSO 580 Project Management
description: Applications of systems theory and concepts , matrix organizational structures , PERT/CPM project modeling , and management information systems to the management of complex and critical projects . Open only to business majors .

name: Inventory Systems
description: Deterministic and stochastic demand systems with static/dynamic models . Practice in inventory management , computerized procedures , materials requirements planning , just-intime production , Kanban systems .

name: Advanced Production Planning and Scheduling
description: Advanced concepts in production planning and scheduling including resource allocation , lot sizing , flow shop and job shop scheduling , workforce scheduling and assembly line balancing .

name: Quality Management for Engineers
description: Principles of quality management , quality philosophies and frameworks , quality leadership and strategic planning , process management , and performance measurements .

name: Industrial Ecology : Technology-Environment Interaction
description: Concepts and methods to analyze the environmental impacts of industrial systems , including lifecycle assessment , material flow analysis , design for environment and sustainable consumption .

name: CHE 510 Energy and Process Efficiency
description: Management and engineering strategies utilized to improve energy efficiency .

name: AME 577 Survey of Energy and Power for a Sustainable Future
description: Power production includes conventional fossil fuels , synthetic fuels , hydroelectric , solar , wind , geothermal , biomass and nuclear . The environmental consequences of various energy sources are discussed .

name: Energy and the Environment
description: Environmental effects of energy development using fossil and fissile fuels , geothermics , photosynthesis , and other sources . Relationship of elemental cycles to the life supporting systems .

name: Sustainability in the Environment : Infrastructures , Urban Landscapes , and Buildings
description: Methodologies and exercises on contextual design and environmentally sound technologies (EST’s) applications for the sustainability of urban infrastructures , operative landscapes , and building integration in the urban system .

name: Smart Infrastructures
description: Examination of smart infrastructures relating to energy , water , waste and transportation drawing from the fields of engineering , sustainability , communications , sociology , and psychology .

name: Environmental and Regulatory Compliance
description: Federal and state environmental laws ; environmental impact assessment techniques ; permitting for industrial facility construction and operation .

name: MOR 566 Environmental Sustainability and Competitive Advantage
description: How business is changing in order to respond to environmental sustainability challenges — adapting strategy , product design , operations , marketing , and accounting . Cases and speakers .

name: HMGT 512 Information Technology and Patient Engagement
description: Strategic management and utilization of healthcare information technology in the delivery of healthcare ; patient engagement and the use of technology to facilitate participation in their own care .

name: Leading People and Health Care Organizations
description: An exploration of contemporary work force issues and skills development in organizational design , performance measurement , teamwork , conflict resolution , leadership , and change management .

name: Health Economics , Financing and Reimbursement
description: Provides a framework for the economic analysis of health care issues and provides students with an opportunity to apply economic methods to a number of actual health care problems .

name: Managing the Organization's Financial Health
description: Executives confront and solve problems requiring use of accounting , finance , and management control principles ; provides core financial skills for non-finance professionals .

name: Strategic Management
description: Provides skill development and application in the integrative discipline of strategic management including assessment , strategy formulation , implementation and control .

name: Managing and Improving Health
description: Methods for monitoring and improving the health of populations . Topics include outcomes management , risk-adjustment , development and implementation of practice guidelines .

name: HMGT 600 Managing Risk
description: Overview of reimbursement models in clinical and institutional settings ; legal , financial and clinical assumption of risk pursuant to new and evolving federal and state statutory and regulatory provisions .

name: HMGT 601 Operations Management for Accountability
description: Hospital operations in the inpatient/outpatient setting ; special emphasis on the growing requirement to more effectively manage across the continuum of care while assuming greater accountability in the delivery of care .

name: HMGT 602 Operational Efficiency Processes in Health Care Organizations
description: Improving productivity and efficiency of health care organizations combining the application of key operational analysis principles to improve quality , speed and productivity in the delivery of health care .

name: HMGT 603 Developing and Monitoring of Quality and Patient Safety Outcomes
description: Overview of contemporary methods used to develop and monitor patient quality and safety outcomes ; develop skill in data collection and analysis of clinical care outcomes ; focus on operationalizing outcomes that matter to payers , organizations , and clinicians .

name: Health Information Systems
description: Conceptual framework for data base development ; relational data management ; use of health statistics ; health indicators ; confidentiality , security , privacy .

name: Quality of Care Concepts
description: Quality issues and complexities affecting health care ; fundamentals of quality improvement programs ; examination of quality issues and improvement programs in various health care venues ; strategies .

name: PPD 605 Frontline Issues in Health Services Administration and Policy
description: Emphasis on current or emergent issues in the health care industry . Focus on impact of recent health legislation and/or health care system responsiveness .

name: Financial Management of Health Services
description: Accounting principles , financial reports , managerial finance , financial planning , capital investments , working capital analysis ; elements of budgeting and reimbursement ; performance standards ; reporting ; developing a management system .

name: PPD 512 Health Administration Residency Seminar
description: Supervised study of health care administration , governance , professional staff relations , internal operations and controls , legal and regulatory requirements , management policy and strategy .

name: PPD 513 Legal Issues in Health Care Delivery
description: Rights of consumers ; health-related powers of governments ; rights and responsibilities of health care providers ; interrelationships of rights , powers , and responsibilities .

name: PPD 514 Economic Concepts Applied to Health
description: Relationships between economic characteristics and health status ; impact of economy on health services industry ; demand and resources for health services ; utilization , prices , costs , health insurance .

name: Strategic Management of Health Organizations
description: Application of principles of health administration in several practice settings . Decision-making ; strategic management ; organizational performance ; communication ; provider comparisons .

name: PPD 516 Financial Accounting for Health Care Organizations
description: Accounting as a management tool ; accounting systems ; basic accounting concepts and procedures ; budgets ; financial statements .

name: Concepts and Practices in Managing Health Care Organizations
description: Application of principles of health administration . Role of managers ; managing people and programs ; human resource management concepts and applications ; working with professionals ; governance ; public relations .

name: PPD 545 Human Behavior in Public Organizations
description: Behavior in organizations ; focus on personal , interpersonal , and group level factors that influence such behavior .

name: Multivariate Statistical Analysis
description: Applied multivariate statistics in support of policy , management , and planning problem solving . Includes regression analysis , logit models , and an introduction to time-series models and multi-equation estimation .

name: Topics in Modern Architecture in Southern California
description: Investigation of modern architecture in southern California within its cultural and historic contexts .

name: Fundamentals of Heritage Conservation
description: Concepts and strategies for conservation of significant elements of the built environment : buildings , sites and communities as revealed by readings , site visits , and case studies .

name: Heritage Conservation Policy and Planning
description: Conservation practice within an economic , political , and cultural context looking at the regulatory environment , public advocacy and policy , real estate development , heritage tourism , environmental sustainability , cultural diversity , and interpretation .

name: Conservation Methods and Materials
description: Concepts and techniques for building conservation including identification of treatments , recordation and research , material properties and behavior , building forensics , and project implementation .

name: Introduction to Historic Site Documentation
description: Survey of basic guidelines and standards for documentation in historic preservation , including cultural resource surveys , historic structures reports and Historic American Building Survey and Historic American Engineering Record recordation .

name: History of American Architecture and Urbanism
description: History of American architecture and urbanism from prehistory to World War II examined in relation to European influences and indigenous developments .

name: ARCH 554 Heritage Conservation Practicum — Advanced Documentation
description: Heritage conservation practicum utilizing in-depth documentation methodology to explore the historic built environment of greater Los Angeles . Topics will vary from year to year ; may be repeated for credit when subjectmatter is different .

name: ARCH 555 Global Perspectives in Heritage Conservation
description: In-depth analysis of international heritage conservation practice with a focus on a single country , continent , or world region outside the United States . Topics will vary from year to year ; may be repeated for credit when subject matter is different .

name: Readings in Heritage Conservation Theory
description: Trans-disciplinary intensive reading and discussion course related to issues in contemporary heritage conservation .

name: ARCH 558 Fundamentals of Place-Making
description: Concepts and strategies for urban design and place-making for heritage conservation as revealed by place-making exercises , site visits , and case studies .

name: ARCH 691a Heritage Conservation Thesis Preparation and Thesis
description: Introduction to , and exploration of , topics leading to the development of a thesis prospectus and directed research towards the completion of the master’s thesis in heritage conservation .

name: HRM 500 Human Resource Strategy
