description: Explores the strategic role that human resources management plays in providing organizations with sustained competitive advantages by unlocking the productive potential of employees’ human and social capital .

name: HRM 505 Organizational Culture and Employee Outcomes
description: Prepares students to create , foster , and manage organizations in which people thrive and perform at their best in order to retain talent and reduce costs in a sustainable way .

name: HRM 510 Leadership in Human Resources
description: Focuses on developing the critical social intelligence skills needed to lead people and change through increased self-awareness , understanding of interpersonal differences , and greater influence .

name: HRM 515 Organization Design
description: Equips students with a deeper understanding of how to design and develop organizations to increase performance and effectiveness and includes sections on strategy , work , and management processes .

name: HRM 520 Talent Management
description: Examines talent management processes that impact employee experience and engagement and explores ways to improve data driven decision making processes including workforce and succession planning .

name: HRM 525 Total Rewards
description: Provides a comprehensive look at the employee rewards strategies that human resource practitioners promote and manage including compensation , performance management , benefits , and non-monetary rewards .

name: HRM 530 Learning and Development
description: Prepares students to identify , design , and implement effective learning and development interventions and strategies that drive results and enhance organizational competitiveness .

name: HRM 535 Employee Relations
description: Applies practical approaches to building positive employee and labor relations and solving related problems through increased employee motivation , effectiveness , and retention .

name: HRM 540 Human Resources Analytics
description: Examines and emphasizes strategies and techniques to enable improved organizational and human capital decisions by directing the organizational analytics for more actionable insights .

name: HRM 545 Management of Diverse and Global Human Resources
description: Analyzes global diversity in today’s environment , fostering a broad understanding of diversity and inclusion and the impact of diversity , inclusion , and inclusive behaviors on organizations .

name: HRM 550 Change Management and Organization Development
description: Identifies the common challenges in organizational change management and explores the limitations and opportunities of different models of organizational change .

name: HRM 555 Anticipating the Future of Human Resources
description: Explores the forces and emerging trends that are reshaping work , the workforce and workplace – and how to address these transformational changes and be effective as a Human Resources leader .

name: Design of Experiments
description: Planning data collection to investigate relationships between product/process design choices (materials , temperatures , etc .) and performance , empirical modeling to predict performance , identification of the best design choices .

name: IDSN 510 Integrative Practices Residential
description: One-week campus residential . Introduction to program themes , content , concepts , theories , and processes . Opportunity to build skills and meet cohort , with an emphasis on team building .

name: IDSN 515 Professional Practices Residential
description: One-week off-campus residential . Visit WIRED headquarters , cultural venues , and businesses . Applied , intensive workshop format focused on solutions for real-world problems with input from industry experts .

name: ACAD 590 Directed Research
description: Research leading to graduate degree . Maximum units which may be applied to degree determined by department .

name: IDSN 540 Processes and Perspectives
description: Discipline-specific , cross-disciplinary , and shared approaches to products , services , projects , systems , organizational development . Topics include creative and user-focused perspectives , feasibility analytics , lean startup techniques .

name: IDSN 545 Integrative Project
description: culty-mentored project paired with a Core course . Demonstrate individual and simultaneous skills and competency across fields and within cross-functional , cross-disciplinary teams .

name: IDSN 550 Opportunity and Uncertainty
description: Discipline-specific , cross-disciplinary , and shared approaches to recognizing/analyzing opportunities , identifying/framing problems , and developing/iterating solutions . Techniques gleaned from entrepreneurship , creative practices , critical thinking methods , ethnography , systems theory .

name: IDSN 560 Narrative and Storytelling
description: Discipline-specific , cross-disciplinary , and shared approaches to exploring visual , written , and spoken storytelling using digital modalities . Topics include communication theory , narrative structures and content creation .

name: IDSN 570 Decisions and Solutions
description: Generate portfolio of solutions for a given “problem .” Explore solutions and decisions , mechanisms for reducing uncertainty and risk . Includes quantitative and qualitative techniques .

name: IDSN 585 Capstone
description: culty-mentored , applied project with individual and team components . Implement a prototype solution to a problem . Deploy relevant tools , methods , and processes learned throughout the program .

name: IDSN 520 Design Essentials
description: Overview of design language , process and product . Build fluency in applying core visual principles and design-based problem-solving techniques . Explore historical and contemporary design issues .

name: IDSN 525 Business Essentials
description: Overview of general business and management concepts and techniques that builds theoretical and analytical fluency and identifies and examines leadership and managerial challenges .

name: IDSN 530 Technology Essentials
description: Overview of core information technology concepts , methods , and frameworks . Develop aptitude in using tools , applications and systems ; learn basic programming languages and methodologies .

name: IDSN 505 Intensive
description: Optional short-term , primarily residential , learning experience paired with an event/activity . Intensive experience aligns with and extends the cross-disciplinary nature of the program .

name: CTIN 511 Interactive Media Seminar
description: Seminars on latest trends in interactive media content , technology , tools , business and culture .

name: CTIN 532 L Interactive Design and Production I
description: The development of interactive experiences with an emphasis on prototyping and development .

name: Interactive Design and Production II
description: Interactive design , prototyping and testing of projects developed in CTIN 548  .

name: Preparing the Interactive Project
description: An advanced production workshop in which students design and prepare for the production of their advanced project .

name: Master's Thesis
description: Credit on acceptance of thesis .

name: Business of Interactive Media
description: In-depth investigation of publication , distribution , business and legal aspects of the interactive entertainment business .

name: IML 500 Digital Media Tools and Tactics
description: Introduction to digital scholarship at the graduate level , with a focus on media research ecologies , online portfolios and distributed scholarly presence . Open only to graduate students .

name: Advanced Storytelling for Interactive Media
description: Advanced writing workshop addressing issues specific to interactive storytelling regarding construction of narrative and character as seen in games and other forms of interactive media .

name: CTIN 583 Game Development for Designers
description: The fundamentals of 3-D real time game engines , scripting for interactivity , and building games with digital tools .

name: Vocal Jazz Ensemble
description: Study and performance of vocal ensemble literature from the Jazz idiom , with emphasis on improvisational techniques .

name: MUEN 529 Jazz Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and performance of literature written for large jazz ensemble .

name: MUEN 532 Jazz Chamber Music
description: Preparation and performance of advanced literature for jazz chamber groups .

name: MUJZ 545 Jazz Ensemble Development
description: Techniques , approaches , teaching materials , and music useful in developing jazz ensembles in educational settings , from junior high school through college .

name: MUJZ 547 Jazz Composition
description: Application of theoretical and compositional techniques used in jazz to written music . Analysis and performance of historical and contemporary examples will be included .

name: JOUR 505 The Practice : Journalism's Evolution as a Profession
description: Analyzes the history , ethics and evolution of journalism ; Students will be introduced to key innovations and innovators in journalism history as well as multimedia platforms . Open only to journalism majors .

name: JOUR 528 Summer Digital Journalism Immersion
description: A journalism immersion experience that orients and familiarizes students with the best practices and standards of cutting-edge multimedia , multi-platform fact gathering , reporting and storytelling . Open only to Journalism majors .

name: JOUR 531L Fall Digital Journalism Immersion
description: Students write , report , produce , code , promote (through social media) , and publish/air cross-platform stories in a converged news environment . Open only to Journalism majors .

name: News , Numbers and Introduction to Data Journalism
description: An overview of the basic quantitative analysis tools and techniques essential to give perspective to a journalistic story or to put it in context .

name: JOUR 547 Navigating the Media Marketplace
description: Explores the economics of the news industry and prepares students to navigate the journalism job market through practical exercises , practice interviews and cover letter-writing .

name: JOUR 553 Coding and Programming for Storytelling
description: Sketch , design and code a website from scratch , using HTML , CSS and jQuery plug-ins to tell a rich multimedia story . Open only to journalism majors .

name: JOUR 560 Seminar in Mass Communication Law
description: Analysis of major elements of mass communication law , legal issues in contemporary mass communication , and the impact of legal trends on professional journalists . Open only to journalism majors .

name: Special Topics
description: Seminar in selected topics in journalism .

name: JOUR 598 Journalism Capstone Project
description: Production of a journalism capstone project with multimedia elements for a master’s degree . Projects can be single stand-alone pieces , or series of pieces .

name: JOUR 521 Documentary Pre-Production
description: Pre-production of video documentary including selection of topic , diversity , ethical and legal problems , research and reporting techniques , interviewing , writing , balanced presentation , visual and audio literacy . Open only to journalism majors .

name: Video Documentary Production
description: Production of video documentary including research and reporting techniques , writing , interviewing , field work , editing , legal issues , economics , aesthetics , balanced presentation , ethics , diversity and production problems .

name: JOUR 575 Converged Media Center
description: Advanced multimedia news production ; preparation and treatment of form and content ; procedures , problems , ethics , and practice in operating a daily , 24-7 news outlet .

name: Advanced Investigative Reporting
description: Advanced reportorial and analytical skills and techniques required for evaluating newsworthy events . Group research and publication of stories on important current topics .

name: JOUR 524 Advanced Broadcast Reporting
description: Reporting and writing broadcast news ; analysis and practical experience ; role of the broadcast journalism reporter ; similarities and differences between media ; application of audio-visual equipment .

name: JOUR 539 Introduction to Investigative Reporting
description: Focus on basic investigative reporting ; understand its history , how to access records , identify sources , use computer assisted reporting , report in a fair and ethical manner . Open only to journalism majors .

name: JOUR 552 Television Reporting and Production
description: Writing , reporting and producing content for video and digital platforms ; similarities and differences between media ; application of audio-visual and digital equipment . Open only to journalism majors .

name: JOUR 495 Journalism for Mobile and Emerging Platforms
description: Create video , audio and graphic news and information using mobile and emerging technology  – such as phones , tablets and laptops – for non-broadcast platforms ; understand ethical and legal issues related to journalists working on mobile and emerging platforms .

name: JOUR 523 Public Radio Reporting
description: Reporting for public radio-style news : writing , newsgathering , editing , vocal delivery . Techniques applicable for broadcast or Web audio stories . Open only to journalism majors .

name: JOUR 525 Public Radio Documentary
description: Advanced production techniques for public radio-style reports : writing , sound , editing , narrative voice . Techniques applicable for broadcast features or Web audio documentaries .

name: JOUR 519 Advanced Writing and Reporting for Magazine and the Web
description: Focus on reporting and writing for magazine and the web , learning fundamental production skills , and pitching stories in the freelance market

name: Monetization and the New Media
description: Understanding new media through an economic lens . Applying knowledge by creating , reporting and delivering a communications or business strategy model .

name: Specialized Reporting : Religion
description: Reporting and writing on religion ; survey of world religion , religion and public life — including politics , gender and science .

name: Specialized Reporting : Science
description: Reporting and writing on science ; survey of scientific research fields and evaluation of evidence and claims .

name: JOUR 596 Follow the Money : Business and Economics Reporting
description: Reporting and writing on business , economics and public finance ; students produce a series of professional projects for publication . Open only to journalism and specialized journalism majors .

name: JOUR 489 Hands-on Disruption : Experimenting with Emerging Technology
description: Exploration and experimentation of emerging technologies through the lens of journalism and hands-on prototyping

name: JOUR 494 Python Coding for Data Journalism
description: Python coding language to gather , parse and analyze data for investigative news reporting .

name: JOUR 496 Interactive Media Design for Publishing
description: Design , test and distribute engaging news and publishing apps . Learn concepts of interactive design , color , type , UX , and more for digital mobile/tablet platforms .

name: JOUR 497 Data Visualization and Interactive Tools
description: Present your data in tables , charts , graphs , maps , and complex multimedia pieces using readily available interactive tools .

name: JOUR 533 Web Journalism and Editorial Site Management
description: Report , edit , and manage a major news Website while operating its content management system ; understand best standards and practices in online site management . Open only to journalism majors .

name: Intermediate Online Publishing
description: Advanced concepts in online publishing ; focus on databases , editing , scripting and authoring applications for news Websites .

name: JOUR 555 Advanced Coding for Creative Storytelling
description: Focuses on advanced coding techniques for the creation of dynamic , interactive , multimedia and data-driven news stories on the web .

name: JOUR 561 Advanced Data Journalism
description: Execute data-driven projects and add context to news stories with advanced quantitative analysis tools and techniques .

name: ARCH 414 Perspectives in History and Theory in Architecture
description: Perspectives in Architecture and Urbanism is an advanced course that allows students to delve deeply into one aspect of world history , theory and/or contemporary issues to develop more focused and critical understanding of that discourse .

name: ARCH 439 Landscape Architecture Media Workshop
description: Introductory media workshop for new landscape architecture students in the 3-year graduate program . Topics include : hand drawing , measuring , architectural drawings , computer software tutorials , and field trips .

name: ARCH 539L Media for Landscape Architecture
description: Development of methods and skills for the study of landscape architecture design and for project presentation , including natural resource and urban mapping .

name: ARCH 541a L Landscape Architecture Design
description: Projects on urban sites with emphasis on cultural and ecological purpose and on urban place and form ; use of traditional and digital media .

name: Landscape Construction : Topographic Design
description: Techniques , strategies , materials , and standards to topographic design and construction in landscape architecture . In-class labs practice basic grading , drainage design , and stormwater management .

name: ARCH 537 Urban Plant Ecology : Environmental Perspectives
description: Principles and concepts of plant ecology for urban planting design ; introduction to California native plant species and communities with field trips and case studies .

name: Media for Landscape Architecture : 3D Design
description: Developing and communicating landscape architecture design intent using visualization tools for three-dimensional studies .

name: ARCH 542a L Landscape Architecture Design
description: Project strategies for urban infrastructure repair and intervention , phasing , and design of initial catalytic projects .

name: ARCH 538 L Urban Plant Ecology : Cultural Perspectives
description: Cultural perspectives of urban planting design and plant species found in Southern California emphasizing aesthetic , functional and ecological designs .

name: Landscape Construction : Assembly and Documentation
description: Learn and practice the process by which a landscape design is assembled through materials systems and design documentation .

name: Landscape Construction : Performance Approaches
description: Develop tools and knowledge to expand the performative boundaries of landscape architecture beyond common typologies . Topics range from ecological infrastructure to design with weather patterns . A systematic approach to case studies , landscape technologies , and field trips seeds the knowledge base and respresentational methods necessary to design and build these complex landscape performances .

name: ARCH 530 Landscape Architecture Practice
description: Introduction to the principles and ethics , scope and activities , and types of organization for landscape architecture practice .

name: ARCH 642 L Landscape Architecture Design
description: Fully integrated landscape place design ; reclamation sites at significant urban or natural locations .

name: ARCH 698aL MLArch Thesis
description: Directed research option for the MLArch degree .

name: ARCH 407 Advanced Computer Applications
description: Investigation of computer graphic applications , emphasizing the role of computers in helping designers create and communicate using color (rendering) , form (modeling) , and time (animation) and the implications of future technological advancements .

name: Theories of Computer Technology
description: Fundamental theories and meanings of computation as a technique in architectural design .

name: ARCH 524 Professional Practicum
description: Comparative studies of professional practice between U .S . firms and firms in other countries .

name: ARCH 540 Topics in Media for Landscape Architecture
description: Exploration of emerging techniques for landscape architecture study , presentation and documentation ; topics vary from year to year ; may be repeated for credit when subject matter is different .

name: ARCH 546 Topics in Landscape Architecture : Issues and Practices
description: A broad range of developing urban landscape conditions and issues , both domestic and global , are given focused attention .

name: PPD 527 The Social Context of Planning
description: Examination of the formation of the modern urban environment with its consumer culture , social classes , and racial and ethnic diversity .

name: PPD 530 Historical Analysis of Urban Form and Planning Practice
description: Awareness , analysis , understanding , and influencing the city building process locally and regionally ; isolate and exercise tools and methods of visual literacy .

name: Planning History and Urban Form
description: History of urban planning with an emphasis on the evolution of how planning shaped the physical environment in response to political , economic , and social issues .

name: PPD 640 Leadership Foundations : Competencies and Core Values
description: An intensive introduction to leading through core values . Focuses on developing leadership skills at the personal level to build a foundation for leadership at all levels .

name: PPD 641 Leading Individuals , Groups and Teams
description: Leadership styles in various settings ; team demographics , and dynamics ; problem-solving ; decision-making ; diversity and critical thinking skills ; effect of culture on small group communication ; managing conflict .

name: PPD 642 Strategic Leadership of Organizations
description: Strategic analysis ; strategic planning ; leadership ; performance measurement and management ; control systems ; organizational structure and networks ; organizational culture ; organizational learning and change .

name: PPD 643 Leading Transformations Across Sectors : Integrative Seminar
description: Application and practice of leadership skills working across the public , private and nonprofit sectors . Skills include negotiation , collaboration , communication , political management and ethical responsibilities .

name: Learning and Motivation
description: Design and advancement of learning and motivation outcomes in various environments through a systematic examination and application of current research .

name: EDUC 589 Human Lifespan Development
description: Fundamentals of human physical , motor , mental , social , and emotional development , spanning the prenatal period through late adulthood .

name: Diversity : Power , Equity and Inclusion
description: Appraises practices that maintain power ; creates strategies to empower individuals and marginalized groups by intervening to achieve equitable outcomes in education , professions and communities .

name: Assessment and Evaluation
description: Overview of the concepts and procedures for assessment and evaluation of individual and overall performance in various learning environments .

name: EDUC 595 Instructional Design
description: Formulation and design of effective instruction ; emphasis on analysis of media characteristics and instrumentation requirements .

name: Media Selection and Evaluation
description: Selection and evaluation of media and technologies in support of instructional design based on a survey of current research and recommendations .

name: Design of Learning Environments
description: Design of learning environments through application of design principles ; project-based practice in aligning instructional design , media selection , and the features of learning spaces .

name: Master's Studio A
description: Students propose and design a capstone project that applies knowledge and skills learned throughout the program and prepare a coursework portfolio .

name: Master's Studio B
description: Students implement the capstone project and submit a portfolio that integrates program coursework .

name: GSBA 502 Management Communication for Leaders
description: Integrates leadership theory and practice with communication skills to improve individual , team , and organizational performance . Emphasizes interpersonal , presentation , and writing skills ; teamwork ; and value-based leadership .

name: LIM 500 Fundamentals of Library and Information Science
description: An overview of the history of recorded knowledge from ancient times to the digital age informed by the cultural implications of those eras . Open only to MMLIS students .

name: LIM 501 Fundamentals of Library Leadership and Management
description: Fundamentals of library leadership and management from past , present and future perspectives , including selected case studies .

name: Collection Development and Management
description: The development of library collections in all formats emphasizing clientele interest , usage patterns , bibliographical and Website sources . Open only to MMLIS students .

name: LIM 503 Information Description , Organization , and Retrieval
description: An overview and critical analysis of current practices of information organization , cataloguing , access and reference services , including a conceptual understanding of these skills .

name: LIM 504 Research Methods in Library and Information Management
description: An overview of research methods in information management including the conceptualization of research problems , literature reviews , research design , sampling , measurement , data collection and data analysis . Open only to MMLIS students .

name: LIM 591 Research and Professional Applications
description: Apply concepts learned during the MMLIS program and investigate research questions and professional problems of concern to employers , their institutions and the profession at large . Open only to Library and Information Science majors .

name: Capstone in Library and Information Management
description: Student-driven research or project-based experience that integrates the knowledge from course work and applies it to current issues in the field .

name: ENGL 601 Introduction to Literary Editing and Publishing
description: Comprehensive introduction to the MA degree and its range of study , focusing on elements of the craft of editing and the literary marketplace .

name: ENGL 602 Writers in the World : Text and Context
description: Editing and publishing within the tradition of literary and cultural influences upon a wide range of authors , readers , and genres .

name: ENGL 603 The Editorial Experience : The Craft of Publication
description: An intensive workshop in applied English , coordinating literary analysis with editing and publication , including relationships with authors ; academic and trade presses ; journals ; editing , and design .

name: ENGL 604 The Nonfiction Experience : A Literary-Editorial Focus
description: Topics on literary and popular forms : profile portrait ; science writing ; food writing ; place and travel ; memoir ; and personal essay ; with venues for publication .

name: ENGL 607 Digital Publishing and Literary Writing for New Media
description: Discussion of literary texts combined with hands-on digital practice in composition , design , and fabrication for electronic publication , including formal , technical , and philosophical issues .

name: ENGL 608 Publishing on Both Sides of the Transom
description: Editorial and publishing workshop with an intensive hands-on student project following the progress of a single piece of writing from manuscript to print .

name: ENGL 609a Internship in Editing and Publishing : Eloquence and Ethics
description: Practical experience in the publishing world for acquiring skills and knowledge beyond the classroom .

name: ENGL 600 Publication in Humanities Journals
description: Development of academic strategies for preparing articles for publication in scholarly journals . Aspects of publication will include abstracts , introductions , argumentation , style and footnotes .

name: FBE 587 Legal and Regulatory Environment of Long Term Care
description: Comprehensive overview of substantive business law topics and issues as they affect the long term care industry .

name: PPD 601 Management of Long-Term Care Organizations
description: History , development , trends ; major policy issues ; organization of systems ; principles and techniques of administration ; management of institutional and community based programs .

name: PPD 649 Concepts and Practices in Public Personnel Administration
description: Concepts of man and of work ; workforce ; government personnel systems , including merit concepts , classification , and compensation ; collective bargaining ; organizational justice ; training and development .

name: Advanced Computational Design and Manufacturing
description: Study advanced concepts behind computational representations , algorithms , and mathematical foundations , and their applications in computeraided design and manufacturing . Develop hands-on computational skills in team projects .

name: ISE 511 L Mechatronic Systems Engineering
description: Use of mechanical , electrical , and computer engineering , math , and computer science to design of high performance and sophisticated products and processes and systems involving mechatronic .

name: Modern Enterprise Systems
description: Managing the process design , interfaces and resources of service and manufacturing systems , based on the state of their processes .

name: Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master’s degree . Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department .

name: Advanced Seminar in Plankton Biology
description: An overview of phytoplankton and zooplankton taxa , their morphologies and life histories using material collected from the local environment off LA and near the Phillip K . Wrigley Marine Science Center on Catalina Island .

name: Advanced Seminar on the Physiology of Marine Organisms
description: Physiological processes dictate survival potential , growth rates , and many other biological processes that affect the distribution of species in the oceans . Emphasis on the diverse environmental factors that influence physiological adaptations of marine organisms . Examples from a wide variety of marine organisms , from bacterial to animals , will be studied .

name: Advanced Seminar in Molecular and Microbial Ecology
description: Microorganisms dominate biological processes in the ocean . These species pose significant problems for estimating species diversity , abundance and activity . Examination of modern molecular biological approaches for analyzing aquatic microbial communities and their ecological roles .

name: Advanced Seminar in Remote Sensing and Modeling
description: Modern oceanographic methods for making remote measurements of aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems using satellite imagery and other means . Integrating these data into models that describe ecosystem structure and enable interpretation of ecosystem function .

name: Advanced Seminar in Population Genetics of Marine Organisms
description: An overview of the theory underlying population and quantitative genetics , with applications to marine systems . Basic evolutionary mechanisms (mutation , migration , drift , selection , nonrandom mating) and modern evidence for their roles in structuring genetic variation within and among marine populations .

name: Advanced Seminar in Marine Biogeochemistry
description: Examination of the interplay between ocean biology and the cycling of carbon , nitrogen and other elements on a local , regional and global scale .

name: BISC 445 L Fundamentals of Vertebrate Biology
description: Evolution and comparative anatomy of vertebrates .

name: BISC 455 L Molecular Approaches to Microbial Diversity — Catalina Semester
description: Overview and practical application of genetic and immunological techniques for examining diversity and community structure of natural microbial assemblages in aquatic ecosystems .

name: Molecular Genetics and Biochemistry
description: Current genetic and biochemical analysis of replication , recombination , mutagenesis , and repair . Fundamentals of transcription and regulation of gene expression . Recent applications of genetic engineering and genome analysis .

name: BISC 511 Integrative Biology
description: Current topics in integrative biology including form , function and energy use throughout the lifespan in the context of genetics , natural selection and ecology .

name: BISC 512 Evolutionary Biology
description: Survey of current topics in evolutionary biology ; genetics , natural selection , ecology ; emphasis on higher order complex questions of lifespan , form , function , and energy use .

name: BISC 588L Quantitative Analysis for Biological and Earth Sciences
description: Basics of biometrics , biodiversity , quantitative methods in ecology , environmental impact assessments and other topics in quantitative analysis .

name: CE 503 Microbiology for Environmental Engineers
description: Basic microbiology of water , air , and soil . Application of microbiology to the practice of environmental pollution control .

name: Marine Paleoecology
description: Principles of marine paleoecology ; interrelationships between marine organisms and their environment in geologic time .

name: Paleobiology
description: Concepts and methods for functional morphologic analysis of fossil marine invertebrates . Systematics theory and methodology , macro evolution , and broad biotic trends in the Phanerozoic .

name: Marine Geology
description: Origin and characteristics of ocean basins ; marine sedimentary environments ; shoreline classification and character ; evolution of oceanic features .

name: Paleoceanography
description: Mesozoic and Cenozoic paleoceanography ; analytical approaches applied to water mass history , paleocirculation , paleoproductivity , nutrient cycling , and paleotemperature reconstruction . Lecture , readings , and research project .

name: Marine Geochemistry
description: Principles of chemical sedimentology and aquatic chemistry ; diagenesis , authigenesis , and the geochemical cycle .

name: Isotope Geochemistry
description: Variations in the isotopic composition of elements in the earth’s crust with applications to geological problems , including geochronology , geothermometry , ore genesis , and crustal evolution .

name: Stable Isotope Geochemistry
description: Theoretical basis ; nuclide nomenclature , partition function ratios , mechanisms and rates of isotope exchange ; mass spectrometry and extraction techniques ; application of stable isotopes to geologic problems .

name: GEOL 577 L Micropaleontology
description: Microscopic fossils , especially foraminifera , their classification , the common genera , morphology , evolutionary trends ; laboratory and field techniques .

name: OS 512 Introduction to Chemical and Physical Oceanography
description: Principles of physical , chemical , and geological oceanography including discussions of air-sea interaction , biogeochemical cycling and the role of the ocean in modulating climate and atmospheric composition ; discussion section will cover formulation of basic calculations that illustrate these principles .

name: Coastal Policy and Planning
description: Coastal management issues in the context of public and private users competing for land resources , the costs and benefits of seaports , compare coastal development models .

name: MKT 543 Market Demand and Sales Forecasting
description: New product concept testing and life cycle forecasting , pricing and advertising response forecasting , consumer purchase intentions , judgmental marketing decision models , time series and regression analysis , computer methods .

name: MKT 512 Customer Insights and Analysis
description: Use of marketing research techniques and technologies such as databases and statistical tools to collect , analyze and act upon customer information .

name: MKT 556 Internet Marketing
description: All aspects of Internet marketing . Internet as a tool for marketing communication , sales and distribution , customer management . Role of paid advertising , search engines , Website design .

name: MKT 560 Marketing Strategy
description: Design and implementation of marketing strategies applied to domestic and global business challenges that span multiple industries complimented by a consumer packaged goods marketing strategic plan project .

name: Professional Identity , Law and Ethics for Counselors
description: History of the field of counseling and professional identity development for counselors are addressed . Examination of current legal , ethical , and other professional issues in counseling .

name: Theories of Marriage and Family Therapy
description: Major psychotherapeutic orientations relating to family systems , marital relationships , and communications theory applied to the family unit .

name: EDUC 544 Measurement Procedures for Counselors
description: Educational and psychological instruments ; psychometric concepts and the rationale for the use of psychological instruments in the counseling relationship .

name: EDUC 546 Psychopathology for Marriage and Family Therapy
description: Theories of psychological impairment emphasizing diagnosis of child and family dysfunction . Practice in utilizing DSM-IV classification of case studies .

name: Psychopharmacology and the Effects of Substance Abuse
description: Focus on the effects of psychotropic medication , alcohol , and other substances on behavior . The professional and ethical issues for marriage and family therapists .

name: Counseling through the Lifespan
description: Developmental issues and life events from infancy to old age and their effect upon individuals , couples , and family relationships .

name: Child and Elder Abuse and Domestic Violence
description: A review of laws governing mandated reporting of child and elder abuse , the procedures involved , as well as etiology , effects , and treatment interventions .

name: Couples Counseling
description: Examines relational development and change , strategies for intervention with couples , and selected issues in couples relationship functioning .

name: EDUC 635 Psychotherapy with Children and Adolescents
description: Training in unique diagnostic considerations in working with children and adolescents . Exposure to empirically supported treatment modalities for children and adolescents .

name: EDUC 636 Perspectives on Human Sexuality
description: The physiological-psychological and socio-cultural variables associated with sexual identity and sexual behavior with an emphasis upon sexual dysfunctions .

name: EDUC 638 Cross-Cultural Counseling : Research and Practice
description: An examination of the cultural , socioeconomic , and language factors that may affect culturally differentiated populations ; alternative crosscultural counseling approaches .

name: EDUC 644 Practicum in Counseling
description: Supervised clinical work with clients , including adults , couples , children , and families .

name: EDUC 645a Fieldwork in Counseling
description: Supervised field experience in a clinical setting .

name: Marriage and Family Therapy Capstone : Leadership Project
description: An evidencebased leadership project , designed to enhance fieldwork site functioning . Includes needs assessment , literature review , project design , implementation , and evaluation .

name: GPPD 500a Global Policy Challenges and Solutions
description: Consideration of current public policy issues through informed discourse and debate ; analysis and policy arguments .

name: GPPD 510 Economic Foundations for Public Policy
description: Microeconomic foundations ; analysis of public sector problems ; markets ; producer and consumer theory ; private and social efficiency .

name: GPPD 520 Leadership in Public-Private Partnerships
description: Issues across public/private partnerships ; leadership and followership in cross-sector settings ; organizational and institutional designs ; problem solving , negotiation and conflict resolution .

name: GPPD 530 Art and Craft of Public Policy Analysis
description: Foundations of public policy as a profession , and develops basic skills in policy analytic reasoning , policy design , normative analysis and ethics , and argumentation .

name: GPPD 540 Comparative Institutions and Policy Context
description: Theoretical and empirical foundations on how institutions affect policy performance ; comparative institutional analysis and framework ; approaches to organizing public action .

name: GPPD 550 Quantitative Methods for Public Policy
description: Economic theory and statistical inference methods to estimate the relationship between economic , social and political variables ; foundations of data-based argumentation , specifically in regards to public policy in an international context .

name: GPPD 560 Methods for Policy Evaluation
description: Methods utilized in the analysis of public policy choices ; ex ante and ex post analysis ; cost-benefit analysis ; decision and risk analysis ; applied social science methods .

name: GPPD 570 Institutions and Policy Processes
description: Policy formulation and implementation in a comparative context and in the context of an East-West dichotomy .

name: GPPD 580 Policy Challenges in International Development
description: Overview of the overarching issues of problem definition of “development” and the policy implications of new ideas for development as it faces a new set of challenges in an increasingly globalized , complex , and interconnected world .

name: GPPD 600a Public Policy Capstone
description: Hands-on experience in policy analysis . Participants learn to work on a specific , client oriented public policy issue , assess policy alternatives , and write an official report .

name: LAW 520 Introduction to U .S . Legal System
description: The basic structure of government in the U .S . , including the constitutionally mandated division of power in the federal government and the federal system of power sharing between state and federal systems . A comparative perspective on selected substantive and procedural matters , such as common law reasoning , jury trials , adversary process , and various aspects of civil procedure . Open to LLM students only .

name: LAW 822 Alternative Dispute Resolution Clause Drafting
description: Explores a variety of contract provisions , and teaches students the important drafting skills necessary to achieve a client’s goal .

name: International Arbitration Competition
description: Covers basic aspects of international commercial arbitration and prepares a USC Law School team for participation in the Willem C . Vis International Commercial Arbitration Moot .

name: LAW 833 Labor Arbitration
description: Introduces students to the National Labor Relations Act , collective bargaining and the labor arbitration process . Students also prepare labor arbitration briefs .

name: LAW 869 Family Law Mediation Clinic
description: Teaches the skills and substantive area of the law necessary to successfully mediate cases in the Edelman Children’s courthouse in Monterey Park .

name: LAW 510 Legal Research
description: Examination of the basic sources of law for federal and California jurisdictions , utilizing a vast array of sources from books to computer-assisted research and analyzing research methodology and techniques .

name: LAW 632 Business for Lawyers
description: , 3 , 4This course introduces law students to the tools , concept , and language of business . It is premised on the belief that to excel as a business lawyer , one must understand the business world from the perspective of the clients one counsels and assists . The course will cover , in compressed form , the basic subjects from the MBA program which are most useful to lawyers .

name: LAW 658 Mergers and Acquisitions
description: Problems of integrating the corporate , securities , tax , business , antitrust , accounting and contractual aspects of corporate mergers and acquisitions .

name: LAW 710 Contract Drafting and Strategy
description: , 3Students examine contracts and present to the class their assessment of why the specific provisions were drafted and possible alternatives and challenges to those provisions .

name: LAW 749 Securities Regulation
description: Regulation by state and federal agencies of issuance of , and trading in , stocks , bonds , and other securities . Particular reference to SEC regulations .

name: MATH 530a Stochastic Calculus and Mathematical Finance
description: Stochastic processes revisited , Brownian motion , Martingale theory , stochastic differential equations , Feynman-Kac formula , binomial models , basic concepts in arbitrage pricing theory , equivalent Martingale measure .

name: Financial Informatics and Simulation (Computer Labs and Practitioner Seminar)
description: Experimental laboratory trading for financial markets using double auctions : handling statistical packages for data analysis . Practical training in virtual market environments , using financial trading system software .

name: Directed Research
description: Research leading to the master’s degree . Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department .

name: Economics of Financial Markets I
description: Equilibrium model of finance economy ; absence of arbitrage ; complete and incomplete markets ; asset pricing theory ; representative agent pricing . Capital Asset Pricing Model , martingale property of security prices .

name: Filtering Theory
description: Theory of random differential equations and stochastic stability ; optimum linear and nonlinear filtering , with discussion of asymptotic behavior of filter .

name: Stochastic Differential Equations
description: Brownian motion , stochastic integrals , the Ito formula , stochastic differential equations , analysis of diffusion processes , Girsanov transformation , Feynmann-Kac formula , applications .

name: Mathematical Theory of Optimal Control
description: Deterministic control : calculus of variations ; optimal control ; Pontryagin principle ; multiplier rules and abstract nonlinear programming ; existence and continuity of controls ; problem of Mayer ; dynamic programming .

name: Economic and Financial Time Series II
description: Stock returns , predictability and volatility , random walk and variance-bounds tests , estimation of capital asset , multifactor , and derivative pricing models , term structure of interest rates .

name: Economics of Financial Markets II
description: Financial market equilibrium and partial equilibrium asset pricing in discrete and continuous time ; properties of equilibria with and without complete markets ; theory of option prices ; Black-Scholes pricing formula ; term structure of interest rates ; hedging strategies and managing market risk using options , futures and swaps ; hedging exchange-rates risks .

name: Modern Alternative Energy Conversion Devices
description: Alternative energy/power conversion including fuel cells , photovoltaic , batteries , and biologically inspired energy processes ; biomass conversion and utilization ; Environmental implications of alternative energy processes .

name: AME 513 Principles of Combustion
description: Thermochemistry , equilibrium , chemical kinetics , flame temperature , flame velocity , flame stability , diffusion flames spray combustion , detonation . Equations of motion including reaction , heat transfer , and diffusion .

name: Applications of Combustion and Reacting Flows
description: Advanced topics and modern developments in combustion and reacting flows including ignition and extinction , pollutant formation , microscale and microgravity combustion , turbulent combustion and hypersonic propulsion .

name: Combustion Chemistry and Physics
description: Thermodynamics of combustion processes . Reaction mechanisms of hydrocarbon combustion . Pollutant formation . Theories and application of thermochemical kinetics and reaction rate theories . Transport in reacting flows .

name: Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
description: Review of basic nuclear physics , binding energy , reactor kinetics , thermal transport in reactor systems , radioactivity , shielding , reactor safety and health effects of radiation , risk assessment . Open only to graduate students .

name: Nuclear Reactor Physics
description: Neutron-induced fission chain reactions , reactor criticality . Neutron transport and diffusion in nuclear reactors . Mathematical/computational foundation for diffusion theory and transport calculations for fission reactor design/analysis .

name: Advanced Mechanical Design
description: ecific problems and methods of analysis in mechanical systems design .

name: Engineering Information Modeling
description: Symbolic and object-oriented modeling , product and process modeling for design and manufacturing , information models for computer integrated and collaborative engineering , information modeling for life-cycle engineering .

name: Elements of Vehicle and Energy Systems Design
description: IrregularDesign synthesis of aero/hydro/mechanical systems ; techniques of design ; conceptual thinking ; problem definition , configurational development , analytic engineering approximation , oral briefings and group problem solving .

name: AME 541 Linear Control Systems II
description: State space representation , linearization , solution of state equations ; controllability and observability ; state feedback , state observers ; optimal control ; output feedback .

name: SAE 549 Systems Architecting
description: Introduction to systems architecture in aerospace , electrical , computer , and manufacturing systems emphasizing the conceptual and acceptance phases and using heuristics .

name: Advanced Problems in Heat Conduction
description: Review of analytical methods in heat conduction ; moving boundaries melting and freezing ; sources and sinks , anisotropic and composite media ; numerical methods for steady and unsteady problems .

name: Radiation Heat Transfer
description: Radiation properties ; black body radiation ; shape factors of radiation network analogy and solar radiation .

name: Multi-Phase Flows
description: Physics of the interaction between phases , empirical and analytical methods of solution to relevant technological problems .

name: Microfluidics
description: Introduction to fluid dynamics in the microscale . Scaling parameters , dynamic , thermodynamic , electroosmotic and electrochemical forces . Flow in microdevices , external flow measurement and control , microvalves and micropumps . Limited to students with graduate standing .

name: AME 559 Creep
description: (Enroll in MASC 559 )

name: AME 560 Fatigue and Fracture
description: (Enroll in MASC 560 )

name: AME 584 Fracture Mechanics and Mechanisms
description: (Enroll in MASC 584 )

name: Theory of Plates
description: (Enroll in CE 542 )

name: AME 588 Materials Selection
description: (Enroll in MASC 583 )

name: AME 455 Introduction to MEMS
description: Introduction to micro-electro-opto-mechanical systems ; scaling effects on material properties , fluid flows , dynamical behavior ; fabrication methods ; design considerations for MEMS sensors and actuators .

name: Introduction to Bio-MEMS and Nanotechnology
description: Principles and biomedical applications of micro-electromechanical systems (MEMS) and nanotechnology , including microfluidics , nanowire sensors , nanomotors , quantum dots , biofuel cells and molecular imaging .

name: EE 607 Microelectromechanical Systems
description: Exploration of the technology methods and physical principles of MEMS , and survey various MEMS of current interest .

name: Nuclear Thermal-Hydraulics
description: Thermal-fluid phenomena for nuclear power stations . Heat generation by nuclear reactions , conduction in fuel rods , and transport of generated heat by convection , boiling , and condensation .

name: Effects of Radiation on Health
description: Nuclear physics relevant to human health . Biological effects of radiation , quantification and measurement of different types of radiation affecting living tissue , radiation protection , nuclear accidents .

name: Nuclear Safety and Security : Human Performance and Safety Culture
description: Provides an overview of human-systems integration considerations , human performance and safety culture in the nuclear power operations .

name: Hazardous Waste Management
description: Standards and regulations for the management of hazardous waste : identification , transportation , monitoring , storage , treatment , and disposal practices .

name: Applications of Physical Methods in Biochemistry
description: Applications of physical analytical methods commonly utilized in research in biochemistry and molecular biology .

name: Basic Principles of Physical Methods in Biochemistry
description: Principles underlying physical analytical methods commonly utilized in research in biochemistry and molecular biology .

name: MBPH 550 Seminar in Medical Biophysics
description: Seminar course in which students make oral and written presentations based on original research , published journal articles , or research proposals .

name: Introduction to Physical Biology
description: Introduces students to the role of physics in biology . Considers both experimental and more fundamental points of view . Explores a few current research directions .

name: Introduction to Quantum Chemistry
description: Basic principles of quantum mechanics and their application to chemistry . Electronic structure of atoms and molecules .

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: General formulation of quantum mechanics with applications ; theory of measurement ; exactly solvable problems ; angular momentum formalism .

name: Ethics and Accountability in Biomedical Research
description: The purpose of this course is to engage current (and potential) research trainees in discussions about the responsible conduct of science . The course is designed as an option for meeting current federal regulations which require that all predoctoral and postdoctoral fellows paid from federal contracts and grants have a component of ethical training .

name: Mathematical Techniques of Physical Chemistry
description: Fundamentals and techniques of mathematics and physics . Linear algebra , differential equations , mechanics , electricity and magnetism . Applications to physical chemistry/chemical physics .

name: INTD 549 Protein Chemistry — Structure and Function
description: Chemistry of peptides and proteins ; protein structure and folding ; molecular basis of protein action .

name: Systems Physiology and Disease I
description: (Enroll in INTD 572 )

name: Systems Physiology and Disease II
description: (Enroll in INTD 573 )

name: PHBI 651 Molecular Modeling and Kinetic Simulations in Membrane Transport
description: Introduction to the principles of mathematical modeling of biological systems and molecular dynamics simulations , with emphasis on membrane transport .

name: PHBI 650 Mechanisms of Ion and Solute Transport Across Cell Membranes
description: Biophysical examination of the mechanisms of ion and solute transport across cell membranes ; emphasis on the structures of transport proteins and kinetic models of transport .

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: Principles of , and relations between , thermodynamics and statistical mechanics ; ensembles , partition function formalism ; quantum statistics of noninteracting particles ; fluctuations .

name: Biomedical Measurement and Instrumentation
description: Design of measurement systems and biomedical instrumentation ; architecture of electronic instruments used to measure physiological parameters , analysis of major process functions integrated in these instruments .

name: Quality Systems and Standards
description: Principles of quality assurance and quality control for medical-product development and manufacture .

name: Regulation of Medical Devices and Diagnostics
description: Development and testing of new medical products according to U .S . and international regulatory requirements .

name: Medical Product Safety
description: Management of medical product safety by manufacturers/suppliers including : safe manufacturing , labeling , packaging ; pharmacovigilance , field observations , complaint handling ; record-keeping , safety issues documentation ; crisis management/recalls .

name: Neural Implant Engineering
description: Advanced studies of the basic neuroscience , engineering design requirements and technological issues associated with implantable neural prostheses , with particular emphasis on retinal and cortical function .

name: BME 620 L Applied Electrophysiology
description: The theoretical basis and applied design principles for medical devices and instrumentation that interact with electrically excitable tissues of the body .

name: Predictive and Prognostic Biomarkers in Cancer Treatment
description: Exploration of how appropriate biomarkers can predict response to cancer therapy , tumor recurrence after surgery , rapid detection of tumor response and overall prognosis .

name: INTD 522 Infection and Host Responses
description: Overview of microbes , their life cycles and the host response they elicit , evade or exploit , including the manipulation and the malfunction of the immune system .

name: INTD 550 Introduction to Pathology
description: Normal histology and introduction to basic pathological concepts . Provides a solid and basic understanding of normal structures and how they relate to function .

name: INTD 551 Pathobiology of Disease
description: Relationship between histopathological and clinical manifestations of disease and their underlying molecular mechanisms . Topics include inflammatory , developmental , environmental , degenerative , and neoplastic disease processes .

name: Genetics in Public Health and Preventive Medicine
description: History and philosophy of public health genetics and mechanisms of genetic diseases . Epidemiologic methods used to identify genetic diseases in individuals , families , and populations . Emphasis on prevention and relevant ethical issues .

name: Biological Effects of Environmental Toxins
description: Overview of how environmental exposures affect various biological systems and lead to observed health outcomes in populations .

name: Systems Physiology and Disease I
description: (Enroll in INTD 572 )

name: Systems Physiology and Disease II
description: (Enroll in INTD 573 )

name: Chronic Disease Epidemiology
description: Overview of causative factors and demographic distribution of major chronic diseases in the western world . Epidemiologic concepts , methods and research design as applied to chronic disease prevention will be emphasized .

name: Human Molecular Genetics
description: (Enroll in BIOC 543 )

name: Human Exposure Assessment for Public Health
description: Examination of important routes of exposure to toxic materials ; how to measure exposure ; strengths and weaknesses of different measurement techniques ; design of exposure assessment studies .

name: Environmental Epidemiology : Concepts , Methods , and Practice
description: Examine epidemiologic methods , concepts , and statistical approaches ; case-study seminars with structured critiques of current literature on human-environment interactions affecting public health .

name: PM 586 Reproductive and Perinatal Epidemiology
description: Introduction to reproductive health , from preconception to the neonatal and early period of human development . Heavy emphasis on the methods and public health implications .

name: BISC 544 Advanced Reading in Molecular Biology
description: Advanced training for molecular biology graduate students in reading primary journal articles . Emphasis on critical analyses of primary scientific literature . master and doctoral students in computational molecular biology , molecular biology , computational biology and bioinformatics majors .

name: Biology of Cancer
description: Focus on the advances in molecular biology of cancer , from fundamental molecular signaling pathways to DNA repair to stem cell biology , through primary research literature reviews .

name: Advanced Genetics through the Primary Scientific Literature
description: Literature-based seminar in current and classical topics in genetics .

name: Evolution and Human Biology
description: Topics in evolution and human biology with emphasis on life span , form , function and energy use in the context of genetics , natural selection and ecology .

name: EDUC 569a Capstone Portfolio in Learning and Instruction
description: The culminating experience in the Master of Arts in Teaching Program for students in the non-credential track . Open only to MAT students .

name: MUHL 579 Studies in Music History
description: Intensive study of major problems , issues , and interpretations in the history of music .

name: MUIN 510 The Music Industry : Careers , Rights and Income Streams
description: History , procedures , economics and evolving technologies involved with careers , rights and income connected with artists , songwriters , producers , labels , music publishing , performance rights and visual media .

name: MUIN 511 Music Industry History : Entrepreneurs , Moguls and Catalogs
description: Focus on recorded music’s sounds and innovators . Includes in-depth research , discussion , presentations and memorization for greater cultural context .

name: MUIN 512 The Management of Live Performances
description: Focus on the Artist , Promoter and Venue , and the roles they play in the Live Performance space , applying theory , technology , and practice .

name: MUIN 520 Artist Management : Campaign Planning , Pitching , Partnerships
description: Lecture and experiential learning focused on the role of an artist’s personal manager including developing their story , assets and strategy for various product release campaigns .

name: MUIN 521 Music Industry/Producers Forum
description: Student-driven discussion , networking and Q&A with guest industry leaders and role models , including producers , artists , music supervisors , concert promoters , agents , label executives , managers and attorneys .

name: MUIN 522 Music Marketing , Branding and Campaigns
description: An overview of music specific concepts and opportunities spanning various roles , tools , forms of music consumption , and campaign stages as it pertains to music marketing .

name: MUIN 523 Survey/Analysis of Music Agreements
description: Focus on demystifying “legalese” and music industry standards by assessing actual contract examples for context , including recording , songwriter , producer , media licensing , sponsorship and band partnerships .

name: MUIN 530 Mentorship
description: A semester bridge for students working on job preparation , career skills , and continued efforts before launching their final campaign projects and graduation portfolio .

name: MUIN 540 Artist Management : Campaign Execution and Hindsight Analysis
description: Lecture and experiential learning focused on the role of an artist’s personal manager including executing various release campaigns and hindsight assessment to inform future endeavors .

name: MUIN 541 Data Analytics : Music Marketing Decisions and Presentations
description: The when , why and how data analysis tools are used to assist music professionals and better support marketing decisions , beyond the realm of intuition and aesthetic appeal .

name: MUIN 542 Developing Copyright Laws and Business Models
description: Study of advanced copyright law , conflicts and entrepreneurial opportunities to gain insight into what is evolving for the globalized digital music industry .

name: MUIN 598 Internship
description: Students gain insight , experience and networking opportunities within the industry areas they wish to consider as a career .

name: MUIN 515 Live Touring Strategy
description: Part of an emphasis track that focuses on advanced live touring strategies , methods and practices . Projects will apply theory and practice in a directed team oriented approach .

name: MUIN 525 Concert Promotion , Venue Management and Event Planning
description: Overview of the three areas that comprise most of the live performance spaces , and focuses on the artist , promoter and venue (“Circle of Live”) and the roles they play in the performance .

name: MUIN 526 Music Supervision , Production and Creative Licensing
description: A comprehensive look at contemporary music supervision for all visual media . Students will creatively apply guided lessons using real world example cases and projects .

name: BAEP 556 Technology Feasibility
description: Learn critical thinking and analytical skills they need to evaluate , value , and manage technology as intellectual property . Understand the technology commercialization process , use data mining and assessment techniques for patent databases , and study the unique business issues facing high technology start-ups .

name: NIIN 500 Neuroimaging and Systems Neuroscience
description: Overview of elemental neuroanatomy and brain systems with an emphasis on a neuroimaging perspective in the human and mouse .

name: NIIN 510 Fundamentals of Human Neuroimaging
description: Survey of anatomical and functional neuroimaging approaches and their use to explore the healthy as well as diseased human brain .

name: NIIN 520 Experimental Design for Neuroimaging
description: Examine experimental design approaches for experimental and clinical neuroimaging investigation . Topics on how to develop rigorous experiments to test theories of cognitive and clinical neuroscience .

name: NIIN 530 Neuroimaging Data Acquisition w/ Magnetic Resonance Imaging
description: Introduces the various approaches used to image the living brain using MR-based techniques . Covers neuroimaging scanning technologies , pulse sequence design , and sources of image artifact .

name: NIIN 540 Neuroimaging Data Processing Methods
description: Comprehensive investigation of data processing methods , software strategies , and workflow design and execution methodologies .

name: NIIN 550 Computational Modeling in Neuroimaging
description: Addresses the current neuroinformatics approaches to large-scale data representations , mining , and visualization in brain imaging .

name: NIIN 560 Brain Architecture and Neuroanatomic Exploratory Techniques
description: Introduction to basic theories and methodological approaches to neuroanatomy in animal models including histology , microscopy , behavioral investigations , and neuroinformatics .

name: NIIN 570 Neuroimaging Genetics
description: Lectures on human genetics and epigenetics . Discuss how applying these concepts to brain imaging advances our understanding of healthy development and neurological disease . Emphasis on critical thinking applied both to designing neuroimaging genetics studies and to constructively assessing peer work and existing neuroimaging genetics literature .

name: NIIN 597 Current Topics in Neuroimaging Informatics
description: Leading researchers in the areas of basic and clinical brain imaging , computational methods , and informatics formally discuss their work for which students provide written critical review and comment .

name: NIIN 598 Neuroimaging and Informatics External Speaker Seminar Series
description: Reading and discussion of recent papers by the INI speaker of the week and attendance at the speaker’s seminar .

name: PPD 542 Policy and Program Evaluation
description: Methods and models for policy and program evaluation ; methods of collecting and analyzing evaluation data ; processes for linking evaluation to policy formulation and program management .

name: Nonprofit Management and Leadership
description: Issues in nonprofit management and leadership including : the role of boards ; strategic planning ; marketing and fund-raising ; financial management ; and volunteer and human resource management .

name: The Nonprofit Sector and Philanthropy
description: Nonprofit organizations and their relation to government and business ; the role of philanthropy , social enterprise and public support ; and implications for policy , strategy and management .

name: PPDE 645 Financial Management of Nonprofit Organizations
description: Accounting and financial management principles and practices in nonprofit organizations : budgeting financial analysis , internal controls , financial policies , grant making and financial reporting .

name: Board Governance and Leadership
description: Governance of nonprofit organizations ; responsibilities and expectations of boards ; board effectiveness ; and changes in governance as a result of recent federal and state legislation .

name: Fund Development for Nonprofit Organizations
description: Key aspects of the fundraising process for nonprofit organizations ; theoretical foundations and general fundraising principles ; techniques sources of donations ; key aspects of managing the process .

name: PPDE 682 Capstone in Nonprofit Leadership and Management
description: Mission-mandated accountable and ethical practice , individually and organizationally ; applications of core competencies ; practical inquiry , analysis , systems ; comparative frameworks ; strategic leadership and management of public value production .

name: Human Anatomy
description: Lectures and laboratory simulation in anatomy emphasizing structure and function of major organs to include brain , cardiovascular , lungs , liver , kidneys and musculoskeletal system .

name: Advanced Pharmacology of Anesthesia Practice I
description: Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic principles , uptake and distribution of inhalational anesthetics , and pharmacology of respiratory and cardiovascular drugs . Application of pharmacologic principles to anesthetic management .

name: Principles of Nurse Anesthesia Practice
description: Basic theory of anesthesia administration , preanesthetic assessment , physical examination , monitoring . Case management including airway and blood/fluid management , anesthesia machine , and postoperative pain . Lecture/case study format .

name: Advanced Pharmacology of Anesthesia Practice II
description: Pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic principles of drugs covering different organs systems (cardiovascular , CNS , hematology , endocrine) , herbal therapies , chemotherapeutics , antimicrobials . Application of pharmacology to anesthetic management using problem-based learning .

name: Advanced Pathophysiology Related to Anesthesia Practice
description: In-depth study of cardiovascular , respiratory , renal , liver , endocrine and neurophysiology and pathophysiology with application of these principles to anesthetic case management using problem-based learning .

name: Advanced Principles of Nurse Anesthesia Practice
description: Advanced theory of anesthesia management for general and specialized procedures , diagnostic procedures , pediatrics and obstetrics .

name: Research : Investigative Inquiry
description: Utilization of research , which includes the evaluation of research , problem identification within the practice setting , awareness of practice outcomes and the clinical application of research .

name: Leadership and Professional Aspects of Nurse Anesthesia
description: Emphasis on the professional components of nurse anesthesia practice , including socialization , regulation , culture , ethics , law , employment , advocacy , and contemporary practice issues .

name: ANST 512 Research Integration : Capstone Experience
description: A capstone course that requires students to demonstrate ability to integrate theory , research , and practice through a mentored research experience with direct relevance to graduate specialization .

name: ANST 607 Advanced Health Assessment
description: Advanced health assessment of all human systems utilizing advanced assessment techniques , concepts and approaches .

name: INTD 572 Systems Physiology and Disease I
description: Mammalian organ systems operation during health , and pathophysiologic analysis of related diseases with focus on muscle , respiratory , cardiovascular and renal systems . Faculty from basic and clinical sciences . Open to graduate students in biomedical science only .

name: ANST 505 Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia I
description: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory in the clinical setting with observation and supervised clinical residency .

name: ANST 507 Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia II
description: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory in the clinical setting with observation and supervised clinical residency .

name: ANST 509 Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia I
description: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to geriatric , obstetrical , and pediatric anesthesia ; anesthetic management to include medically compromised patients .

name: ANST 511 Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia II
description: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to neuroanesthesia , cardiac anesthesia , trauma anesthesia , critical care and pain management .

name: ANST 513 Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia III
description: Correlation of advanced techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory in diverse specialty anesthesia rotations .

name: Specialty Fellowship
description: Optional internship to develop advanced skills and critical assessment of anesthesia specialty or clinical research .

name: NURS 501 Pathophysiology for Advanced Nursing Practice
description: Advanced physiology/pathophysiology including general principles that apply across the lifespan .

name: NURS 502 Advanced Health Assessment Across the Life Span
description: Development of advanced critical thinking and clinical judgement skills through comprehensive health assessment .  Health promotion and health maintenance content is utilized to assess health status and evaluate health risk among individuals and groups .

name: NURS 503 Theory : Clinical Management of Adult Patients
description: The scope of practice and responsibilities of the family nurse practitioner in prevention of disease , health maintenance , and the diagnosis and management of patients with common illnesses are explored .

name: NURS 504 Pharmacology for Advanced Practice Nursing
description: Advanced pharmacology including pharmacodynamics , pharmacokinetics , and pharmacotherapeutics of all broad categories of agents .

name: NURS 505 Clinical Practicum : Management of Adult Patients
description: Primary health care to patients throughout the life cycle with a focus on the prevention of disease , health maintenance , and the diagnosis and management of patients with common illnesses .

name: NURS 507 Theory : Clinical Management of the Childbearing/Childrearing Family
description: Diagnosing and managing childbearing women from preconception through uncomplicated pregnancy and postpartum periods and providing primary care to children and their families from newborn through adolescence periods .

name: NURS 600 Theory : Clinical Management of Adult Patients with Complex Medical Issues
description: The scope of practice and responsibilities of the family nurse practitioner in the diagnosis and management of patients with acute , complex and chronic illnesses are explored .

name: NURS 601 Clinical Practicum : Management of the Childbearing/Childrearing Family
description: Clinical practicum is intended to prepare FNP students to provide primary health care to childbearing/childrearing families from preconception through adolescent phase of the life cycle .

name: NURS 602 Research/Analytical Methods
description: Understanding and applying commonly used research methodologies and data analysis techniques in healthcare research .

name: NURS 603 Transforming Research Evidence into Practice
description: Preparing the advanced practice nursing student to critically evalute knowledge , research and evidence for implementation of best practices in healthcare in order to deliver safe , ethical , culturally senstive evidence based care for patients in diverse settings .

name: NURS 604 Clinical Practicum : Management of Adult Patients with Complex Medical Issues
description: Application of theoretical concepts studied in NURS 600 .  Comprehsive assessments , formulation of differential diagnoses , and the development of plans of care to manage acute and chronic complex in a variety of practice settings .

name: NURS 605 Professional Issues in Advanced Practice Nursing
description: The professional role and legal responsibilities of the nurse practitioner at entry to clinical practice and throughout a career are explored .

name: NURS 606 Health Policy Principles in Changing Health Care Contexts
description: Foundation for leadership in interprofessional collaborative endeavors to address health policy that prepares learners to analyze and influence health policy and explores the role of nurse practitioners in the creation and modification of health policy .

name: NURS 607 Theory : Family Primary Care
description: Capstone course draws on material and concepts learning throughout the FNP program and explores additional complex issues including management of pain , caregiver burden , palliative care , and end of life .

name: NURS 608 Clinical Practicum : Family Primary Care
description: Prepares the family nurse practitioner student for entry into practice in the diagnosis and managment of patients with acute , complex , and chronic illnesses in the primary care setting .

name: SOWK 506 Human Behavior and the Social Environment
description: The person-in-environment , bio-psycho-social perspective is the lens through which theories of personality , family , group , organization , community , culture and their interactions are explored .

name: NURS 500 Bridge Course
description: Key concepts from chemistry , biochemistry , genetics , cell biology , metabolism , microbiology , and immunology in an 8-week format . Successful completion of this unique preparatory course is expected to position students for success in the graduate level pathophysiology and pharmacology courses .

name: Nutrition , Genes , Longevity and Diseases
description: Examines the role of nutrition and genes and the impact each has on longevity and diseases , particularly diseases related to aging . Offered in Genoa , Italy .

name: GERO 511 Fundamentals of Clinical Nutrition Screening and Assessment
description: Examines tools and resources used to evaluate the nutrition status of individuals across the lifespan including biochemical , anthropometric and subjective global assessment . Open only to graduate students .

name: GERO 512 Communicating Nutrition and Health
description: Overview of current understanding of the dietary and nutritional needs of individuals across their lifespan .

name: GERO 513 Fundamentals of Nutrition : Macronutrients
